Title: Department of Transportation - Human Trafficking Awareness, Training, and Response (See Someone, Save Someone Act)
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Transportation to develop or identify and implement a training program for transportation sector employees on the identification and reporting of suspected human trafficking victims; requiring transportation sector employers to certify by January 1, 2027, and each year thereafter that certain employees have completed the training program; requiring new employees to receive training within 90 days of hiring; removing civil and criminal liability for reporting of suspected trafficking; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Transportation to develop or identify and implement training programs for transportation-sector employees on identifying and reporting human trafficking. It also mandates certification of training completion, establishment of reporting procedures, and public awareness announcements.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation
stakeholders: Transportation-sector employees, transportation employers, and potential human trafficking victims in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The program focuses on training and awareness, which may indirectly support victims but does not directly impact access to capital for small businesses.

Title: State Board of Physical Therapy Examiners - Revisions
Synopsis: Clarifying the definition of "physical therapist assistant" as used in the Maryland Physical Therapy Act to mean an individual licensed by the State Board of Physical Therapy Examiners; increasing the membership of the State Board of Physical Therapy Examiners from 8 to 9; and requiring the Board to send renewal notices to licensees by electronic means, rather than first-class mail, unless the licensee requests to receive the renewal notice by first-class mail.
bill_summary: The bill clarifies the definition of 'physical therapist assistant' in Maryland, adjusts the membership of the State Board of Physical Therapy Examiners, and changes the method of sending renewal notices to licensees from first-class mail to electronic means, with an option for licensees to request traditional mail.
responsible_party: State Board of Physical Therapy Examiners
stakeholders: Licensed physical therapists and physical therapist assistants in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Restrictions on Use - Solar Collector Systems - Alteration
Synopsis: Prohibiting a restriction on land use that increases the cost of installing a solar collector system by at least 5% over a certain cost or that reduces the efficiency of the system by at least 10% under a certain energy generation level; authorizing a community association to impose certain restrictions on the installation of solar collector systems in common areas or common elements; authorizing a community association to install a solar collector system in common areas or common elements under certain circumstances; etc.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits restrictions on land use that significantly increase the cost or decrease the efficiency of installing solar collector systems, and allows community associations to regulate or prohibit the installation of solar systems in common areas, including the ability to install systems in those areas.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development or local land use authorities
stakeholders: Property owners, community associations, solar energy system installers, residents interested in solar energy
access_to_capital_summary: The bill could facilitate the installation of solar systems by reducing restrictions, potentially lowering costs and increasing efficiency, which may improve access to solar-related capital for property owners.

Title: Public Safety - Food System Resiliency Council - Definitions and Reports
Synopsis: Altering certain definitions related to the Food Resiliency Council; defining what constitutes "healthy food priority areas" as predominantly lower-income areas that have limited access to retail outlets that sell, affordable, healthy foods; defining "wasted food" as food not used for its intended purpose; requiring the Council to make recommendations to increase the availability of local foods, create market opportunities for Maryland food businesses, and expand access to small scale food production infrastructure; etc.
bill_summary: This bill establishes the Maryland Food System Resiliency Council to address food insecurity, promote equitable access to healthy foods, reduce food waste, and support local food production and markets. It defines key terms, sets reporting requirements, and aims to improve the long-term resilience of Maryland's food system.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Emergency Management (Office of Resilience)
stakeholders: Residents of Maryland, especially those in food insecure areas, local food businesses, schools, and community organizations.
access_to_capital_summary: The bill has the potential to improve access to local food markets and infrastructure, which could facilitate small business growth and access to capital.

Title: Health Insurance - Access to Nonparticipating Providers - Referrals, Additional Assistance, and Coverage
Synopsis: Repealing the June 30, 2025, termination date for certain provisions of law related to referrals to and reimbursement of specialists and nonphysician specialists who are not part of a carrier's provider panel; prohibiting certain carriers from imposing utilization review requirements other than would be required if the covered benefit was provided by a provider on the carrier's provider panel under certain circumstances; etc.
bill_summary: The bill repeals the sunset date for laws requiring insurers to establish procedures for members to request referrals to specialists and nonphysician specialists outside of provider panels, especially for mental health and substance use disorder services. It also mandates insurers to assist members in finding and arranging coverage for such specialists, prohibits certain prior authorization requirements, and sets a reimbursement formula for nonparticipating providers.
responsible_party: Maryland Health Care Commission
stakeholders: Members seeking mental health and substance use disorder services, mental health and substance use disorder providers, insurers, and the general public in Maryland.
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's provisions could improve access to mental health and substance use disorder services, potentially enabling providers to receive better reimbursement and thus improving their financial stability and capacity to serve more patients.

Title: Cannabis - Sale and Distribution - Tetrahydrocannabinol Offenses
Synopsis: Authorizing the officers and employees of the Field Enforcement Division of the Alcohol, Tobacco, and Cannabis Commission to issue a citation for a violation of ยง10-108 of the Criminal Law Article; prohibiting the sale or distribution of certain products that contain tetrahydrocannabinol or are advertised as containing tetrahydrocannabinol; authorizing the Executive Director of the Commission to seize, destroy, or confiscate a certain unlawful product; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland laws regarding the sale, distribution, and regulation of tetrahydrocannabinol (THC) and related products, including establishing enforcement authority, defining legal standards, and setting penalties for violations.
responsible_party: Maryland Alcohol, Tobacco, and Cannabis Commission
stakeholders: Cannabis producers, sellers, consumers, and law enforcement in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly create or expand programs that impact small business access to capital.

Title: Corporations and Associations - Limited Worker Cooperative Associations - Authorization (Maryland Limited Worker Cooperative Association Act)
Synopsis: Authorizing the formation of limited worker cooperative associations; and establishing rules and procedures for the formation, governance, conversion, and dissolution of limited worker cooperative associations.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the formation of limited worker cooperative associations in Maryland, establishing rules for their formation, governance, conversion, and dissolution, and creating a new legal framework for these entities.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Commerce or equivalent state agency responsible for business regulation and registration
stakeholders: Workers and small business owners interested in forming or operating worker cooperatives in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill has the potential to improve access to capital for worker cooperatives by establishing clear legal and governance structures, but direct impact on capital access is moderate.

Title: Vehicle Laws - Noise Abatement Monitoring Systems Pilot Program - Inspection and Extension
Synopsis: Establishing that certain provisions of law relating to the inspection of recorded images apply to recorded images produced by a noise abatement monitoring system; and extending by 2 years the reporting and termination dates of the noise abatement monitoring systems pilot programs in Montgomery County and Prince George's County.
bill_summary: The bill extends the pilot programs for noise abatement monitoring systems in Montgomery County and Prince George's County, including systems that record images related to noise violations, and clarifies legal provisions regarding access to recorded images. It also requires counties to report on the use and effectiveness of these systems and extends the duration of the pilot programs.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation or local county agencies implementing noise monitoring systems
stakeholders: Residents and motorists in Montgomery County and Prince George's County, local government agencies, and law enforcement
access_to_capital_summary: The program has a high potential to impact small business owners' access to capital by providing data and enforcement mechanisms that could influence noise-related regulations and compliance costs.

Title: Health Occupations - Nursing - Loan Repayment, Education, and Sunset Extension (Building Opportunities for Nurses Act of 2025)
Synopsis: Expanding the purpose of the Maryland Loan Assistance Repayment Program for Nurses and Nursing Support Staff; requiring the Department to prioritize funding for nurses or nursing support staff who practice in an area with a shortage of nurses or nursing support staff or who practice in a specialty where a shortage has been identified; altering certain education requirements for licensure; repealing a certain requirement that the State Board of Nursing approve certain nursing assistant training program sites within a certain time period; etc.
bill_summary: The bill extends and modifies the Maryland Loan Assistance Repayment Program for nurses, updates licensing requirements for nursing assistants, and makes related changes to nursing education and staffing regulations, including extending the sunset date for certain programs to 2030.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and Maryland Board of Nursing
stakeholders: Nurses, nursing support staff, nursing students, healthcare facilities in Maryland, and residents needing healthcare services
access_to_capital_summary: The bill has a high potential to impact small business owners and healthcare providers by improving staffing and supporting workforce development through loan repayment programs.

Title: Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services - Study on Location of Individuals Prior to and Following Incarceration
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services to conduct an annual study examining and comparing certain data regarding an individual's residence prior to incarceration and on release from a State correctional facility; and requiring the Department by October 1, 2026, and each October 1 thereafter, to report the results of the study to certain committees of the General Assembly.
bill_summary: This bill requires the Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services to conduct a study on the residence locations of individuals before and after incarceration, including data on their county of residence, transfer details, and comparisons of release locations, with reports due annually.
responsible_party: Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services
stakeholders: Individuals incarcerated in Maryland and their communities
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Environment โ Reservoir Augmentation Permit โ Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Reservoir Augmentation Program in the Department of the Environment; defining "reservoir augmentation" as the planned placement of reclaimed water into a surface water reservoir used as a source for a drinking water treatment facility; requiring a person to obtain a permit from the Department to perform reservoir augmentation; establishing an Indirect Potable Reuse Pilot Program in the Department to make recommendations on whether the program should be extended or made permanent and any statutory or regulatory changes necessary; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Reservoir Augmentation Program in the Maryland Department of the Environment, requiring permits for reservoir augmentation using reclaimed water, and sets rules for issuing, renewing, and revoking these permits, along with funding and reporting requirements.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Public water systems, environmental agencies, and communities relying on surface water reservoirs
access_to_capital_summary: The program could improve access to safe, reliable water sources, potentially reducing costs and barriers for small water systems and communities.

Title: Estates and Trusts - Compensation of Guardians of Property and Trustees
Synopsis: Clarifying the commissions that a guardian of the property may charge; authorizing a trustee of a trust to charge compensation that is reasonable under the circumstances; and authorizing trustees who are financial institutions or members of the Maryland Bar to charge compensation that is reasonable under the circumstances and calculated in accordance with a schedule of rates filed with an appropriate agency.
bill_summary: This bill clarifies and updates the rules regarding the compensation that guardians of property and trustees of trusts can charge, including establishing reasonable compensation standards, schedules of rates, and procedures for approval and notification.
responsible_party: Maryland Courts and the Office of the Commissioner of Financial Regulation
stakeholders: Guardians of property, trustees, and beneficiaries of estates and trusts in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's impact on access to capital is minimal as it mainly addresses legal and procedural standards for trustee and guardian compensation.

Title: Consumer Protection - Right to Repair - Powered Wheelchairs
Synopsis: Requiring, in order to make repairs to powered wheelchairs, that a certain manufacturer make available certain documentation, parts, embedded software, firmware, and tools to a certain independent repair provider or owner of a powered wheelchair; providing that a violation of the Act constitutes an unfair, abusive, or deceptive trade practice subject to certain enforcement and penalty provisions; and applying the Act prospectively.
bill_summary: This bill requires manufacturers of powered wheelchairs to provide independent repair providers and owners with access to documentation, parts, embedded software, firmware, and tools necessary for repairs, under fair and reasonable terms and costs.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Commerce or relevant state agency responsible for consumer protection and medical device regulation
stakeholders: Owners of powered wheelchairs, independent repair providers, and manufacturers of powered wheelchairs in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The program has high potential to impact small business owners by reducing costs and barriers to repairing powered wheelchairs, thus improving access to repair services.

Title: Maryland Department of Health - Forensic Review Board - Established
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Health to establish a forensic review board at facilities that have charge of persons who have been committed to the facility as not criminally responsible; authorizing a forensic review board to make recommendations relating to the release or rehabilitation of a committed person; requiring the board to give notice at least 10 days before a meeting concerning the committed person; requiring the board to give consideration to a written statement offered by the committed person to the board; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes forensic review boards at facilities with persons committed as not criminally responsible, to review their eligibility for release and make recommendations. It also creates a Community Forensic Aftercare Program to monitor these individuals on conditional release.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Persons committed as not criminally responsible, mental health professionals, courts, and the Maryland Department of Health
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's focus is on monitoring and review processes rather than direct financial support or capital access programs.

Title: Department of Service and Civic Innovation - Maryland Corps Program Service Year Option Pathways - Revisions
Synopsis: Altering the duties of the Department of Service and Civic Innovation; renaming the Governor's Volunteer Council to be the Governor's Commission on Service and Volunteerism; altering certain requirements relating to qualifications for applicants and compensation for participants in the Young Adult Service Year Option Pathway and the Maryland Service Year Option Pathway; altering certain reporting requirements; and repealing the Executive Fellows Program.
bill_summary: The bill revises the Maryland Corps Program, establishing two new pathways: the Young Adult Service Year Pathway and the Maryland Service Year Pathway. It sets program goals, funding, participant requirements, and reporting obligations, and renames the Governorโs Volunteer Council to the Governorโs Commission on Service and Volunteerism.
responsible_party: Department of Service and Civic Innovation
stakeholders: Young adults, Maryland residents, state and local government agencies, community organizations, and employers
access_to_capital_summary: The bill creates structured pathways with stipends and awards, potentially increasing access to capital for participants and organizations involved.

Title: Department of Aging โ Aging Services โ Program Repeal and Consolidation
Synopsis: Repealing provisions of law requiring the Secretary of Aging to develop certain congregate housing and assisted living programs for seniors; repealing the Interagency Committee on Aging Services and transferring certain responsibilities of the Committee to the Department of Aging; requiring the Department, beginning in June 2025, in coordination with area stakeholders, to conduct program transition planning and to co-design the new, consolidated program required by the Act; etc.
bill_summary: The bill repeals certain aging programs and committees, consolidates responsibilities into the Department of Aging, and establishes a new program to provide a single point of entry for services to older adults, including assessments and access to various support services.
responsible_party: Department of Aging
stakeholders: Older adults in Maryland and their caregivers
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's focus is on service coordination and access rather than direct financial support or capital access for small businesses.

Title: Public Health - Repeal of Prohibition on Transfer of Human Immunodeficiency Virus (Carlton R. Smith Act)
Synopsis: Repealing the prohibition on an individual from knowingly transferring or attempting to transfer the human immunodeficiency virus to another individual.
bill_summary: The bill repeals the existing prohibition on knowingly transferring or attempting to transfer the human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) to another individual, effectively removing criminal penalties for such actions.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Individuals living with HIV and the general public
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Natural Resources - Fishing Licenses and Stamps - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the fees for resident consolidated senior sport fishing licenses, angler's licenses, and trout stamps; and repealing the exemption from the requirement to obtain a trout stamp under certain circumstances for a holder of a resident consolidated senior sport fishing license.
bill_summary: The bill increases fees for certain fishing licenses and stamps in Maryland, repeals some exemptions, and establishes a program for discounted licenses for Purple Heart recipients.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Maryland residents who fish, especially senior citizens and disabled persons, and military service members
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Election Law - Petitions for the Formation of a New Political Party - Process
Synopsis: Altering the time periods during which a petition for the formation of a new political party or additional signatures to a petition may not be filed; and prohibiting signatures submitted with a petition that was officially determined as not meeting certain legal requirements from being resubmitted with a subsequent petition.
bill_summary: The bill amends Maryland election law to change the time periods during which petitions for the formation of a new political party can be filed, and prohibits resubmission of signatures if a petition fails to meet legal requirements.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Elections
stakeholders: Individuals and groups interested in forming new political parties in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Federally Qualified Health Centers Grant Program - Acquisition of Land
Synopsis: Authorizing the Board of Public Works, on recommendation of the Secretary of Health, to make grants under the Federally Qualified Health Centers Grant Program to counties, municipal corporations, and nonprofit corporations for the acquisition of land for the construction or use of a federally qualified health center.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland Board of Public Works, based on the recommendation of the Secretary of Health, to provide grants to counties, municipal corporations, and nonprofit organizations for acquiring land to build or use federally qualified health centers, as part of the existing Federally Qualified Health Centers Grant Program.
responsible_party: Board of Public Works, Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Counties, municipal corporations, nonprofit organizations, and residents who will access federally qualified health centers
access_to_capital_summary: The program has a high potential to impact small business owners and organizations seeking to acquire land for health centers by providing grants for land acquisition.

Title: Public Health - Cannabis Public Health Advisory Council - Membership
Synopsis: Altering the membership of the Cannabis Public Health Advisory Council to include the Administrator of the Motor Vehicle Administration, or the Administrator's designee, and the Executive Director of the Office of Social Equity in the Maryland Cannabis Administration, or the Executive Director's designee.
bill_summary: This bill amends the membership composition of the Cannabis Public Health Advisory Council in Maryland, adding new members appointed by the Governor, including representatives from historically black colleges, health care providers, pharmacists, researchers, and industry stakeholders.
responsible_party: Maryland Cannabis Administration and other state agencies involved in public health and cannabis regulation
stakeholders: Public health officials, cannabis industry stakeholders, healthcare providers, researchers, and residents of Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly establish or fund programs that impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Environment - Building Energy Performance Standards - Alterations and Analysis
Synopsis: Altering the requirements for certain regulations adopted by the Department of the Environment relating to building energy performance standards to include certain exclusions, considerations, and a certain  annual reporting fee to cover certain costs; requiring the Department to certify a certain building energy performance standards program adopted by a county under certain circumstances; requiring the Department to conduct an analysis of the potential costs and benefits of certain building energy performance standards policy options; etc.
bill_summary: This bill establishes regulations and standards for building energy performance in Maryland, including targets, exemptions, and alternative compliance pathways, and creates a program for fees and incentives related to greenhouse gas emissions and energy use in large buildings.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Owners and operators of large commercial and multifamily buildings in Maryland, including government agencies and private sector entities
access_to_capital_summary: The bill introduces fees, waivers, and incentives that could influence the financial strategies of building owners, potentially impacting their access to capital for energy efficiency projects.

Title: Health Services Cost Review Commission โ User Fee Assessment โ Repeal of Sunset
Synopsis: Repealing the termination date for a certain provision of law related to the maximum amount of total user fees that may be assessed on hospitals and related institutions by the Health Services Cost Review Commission.
bill_summary: The bill repeals the sunset date for a law that limits the maximum amount of user fees that the Health Services Cost Review Commission can assess on hospitals and related institutions in Maryland.
responsible_party: Health Services Cost Review Commission
stakeholders: Hospitals and related health institutions in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners or healthcare providers.

Title: Procurement - State Department of Education - Local Food Purchasing Program
Synopsis: Requiring the State Department of Education, in coordination with the Department of General Services and the Department of Agriculture, to establish a program to procure, when funding is available, local food for local school systems with preference to providers that are certified local farms or certified Chesapeake invasive species providers; altering the percentage price preference adopted by the Board of Public Works for locally grown food from 5% to 10%; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland State Department of Education to establish a program to procure local food for schools, focusing on food grown within a 200-mile radius, at certified local farms, or from Chesapeake invasive species providers. It also creates a Certified Local Farm and Fish Program to encourage procurement from local farms and invasive species providers, with a goal of 20% of procurement contracts.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education, Department of Agriculture, Department of General Services
stakeholders: Local farmers, Chesapeake invasive species providers, students, local school systems
access_to_capital_summary: The bill promotes local procurement and supports local farms and invasive species providers, which could improve their access to government contracts and revenue.

Title: Property Tax โ Tax Sales โ Revisions
Synopsis: Authorizing a tax collector to withhold from tax sale certain property occupied by an heir of a deceased owner of the property; requiring that certain owner-occupied property and certain property occupied by an heir of a deceased owner of the property be withheld from tax sale; requiring each county to establish a registry for interested parties or the Tax Sale Ombudsman to designate property to be withheld from tax sale; requiring the State Department of Assessments and Taxation to assist each county in creating and maintaining the registry; etc.
bill_summary: This bill revises Maryland's property tax sale laws by establishing rules for withholding certain properties from tax sales, setting maximum redemption rates, updating notice requirements, and creating a Homeowner Protection Program to help vulnerable homeowners.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation
stakeholders: Homeowners, heirs, and vulnerable property owners in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The program aims to help homeowners retain their properties and avoid foreclosure, which can improve their access to capital by maintaining property ownership.

Title: State Board of Public Accountancy - Sunset Extension and Report
Synopsis: Continuing the State Board of Public Accountancy in accordance with the provisions of the Maryland Program Evaluation Act (sunset law) by extending to July 1, 2030, the termination provisions relating to the statutory and regulatory authority of the Board; and requiring the Maryland Department of Labor to submit a certain report to the Joint Audit and Evaluation Committee on or before July 1, 2028.
bill_summary: The bill extends the sunset date for the State Board of Public Accountancy to July 1, 2030, and requires a report to be submitted by the Maryland Department of Labor by July 1, 2028.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: Public accountants and related professionals in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Education - Holocaust Education Assistance Grant Program - Established
Synopsis: Establishing the Holocaust Education Assistance Grant Program in the State Department of Education to assist local school systems with Holocaust education in public schools; authorizing a local school system to apply to the Department for a grant from the Program to be used for teacher training or teaching materials; and requiring the Governor to include in the annual budget bill an appropriation of $50,000 for the Program.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Holocaust Education Assistance Grant Program within the Maryland State Department of Education to support local school systems with Holocaust education through grants for teacher training and teaching materials.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: Public school students and educators in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The program provides targeted grants for Holocaust education, which could improve access to educational resources but is limited in scope.

Title: State Finance and Procurement - State Leasing of Real Property
Synopsis: Increasing the noncompetitive threshold for State leases of real property from less than 2,500 square feet to up to 5,000 square feet; altering the time frame during which the State is required to advertise the need for rental of building space from at least 30 days to 20 days before proposals for lease are due; requiring the advertisement to be in certain newspapers providing notice to at least the people of the affected locality; and requiring the notice to be posted on the Department's website and eMaryland Marketplace.
bill_summary: The bill increases the noncompetitive threshold for State leases of real property from 2,500 to 5,000 square feet, and changes the advertising requirements for leasing needs, including reducing the notice period from 30 to 20 days and requiring advertising on the eMaryland Marketplace platform.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of General Services
stakeholders: State government agencies and entities seeking to lease real property for state use
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Election Law โ Special Elections
Synopsis: Altering requirements for scheduling special elections to fill vacancies in a county council or in the office of chief executive officer or county executive; requiring the State Administrator to conduct a special election in accordance with State law and regulations if the State Administrator determines a conflict exists between State law and regulations and a county charter or other county law relating to the conduct of a special election; etc.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the rules for scheduling and conducting special elections in Maryland, including provisions for when they can be held, how they are conducted, and the process for mail-in ballots.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Elections
stakeholders: Voters and election officials in Maryland, especially those involved in special elections for county councils and county executives.
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Estates and Trusts - Maryland Trust Decanting Act - Notification and Document Transmittal
Synopsis: Specifying the manner in which notice regarding an exercise of the decanting power or the sending of a document under the Maryland Trust Decanting Act is required to be provided.
bill_summary: This bill amends the Maryland Trust Decanting Act to specify acceptable methods for providing notice and transmitting documents related to decanting, including personal service, mail, courier, and agreed-upon electronic methods.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Estates and Trusts (or equivalent agency responsible for estate law enforcement)
stakeholders: Trustees, beneficiaries, and individuals involved in estate decanting processes in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill primarily clarifies legal procedures for trust decanting and does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Criminal Law - Crimes Relating to Animals - Conviction and Sentencing
Synopsis: Establishing that certain crimes relating to animals do not include certain activities; establishing that each animal harmed in a violation of a prohibition against animal cruelty is a separate offense and shall be deemed an individual victim for purposes of the sentencing guidelines stacking rule; establishing that a conviction for a crime relating to animals may not merge with a conviction for any other crime based on the act establishing the violation; etc.
bill_summary: The bill clarifies and enhances laws related to animal cruelty in Maryland. It establishes that each animal harmed in a cruelty violation is a separate offense and victim, prevents convictions under animal cruelty laws from merging with other crimes, and allows sentences to be separate and consecutive or concurrent. It also exempts certain activities like veterinary practices, research, and humane hunting from animal cruelty laws.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services or relevant law enforcement agencies
stakeholders: Animals, animal welfare organizations, law enforcement, and individuals involved in activities like veterinary care, research, hunting, and farming
access_to_capital_summary: The bill primarily focuses on legal definitions and sentencing related to animal cruelty and does not directly impact access to capital for small businesses.

Title: Heating, Ventilation, AirโConditioning, and Refrigeration Contractors โ License Restoration
Synopsis: Extending from 90 days to 4 years the time period during which an individual who has held a heating, ventilation, air-conditioning, and refrigeration contractor license may apply for license restoration after expiration.
bill_summary: The bill extends the period during which a heating, ventilation, air-conditioning, and refrigeration contractor license can be restored after expiration from 90 days to 4 years.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Heating, Ventilation, AirโConditioning, and Refrigeration Contractors
stakeholders: Heating, ventilation, air-conditioning, and refrigeration contractors in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Opioid-Associated Disease Prevention and Outreach Programs - Appeals and Membership of Standing Advisory Committee
Synopsis: Authorizing a local health department or community-based organization to appeal to the Secretary of Health or the Secretary's designee rather than to the Deputy Secretary for Public Health Services, an adverse decision of the Maryland Department of Health and a local health officer regarding an application for authorization to operate an Opioid-Associated Disease Prevention and Outreach Program; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes local health departments and community-based organizations to establish opioid prevention and outreach programs, outlines the application and appeal process for program authorization, and establishes a standing advisory committee to provide technical assistance and guidance for these programs.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Individuals affected by opioid use, local health departments, community organizations, law enforcement, healthcare providers, and families of individuals who inject drugs.
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's focus is on establishing and supporting opioid prevention programs, which may indirectly impact access to resources for substance use treatment, but it does not directly address access to capital for small businesses.

Title: Anne Arundel County - Class A (Off-Sale) and Class D (Off-Sale) Licenses - Population Ratio Quota
Synopsis: Establishing a population ratio quota for certain Class A (off-sale) and Class D (off-sale) licenses in Anne Arundel County; specifying a certain official map to be used to identify certain tax assessment districts for purposes of the population ratio quota; and prohibiting the Board of License Commissioners for Anne Arundel County from approving the transfer of certain alcoholic beverages licenses under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a population ratio quota for certain off-sale alcohol licenses in Anne Arundel County, limiting the number of licenses based on the population of specific assessment districts, and restricts license transfers outside these districts.
responsible_party: Anne Arundel County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Alcohol license holders, residents of Anne Arundel County, businesses seeking alcohol licenses
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's restrictions on license transfers and issuance could limit the growth of alcohol-related businesses and affect their access to licenses, which are a form of capital or business asset.

Title: Insurance Pooling - Public Entity - Definition
Synopsis: Altering the definition of "public entity" to include a Resilience Authority for purposes of insurance pooling.
bill_summary: The bill amends the definition of 'public entity' to include Resilience Authorities, allowing them to participate in insurance pooling for casualty, property, or health insurance, or to self-insure against these risks.
responsible_party: Maryland State Insurance Department or relevant local government agencies
stakeholders: Resilience Authorities, local governments, and public entities involved in resilience infrastructure projects
access_to_capital_summary: The bill potentially increases access to insurance and self-insurance options for Resilience Authorities, which could improve their ability to fund resilience projects.

Title: Family and Medical Leave Insurance Program - Revisions
Synopsis: Defining "anchor date" to establish certain reference points for the calculation of a certain covered employee's average weekly wage and eligibility for increases in weekly benefits under the Family Medical Leave and Insurance Program; requiring the Maryland Department of Labor to adopt regulations establishing an optional self-employed enrollment program governing the participation of self-employed individuals in the Program; repealing certain requirements related to  contributions made by certain participating individuals; etc.
bill_summary: This bill revises the Maryland Family and Medical Leave Insurance Program by defining key terms, establishing an optional self-employed enrollment program, adjusting contribution and benefit calculation rules, and setting program timelines and reporting requirements.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: Employees, self-employed individuals, employers, and healthcare providers in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's impact on access to capital is indirect, primarily through the establishment of a self-employed enrollment program and contribution rules, which could influence financial stability for small business owners.

Title: Maryland Farms and Families Fund โ Purpose and Use โ Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the purpose and use of the Maryland Farms and Families Fund to match purchases made with FMNP, SNAP, and WIC benefits at certain farmers markets and farm stands, support nonprofit farmers markets by providing logistical and marketing support to increase the use of federal nutrition programs at these markets, and to support nonprofit  organizations or other responsible persons to implement the Program.
bill_summary: The bill alters the purpose and use of the Maryland Farms and Families Fund to support programs that increase access to fresh fruits and vegetables for food-insecure Maryland residents by matching federal nutrition benefits at farmers markets and supporting nonprofit organizations and farmers markets in implementing these programs.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Agriculture
stakeholders: Food-insecure Maryland residents, farmers, nonprofit organizations, farmers markets
access_to_capital_summary: The program has a high potential to directly impact small business owners (farmers and farmers markets) by providing funding and support to increase sales through federal nutrition benefits.

Title: Consumer Protection - Automatic Renewals
Synopsis: Requiring a person who makes an automatic renewal offer to consumers to allow a consumer to cancel the automatic renewal in a cost-effective, timely, and easy-to-use manner; requiring automatic renewal offers to be displayed in a certain manner and contain certain information; establishing that compliance with certain regulations or a certain license shall be considered to be compliance with the Act; establishing that a violation of the Act is an unfair, abusive, or deceptive trade practice; etc.
bill_summary: This bill regulates automatic renewal offers by requiring clear disclosures, easy cancellation options, and prior notice to consumers, and prohibits automatic charges without consumer consent.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Commerce or relevant regulatory agency
stakeholders: Consumers and businesses offering automatic renewal services in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill primarily focuses on consumer protection and does not directly impact access to capital for small businesses.

Title: Pesticide and Pest Control - Revisions to Pesticide Applicator's Law and Repeal of Obsolete Provisions
Synopsis: Establishing requirements for the commercial application of general use pesticides, the commercial application of restricted use pesticides, and the private application of restricted use pesticides; requiring a certified private applicator to ensure that certain individuals working under the certified applicator's supervision meet certain requirements; specifying the responsibility and liability of certified applicators for the application of certain pesticides; etc.
bill_summary: The bill revises Maryland's pesticide laws by establishing requirements for the application of general use and restricted use pesticides, including certification and supervision rules, and repeals obsolete provisions related to certain pesticides and antifouling paints.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Agriculture
stakeholders: Pesticide applicators, pest control businesses, agricultural producers, commercial boatyards, vessel owners, and the general public in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Electric Companies - Regional Transmission Organizations - Report (Utility Transparency and Accountability Act)
Synopsis: Requiring an electric company, other than a municipal electric utility, by February 1 each year, to submit a report to the Public Service Commission regarding each recorded vote cast by the electric company and any of its State affiliates at a meeting of a regional transmission organization.
bill_summary: The bill requires electric companies in Maryland to submit an annual report to the Public Service Commission detailing each recorded vote they or their affiliates cast at regional transmission organization meetings.
responsible_party: Public Service Commission of Maryland
stakeholders: Electric companies, regional transmission organizations, and consumers in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Maryland Correctional Training Commission โ Membership
Synopsis: Altering the membership of the Maryland Correctional Training Commission to include the Director of the Division of Parole and Probation within the Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services and one employee of the Division recommended by the exclusive representative for the employees of the Division of Parole and Probation and appointed by the Governor.
bill_summary: The bill amends the membership of the Maryland Correctional Training Commission to include the Director of the Division of Parole and Probation and one employee of the Division of Parole and Probation, appointed by the Governor.
responsible_party: Maryland Correctional Training Commission
stakeholders: Correctional officers, parole and probation employees, correctional institutions, and the criminal justice system in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Residential Property - Assignment of Contracts of Sale - Disclosure Requirements and Rescission
Synopsis: Authorizing a seller or assignee of certain residential property to rescind a contract of sale without penalty at any time before closing if a certain seller does not provide a certain notice; establishing that an assignee is entitled to a refund of any deposit paid in connection with the assignment of a contract of sale of the residential property under certain circumstances; requiring that a contract of sale comply with the requirements of the Act; and applying the Act prospectively.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes residential property sellers and assignees to rescind contracts of sale under certain circumstances, mandates disclosures for wholesale buyers and sellers, and provides refunds for deposits if contracts are rescinded before closing.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Residential property buyers, sellers, wholesale buyers, wholesale sellers, and real estate professionals in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's provisions on rescinding contracts and refunds could improve small business and individual access to capital by reducing financial risks.

Title: Department of Housing and Community Development - Maryland Housing Rehabilitation Program - Local Rehabilitation Program Administration
Synopsis: Expanding the entities eligible to administer local rehabilitation programs to include certain nonprofit sponsors.
bill_summary: The bill expands the entities eligible to administer local housing rehabilitation programs in Maryland to include certain nonprofit sponsors, and clarifies the roles and standards for these entities in managing rehabilitation loans and projects.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Homeowners and communities in Maryland seeking housing rehabilitation assistance, nonprofit organizations, and local governments involved in housing projects.
access_to_capital_summary: The bill potentially increases access to rehabilitation funding for local entities, including nonprofits, which could improve small business owners' access to capital for housing projects.

Title: Climate Change Adaptation and Mitigation - Total Assessed Cost of Greenhouse Gas Emissions - Study and Reports
Synopsis: Requiring the Comptroller, in coordination with the Department of the Environment and the Department of Commerce, to conduct a study to assess the total cost of greenhouse gas emissions in the State and report certain findings to certain committees by December 1, 2026, on the total assessed cost of greenhouse gas emissions in the State based on the findings of the study; authorizing the Comptroller to hire a consultant to conduct the study; and requiring the report to include certain information and calculations.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Climate Change Adaptation and Mitigation Payment Program in Maryland, which requires fossil fuel companies responsible for significant greenhouse gas emissions to pay compensatory fees. These funds will be used to support infrastructure projects and programs that help the state adapt to and mitigate climate change effects, especially benefiting vulnerable communities.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of the Environment and the Maryland Department of Commerce
stakeholders: Fossil fuel companies, vulnerable communities, state agencies, general public
access_to_capital_summary: The bill creates a financial liability for large fossil fuel companies, which could lead to increased funding for climate-related infrastructure and projects, indirectly supporting community resilience and adaptation efforts.

Title: Environment - Bay Restoration Fund - Septic System Upgrade Program
Synopsis: Updating the funding priorities for failing sewage systems and holding tanks; requiring as a second priority those located within the Maryland Chesapeake Bay 8-digit watershed that have a relative effectiveness for total nitrogen reduction of 9.24 or higher based on the Chesapeake Bay watershed model; requiring as a third priority funding for failing systems within the 500-year floodplain, and fourth to certain other failing systems; and expanding certain funding eligibility criteria for on-site and community sewage systems.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a program for funding upgrades to septic systems using nitrogen removal technology, evaluates and ranks these technologies, and allocates funds for repairs, replacements, and upgrades to improve water quality in Maryland.
responsible_party: Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Residents and property owners with on-site sewage disposal systems in Maryland, local governments, and environmental agencies.
access_to_capital_summary: The program has a high potential to improve access to capital for septic system upgrades, repairs, and replacements, especially for low- and moderate-income homeowners.

Title: State Department of Assessments and Taxation - Notification of Constant Yield Tax Rate - Alteration
Synopsis: Altering the requirement that the State Department of Assessments and Taxation notify each taxing authority of the constant yield tax rate for each taxable year by requiring that the notice be sent by the Department to a taxing authority only on the request of the taxing authority.
bill_summary: The bill alters the process for notifying taxing authorities about the constant yield tax rate by requiring the Department of Assessments and Taxation to send the notice only upon request, rather than automatically.
responsible_party: Department of Assessments and Taxation
stakeholders: Taxing authorities and local governments in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Criminal Procedure - Sexual Assault Exam and Treatment Reimbursement
Synopsis: Providing that the Governor's Office of Crime Prevention and Policy, rather than the Criminal Injuries Compensation Board, is responsible for payment to a physician, qualified health care provider, and hospital for providing certain services to a victim of an alleged rape or sexual offense or a victim of alleged child sexual abuse.
bill_summary: The bill shifts the responsibility for reimbursing providers for sexual assault exams and treatments from the Criminal Injuries Compensation Board to the Governorโs Office of Crime Prevention and Policy, effective June 1, 2025.
responsible_party: Governorโs Office of Crime Prevention and Policy
stakeholders: Victims of sexual assault and child sexual abuse, healthcare providers, hospitals
access_to_capital_summary: The bill ensures that providers are reimbursed for services without charge to victims, potentially reducing financial barriers for providers, but does not directly impact small business access to capital.

Title: Estates and Trusts - Resignation of Trustee - Notice
Synopsis: Authorizing the trustee of a trust to resign under the Maryland Trust Act on 30 days' notice to qualified beneficiaries, the settlor, if living, all cotrustees, and any person that has a right to replace or appoint a successor to the resigning trustee.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes trustees of trusts in Maryland to resign by providing at least 30 days' notice to specified parties or with court approval, and clarifies procedures and protections related to trustee resignation.
responsible_party: Maryland Judiciary or courts
stakeholders: Trust beneficiaries, trustees, and trust settlors in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners; it pertains to trust management procedures.

Title: Child Care Centers - Certificated Staff Ratio Requirement - Alteration
Synopsis: Altering a requirement that a child care center that has 20 or more children have in attendance a certain ratio, set by the Department, of staff to children who hold a certificate in first aid and cardiopulmonary resuscitation under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill alters the staffing requirements for child care centers in Maryland, specifically removing the previous staff-to-children ratio requirement for staff with first aid and CPR certificates.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: Child care centers, children, parents, and staff in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Department of Aging - Senior Call-Check and Social Connections Program
Synopsis: Renaming the Senior Call-Check Service and Notification Program to be the Senior Call-Check and Social Connections Program; providing that the purpose of the program is to provide regular, direct communication from the Department of Aging or the Department's designee to an eligible participant to promote wellness and purposeful social engagement; authorizing the integration of services between the Program and Telecommunications Access of Maryland to promote awareness of the availability of accessible telecommunications equipment; etc.
bill_summary: The bill renames the Senior CallโCheck Service and Notification Program to the Senior CallโCheck and Social Connections Program, and establishes the new program to promote wellness and social engagement among older adults through regular communication and integration with telecommunications services.
responsible_party: Department of Aging
stakeholders: Older adults in Maryland at risk of social isolation
access_to_capital_summary: The program is focused on social engagement and wellness checks, not on providing access to capital for small businesses.

Title: County Boards of Education - Curriculum Guides and Courses of Study - Discrepancies
Synopsis: Requiring each county board of education to adopt curriculum guides and courses of study aligned with content standards established by the State Department of Education; establishing a process for correcting discrepancies identified by the State Superintendent of Schools in a county board's curriculum guides and courses of study, including the imposition of certain penalties; requiring the Department, in consultation with certain teachers, to develop content and curriculum standards and resources for each subject at each grade level; etc.
bill_summary: The bill mandates the development of a comprehensive health education framework and curriculum for public schools in Maryland, including policies for parental opt-out and curriculum review processes, and establishes standards and resources for core subjects to improve student readiness for college and careers.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: Public school students, parents, teachers, and school administrators in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill primarily focuses on curriculum development and health education standards, with no direct provisions for access to capital for small businesses.

Title: Motor Home and Recreational Vehicle Shows in Worcester County - Permit for Out-of-State Dealers
Synopsis: Establishing the reciprocal out-of-state motor home and recreational trailer vehicle show permit, to be issued by the Motor Vehicle Administration, authorizing the holder to display motor homes and recreational vehicles at vehicle shows in Worcester County; and requiring a permit holder, after the permit is approved, to file a bond with the Administration.
bill_summary: This bill establishes a reciprocal out-of-state motor home and recreational vehicle show permit, allowing out-of-state dealers to display vehicles at shows in Worcester County, Maryland, with certain restrictions and bonding requirements.
responsible_party: Motor Vehicle Administration of Maryland
stakeholders: Out-of-state motor home and recreational vehicle dealers, residents and visitors of Worcester County, Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Health - Maternal and Child Health Population Health Improvement Fund - Use
Synopsis: Altering from December 31, 2025, to December 31, 2027, the date through which the Maternal and Child Health Population Health Improvement Fund may be used for expenses associated with maternal and child health population health improvements.
bill_summary: This bill extends the use of the Maternal and Child Health Population Health Improvement Fund until December 31, 2027, allowing funds to be used for maternal and child health improvements.
responsible_party: Department and the Commission (unspecified specific agencies)
stakeholders: Maternal and child health populations in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly establish a program to improve access to capital for small businesses.

Title: Davis Martinez Public Employee Safety and Health Act
Synopsis: Requiring the Correctional Training Commission to adopt regulations for the training, issuance, and use of body-worn cameras by January 1, 2026; establishing the Public Employees' Safety and Health Unit in the Division of Labor and Industry to administer and enforce certain duties regarding the oversight of workplace safety and health of employees of certain public bodies; establishing and applying certain civil and criminal penalties to public bodies and persons in government; etc.
bill_summary: This bill establishes regulations and oversight for workplace safety and health, including the use of body-worn cameras by correctional officers, and creates a new Public Employeesโ Safety and Health Unit to enforce these standards, with a focus on public bodies and workplace violence prevention.
responsible_party: Division of Labor and Industry, Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: Employees of public bodies, correctional officers, and workplaces of public entities in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's focus on workplace safety and health standards, including violence prevention, may indirectly impact small business owners by improving safety conditions, but it does not directly provide access to capital.

Title: Organized Retail Theft Act of 2025
Synopsis: Providing that multiple thefts committed by the same person in multiple counties under one scheme or continuing course of conduct may be joined and prosecuted in any county in which any one of the thefts occurred; prohibiting one or more persons from committing a series of thefts from retail merchants over a 90-day period with an aggregate value exceeding $1,500; requiring a court to make a finding as to whether a certain crime is organized retail theft under certain circumstances for a certain purpose; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a new offense called organized retail theft, defining it as a series of thefts from retail stores over a 90-day period with specific monetary thresholds. It sets penalties based on the total value stolen and allows multiple thefts across counties to be prosecuted together. The bill also clarifies procedures for determining whether a theft is organized retail theft and requires courts to make findings on this.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services or the judiciary system
stakeholders: Retail merchants, law enforcement, and the general public in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's focus on criminal penalties and law enforcement procedures does not directly impact small business owners' access to capital.

Title: Military Department โ Chief of Staff and Aides โ Appointment Authority
Synopsis: Authorizing the Adjutant General instead of the Governor to appoint certain staff in the Military Department; and establishing that certain staff in the Military Department serve at the pleasure of the Adjutant General instead of the Governor.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Adjutant General of Maryland's Military Department to appoint the chief of staff and aides, replacing the Governor's authority, and specifies that these staff serve at the pleasure of the Adjutant General.
responsible_party: Maryland Military Department
stakeholders: Members of the Maryland Military Department and state government
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Motor Vehicles - Speed Monitoring Systems -
Synopsis: Altering the penalties for a civil citation issued as a result of a recorded image produced by a speed monitoring system; requiring the State Highway Administration to convene a workgroup to study best practices regarding speed monitoring systems in school zones; and requiring the workgroup to submit its findings and recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly by December 1, 2025.
bill_summary: The bill modifies penalties for speeding violations recorded by speed monitoring systems and establishes a workgroup to study best practices for speed monitoring in school zones. It also sets the effective date for these changes.
responsible_party: Maryland State Highway Administration
stakeholders: Motor vehicle drivers, school children, local governments, law enforcement agencies
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Therapeutic Child Care Grant Program - Funding - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the fiscal years to include fiscal year 2027 through fiscal year 2029, during which the Governor is required to include in the annual budget bill an appropriation of $3,700,000 to the Therapeutic Child Care Grant Program.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the funding structure and fiscal years for the Therapeutic Child Care Grant Program in Maryland, including the annual budget appropriations and distribution of grants to providers for children with developmental delays or disabilities.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Education
stakeholders: Children under 6 years with developmental delays or disabilities, child care providers, families
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's focus on grants to providers for specialized child care services may improve access to quality care for children with special needs, but it does not directly impact small business capital access.

Title: Drunk Driving - Commercial Driver's Licenses - Disqualification From Driving
Synopsis: Requiring the Motor Vehicle Administration to disqualify any individual from driving a commercial motor vehicle for 1 year if the individual, while holding a commercial instructional permit or commercial driver's license, drives or attempts to drive any motor vehicle while the alcohol concentration of the person's blood or breath is 0.08 or greater.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration to disqualify individuals from driving commercial motor vehicles for specified periods, including a lifetime disqualification for multiple violations related to drunk driving with blood alcohol concentrations of 0.08 or higher.
responsible_party: Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration
stakeholders: Commercial drivers and the general public
access_to_capital_summary: The bill primarily focuses on disqualification rules for drunk driving and does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Vehicle Laws - Towed, Removed, or Abandoned Vehicles - Electronic Notice to Owner
Synopsis: Authorizing a person who tows or removes a vehicle from a parking lot to provide electronic notice of the tow or removal to the vehicle owner through the Motor Vehicle Administration under certain circumstances; and authorizing a police department that takes an abandoned vehicle into custody to send an electronic notice to the last known registered owner of the vehicle through the Administration under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes towing companies and police departments to send electronic notices to vehicle owners, secured parties, and insurers regarding towed, removed, or abandoned vehicles, replacing some traditional mailing procedures.
responsible_party: Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration and police departments
stakeholders: Vehicle owners, towing companies, police departments, insurers, secured parties, parking lot owners
access_to_capital_summary: The program could improve the efficiency of vehicle recovery and reduce costs associated with traditional mailing, potentially aiding small businesses involved in towing and vehicle recovery.

Title: Uninsured Employers' Fund - Assessments and Special Monitor
Synopsis: Altering the circumstances under which the Uninsured Employers' Fund must collect or suspend a certain assessment; altering, from 1% to up to 1.5%, the additional percentage the Uninsured Employers' Fund Board may direct the Workers' Compensation Commission to assess on awards and settlements if the Board determines that the reserves of the Fund are inadequate to meet anticipated losses; and requiring the Workers' Compensation Commission to designate a special monitor to assess the financial condition of the Uninsured Employers' Fund.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the assessment process for the Maryland Uninsured Employers' Fund, including increasing the assessment rate when reserves are inadequate, establishing a special monitor to assess the fund's financial health, and setting thresholds for suspending and resuming assessments.
responsible_party: Maryland Workersโ Compensation Commission
stakeholders: Employers, insurers, and workers in Maryland, especially those involved with uninsured employers' liabilities
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's focus on assessments and fund monitoring indirectly impacts the financial stability of the fund, which could influence small business access to capital, but it does not directly create a program to improve access.

Title: Public Schools - Restorative Practices Schools - Comprehensive Plan
Synopsis: Requiring the State Department of Education to develop a comprehensive plan by July 1, 2026, for the establishment of Restorative Practices Schools which integrate restorative practices into daily practices and activities of the whole school; requiring a county board of education to use the comprehensive plan if the county board chooses to establish a Restorative Practices School; and requiring the Department to report to the Governor and the General Assembly by December 1, 2026, on the comprehensive plan for Restorative Practices Schools.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Education to develop a comprehensive plan for establishing Restorative Practices Schools, which focus on relationship-based, proactive discipline methods that emphasize accountability and repairing relationships. It also mandates the use of these practices in public schools and provides guidelines for their implementation.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: Public school students, teachers, administrators, and families in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill promotes the integration of restorative practices into schools, which may indirectly support the development of programs and training that could benefit small business owners involved in educational services, but it does not directly impact access to capital.

Title: Election Law - Notice to Permanent Absentee Voters
Synopsis: Altering the time before an election when a certain notice is required to be sent to each voter who is on the permanent absentee ballot list; repealing a requirement that the notice be sent to each voter who is on the permanent absentee ballot list as of a certain date; and altering the action the State Board of Elections is required to take if the State Board is unable to contact a voter who is on the permanent absentee ballot list using the method of communication chosen by the voter.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the notification process for voters on the permanent absentee ballot list, including the timing of notices and the methods of contact, and requires the State Board of Elections to attempt contact with voters if initial contact fails.
responsible_party: State Board of Elections
stakeholders: Voters on the permanent absentee ballot list in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Consumer Protection โ False Advertising โ Digital Goods
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person that is a seller from advertising or offering for sale a digital good using certain terminology unless, before executing the sale, a certain affirmative acknowledgment is received from the purchaser or a certain clear and conspicuous statement is provided by the seller; and establishing that a violation of the Act is an unfair, abusive, or deceptive trade practice subject to certain enforcement and penalty provisions.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits deceptive advertising of digital goods, requiring sellers to clearly communicate license terms and restrictions, especially when offering time-limited rentals, and establishes penalties for violations.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Commerce or relevant consumer protection agency
stakeholders: Consumers and digital goods sellers in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's focus on advertising and licensing clarity may indirectly influence digital goods market practices but does not directly impact access to capital for small businesses.

Title: State Finance and Procurement - Local Cybersecurity Preparedness and Response Plan and Assessment - Repeal
Synopsis: Repealing a duplicative provision of law requiring each county government, local school system, and local health department, in consultation with the local emergency manager, to create or update a cybersecurity preparedness and response plan and complete a cybersecurity preparedness assessment in a manner and frequency established by the Department of Information Technology.
bill_summary: The bill repeals a law that required local government entities in Maryland to create or update a cybersecurity preparedness and response plan and complete a cybersecurity assessment.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Information Technology
stakeholders: Local government entities in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Human Services - Maryland Assistive Technology Program - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Maryland Assistive Technology Program in the Department of Disabilities; providing the purpose of the Program is to increase access to assistive technology services and devices for individuals with disabilities, support the State's efforts to provide assistive technology services and devices to persons with disabilities of all ages, including underrepresented populations, and ensure statewide access to assistive technology lending libraries; establishing the Assistive Technology Services Fund; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland Assistive Technology Program within the Department of Disabilities to provide assistive technology devices and services to individuals with disabilities. It also creates the Assistive Technology Services Fund to support the program's operations and activities.
responsible_party: Department of Disabilities
stakeholders: Individuals with disabilities in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The program is focused on providing assistive technology devices and services, not on access to capital for small businesses.

Title: Public Safety - Fuel Gas Piping Systems and Corrugated Stainless Steel Tubing - Prohibitions and Study
Synopsis: Prohibiting the sale, offer for sale, transfer, or distribution of non-arc-resistant jacketed corrugated stainless steel tubing; providing a civil penalty of up to $1,000 for a violation of the Act; and requiring the Maryland Department of Labor and the Office of the State Fire Marshal, by September 1, 2026, to submit a final report to the Governor and certain committees of the General Assembly with recommendations related to preventing the fire hazards associated with commonly used fuel gas piping systems.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits the sale and use of nonโarc-resistant jacketed corrugated stainless steel tubing that does not meet specific safety standards for use in fuel gas piping systems, and mandates a study on fire hazards related to fuel gas piping systems, including gas piping and stainless steel tubing.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor and the Office of the State Fire Marshal
stakeholders: Residential and commercial building owners, gas piping system manufacturers, and regulatory agencies in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's focus on safety standards and potential regulations may influence the market for certain types of gas piping, but it does not directly create a program to improve access to capital for small businesses.

Title: Vehicle Laws - Exceptional Hauling Permits for Farm Products
Synopsis: Creating an exception for vehicles carrying fluid milk products to the prohibition against driving a vehicle subject to an exceptional hauling permit on the interstate highway system; altering certain weight limits and tolerances under an exceptional hauling permit; altering the preventive maintenance documents that an individual operating under an exceptional hauling permit must possess; and altering certain record-keeping requirements and the application of certain administrative penalties under an exceptional hauling permit.
bill_summary: The bill creates an exception for vehicles carrying fluid milk products from certain restrictions under the exceptional hauling permit rules, including restrictions on interstate highway use, weight limits, and record-keeping requirements.
responsible_party: Maryland State Highway Administration
stakeholders: Farmers, dairy producers, and transportation companies involved in hauling milk and farm products in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Anne Arundel County โ Public Schools โ School Schedule Options
Synopsis: Authorizing the Anne Arundel County Board of Education to operate all schools within the county using a scheduling model that eliminates early dismissal days to allow for less than 180 school days if the minimal hours of attendance are met; requiring the board, if it elects to use a scheduling model that results in a school in the county being open for less than 180 days to offer certain school employees an opportunity to make up the lost wages; and requiring the Board to make a report on the schools using an alternative scheduling model.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Anne Arundel County to operate schools using a flexible scheduling model that can eliminate early dismissal days, allowing for fewer than 180 school days if the minimum hours are met, and requires reporting on these alternative schedules.
responsible_party: Anne Arundel County Board of Education
stakeholders: Students and staff in Anne Arundel County public schools
access_to_capital_summary: The program could improve access to capital for schools by allowing more flexible scheduling, potentially reducing costs associated with traditional school calendars.

Title: Corporations and Associations - Electric Cooperatives - Nonescheat Capital Credits
Synopsis: Providing that certain unclaimed money held by an electric cooperative and due to a past member is not considered abandoned property; and authorizing an electric cooperative to use this money only to assist members of the cooperative or make donations to nonprofit, charitable organizations.
bill_summary: The bill clarifies that unclaimed money held by electric cooperatives and due to past members is not considered abandoned property and can only be used for specific purposes such as assisting members or making donations to nonprofits. It also defines 'nonescheat capital credits' and sets rules for their use and refund.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Commerce or relevant electric cooperatives
stakeholders: Members of electric cooperatives, electric cooperatives, and nonprofit organizations in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's impact on access to capital is indirect, mainly affecting how unclaimed funds are handled and used, rather than providing direct capital access programs.

Title: Maryland Veterans Trust โ Assistance to Members of the Maryland National Guard
