Synopsis: Expanding the purposes of the Maryland Veterans Trust to include providing monetary and other assistance to members of the Maryland National Guard and their families; and authorizing the Maryland Veterans Trust to expend money from the Maryland Veterans Trust Fund to provide loans and grants to members of the Maryland National Guard and their families.
bill_summary: The bill expands the purposes of the Maryland Veterans Trust to include providing assistance, including loans and grants, to members of the Maryland National Guard and their families.
responsible_party: Maryland Veterans Trust
stakeholders: Members of the Maryland National Guard and their families, veterans, and veteran support programs
access_to_capital_summary: The bill potentially increases access to capital for members of the Maryland National Guard and their families through loans and grants.

Title: Maryland Public Ethics Law - Training and Financial Disclosure Requirements - Revisions
Synopsis: Altering the format and content of training on the requirements of the Maryland Public Ethics Law provided by the State Ethics Commission to certain State employees and regulated lobbyists to be either through online training or live presentation on the conflict of interest, financial disclosure, relevant administrative, and other applicable requirements of the law; and altering the scope of disclosure for the employment of an individual or a member of the individual's immediate family reported in a financial disclosure statement.
bill_summary: The bill revises the Maryland Public Ethics Law by changing the format of ethics training courses for state employees and lobbyists, and expanding the scope of financial disclosure requirements for public officials and their immediate families.
responsible_party: Maryland State Ethics Commission
stakeholders: State employees, lobbyists, public officials, and their immediate families in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill primarily focuses on ethics training and disclosure requirements, with no direct programs aimed at increasing access to capital for small businesses.

Title: State Government - Information Technology - Cybersecurity Revisions
Synopsis: Altering the duties of the Cyber Preparedness Unit in the Maryland Department of Emergency Management; altering the duties of the Office of Security Management in the Department of Information Technology; requiring the Office to submit a yearly report to the Governor and certain committees of the General Assembly on the State's cybersecurity expenditures and recommendations for changes to the budget; and altering the responsibilities of the Secretary of Information Technology with regard to information technology policies.
bill_summary: The bill revises the duties and responsibilities of the Maryland Department of Emergency Management's Cyber Preparedness Unit and the Department of Information Technology's Office of Security Management. It enhances cybersecurity coordination, reporting, and resource support for local governments and establishes a statewide cybersecurity strategy and standards.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Information Technology and Maryland Department of Emergency Management
stakeholders: State and local government agencies, local school systems, local health departments, and other public entities in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill primarily focuses on cybersecurity strategy, coordination, and resource support, with no direct programs aimed at increasing access to capital for small businesses.

Title: Peace Orders and Criminal Harassment - Intentional Visual Surveillance
Synopsis: Expanding the relief that may be included in a final peace order; altering the acts that constitute criminal harassment to include certain visual surveillance of an area of another person's residence where the other has a reasonable expectation of privacy; and providing that a person who violates the Act is guilty of a misdemeanor and on conviction for a first offense is subject to imprisonment of up to 90 days or a fine of $500 or both, and for a second or subsequent offense, imprisonment of up to 180 days or a fine of $1,000 or both.
bill_summary: The bill expands the legal protections against visual surveillance and harassment by allowing individuals to petition for peace orders if they are subjected to intentional visual surveillance of areas where they have a reasonable expectation of privacy, including their residence. It also modifies the acts that constitute criminal harassment to include such visual surveillance and provides remedies in peace orders, such as removing or repositioning surveillance devices.
responsible_party: Maryland courts and judicial system
stakeholders: Individuals concerned about privacy and harassment, residents, and the general public in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Charitable Organizations - Late Fees and Registration - Suspension and Cancellation Requirements
Synopsis: Authorizing the Secretary of State to suspend payment of certain late fees assessed to certain charitable organizations that fail to file an annual report under certain circumstances; and authorizing the Secretary of State to cancel a charitable organization's registration or reinstate a charitable organization's canceled registration under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Secretary of State to suspend late fees, cancel or reinstate charitable organizations' registration, and makes changes to reporting and fee requirements for charitable organizations in Maryland.
responsible_party: Secretary of State of Maryland
stakeholders: Charitable organizations operating in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's provisions are unlikely to have a direct impact on small business owners' access to capital.

Title: Marriage - Confidential Communication
Synopsis: Clarifying that "spouse" includes a former spouse for purposes of disclosure of confidential communications occurring during marriage; and establishing that a spouse, who is the alleged victim, is competent to disclose a confidential communication between spouses occurring during their marriage in a criminal action in which one spouse is charged with a crime against the other spouse.
bill_summary: The bill clarifies that a spouse, including a former spouse, can disclose confidential communications made during marriage in certain criminal cases, specifically when the spouse is the alleged victim and the case involves a crime against the spouse.
responsible_party: Maryland Judiciary or Courts and Judicial Proceedings
stakeholders: Spouses, former spouses, victims of crimes involving spouses, criminal justice system
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Family Law - Adoption of an Adult
Synopsis: Limiting the requirement that a petitioner's spouse join in the petition for adoption to apply only when the prospective adoptee is a minor; authorizing a petitioner's spouse to join in the petition for adoption if the prospective adoptee is an adult; establishing that certain provisions of law requiring the issuance and service of a show-cause order on a prospective adoptee's parents do not apply if the prospective adoptee is an adult; etc.
bill_summary: This bill modifies Maryland family law to allow the adoption of adults, including changes to spousal joining requirements, parental consent, and investigation procedures for adult adoptees.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Human Services or the relevant family court system
stakeholders: Adults seeking adoption, their families, and the legal system involved in adoption proceedings
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's focus on adult adoption does not directly impact small business access to capital.

Title: Human Services - Adult Protective Services
Synopsis: Specifying that certain provisions of law relating to confidentiality do not prohibit the disclosure of certain information relating to adult protective services or the disclosure of the identity of certain persons making certain reports under certain circumstances; expanding the definition of "health practitioner" to include certain emergency medical providers; and authorizing individuals who are required in specific instances to report information regarding alleged vulnerable adults to make a report by calling the statewide reporting hotline.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland laws to clarify confidentiality rules related to adult protective services, expands the definition of health practitioners to include certain emergency medical services providers, and allows certain individuals to report suspected abuse of vulnerable adults via a statewide hotline.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Human Services
stakeholders: Vulnerable adults and professionals involved in adult protective services and emergency medical services
access_to_capital_summary: The bill primarily focuses on legal and procedural updates related to adult protective services and does not directly impact access to capital for small businesses.

Title: Residential Real Property - Local Limits on Summoning Law Enforcement or Emergency Services
Synopsis: Prohibiting a local jurisdiction from enforcing a law or ordinance that limits the summoning of law enforcement or emergency services to a residential property by establishing a certain threshold or penalty.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits local jurisdictions in Maryland from enforcing laws or ordinances that limit the number of times law enforcement or emergency services can be summoned to a residential property, or that penalize individuals for summoning such services, unless specific exceptions apply.
responsible_party: Maryland local governments and courts
stakeholders: Residents, property owners, tenants, law enforcement, emergency services
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Human Services โ Local Departments of Social Services โ Audits
Synopsis: Altering the frequency, from once every 3 years to an interval of once every 4 years unless it is determined on a case-by-case basis that an audit occur at an interval of 3 years, with which the Office of the Inspector General in the Department of Human Services conducts or contracts for financial and compliance audits of local departments of social services.
bill_summary: The bill changes the frequency of financial and compliance audits for local departments of social services conducted by the Office of the Inspector General in the Maryland Department of Human Services, extending the interval from once every 3 years to a range of 3 to 4 years, with case-by-case exceptions.
responsible_party: Office of the Inspector General in the Department of Human Services
stakeholders: Local departments of social services and the populations they serve
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Health Occupations Boards - Membership Alteration and Sunset Extensions
Synopsis: Continuing certain health occupations boards and the Behavior Analyst Advisory Committee within the State Board of Professional Counselors and Therapists in accordance with the provisions of the Maryland Program Evaluation Act (sunset law) by extending to a certain date the termination provisions relating to the statutory and regulatory authority of the boards and Committee; and altering the membership of the State Board of Massage Therapy Examiners.
bill_summary: The bill extends the sunset dates for several health occupations boards and committees in Maryland, including the State Board of Examiners for Audiologists, Hearing Aid Dispensers, SpeechโLanguage Pathologists, and Music Therapists, the State Board of Massage Therapy Examiners, the State Board of Pharmacy, the State Board of Professional Counselors and Therapists, and the Behavior Analyst Advisory Committee. It also makes changes to the membership of the Massage Therapy Examiners Board.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and relevant licensing boards
stakeholders: Health professionals, massage therapists, pharmacists, counselors, therapists, and consumers in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill primarily extends regulatory oversight and does not directly create or fund programs impacting access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Economic Development - West North Avenue Development Authority - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the administration and membership of the West North Avenue Development Authority; specifying the powers and duties of the Authority, subject to certain limitations; requiring the Authority to take certain actions regarding the finances of the Authority; exempting the Authority from certain taxation or assessments under certain circumstances; establishing the West North Avenue Development Authority Fund as a special, nonlapsing fund; altering the termination date of the Authority; etc.
bill_summary: This bill establishes the West North Avenue Development Authority in Baltimore City to promote economic development, redevelopment, and community revitalization within the target area and buffer zone, including powers to acquire property, finance projects, and coordinate development efforts.
responsible_party: West North Avenue Development Authority
stakeholders: Residents, businesses, and community organizations in Baltimore City, particularly in the West North Avenue corridor
access_to_capital_summary: The program has a high potential to impact small business owners' access to capital by providing financial resources, development support, and property acquisition opportunities.

Title: Public Safety - Statewide DNA Database System, DNA Collection, and Penalties - Alterations
Synopsis: Requiring a certain DNA sample to be collected in a certain manner from an individual who is required to register as a sex offender; requiring a DNA sample to be collected by a certain individual or at a certain location under certain circumstances; requiring a custodial agency or correctional facility to ensure a DNA sample is collected in a certain manner; prohibiting a DNA sample from being tested and placed in a certain statewide DNA database system until certain conditions are met; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland's laws regarding the collection, testing, and expungement of DNA samples from individuals convicted of certain crimes, including sex offenders, and establishes procedures for destruction and expungement of DNA records.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of State Police, Forensic Sciences Division
stakeholders: Individuals required to provide DNA samples, law enforcement agencies, criminal justice system, and the public safety community in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Criminal Law - Drug Paraphernalia - Prohibitions and Penalties
Synopsis: Altering the penalties for a person using or possessing with intent to use, delivering or selling under certain circumstances, or manufacturing or possessing with intent to deliver or sell under certain circumstances drug paraphernalia to inject, ingest, inhale, or otherwise introduce into the human body a controlled dangerous substance; removing intent to administer a controlled dangerous substance from a certain list of intents; etc.
bill_summary: This bill alters penalties for possession, use, delivery, or sale of drug paraphernalia related to controlled dangerous substances, and removes certain prohibitions and intent requirements.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services or local law enforcement agencies
stakeholders: Individuals involved in drug use or distribution, law enforcement, and the general public
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small businesses or entrepreneurs.

Title: Estates and Trusts - Priority of Claims on an Estate - Unpaid Child Support
Synopsis: Prioritizing the payment of unpaid child support over certain other claims on an estate of a decedent with insufficient assets to pay all claims in full.
bill_summary: This bill amends the order of priority for claims paid from an estate in Maryland, specifically to prioritize unpaid child support over other claims when the estate's assets are insufficient to pay all claims in full.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Estates and Trusts (or equivalent estate management authority)
stakeholders: Decedents' estates, unpaid child support recipients, estate administrators, creditors
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's focus on estate claims does not directly impact small business access to capital.

Title: Department of Agriculture - Maryland Agricultural Commission and Young Farmers
Synopsis: Altering the membership of the Maryland Agricultural Commission; establishing the Committee on Young Farmers for purposes of  communicating to the Maryland Agricultural Commission on issues relating to young and beginning farmers in the State; repealing the provisions of law establishing and governing the Young Farmers Advisory Board; and requiring the Maryland Agricultural Land Preservation Foundation to be governed and administered by a board of trustees composed in a certain manner.
bill_summary: The bill alters the membership of the Maryland Agricultural Commission, establishes the Committee on Young Farmers to address issues related to young and beginning farmers, and repeals the existing Young Farmers Advisory Board.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Agriculture
stakeholders: Young and beginning farmers in Maryland, agricultural industry stakeholders, Maryland agricultural community
access_to_capital_summary: The bill aims to support young farmers, which could improve their access to resources and capital, but it does not directly provide financial capital or funding.

Title: Dental Services - Qualification for Maryland Dent-Care Program
Synopsis: Altering the eligibility criteria for Higher Education Loan Assistance Grants under the Maryland Dent-Care Program to include part-time employment.
bill_summary: The bill modifies eligibility criteria for the Maryland DentโCare Program's loan assistance grants for dental professionals, establishes grant amounts, and requires a study on the use of online credentialing systems by dental insurance carriers.
responsible_party: Office of Student Financial Assistance and Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Dental professionals (dentists and dental hygienists) practicing in Maryland and Maryland Medical Assistance Program recipients
access_to_capital_summary: The bill has a high potential to improve access to capital for dental professionals through increased loan assistance and program support.

Title: Hospitals - Financial Assistance and Collection of Debts - Policies
Synopsis: Altering provisions of law related to a hospital's financial assistance and collection of debts policies; specifying the percentage by which a hospital is required to reduce a patient's out-of-pocket expenses under certain circumstances; adding to the notice requirements relating to a hospital's financial assistance policy; prohibiting a hospital from filing a civil action to collect a debt against a patient whose outstanding debt is at or below $500; etc.
bill_summary: This bill updates Maryland laws regarding hospital financial assistance, debt collection policies, and legal procedures, including limits on civil actions, interest, and fees, and enhances patient rights and hospital transparency.
responsible_party: Maryland Health Care Commission and hospitals in Maryland
stakeholders: Hospital patients, especially those with low income or facing financial hardship
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's provisions primarily focus on debt collection and financial assistance policies, which may indirectly influence access to capital but do not establish a direct program to improve access.

Title: Data Center Impact Analysis and Report
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of the Environment, the Maryland Energy Administration, and the University of Maryland School of Business, in coordination with the Department of Legislative Services, to conduct an analysis of the likely environmental, energy, and economic impacts of data center development in the State; and requiring the Department of Legislative Services to coordinate preparation of the final report to be submitted to the Governor and the General Assembly by September 1, 2026.
bill_summary: The bill requires Maryland state agencies and the University of Maryland to analyze the environmental, energy, and economic impacts of data center development in the state, and to report their findings by September 1, 2026.
responsible_party: Department of the Environment, Maryland Energy Administration, University of Maryland School of Business, Department of Legislative Services
stakeholders: State government agencies, data center industry, environmental groups, local communities, general public
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners; it focuses on analysis and reporting of impacts of data centers.

Title: Maryland Department of Planning โ Modernization
Synopsis: Requiring the State Administrator of Elections to electronically submit certain precinct boundary information to the Secretary of Planning; altering certain requirements related to the Department of Planning preparing population projections for the Washington and Baltimore metropolitan areas to authorize the use of population figures developed by the Baltimore Metropolitan Council, the Metropolitan Washington Council of Governments and their member jurisdictions; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates and clarifies the roles, responsibilities, and procedures of the Maryland Department of Planning, including population projections, information sharing, and coordination with other agencies, and modifies rules related to state and local project planning and funding.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Planning
stakeholders: State and local government agencies, planning organizations, and residents of Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill primarily focuses on planning, data sharing, and regulatory procedures, with no direct programs aimed at increasing access to capital for small businesses.

Title: Residential Leases - Late Payment Penalties - Calculation
Synopsis: Altering a prohibition concerning the maximum penalty for the late payment of rent that a landlord may charge in a residential lease to prohibit a penalty in excess of 5% of the amount of the unpaid rent rather than of the amount due.
bill_summary: The bill amends Maryland law to limit late payment penalties for residential rent to a maximum of 5% of the unpaid rent, replacing the previous limit of a percentage of the total rent due. It also clarifies enforcement and applicability of these rules.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Residential tenants and landlords in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's impact on access to capital is minimal as it primarily changes late payment penalty rules rather than providing direct financial support or capital access programs.

Title: Family Law - Child Support - Multifamily Adjustment
Synopsis: Altering the definition of "adjusted actual income" under the State child support guidelines by requiring the deduction, from actual income, of an allowance for support for each child in the parent's home for whom the parent owes a legal duty of support but who is not subject to a support order; requiring that the amount of a certain allowance be subtracted from a parent's actual income before the court determines the amount of a child support award; etc.
bill_summary: The bill amends Maryland's child support guidelines by redefining 'adjusted actual income' to include a new allowance for support for children living in a parent's home, which is deducted from the parent's income before calculating support. It also clarifies how courts may consider various financial factors and when they can depart from standard guidelines.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Human Services or the judiciary (courts)
stakeholders: Parents and children involved in child support cases in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's changes to income calculation could influence the amount of child support ordered, potentially affecting the financial stability of parents, but it does not directly create a program to increase access to capital.

Title: State Government - Forms - Reporting Requirement - Repeal
Synopsis: Repealing a requirement that certain departments or units of State government annually submit a report on the management of forms to the Department of General Services.
bill_summary: This bill repeals the requirement for certain state government departments to submit an annual report on their management of forms, and it takes effect on July 1, 2025.
responsible_party: Department of General Services or relevant state government departments
stakeholders: State government departments and units, and the general public who interact with government forms
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Environment - Water Bottle Filling Stations - Requirement
Synopsis: Requiring a water bottle filling station or a combined water bottle filling station and drinking fountain to be installed in certain new construction or as part of certain renovations beginning October 1, 2025, subject to certain exceptions; requiring the Maryland Department of Labor to adopt regulations to carry out the provisions of the Act; and applying the Act prospectively.
bill_summary: The bill requires that starting October 1, 2025, new construction and renovations in Maryland include at least one water bottle filling station, replacing or supplementing drinking fountains, with certain exceptions.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: Buildings undergoing new construction or renovation in Maryland, including public and private entities
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners; it focuses on infrastructure requirements.

Title: Municipalities - Annexation Resolutions - Submission to Department of Planning
Synopsis: Adding the Department of Planning to the list of entities to which a municipality must send a copy of an annexation resolution with the new municipal boundaries.
bill_summary: The bill requires municipalities in Maryland to send a copy of their annexation resolution with new boundaries to the Department of Planning, in addition to other entities, within 10 days of the resolution taking effect.
responsible_party: Department of Planning
stakeholders: Municipalities and residents affected by annexation in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Procurement โ Electronic Transactions โ Clarification of Fees Due
Synopsis: Specifying that fees collected for electronic transactions for procurements are those due to the State and not any fees due to a third party.
bill_summary: The bill clarifies that fees collected for electronic procurement transactions are owed to the State of Maryland, not to third parties, and specifies procedures for charging and depositing these fees.
responsible_party: Chief Procurement Officer of Maryland
stakeholders: Businesses and vendors participating in Maryland's electronic procurement processes
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Local Comprehensive Planning and State Economic Growth, Resource Protection, and Planning Policy - Planning Principles
Synopsis: Providing certain planning principles that are collectively intended to create sustainable communities and to protect the environment utilizing active public participation; altering the State Economic Growth, Resource Protection, and Planning Policy to consist of planning principles for advancing sustainable growth in the State; and requiring the publisher of the Annotated Code of Maryland, along with the Department of Legislative Services, to correct cross-references and terminology in the Code that are rendered incorrect by the Act.
bill_summary: The bill updates and clarifies planning principles for local comprehensive plans and the State Economic Growth, Resource Protection, and Planning Policy in Maryland, emphasizing sustainable communities, environmental protection, and public participation.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Planning and Department of Legislative Services
stakeholders: Maryland residents, local governments, environmental groups, and community organizations
access_to_capital_summary: The bill primarily focuses on planning principles and policies, with no direct programs or interventions related to access to capital.

Title: Maryland Transportation Authority โ Tolls, Fees, and Other Charges โ Temporary Adjustments
Synopsis: Increasing from 180 days to 300 days the maximum duration of an emergency status determination authorizing the temporary adjustment of tolls, fees, or other charges by the Maryland Transportation Authority.
bill_summary: The bill extends the maximum duration of emergency status determinations that allow the Maryland Transportation Authority to temporarily adjust tolls, fees, or other charges from 180 days to 300 days.
responsible_party: Maryland Transportation Authority
stakeholders: Motorists and transportation users in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact small business access to capital.

Title: Cooperative Housing Corporations, Condominiums, and Homeowners Associations - Funding of Reserve Accounts and Preparation of Funding Plans
Synopsis: Requiring that certain funds for certain reserve accounts be deposited on or before the last day of each fiscal year; requiring the governing body of a cooperative housing corporation, a residential condominium, or a homeowners association to prepare a certain funding plan subject to certain requirements; authorizing a reasonable deviation from certain reserve funding requirements following a certain financial hardship determination; requiring that certain updated reserve studies be prepared by a certain person; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires cooperative housing corporations, condominiums, and homeowners associations in Maryland to conduct reserve studies, prepare funding plans, and deposit funds into reserve accounts to ensure proper funding for future repairs and replacements of common elements. It establishes specific timelines, standards, and procedures for these entities to follow, including provisions for financial hardship deviations.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development or relevant local authorities
stakeholders: Residents and owners of cooperative housing, condominiums, and homeowners associations in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill has a high potential to improve access to capital for small property owners by ensuring adequate reserve funding and planning.

Title: Criminal Procedure - Child Victims - Testimony in Child Abuse Cases
Synopsis: Altering a certain requirement under which a court is authorized to order that the testimony of a child victim be taken outside a courtroom and shown in the courtroom by closed circuit television in certain child abuse cases; requiring the testimony of a child victim taken by closed circuit television within the courthouse be in a setting that reasonably mitigates the likelihood the child victim will suffer emotional distress; etc.
bill_summary: The bill amends Maryland law to clarify that courts may order child victims' testimony in child abuse cases to be taken outside the courtroom and shown via closed circuit television if the child would suffer serious emotional distress testifying in the presence of the defendant or respondent.
responsible_party: Maryland Judiciary or courts
stakeholders: Child victims in abuse cases, families, legal professionals, and the judicial system
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Maryland Health Benefit Exchange - State-Based Young Adult Health Insurance Subsidies Pilot Program - Sunset Repeal
Synopsis: Renaming the State-Based Young Adult Health Insurance Subsidies Pilot Program to be the State-Based Young Adult Health Insurance Subsidies Program; repealing the termination date of certain provisions of law that establish and govern the funding for the Program; authorizing rather than requiring the Maryland Health Benefit Exchange to establish and implement the Program; and prohibiting the Exchange from implementing the Program if certain funds are not available.
bill_summary: This bill renames and extends the Maryland Health Benefit Exchange's Young Adult Health Insurance Subsidies Pilot Program, making it a permanent program and clarifying its funding and implementation details.
responsible_party: Maryland Health Benefit Exchange
stakeholders: Young adults in Maryland aged 18 to 40, especially those with income between 133% and 400% of the federal poverty level
access_to_capital_summary: The program has a high potential to impact access to health insurance subsidies for young adults, which can influence their overall access to healthcare and financial stability.

Title: State Government - Grants and Contracts - Reimbursement of Indirect Costs
Synopsis: Altering the rate at which nonprofit organizations receiving State-funded grants or contracts may be reimbursed for indirect costs to match the rate established under relevant federal guidelines; requiring the Maryland Efficient Grant Application Council to study and make certain recommendations to the Department of Budget and Management regarding the entire grants life cycle; requiring the Council to submit a report on its full recommendations to the Department and the General Assembly by July 1, 2027; etc.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the reimbursement rate for indirect costs for nonprofit organizations receiving state grants or contracts, establishes a study on indirect costs and grant management, and sets reporting requirements.
responsible_party: Department of Budget and Management
stakeholders: Nonprofit organizations receiving state grants or contracts, state government agencies
access_to_capital_summary: The bill has the potential to improve access to capital for nonprofit organizations by clarifying and potentially increasing indirect cost reimbursements.

Title: Criminal Procedure - Forensic Genetic Genealogical DNA Analysis and Search - Affidavit for Judicial Authorization
Synopsis: Altering and clarifying the requirement that a sworn affidavit for judicial authorization to initiate forensic genetic genealogical DNA analysis and search (FGGS) assert that the reasonable investigative leads have been pursued and failed to identify the perpetrator and instead requiring that a sworn affidavit for judicial authorization assert that identity of the perpetrator is unknown.
bill_summary: The bill amends Maryland's criminal procedure laws to clarify and alter requirements for judicial authorization of forensic genetic genealogical DNA analysis and search (FGGS), including the affidavit process law enforcement must follow.
responsible_party: Maryland State Judiciary and Law Enforcement Agencies
stakeholders: Individuals involved in criminal investigations, especially cases involving violent crimes or threats to public safety
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small businesses or entrepreneurs.

Title: Courts and Judicial Proceedings - Statement of Charges - Human Service Workers
Synopsis: Expanding certain provisions of law relating to a certain investigation and recommendation by a State's Attorney concerning the filing of a statement of charges against certain professionals to include certain human service workers.
bill_summary: The bill expands legal procedures related to investigations and statements of charges against human service workers, including adult protective services workers, child welfare caseworkers, educators, law enforcement officers, emergency services personnel, and others, requiring investigations and recommendations by the State's Attorney before charges are filed.
responsible_party: Maryland State's Attorney's Office
stakeholders: Human service workers, law enforcement officers, emergency services personnel, educators, and the general public in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Public Safety - Law Enforcement Agencies - Peer Support Programs
Synopsis: Establishing certain confidentiality requirements for peer support counseling programs for law enforcement agencies; prohibiting a peer support specialist from  disclosing the contents of any written or oral communication regarding a peer support interaction; and providing certain exceptions.
bill_summary: This bill establishes confidentiality requirements for peer support counseling programs for law enforcement officers, ensuring that communications between officers and peer support specialists are protected unless certain exceptions apply.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services or law enforcement agencies implementing peer support programs
stakeholders: Law enforcement officers and law enforcement agencies in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small businesses.

Title: Motor Vehicles - Specially Designed Vintage Reproduction Registration Plates
Synopsis: Repealing the time limitation within which the Motor Vehicle Administration is required to make available specially designed vintage reproduction registration plates; and requiring the Administration to charge a fee of $100 for the initial issuance and $25 for the renewal of a specially designed vintage reproduction registration plate.
bill_summary: The bill repeals the time limitation for making available vintage reproduction registration plates in Maryland, requires the Motor Vehicle Administration to charge fees for initial issuance and renewal of these plates, and specifies the design resembling a 1910 black-on-yellow plate.
responsible_party: Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration
stakeholders: Vehicle owners interested in vintage or historic vehicles in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's impact on access to capital for small business owners is minimal, as it primarily involves fees and design specifications for vehicle registration plates.

Title: Task Force to Study Fiduciary Adjudication in Maryland
Synopsis: Establishing the Task Force to Study Fiduciary Adjudication in Maryland to examine and analyze the efficiency, uniformity, and quality of fiduciary adjudication in Maryland and make recommendations; requiring the orphans' courts, circuit courts, registers of wills, and Administrative Office of the Courts to comply with certain requests of the Task Force; and requiring the Task Force to report its findings and make recommendations on or before January 1, 2026.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Task Force to Study Fiduciary Adjudication in Maryland to examine and improve the efficiency, uniformity, and quality of fiduciary adjudication processes in the state, including probate, trusts, and guardianships.
responsible_party: Department of Legislative Services in conjunction with the Maryland State Bar Association
stakeholders: Families, fiduciaries, judges, and legal professionals involved in fiduciary matters in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Election Law - Municipal Elections - Administration
Synopsis: Authorizing the State Administrator of Elections to enter into memoranda of understanding with municipal corporations that allow the State Administrator to work collaboratively with a municipal corporation to support the administration of the municipal corporation's elections; authorizing the State Administrator to lease a voting system or other equipment used to administer an election for use in a municipal election; repealing the authority of a local board to lease a voting system to certain entities within the county; etc.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes the Maryland State Administrator of Elections to collaborate with municipal corporations, including entering into memoranda of understanding and leasing voting systems for municipal elections. It also modifies procedures for municipal election ballot inclusion and deadlines.
responsible_party: Maryland State Administrator of Elections
stakeholders: Municipalities and voters in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's focus is on election administration and equipment leasing, with no direct provisions for increasing access to capital for small businesses.

Title: Domestic Partnership and Marriage - Required Information
Synopsis: Clarifying required information for registering a domestic partnership or obtaining a marriage license; and requiring a declaration of domestic partnership filed with the register of wills to include the Social Security number of each domestic partner who has a Social Security number.
bill_summary: The bill clarifies requirements for registering a domestic partnership and obtaining a marriage license in Maryland. It mandates including Social Security numbers in declarations and applications, and adjusts public record disclosure rules.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and Maryland Register of Wills
stakeholders: Individuals registering domestic partnerships or applying for marriage licenses in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: County Boards of Education - Antibias Training for Members - Requirement (County Board Member Antibias Training Act)
Synopsis: Requiring each member of a county board of education to complete certain antibias training at least once during the member's term.
bill_summary: The bill requires each member of a county board of education in Maryland to complete an antibias training at least once during their term. It also mandates the development of antibias training guidelines for school employees and requires biannual training for public school employees involved with students.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Education
stakeholders: Members of county boards of education, public school employees, students, and communities in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill primarily focuses on antibias training and does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Adult Education - High School Diploma by Examination - Requirements and Study
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Labor to allow an individual to choose to take all components of the General Educational Development Test in either English or Spanish; and requiring the Department to study the feasibility and cost of offering the examination in additional languages and to report its findings and recommendations to certain committees of the General Assembly on or before December 1, 2026.
bill_summary: The bill allows individuals in Maryland to take all components of the General Educational Development (GED) test in the same language, either English or Spanish, and requires the Maryland Department of Labor to study offering the test in additional languages and report on its findings.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: Adult learners seeking a high school diploma or equivalency in Maryland, especially non-English speakers and English language learners
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's focus is on educational testing and language accessibility, not directly on access to capital for small businesses.

Title: State Lottery โ Instant Ticket Lottery Machines โ Veteransโ and Fraternal Organizations
Synopsis: Authorizing the Director of the State Lottery and Gaming Control Agency to issue certain fraternal organizations a license for not more than three instant ticket lottery machines; altering the distribution of proceeds from instant ticket lottery machine sales by veterans' organizations; providing for the distribution of proceeds from instant ticket lottery machine sales by fraternal organizations; altering certain requirements concerning the conduct of gaming through instant ticket lottery machines; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes certain fraternal and veterans' organizations in Maryland to operate a limited number of instant ticket lottery machines at their principal meeting halls, with specific rules on proceeds distribution, location restrictions, and licensing.
responsible_party: Maryland State Lottery and Gaming Control Agency
stakeholders: Veterans' organizations, fraternal organizations, veterans, students, and the general public in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The program could increase access to capital for eligible organizations through proceeds from lottery machines, but the impact is limited to specific organizations and proceeds are partially allocated to other funds.

Title: Public Information Act - Public Access Ombudsman - Delegation of Powers
Synopsis: Authorizing the Public Access Ombudsman to delegate to a staff member of the Office of the Public Access Ombudsman any of the powers and duties granted to the Ombudsman that are appropriate to the staff member's training and expertise.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes the Public Access Ombudsman to delegate certain powers and duties to staff members and clarifies the appointment, term, and responsibilities of the Ombudsman within Maryland's legal framework.
responsible_party: Office of the Public Access Ombudsman, Office of the Attorney General
stakeholders: Public access to government information, Maryland residents, government agencies
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Healthcare Ecosystem Stakeholder Cybersecurity Workgroup
Synopsis: Establishing the Healthcare Ecosystem Stakeholder Cybersecurity Workgroup to develop strategies to prevent cybersecurity disruptions to the healthcare ecosystem, ensure the continuous delivery of essential healthcare ecosystem services, and enhance recovery efforts of the healthcare ecosystem following a cybersecurity incident; and requiring the Workgroup to submit an interim report on or before January 1, 2026, and a final report of its findings and recommendations on or before December 1, 2026.
bill_summary: This bill establishes a Healthcare Ecosystem Stakeholder Cybersecurity Workgroup in Maryland to develop strategies for preventing cybersecurity disruptions, ensuring continuous delivery of healthcare services, and improving recovery efforts following cybersecurity incidents within the healthcare sector.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Emergency Management and related state agencies
stakeholders: Healthcare entities including hospitals, medical facilities, health information exchanges, and insurance providers in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's focus is on cybersecurity standards and incident reporting, which can indirectly impact access to capital by improving security and trust, but it does not directly establish a service or intervention for capital access.

Title: Workgroup on Newborn Nurse Home Visiting Services - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Workgroup on Universal Newborn Nurse Home Visiting Services; requiring the Workgroup to compile updated participant data and expenditure per participant from the home visiting programs currently operating in the State, compare the data for home visiting programs to the data for evidence-based models, identify service gaps, and identify workforce needs; and requiring the Workgroup to report its findings and recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly by December 31, 2025.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a statewide program in Maryland to provide universal newborn nurse home visiting services to all families with newborns, aiming to support healthy child development, postpartum health, and family strengthening. It creates a workgroup to oversee and improve the program, and mandates insurance coverage and reimbursement for these services.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Families with newborns, healthcare providers, community organizations, insurers, and public health agencies in Maryland.
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's focus is on establishing and funding a universal service rather than directly providing capital access for small businesses.

Title: State Lottery Fund - Laurel Race Course - Local Impact Aid
Synopsis: Requiring the Comptroller, beginning in fiscal year 2026, to distribute from the State Lottery Fund $250,000 of supplemental local impact aid to Anne Arundel County, Howard County, and the City of Laurel from the proceeds of the Racetrax lottery game to be used for certain programs and services in the communities surrounding Laurel Race Course; specifying the purposes for and manner in which the supplemental local impact aid may be utilized; etc.
bill_summary: The bill allocates funds from the Maryland State Lottery to support local impact aid for Anne Arundel County, Howard County, and the City of Laurel, especially related to the Laurel Race Course. It establishes specific funding amounts for these areas to provide health, social, and transportation services to communities surrounding the race course, and sets rules for the use and distribution of these funds.
responsible_party: Maryland State Comptroller and local governments of Anne Arundel County, Howard County, and the City of Laurel
stakeholders: Residents and workers in the communities surrounding Laurel Race Course, including backstretch workers and non-English speakers
access_to_capital_summary: The bill primarily focuses on social services and community support programs, not direct financial access or capital for small businesses.

Title: Motor Vehicles - Speed Monitoring Systems - Statements and Certificates of Violations
Synopsis: Authorizing certain technicians to swear to and affirm, based on inspection of recorded images, the occurrence of violations recorded by speed monitoring systems; requiring law enforcement officers and technicians to complete a reasonable training specific to the speed monitoring system before certifying any certificates of violation; and defining "reasonable training" as a sufficient level of education, instruction, and practical experience to ensure competency in the inspection of images generated by speed monitoring systems.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes technicians to swear to violations recorded by speed monitoring systems, requires law enforcement and technicians to complete specific training before certifying violations, and makes related amendments to Maryland transportation law.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation or local transportation agencies
stakeholders: Motor vehicle owners, law enforcement agencies, technicians, and local governments in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's impact on access to capital is indirect, primarily through improved enforcement and accuracy of speed violations, which could influence revenue and compliance.

Title: Maryland Environmental Service - Membership of Board of Directors - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the composition of the Board of Directors of the Maryland Environmental Service to include the Secretary of Planning or a designee and, as nonvoting members, one member from the Senate of Maryland and one from the Maryland House of Delegates; and providing that certain provisions of law relating to terms of members of the Board do not apply to the Secretary of Planning, certain legislative members, and the Executive Director.
bill_summary: The bill amends the composition of the Maryland Environmental Service Board of Directors, replacing the State Treasurer with the Secretary of Planning or their designee, and clarifies the appointment process and terms for board members.
responsible_party: Maryland Environmental Service
stakeholders: State government, environmental management agencies, and the public in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact small business access to capital.

Title: Interstate Social Work Licensure Compact
Synopsis: Entering into the Social Work Licensure Compact for the purpose of authorizing regulated social workers who hold multistate licenses to practice social work in member states in order to improve public access to competent social work services; establishing requirements for multistate licensure; establishing the Social Work Licensure Compact Commission; providing for withdrawal from the Compact; and providing that the Act is contingent on the enactment of substantially similar legislation in six other states.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland participation in the Interstate Social Work Licensure Compact, which allows social workers with multistate licenses to practice across member states, aiming to improve public access, workforce mobility, and cooperation among states.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Licensed social workers and the public seeking social work services in Maryland and other member states.
access_to_capital_summary: The program has high potential to impact small business owners by facilitating workforce mobility and reducing licensing barriers, thereby enabling social workers to serve clients across state lines more easily.

Title: Baltimore City - Alcoholic Beverages - 43rd Alcoholic Beverages District - Class B-D-7 Licenses
Synopsis: Authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Baltimore City to issue additional B-D-7 beer, wine, and liquor licenses in certain areas of the 43rd alcoholic beverages district of Baltimore City if the license applicant meets certain criteria; and extending to July 1, 2026, an alcoholic beverages license issued for a certain area for the purpose of renewal.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Baltimore City Board of License Commissioners to issue specific new alcohol licenses in certain districts, including a new Class BโDโ7 license in the 43rd Alcoholic Beverages District, and extends the renewal period for certain existing licenses.
responsible_party: Baltimore City Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Alcohol license applicants, Baltimore City residents, local businesses in the 43rd Alcoholic Beverages District
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's focus on licensing and renewal does not directly impact small business owners' access to capital.

Title: Real Property โ Recordation and Land Records โ Requirements
Synopsis: Altering certain provisions relating to the filing, maintenance, and transmittal of land records; and defining "land record" as any document recorded by a clerk of the circuit court relating to property.
bill_summary: This bill makes changes to the land recordation process in Maryland, including requirements for recording instruments affecting property, procedures for releasing mortgages and deeds of trust, and updates to land subdivision plat recording and indexing.
responsible_party: Clerk of the Circuit Court and the Department of Assessments and Taxation
stakeholders: Property owners, land recorders, surveyors, and land developers in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill primarily updates land record procedures and does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Prince George's County - Speed Monitoring Systems - Maryland Route 210 PG 306-25
Synopsis: Increasing the maximum civil penalties for violations recorded by speed monitoring systems on Maryland Route 210 (Piscataway Highway) in Prince George's County that involve exceeding the maximum speed limit by certain amounts.
bill_summary: The bill increases the maximum civil penalties for speeding violations recorded by speed monitoring systems on Maryland Route 210 (Piscataway Highway) in Prince George's County, especially for exceeding the speed limit by certain amounts.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation or local authorities responsible for speed monitoring systems
stakeholders: Motorists and residents in Prince George's County, Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Budget Bill (Fiscal Year 2026)
Synopsis: Making the proposed appropriations contained in the State Budget for the fiscal year ending June 30, 2026, in accordance with Article III, Section 52 of the Maryland Constitution; etc.
bill_summary: The bill is a comprehensive budget bill for fiscal years 2025 and 2026, detailing appropriations, reductions, and supplemental allocations across various state agencies, programs, and funds, including general, special, and federal funds, with numerous contingent and technical provisions.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Budget and Management and other state agencies
stakeholders: State agencies, local governments, educational institutions, healthcare providers, and Maryland residents
access_to_capital_summary: The bill primarily reallocates and reduces funds across various programs and agencies, with some allocations contingent on legislation; it does not establish a new program or intervention directly impacting access to capital.

Title: Creation of a State Debt - Maryland Consolidated Capital Bond Loan of 2025, and the Maryland Consolidated Capital Bond Loans of 2011, 2012, 2013, 2014, 2015, 2016, 2017, 2018, 2019, 2020, 2021, 2022, 2023, and 2024
Synopsis: Authorizing the creation of a State Debt in the amount of $1,763,325,000, the proceeds to be used for certain necessary building, construction, demolition, planning, renovation, conversion, replacement, and capital equipment purchases of the State, for acquiring certain real estate in connection therewith, and for grants to certain subdivisions and other organizations for certain development and improvement purposes; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the creation of multiple state debt loans through bonds to fund various public infrastructure, educational, health, and community development projects across Maryland from 2025 through 2029.
responsible_party: Maryland Board of Public Works and various state agencies
stakeholders: Maryland residents, local governments, educational institutions, health care providers, community organizations, and businesses
access_to_capital_summary: The bill primarily funds large-scale public projects and does not directly establish programs aimed at increasing small business access to capital.

Title: Budget Reconciliation and Financing Act of 2025
Synopsis: Establishing or altering certain administrative penalties; altering or repealing certain required appropriations; authorizing the use of certain funds for certain purposes; establishing certain funds; authorizing, requiring, or altering the distribution of certain revenue; altering the rates and rate brackets under the State income tax on certain income of individuals; requiring certain groups of corporations to file a combined income tax return reflecting the aggregate income tax liability of all members of the group; etc.
bill_summary: The bill is a comprehensive budget reconciliation and financing act that allocates funds, establishes new programs, modifies existing laws, and sets financial policies across various sectors including agriculture, transportation, health, education, environment, and public safety. It includes funding for infrastructure, health services, education grants, environmental projects, and tax policies.
responsible_party: Maryland State Government, Department of Budget and Management, and various state agencies
stakeholders: Maryland residents, businesses, local governments, health care providers, educational institutions, environmental organizations, and specific industry groups impacted by tax and regulatory changes.
access_to_capital_summary: The bill allocates significant funds for various economic development programs, grants, and loan programs aimed at supporting businesses, infrastructure, and community projects, which could enhance access to capital for small and medium-sized enterprises.

Title: Prince George's County - Community Associations - Registration Fees for Administrative Hearing Process PG 408-25
Synopsis: Altering the registration fee requirement for the Community Association Registry; permitting the County Executive to establish the registration fee; prohibiting a person or entity who fails to register from filing a dispute; and requiring the Prince George's County Office of Community Relations to provide revenue from annual community association registration fees to fund the administrative hearing process for disputes between community associations and owners in Prince George's County.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the registration fee requirements for community associations in Prince George's County, establishes a registry for community association management entities, and allocates revenue from registration fees to fund an administrative dispute resolution process.
responsible_party: Prince George's County Office of Community Relations
stakeholders: Community associations, property owners, community management entities in Prince George's County
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's focus on dispute resolution and registration fees does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Health Occupations Boards - English Proficiency Requirements and Licensure by Endorsement for Nursing
Synopsis: Prohibiting a health occupations board from requiring additional evidence of English proficiency as a condition for licensure, certification, or registration if an applicant holds a valid, unrestricted license, certification, or registration from another state that requires evidence of English proficiency; requiring each health occupations board that requires evidence of English proficiency to post a statement on their website that an applicant may not be required to provide additional evidence of proficiency; etc.
bill_summary: This bill prohibits health occupations boards in Maryland from requiring additional evidence of English proficiency for licensure if the applicant already holds a valid license from another state that requires English proficiency. It also mandates that boards display a list of states with similar requirements and updates acceptable proof of English proficiency for nursing licensure and endorsement.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Nursing and other health occupations boards
stakeholders: Applicants for health occupation licenses, including nurses and pharmacists, in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill primarily changes licensing requirements and does not directly impact access to capital for small businesses.

Title: Prince George's Gateway Development Authority - Sunset Repeal PG 403-25
Synopsis: Repealing the termination of certain provisions of law establishing the Prince George's Gateway Development Authority.
bill_summary: The bill repeals the sunset clause on the Prince George's Gateway Development Authority, extending its authority and responsibilities, including developing a neighborhood revitalization plan for certain communities in Prince George's County.
responsible_party: Prince George's Gateway Development Authority and the Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Residents, businesses, and communities within the target area in Prince George's County
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's focus on neighborhood revitalization and development suggests a potential to improve access to capital for small businesses and residents in the target area.

Title: Bicycles, Play Vehicles, and Unicycles - Authorizations and Requirements (Jay's Law)
Synopsis: Authorizing a person to ride a bicycle, play vehicle, or unicycle on a sidewalk or sidewalk area unless prohibited by local ordinance; and requiring a person riding a bicycle, play vehicle, or unicycle on a sidewalk or sidewalk area or in or through a crosswalk to yield the right-of-way to a pedestrian or a person using an electric personal assistive mobility device.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes riding bicycles, play vehicles, and unicycles on sidewalks unless prohibited by local ordinance, and requires riders to yield to pedestrians and electric personal assistive mobility device users.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation or local transportation authorities
stakeholders: Pedestrians, bicyclists, unicycle and play vehicle riders, electric personal assistive mobility device users
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Maryland Cybersecurity Council - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the selection of the membership and chair of the Maryland Cybersecurity Council; requiring beginning on October 1, 2025, and every 2 years thereafter, the Council to elect a chair and vice chair from among the members of the Council; requiring the Council, working with certain entities, to assess and address cybersecurity threats and associated risks from artificial intelligence and quantum computing; etc.
bill_summary: This bill amends the Maryland Cybersecurity Council by altering its membership, selection process, and chair, and requires the Council to assess and address cybersecurity threats from artificial intelligence and quantum computing, including recommendations for legislative changes.
responsible_party: Maryland Cybersecurity Council
stakeholders: Cybersecurity companies, higher education institutions, private sector businesses, government agencies, and residents of Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's focus on cybersecurity and emerging technologies could indirectly impact small business access to capital by improving cybersecurity resilience and fostering innovation.

Title: Maryland Disability Service Animal Program - Established
Synopsis: Establishing the Maryland Disability Service Animal Program in the Department of Disabilities to select one or more nonprofit training entities to participate in the Program and provide additional funding mechanisms to assist eligible individuals in the Program; requiring the Department to select at least one nonprofit training entity to develop and implement a training protocol and to select qualified participants; and establishing the Maryland Disability Service Animal Program Fund to pay a participating nonprofit training entity.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland Disability Service Animal Program within the Department of Disabilities, which trains and provides service animals to eligible individuals with disabilities, and creates a dedicated fund to support this initiative.
responsible_party: Department of Disabilities
stakeholders: Individuals with disabilities in Maryland who could benefit from service animals
access_to_capital_summary: The program is focused on training and providing service animals, which could improve access to support for individuals with disabilities, but does not directly impact small business access to capital.

Title: Vehicle Laws - Drunk and Drugged Driving - Points Assessments
Synopsis: Imposing assessments of 12 points for certain subsequent drunk and drugged driving violations.
bill_summary: The bill increases the points assessed for certain subsequent drunk and drugged driving violations in Maryland, specifically adding 12 points for violations of sections 21-902(H) and 21-902(I) of the Transportation Article.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation or Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration
stakeholders: Drivers in Maryland, law enforcement, and the general public concerned with road safety
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Property Tax - Day Care Centers, Child Care Homes, and Child Care Centers
Synopsis: Exempting personal property used in connection with certain large family child care homes from valuation and taxation; authorizing the Mayor and City Council of Baltimore City or the governing body of a county or a municipal corporation to grant, by law, a property tax credit against the real property tax owed on the portion of real property used for certain large family child care homes; increasing the maximum amount of a property tax credit that may be granted for certain child care homes and centers and day care centers; etc.
bill_summary: The bill exempts personal property used in connection with certain large family child care homes from valuation and taxation, and increases the maximum property tax credits available for day care centers, child care homes, and related facilities. It also repeals certain requirements related to property improvements for tax credits.
responsible_party: Maryland local governments (cities, counties, municipal corporations) and the Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation
stakeholders: Large family child care homes, day care centers, child care homes, and their operators and owners in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's provisions could potentially increase access to capital for child care providers by reducing property tax burdens and providing credits, thereby lowering operational costs.

Title: Affordable Housing Payment In Lieu of Taxes Expansion Act
Synopsis: Authorizing an owner of real property used for rental housing and the governing body of a county to enter into a payment in lieu of taxes agreement for maintaining at least 25% of the rental housing units located at the real property as affordable dwelling units for at least 15 years; and authorizing the governing body of the county to require the owner of real property to maintain a higher percentage of rental housing units as affordable dwelling units than the minimum percentage specified in the Act.
bill_summary: The bill expands the use of payment in lieu of taxes agreements for rental housing properties, allowing property owners and counties to agree on a negotiated payment in exchange for maintaining at least 25% of units as affordable for at least 15 years.
responsible_party: County governments and property owners of rental housing
stakeholders: Rental housing property owners, tenants, and local governments in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill potentially increases the availability of affordable rental units, which could improve access to housing for low-income households, but does not directly impact access to capital for small businesses.

Title: Maryland Agricultural and Resource-Based Industry Development Corporation - Oyster Shucking House Loan Program
Synopsis: Altering a certain loan program to authorize the Maryland Agricultural and Resource-Based Industry Development Corporation to provide loans in an amount up to $25,000 for certain seasonal full-time jobs; and reducing, from 5 years to 3 years, the number of years that a person must have been a licensed seafood dealer in order to be eligible to receive financing under the loan program.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the Maryland Oyster Shucking House Loan Program to allow loans up to $250,000 for seafood processing projects, with specific provisions for job creation and shell recycling incentives. It reduces the eligibility requirement for licensed seafood dealers from 5 years to 3 years and allocates $1,000,000 for the program in fiscal year 2024.
responsible_party: Maryland Agricultural and ResourceโBased Industry Development Corporation
stakeholders: Seafood dealers, oyster shucking businesses, Chesapeake Bay oyster industry, local communities involved in seafood processing
access_to_capital_summary: The program has a high potential to impact small business access to capital by providing targeted loans and incentives for seafood processing projects.

Title: Anne Arundel County Board of Education - Student Member Scholarship - Increase
Synopsis: Increasing the scholarship award for a student member of the Anne Arundel County Board of Education who completes a full term on the county board from $8,000 to $15,000.
bill_summary: The bill increases the scholarship award for a student member of the Anne Arundel County Board of Education who completes a full term from $8,000 to $15,000.
responsible_party: Anne Arundel County Board of Education
stakeholders: Student members of the Anne Arundel County Board of Education and their higher education institutions
access_to_capital_summary: The bill directly increases the financial support available to student board members, potentially improving their access to higher education funding.

Title: State Board of Examiners for Audiologists, Hearing Aid Dispensers, Speech-Language Pathologists, and Music Therapists - Appointment of Hearing Aid Dispenser Members
Synopsis: Altering the appointment process for licensed hearing aid dispenser members of the State Board of Examiners for Audiologists, Hearing Aid Dispensers, Speech-Language Pathologists, and Music Therapists by requiring the Board to notify all licensed hearing aid dispensers in the State of the vacancy and to solicit nominations to fill the vacancy.
bill_summary: This bill alters the appointment process for the Maryland State Board of Examiners for Audiologists, Hearing Aid Dispensers, SpeechโLanguage Pathologists, and Music Therapists, including the composition of the board and the appointment procedures for its members.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Examiners for Audiologists, Hearing Aid Dispensers, SpeechโLanguage Pathologists, and Music Therapists
stakeholders: Licensed audiologists, hearing aid dispensers, speech-language pathologists, and music therapists practicing in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Anne Arundel County - Board of License Commissioners - Part-Time Deputy Chief Inspector - Compensation
Synopsis: Increasing the annual salary of a part-time deputy chief inspector employed by the Board of License Commissioners for Anne Arundel County from $9,000 to $18,000.
bill_summary: The bill increases the annual salary of a part-time deputy chief inspector employed by the Board of License Commissioners for Anne Arundel County from $9,000 to $18,000 and maintains the salaries for 18 part-time inspectors at $7,000 each.
responsible_party: Board of License Commissioners for Anne Arundel County
stakeholders: Part-time inspectors and deputy chief inspector employed by the Board of License Commissioners for Anne Arundel County
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: State Designations โ State Mineral โ Chromite (State Mineral Act)
Synopsis: Designating chromite, which reflects the nature of Maryland's rich mining history and vast mineral resources, as the State mineral.
bill_summary: This bill designates chromite as the official state mineral of Maryland, recognizing its historical significance and presence in the state's mining history.
responsible_party: Maryland General Assembly (Legislature)
stakeholders: Maryland residents, historians, and the mining community
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not establish a program or initiative that directly impacts access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Elections - Local Boards of Elections - Open Meeting Requirements (Local Boards of Elections Transparency Act)
Synopsis: Requiring each local board of elections to make available on its website each open meeting agenda, a summary of any finalized documents, certain written testimony, and other materials on which the  board will be voting; requiring each local board to provide live video streaming of each open meeting and to maintain a complete and unedited archived video recording of each open meeting for 5 years; requiring the State Board of Elections to adopt regulations to ensure that the streaming requirements are met in a certain manner; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes enhanced open meeting requirements for local boards of elections in Maryland, including public access to agendas, live video streaming of meetings, and archiving of recordings for at least 5 years.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Elections
stakeholders: Voters, local election boards, candidates, political parties, and the general public interested in election transparency
access_to_capital_summary: The bill primarily focuses on transparency and public access to election meetings and processes, not on access to capital for small businesses.

Title: Criminal Law - Controlled Dangerous Substances and Firearms
Synopsis: Authorizing a person who is at least 21 years of age to manufacture a personal use amount of cannabis products or concentrated cannabis for personal use or adult sharing at a private residence if the manufacturing process does not involve the use of a volatile solvent; specifying that manufacturing, distributing, dispensing, or possessing certain large quantities of certain controlled dangerous substances is a felony; altering the penalties for being a volume dealer and drug kingpin with regard to cannabis; etc.
bill_summary: This bill legalizes manufacturing a small amount of cannabis for personal use and adult sharing at private residences, with restrictions on the use of volatile solvents. It also revises penalties for large quantities of controlled substances and firearms, and provides for sentence modifications for certain past convictions related to drug offenses involving cannabis.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services
stakeholders: Adults 21 years and older, individuals with past drug convictions, small business owners in the cannabis industry, law enforcement agencies
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's provisions on legal cannabis manufacturing and reduced penalties for certain drug offenses could improve access to capital for small cannabis businesses and individuals.

Title: State Library Agency - Family Literacy Pilot Program - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Family Literacy Pilot Program administered by the State Library Agency in consultation with the Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services and the Correctional Education Council to enable certain incarcerated individuals to read aloud to their children by preparing a recording; and requiring the State Library Agency to submit a certain report on or before December 1, 2028.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Family Literacy Pilot Program, which allows incarcerated individuals to record themselves reading children's books and send these recordings and books to their children, to foster family literacy and strengthen parent-child relationships.
responsible_party: Maryland State Library Agency
stakeholders: Incarcerated individuals and their children, families, correctional facilities
