access_to_capital_summary: The program is focused on literacy and family connection, not on access to capital for small businesses.

Title: Education and Health - Emergency Use Epinephrine - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the defined term "auto-injectable epinephrine" to be "emergency use epinephrine" and to include certain drug delivery devices and products; and altering the name of the Emergency Use Auto-Injectable Epinephrine Program to be the Emergency Use Epinephrine Program.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland laws to expand the definition and use of emergency use epinephrine, including allowing schools, nonpublic schools, child care providers, youth camps, and certain institutions to store and administer epinephrine in emergency situations for allergic reactions, and establishes a statewide program for its use.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Students, children, youth camp attendees, school personnel, child care providers, and the general public who may experience anaphylaxis
access_to_capital_summary: The bill creates a structured program for the storage and administration of emergency epinephrine, which could improve access to this critical medication in emergencies.

Title: Public Safety - 9-1-1 Trust Fund - 9-8-8 Suicide Prevention Hotline
Synopsis: Authorizing the use of the 9-1-1 Trust Fund for certain expenditures that support the 9-8-8 suicide prevention hotline; and altering a certain restriction on the use of the 9-1-1 Trust Fund to prohibit funds from being used for expenses solely related to the 9-8-8 suicide prevention hotline, instead of preventing the use of funds for any costs associated with the 9-8-8 suicide prevention hotline.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the use of the 9โ1โ1 Trust Fund to support the 9โ8โ8 suicide prevention hotline, with specific restrictions on the types of costs that can be funded, and clarifies that funds cannot be used solely for the hotline.
responsible_party: Maryland 9โ1โ1 Trust Fund and related public safety agencies
stakeholders: Public safety answering points, emergency response agencies, and individuals seeking mental health support via the 9โ8โ8 hotline
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's impact on access to capital for small businesses is indirect, primarily through funding of emergency and mental health services rather than direct financial support or capital access programs.

Title: Public Safety - Maryland 9-1-1 Board and Maryland Department of Emergency Management - Regulatory Authority
Synopsis: Authorizing the Maryland 9-1-1 Board to adopt regulations to implement and enforce certain responsibilities of the Board; and authorizing the Maryland Department of Emergency Management to adopt regulations to implement and enforce the responsibilities of the Department.
bill_summary: This bill grants regulatory authority to the Maryland 9โ1โ1 Board and the Maryland Department of Emergency Management to adopt regulations for implementing and enforcing responsibilities related to 9โ1โ1 systems, including enhanced and Next Generation 9โ1โ1 services, standards, and personnel training.
responsible_party: Maryland 9โ1โ1 Board and Maryland Department of Emergency Management
stakeholders: Public safety answering points, emergency response personnel, and residents of Maryland who use 9โ1โ1 services
access_to_capital_summary: The bill primarily focuses on regulatory standards and training, with no direct programs aimed at increasing access to capital for small businesses.

Title: Prescription Drug Affordability Board - Authority and Stakeholder Council Membership (Lowering Prescription Drug Costs for All Marylanders Now Act)
Synopsis: Altering the membership of the Prescription Drug Affordability Stakeholder Council; requiring the Prescription Drug Affordability Board, under certain circumstances, to establish a process for setting upper payment limits for purchases and payor reimbursements of prescription drug products that the Board determines have led or will lead to affordability challenges; authorizing the Board to reconsider an upper payment limit for a drug that becomes a current shortage; and altering requirements related to the setting of upper payment limits.
bill_summary: This bill establishes the Prescription Drug Affordability Board's authority to set upper payment limits for prescription drugs in Maryland, create a stakeholder council, and develop processes for managing drug affordability challenges, including considerations for shortages and specific populations.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health or Prescription Drug Affordability Board (implied)
stakeholders: Patients, pharmacies, healthcare providers, insurance carriers, pharmaceutical industry, and vulnerable populations in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's focus is on drug pricing and reimbursement limits, which could influence the financial dynamics of pharmaceutical companies and healthcare providers, but it does not directly create a program to improve access to capital for small businesses.

Title: Natural Resources - State Boat Act - Auctioneers
Synopsis: Exempting certain auctioneers from certain provisions of the State Boat Act.
bill_summary: The bill exempts certain auctioneers from specific provisions of the State Boat Act, clarifying that licensed auctioneers acting on behalf of sellers, secured parties, or owners do not qualify as dealers under the law.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Boat auctioneers, boat sellers, and owners in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Election Law - Postelection Tabulation Audits - Risk-Limiting Audits
Synopsis: Requiring the State Board of Elections, in collaboration with the local boards of elections, to conduct a risk-limiting audit after each statewide election; authorizing the State Board, in collaboration with the local boards, to conduct a risk-limiting audit after a special general election; authorizing the State Board, in collaboration with the local boards, to conduct an automated software audit after a statewide election; authorizing a local board to conduct a risk-limiting audit of a local contest under certain circumstances; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland State Board of Elections to conduct risk-limiting audits after each statewide election, including automated software audits and manual audits of voter-verifiable paper records, to ensure the accuracy of vote tabulation.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Elections
stakeholders: Voters and election officials in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: State Board of Public Accountancy - Emeritus Status
Synopsis: Authorizing the State Board of Public Accountancy to place a licensee on emeritus status under certain circumstances; and requiring the Board to reinstate the license of an individual who is on emeritus status under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland State Board of Public Accountancy to place licensed public accountants on emeritus status, allowing them to retire from active practice while maintaining a license that exempts them from certain requirements, and provides rules for reinstatement and usage of titles.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Public Accountancy
stakeholders: Certified Public Accountants in Maryland, retired accountants, and the public who rely on CPA services
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's impact on access to capital is indirect, mainly through allowing experienced accountants to retain a license and potentially provide services or mentorship, which could support small business growth.

Title: Medical Debt - Complaints for Money Judgment and Real Property Liens
Synopsis: Establishing certain requirements for a complaint for a money judgment; defining "medical debt" as a debt owed by a consumer to a provider of medical services, products, or devices, but does not include debt charged to a credit card except under certain circumstances; prohibiting the creation of a lien on owner-occupied residential property by contract or as a result of a breach of contract for the payment of medical debt; and applying the Act prospectively.
bill_summary: The bill establishes rules for medical debt judgments, prohibits creating liens on owner-occupied residential property for medical debt, and requires certain disclosures in legal complaints related to medical debt.
responsible_party: Maryland courts and legal system
stakeholders: Homeowners with owner-occupied residential property and medical debt creditors
access_to_capital_summary: The bill reduces the ability of creditors to place liens on primary residences for medical debt, potentially limiting access to capital for medical debtors.

Title: Consumer Protection - Consumer Contracts - Limitation Periods
Synopsis: Prohibiting a consumer contract from setting a shorter time to bring an action under or on the consumer contract than required by the law of the State; excluding certain entities from the application of this Act; and applying the Act prospectively.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits consumer contracts from including provisions that set shorter time limits for legal actions than those required by Maryland law, making such provisions void and illegal. It also clarifies that violations are considered unfair trade practices.
responsible_party: Maryland courts and judicial system, specifically enforcement through the Commercial Law Article and Courts Article
stakeholders: Consumers entering into consumer contracts in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's focus is on legal contract provisions and does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Vehicle Laws - Medical Exemption for Enhanced Tinted Windows - Time Limitation
Synopsis: Repealing the 2-year time limitation on medical exemptions for enhanced tinted windows for vehicle owners with certain permanent medical conditions.
bill_summary: The bill repeals the 2-year time limitation on medical exemptions for enhanced tinted windows on vehicles for owners with certain medical conditions, allowing such exemptions to be valid indefinitely if the condition is permanent.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of State Police
stakeholders: Vehicle owners with medical conditions requiring tinted windows
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Criminal Law - Visual Surveillance With Prurient Intent - Modifications
Synopsis: Altering the definition of "private place" as it relates to the prohibition on conducting visual surveillance with prurient intent of an individual without the consent of the individual to include a residence; and altering the prohibition against conducting visual surveillance with prurient intent.
bill_summary: The bill amends Maryland law to modify the definition of 'private place' and clarifies the prohibition on visual surveillance with prurient intent, including surveillance by cameras, in private places or private areas without consent.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety or law enforcement agencies
stakeholders: Individuals whose private areas or private places may be surveilled without consent
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Civil Actions - Tortious Injury to or Death of Pet - Compensatory Damages (Buddy's Law)
Synopsis: Increasing from $10,000 to $25,000 the maximum amount of compensatory damages that may be awarded to an owner of a pet from a person who tortiously causes an injury to or death of the pet while acting individually or through an animal under the person's ownership, direction, or control.
bill_summary: The bill increases the maximum amount of compensatory damages that can be awarded to pet owners when their pet is injured or killed due to someone else's tortious actions from $10,000 to $25,000.
responsible_party: Maryland courts and judicial system
stakeholders: Pet owners and pet owners' pets in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Criminal Procedure - Victims and Witnesses - Out of Court Statement of Child to Forensic Interviewer
Synopsis: Expanding the evidentiary rule on the admissibility of out of court statements made by child victims or witnesses to make admissible an out of court statement made by a child to a forensic interviewer.
bill_summary: The bill expands the admissibility of out-of-court statements made by child victims or witnesses in criminal and juvenile court proceedings, specifically allowing statements made to forensic interviewers under certain conditions.
responsible_party: Maryland Judiciary or relevant court system
stakeholders: Child victims and witnesses, legal professionals, child advocacy organizations, and the criminal justice system
access_to_capital_summary: The bill primarily changes evidentiary rules and does not directly impact access to capital for small businesses.

Title: Baby Food Labeling - Statement Regarding Toxic Heavy Metal Testing - Terminology
Synopsis: Altering the statement that must be included on a baby food product label if the baby food product has been tested for toxic heavy metals for the purpose of changing the term included on the label from "toxic heavy metal" to "toxic element".
bill_summary: This bill requires baby food manufacturers in Maryland to test their products for toxic heavy metals and include specific labeling information, including a QR code linking to test results and health guidance, starting in 2025. It also establishes testing and reporting requirements and restricts sales of products exceeding federal limits.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Baby food manufacturers, parents, and children under 2 in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The program's focus on testing and transparent reporting could improve consumer trust and market access for compliant manufacturers, potentially impacting small businesses positively.

Title: Criminal Law - Interference With a Public Safety Answering Point - Penalties
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person from taking certain actions with the intent to interrupt or impair the functioning of a public safety answering point; and providing that a person who violates the Act is guilty of a felony and on conviction is subject to imprisonment not to exceed 5 years or a fine of up to $25,000 or both.
bill_summary: The bill enhances laws related to cybercrimes, specifically targeting acts that interfere with public safety answering points and other critical infrastructure, with increased penalties for violations.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services
stakeholders: Public safety agencies, cybersecurity entities, and the general public
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small businesses.

Title: Natural Resources - Invasive Blue Catfish Pilot Program
Synopsis: Establishing the Invasive Blue Catfish Pilot Program in the Department of Natural Resources to curb the spread of the invasive blue catfish in the Chesapeake Bay and its tributaries; requiring the Department to expand the use of practices determined to be effective under the Program; and requiring the Department to report to the Governor and the General Assembly by December 1, 2025, on its findings and recommendations based on the Pilot Program.
bill_summary: This bill establishes the Invasive Blue Catfish Pilot Program to control the spread of invasive blue catfish in the Chesapeake Bay and its tributaries. It includes provisions to expand fishing methods and regulations to increase harvest and manage the invasive species.
responsible_party: Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Fishermen, environmental agencies, residents and ecosystems of the Chesapeake Bay area
access_to_capital_summary: The program may increase opportunities for commercial fishing, potentially improving access to capital for fishermen involved in blue catfish harvest.

Title: Anne Arundel County โ Property Tax Credit โ Habitat for Humanity of the Chesapeake, Incorporated
Synopsis: Altering the name of Arundel Habitat for Humanity, Inc., to be Habitat for Humanity of the Chesapeake, Incorporated, for purposes of a certain property tax credit against the county or municipal corporation tax imposed on the entity; and authorizing the tax credit for any real property owned by the entity.
bill_summary: The bill alters the name of Arundel Habitat for Humanity, Inc. to Habitat for Humanity of the Chesapeake, Incorporated, and authorizes a property tax credit for real property owned by this entity in Anne Arundel County.
responsible_party: Anne Arundel County government or municipal corporations within Anne Arundel County
stakeholders: Habitat for Humanity of the Chesapeake, Inc. and property owners in Anne Arundel County
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly create a program impacting access to capital for small businesses.

Title: Modernization of Military Laws Act
Synopsis: Establishing rules of interpretation related to the uniformed services; altering the rule of interpretation for "veteran"; requiring the Secretary of Veterans and Military Families to develop certain policies related to life transitions of veterans, service members, and military families; and altering the application of certain provisions of law related to veterans, the uniformed services, and the filing of certificates of candidacy, the powers of the Governor, State veterans' cemeteries, and housing and employment discrimination.
bill_summary: The bill modernizes Maryland's military laws by establishing interpretation rules for military and veteran-related terms, creating policies for life transitions of veterans and service members, and making changes to laws regarding veterans' benefits, cemeteries, and employment preferences.
responsible_party: Department of Veterans and Military Families
stakeholders: Veterans, service members, military families, and their dependents in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill primarily focuses on veterans' benefits, services, and legal definitions, with no direct programs aimed at increasing access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Maryland Transit Administration - Disability Reduced Fare Program - Renewal for Permanently Disabled Individuals
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Transit Administration to automatically renew the Disability Reduced Fare Program certification of an enrollee who is permanently disabled.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Transit Administration to automatically renew the certification of individuals who are permanently disabled for the Disability Reduced Fare Program.
responsible_party: Maryland Transit Administration
stakeholders: Individuals who are permanently disabled and use the reduced fare program
access_to_capital_summary: This bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Outdoor Lighting - Guidance and Use of State Funds
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Green Building Council, on or before October 1, 2026, to update or develop guidance for the purchase of outdoor lighting fixtures in consideration of certain recommendations; prohibiting State funds from being used to install or replace certain permanent outdoor luminaires for lighting unless certain requirements are met; altering the requirements for the use of State funds for the installation or replacement of certain permanent outdoor luminaires for lighting; applying the Act prospectively; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates guidelines for outdoor lighting in Maryland, including restrictions on the use of state funds for outdoor luminaires, and requires the Maryland Green Building Council to develop or update guidance considering light pollution and color temperature. It also mandates a review of highway lighting practices by the Department of Transportation.
responsible_party: Maryland Green Building Council and Department of Transportation
stakeholders: State agencies, outdoor lighting manufacturers, and the general public in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's focus on guidelines and restrictions on outdoor lighting does not directly impact small business access to capital.

Title: Anne Arundel County - Development Impact Fees
Synopsis: Altering the scope of certain limitations on the authority of the Anne Arundel County Council to grant exemptions from or credits against development impact fees.
bill_summary: The bill amends the scope of exemptions and credits for development impact fees in Anne Arundel County, allowing the County Council to grant exemptions or credits for certain types of development projects, including affordable housing and land conveyances.
responsible_party: Anne Arundel County Council
stakeholders: Developers, affordable housing projects, local government, residents of Anne Arundel County
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's focus on exemptions and credits for impact fees may indirectly influence the financial viability of development projects, but it does not directly establish a program to improve access to capital.

Title: Braille Flag Memorial Act of 2025
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of Veterans and Military Families to designate a location for an American braille tactile flag to be placed on the grounds of one or more State veterans' cemeteries to honor members of the uniformed services, veterans, and other individuals in the State who are blind or visually impaired.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Veterans and Military Families to designate a location for an American braille tactile flag at one or more State veterans' cemeteries to honor blind and visually impaired veterans and service members.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Veterans and Military Families
stakeholders: Blind and visually impaired veterans and service members, visitors of State veterans' cemeteries
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: University of Maryland, College Park Campus - TerpsEXCEED Program - Funding
Synopsis: Authorizing the Governor to include in the annual budget bill, beginning in fiscal year 2027, an appropriation of $350,000 to the University of Maryland, College Park Campus TerpsEXCEED (EXperiencing College through Education and Employment Discovery) Program to provide educational and employment opportunities to students with intellectual disabilities.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes funding for the University of Maryland, College Park's TerpsEXCEED Program, which provides educational and employment opportunities for students with intellectual disabilities, starting in fiscal year 2027 with an annual appropriation of $350,000.
responsible_party: University of Maryland, College Park Campus
stakeholders: Students with intellectual disabilities and related support services
access_to_capital_summary: The program's focus on employment opportunities and support services suggests a high potential to impact access to capital for small business owners involved in employment and internship programs.

Title: Counties - Cancer Screening for Professional Firefighters - Required Coverage (James "Jimmy" Malone Act)
Synopsis: Requiring counties that offer self-insured employee health benefit plans to provide to firefighters employed by the county coverage for preventive cancer screenings in accordance with certain guidelines; authorizing a county to satisfy the requirement by providing a no-cost annual examination or applying for a grant to pay for certain cancer screening technologies; prohibiting counties from imposing a copayment, coinsurance, or deductible requirement; and requiring the Maryland Health Commission to conduct a certain study.
bill_summary: The bill requires health insurers, nonprofit health plans, and health maintenance organizations to provide coverage for preventive cancer screenings for professional firefighters without copayments, coinsurance, or deductibles. It also mandates counties offering self-insured employee health plans to ensure coverage for firefighters and to report data on screenings and costs. Additionally, the Maryland Health Care Commission will study the impact of expanding this coverage to the commercial insurance market.
responsible_party: Maryland Health Care Commission and local governments (counties)
stakeholders: Professional firefighters and county employees in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The program has a high potential to impact small business owners' access to capital by expanding preventive health coverage and potentially reducing healthcare costs.

Title: Vehicle Laws - Motor Vehicle Administration - 3-Hour Roadway Safety Driving Education Program - Requirements
Synopsis: Altering the requirements of the 3-hour Roadway Safety Driving Education Program established by the Motor Vehicle Administration for certain applicants for driver's licenses; and requiring the Administration to adopt regulations establishing criteria for certifying a private entity to offer the 3-hour Roadway Safety Education Program.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration to establish a 3-hour Roadway Safety Driving Education Program for certain new drivers and modifies the requirements for driver licensing, including the implementation of this program.
responsible_party: Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration
stakeholders: New and prospective drivers in Maryland, especially those without prior driving experience or licenses
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Health Equality for Service Members Act
Synopsis: Establishing rules of interpretation related to the uniformed services; altering the rule of interpretation for "veteran"; and altering the application of certain provisions of law governing public health, the regulation of health occupations, and housing vouchers and assistance to apply to all uniformed services, rather than only the armed forces.
bill_summary: The bill establishes rules of interpretation for uniformed services, expands legal protections and benefits to all uniformed service members and veterans, and creates a program to support behavioral health services for service members and veterans in Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Veterans and Military Families
stakeholders: Service members, veterans, their families, and behavioral health providers in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill primarily focuses on health, legal protections, and program support for service members and veterans, with no direct focus on small business capital access.

Title: Local Government - Annapolis and Anne Arundel County Conference and Visitors Bureau Designation
Synopsis: Altering references to the Annapolis and Anne Arundel County Conference and Visitors Bureau to be Visit Annapolis and Anne Arundel County, Inc.
bill_summary: The bill updates references to the Annapolis and Anne Arundel County Conference and Visitors Bureau to 'Visit Annapolis and Anne Arundel County, Inc.' and specifies the distribution of hotel tax revenue to this organization and other funds, along with reporting and auditing requirements.
responsible_party: Anne Arundel County and City of Annapolis government agencies
stakeholders: Tourism organizations, local government, residents, and visitors of Annapolis and Anne Arundel County
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Vehicle Laws - Obscured, Modified, or Blocked Registration Plates and Registration Plate Covers
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person from obscuring or modifying any vehicle registration plate in a manner that may prevent identification and enforcing the prohibition as a secondary offense; prohibiting a person from advertising for or promoting the sale of an unlawful registration plate cover by falsely claiming that the registration plate cover is lawful in the State; and establishing that a violation of the Act is an unfair, abusive, or deceptive trade practice subject to certain enforcement and penalties.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits obscuring, modifying, or blocking vehicle registration plates and bans the sale and promotion of unlawful registration plate covers that obscure or distort plates. It enforces these rules as secondary violations and establishes penalties for violations.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation or law enforcement agencies
stakeholders: Vehicle owners, law enforcement, and businesses selling registration plate covers in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Baltimore City - Alcoholic Beverages - 45th Alcoholic Beverages District - Licenses
Synopsis: Authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Baltimore City to issue a Class C beer, wine, and liquor license in a certain area of the 45th alcoholic beverages district in Baltimore City under certain circumstances; and altering a geographic boundary in the 45th district within which the holder of a Class A or Class B-D-7 beer, wine, and liquor license must operate in accordance with specified hours.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Baltimore City Board of License Commissioners to issue a new Class C alcohol license in the 45th district, modifies geographic boundaries for existing licenses, and adjusts sale hours and conditions for various alcohol licenses within Baltimore City.
responsible_party: Baltimore City Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Alcohol license holders, residents, and businesses in Baltimore City, especially in the 45th district
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Maryland Community College Promise Scholarship Program - Revisions
Synopsis: Altering the number of years that a recipient of an award under the Maryland Community College Promise Scholarship Program may hold the award under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill revises the Maryland Community College Promise Scholarship Program by extending the maximum duration a recipient can hold the award from 3 years to 6 years after first enrolling, under certain conditions.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: Community college students in Maryland receiving Promise Scholarships
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's focus on scholarship duration and eligibility does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Transportation Equality for Service Members Act
Synopsis: Establishing rules of interpretation related to the uniformed services; altering the rule of interpretation for "veteran"; and altering the application of certain provisions of law governing transportation to apply to all uniformed services, rather than only certain uniformed services.
bill_summary: The bill establishes rules of interpretation for military service members and veterans, expands transportation-related benefits and legal provisions to include all uniformed services, and provides specific accommodations for active duty service members and veterans in Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Veterans and Military Families
stakeholders: Military service members, veterans, and their families in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: St. Mary's County - Alcoholic Beverages - Class A License Quota
Synopsis: Altering the quota for the number of Class A alcoholic beverages licenses that may be issued in the 8th election district in St. Mary's County.
bill_summary: This bill alters the quota for the number of Class A alcoholic beverage licenses that can be issued in the 8th election district in St. Mary's County, Maryland, based on population statistics.
responsible_party: Maryland Alcoholic Beverages Board
stakeholders: Residents and businesses in St. Mary's County, especially in the 8th election district
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: State Department of Education - Family Child Care Homes and Child Care Centers - Regulatory Analysis
Synopsis: Requiring the State Department of Education to conduct a thorough analysis of the State's regulatory framework for child care facilities with particular emphasis on regulations that limit a person's ability to register a child care facility, receive a license to operate a child care center, or operate a child care facility in a profitable manner while providing quality care; and requiring an interim and final report be submitted to the Governor and the General Assembly by January 1, 2026, and September 1, 2026, respectively.
bill_summary: This bill revises child care regulations in Maryland, including child-to-adult ratios in family child care homes and centers, and mandates a comprehensive analysis of the state's regulatory framework for child care facilities, with reports due in 2026.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: Child care providers, children in care, families, and regulatory agencies in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's focus on regulatory analysis and potential reforms could impact the ease of opening and operating child care facilities, thereby affecting access to capital for providers.

Title: Hagerstown Community College Police Force - Jurisdiction
Synopsis: Authorizing a Hagerstown Community College police officer to exercise powers granted to a peace and police officer under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes Hagerstown Community College police officers to exercise certain law enforcement powers outside the college property under specific circumstances within Washington County, Maryland.
responsible_party: Hagerstown Community College Police Force in coordination with Maryland law enforcement agencies
stakeholders: Hagerstown Community College students, staff, and the local community within Washington County
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: St. Maryโs County โ County Plans โ Public Sewerage Systems and Water Supply Systems
Synopsis: Applying certain provisions relating to the adoption of or revision or amendment to a county plan to county plans in St. Mary's County; and repealing certain provisions relating to public sewerage systems and water supply systems in St. Mary's County.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the process for adopting or amending county plans related to public sewerage and water supply systems in St. Maryโs County, including repealing certain existing provisions and establishing new review and approval procedures.
responsible_party: St. Maryโs County government and Planning Commission
stakeholders: Residents and businesses in St. Maryโs County, especially those involved in or affected by sewerage and water supply infrastructure planning
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly establish or fund programs that impact access to capital for small businesses.

Title: Washington County - Board of License Commissioners - Membership
Synopsis: Requiring that certain numbers of members of the Board of License Commissioners for Washington County belong to certain political parties based on the aggregated number of votes in the preceding election of the Board of County Commissioners.
bill_summary: This bill amends the membership rules for the Washington County Board of License Commissioners, requiring that two members belong to the political party with the highest number of votes in the previous election and one member to the second highest, replacing the previous rule that no more than two members could belong to the same party.
responsible_party: Washington County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Residents and businesses in Washington County, Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Occupational Licensing and Certification - Criminal History - Predetermination Review Process
Synopsis: Providing that "department" does not include the Maryland Department of Health or the Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services for purposes of certain provisions prohibiting a department from refusing to issue an occupational license or certificate based on a certain conviction under certain circumstances; establishing a predetermination review process for occupational licenses and certificates in certain departments of State government; authorizing a department to charge a criminal history review fee of up to $100; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a predetermination review process for occupational licenses and certificates in certain Maryland state departments, allowing individuals to request a review of their criminal history to determine if it disqualifies them from obtaining a license.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Agriculture, Department of the Environment, Department of Human Services, Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: Individuals seeking occupational licenses or certificates in Maryland with criminal histories
access_to_capital_summary: The program could improve access to occupational licenses for individuals with criminal histories, potentially increasing their economic opportunities.

Title: St. Mary's County - Corrections
Synopsis: Adding programs, a day reporting program, an in-patient treatment program, and a pretrial release supervision program, that the St. Mary's County Sheriff is authorized to establish; repealing a requirement that the Sheriff or the Sheriff's designee collect the earnings of a certain individual participating in a certain program; and authorizing the Sheriff or the Sheriff's designee to direct an individual participating in a certain program to provide proof that the individual has made payments toward certain obligations.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Sheriff of St. Mary's County to establish various correctional programs, including home detention, day reporting, work release, inpatient treatment, pretrial supervision, and prerelease programs. It also allows the Sheriff to direct participants to provide proof of payments toward certain obligations and removes the previous requirement that earnings of participants be collected.
responsible_party: St. Mary's County Sheriff
stakeholders: Individuals participating in correctional programs in St. Mary's County
access_to_capital_summary: The bill has the potential to improve access to capital for program participants by allowing them to provide proof of payments toward obligations instead of earnings being automatically collected.

Title: St. Mary's County - Alcoholic Beverages - Civil Penalty for Sales Violations
Synopsis: Increasing, from $1,000 to $2,500, the maximum civil penalty that the Board of License Commissioners for St. Mary's County may impose for a violation of a law relating to licensing the sale of alcoholic beverages.
bill_summary: The bill increases the maximum civil penalty that the Board of License Commissioners for St. Mary's County can impose for violations related to the sale of alcoholic beverages, raising it from $1,000 to $2,500.
responsible_party: Board of License Commissioners for St. Mary's County
stakeholders: Alcoholic beverage licensees and the general public in St. Mary's County
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Maryland Department of Labor - Study on Building Code Requirements for Single-Staircase Buildings
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Labor to study building code requirements for single-staircase buildings in the State and other States and analyze best practices when drafting building code requirements; requiring the Department to make legislative and regulatory recommendations for the purpose of increasing the affordable housing supply by reducing barriers to multifamily housing development; and requiring the Department to report to the Governor and certain committees of the General Assembly by December 1, 2026.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Labor to study building code requirements for single-staircase buildings and make recommendations to potentially allow the construction of up to six-story buildings with a single staircase to increase affordable housing.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: Housing developers, residents, fire safety officials, and policymakers interested in affordable housing and building safety.
access_to_capital_summary: The program aims to reduce barriers to multifamily housing development, which could facilitate access to capital for developers and investors.

Title: St. Mary's County - Competitive Bidding - Threshold
Synopsis: Increasing the minimum contract value to $50,000 to require a competitive bidding process in St. Mary's County for contracts for services or supplies.
bill_summary: This bill increases the minimum contract value threshold for requiring a competitive bidding process in St. Mary's County from $15,000 to $50,000 for contracts for services or supplies.
responsible_party: St. Mary's County government
stakeholders: County government and contractors in St. Mary's County
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: St. Mary's County - Metropolitan Commission - Discontinuance of Service
Synopsis: Authorizing the St. Mary's County Metropolitan Commission to discontinue all or part of water or sewer service provided to an improved private property determined to be unsafe, unfit, or unsuitable for human occupancy due to an accident, artificial disaster, or natural disaster; requiring the suspension of the ready-to-serve charge on certain private properties; and authorizing the St. Mary's County Metropolitan Commission to utilize certain remedies for a violation related to certain public water and sewer use.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes the St. Mary's County Metropolitan Commission to discontinue water or sewer service to private properties under certain circumstances, including nonpayment and unsafe conditions, and to suspend the ready-to-serve charge during service discontinuance. It also establishes enforcement remedies for violations of water and sewer regulations.
responsible_party: St. Mary's County Metropolitan Commission
stakeholders: Private property owners and residents in St. Mary's County
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Frederick County - County Employees and Volunteers - Criminal History Records Check
Synopsis: Authorizing the Director of Human Resources of Frederick County to request from the Criminal Justice Information System Central Repository of the Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services a State and national criminal history records check for a prospective or current county employee or county volunteer; requiring the Central Repository to forward certain information to certain persons; requiring that the information remain confidential and that it be used only for personnel-related purposes; etc.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes Frederick County's Human Resources Director to request criminal history records checks for current or prospective employees and volunteers, and establishes procedures for handling and contesting such records.
responsible_party: Frederick County Department of Human Resources
stakeholders: County employees and volunteers in Frederick County
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Recreational Equality for Service Members Act
Synopsis: Establishing rules of interpretation related to the uniformed services; altering the rule of interpretation for "veteran"; altering the application of certain provisions of law governing public health and the regulation of health occupations to apply to all uniformed services, rather than only the armed forces; altering the circumstances under which licenses for fishing in tidal waters do not lapse; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes rules of interpretation for service members and veterans, expands access to natural resources and recreational activities for active duty members and veterans, and provides fee exemptions for entry into state parks for active service members and veterans.
responsible_party: Department of Natural Resources and Department of Veterans and Military Families
stakeholders: Active service members, veterans, disabled veterans, Gold Star recipients, and their families in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill primarily focuses on recreational and fee exemptions for service members and veterans, with no direct programs related to access to capital.

Title: Residential Child Care Programs - Transportation Companies - Regulation (Preventing Abduction in Youth Transport Act of 2025)
Synopsis: Prohibiting transportation companies that transport children to residential child care programs from using certain restraints unless there is a substantial likelihood of imminent serious physical harm to a child or others; prohibiting transportation companies that transport children to residential child care programs from picking up children between the hours of 9 p.m. and 6 a.m.; authorizing an individual and the Attorney General to bring a certain civil action against certain transportation companies; and applying the Act prospectively.
bill_summary: The bill regulates transportation companies that transport children to residential child care programs, prohibiting certain restraints and restricting pickup hours to prevent child abduction.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Human Services and the Attorney General's Office
stakeholders: Children in residential child care programs, transportation companies, and their families
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Procurement Reform Act of 2025
Synopsis: Authorizing the Secretary of General Services to delegate certain powers and duties to the Chief Procurement Officer; altering the authority of the Department of General Services to engage in or control procurement of certain equipment and services; requiring the Department of Information Technology to establish a technical procurement team; altering the authority of the Department of Transportation and the Maryland Transportation Authority to engage in procurement for certain supplies and services; etc.
bill_summary: This bill overhauls Maryland's procurement laws, establishing new procedures, programs, and evaluation factors to promote small, minority, women, veteran-owned businesses, environmental outcomes, and good labor practices in state contracting.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of General Services and Office of Small, Minority, and Women Business Affairs
stakeholders: Small businesses, minority-owned businesses, veteran-owned businesses, environmental organizations, state agencies, contractors, and workforce development programs
access_to_capital_summary: The bill introduces programs and evaluation factors that could significantly improve small business access to capital through targeted procurement preferences, certifications, and performance-based contracting.

Title: Office of Disability Employment Advancement and Policy and Maryland as a Model Employer Initiative - Established
Synopsis: Establishing the Office of Disability Employment Advancement and Policy within the Department of Disabilities; establishing the Maryland as a Model Employer Initiative within the Office of Disability Employment Advancement and Policy to facilitate efforts that improve outcomes in the hiring, recruitment, retention, and advancement of people with disabilities in the State government workforce; authorizing the Governor for fiscal year 2027, to include $250,000 in the annual budget bill for the Office; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Office of Disability Employment Advancement and Policy within the Maryland Department of Disabilities and creates the Maryland as a Model Employer Initiative to improve employment outcomes for people with disabilities in state government.
responsible_party: Department of Disabilities
stakeholders: People with disabilities seeking employment, state government agencies, and related organizations
access_to_capital_summary: The program aims to improve employment opportunities for people with disabilities, which can enhance their access to employment-related resources and support, indirectly impacting access to capital.

Title: Excellence in Maryland Public Schools Act
Synopsis: Altering the source of funds for the Blueprint for Maryland's Future Fund to include the interest earnings of the Academic Excellence Fund; authorizing the Department to establish a national teacher recruitment campaign; establishing the Academic Excellence Program in the Department to address critical academic needs in public schools; requiring the Department to consult with a certain entity to evaluate  the Concentration of Poverty School Grant Program and establish requirements for community school implementation plans; etc.
bill_summary: This bill makes extensive reforms to Maryland's education funding, programs, and policies, including establishing new grants, programs, and initiatives to improve student achievement, support community schools, enhance teacher recruitment and development, and implement the Blueprint for Maryland's Future.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: Students, families, teachers, school administrators, community organizations, and local education agencies in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's programs and grants aim to improve educational outcomes and support community and school development, which can indirectly enhance access to capital for educational initiatives, but it primarily focuses on funding and program development.

Title: Chesapeake Bay Legacy Act
Synopsis: Establishing the Maryland Leaders in Environmentally Engaged Farming (LEEF) Program; establishing the Maryland Leaders in Environmentally Engaged Farming (LEEF) Program Fund to support actions associated with the Program's purpose; altering the definition of "healthy soils" for purposes of the Maryland Healthy Soils Program; exempting certain holders of certain fishing licenses from the requirement to obtain a food establishment license from the Maryland Department of Health; establishing the Water Quality Monitoring Program; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland Leaders in Environmentally Engaged Farming (LEEF) Program, creates a dedicated fund for it, and implements various water quality, fisheries management, and land leasing initiatives aimed at environmental restoration and sustainable farming practices in Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Agriculture and Maryland Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Farmers, environmental agencies, local communities, and aquatic life in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill provides financial incentives and funding to promote environmentally sustainable farming practices, which could improve access to capital for farmers adopting these practices.

Title: State Contracts - Prohibited Provisions
Synopsis: Clarifying a prohibition on including in State contracts provisions pertaining to limitations of liability for damage to real or tangible personal property; and clarifying a prohibition on including in State contracts provisions limiting the recovery of costs related to the use of replacement contractors under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: This bill clarifies and prohibits certain provisions in State contracts in Maryland, including limitations on liability for damage to property, restrictions on recovery of costs related to replacement contractors, and other specific contractual clauses.
responsible_party: Maryland State government, specifically the Department of General Services or relevant state contracting authority
stakeholders: Maryland State government, contractors, and the public interested in state procurement practices
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's focus on contract provisions does not directly impact small business access to capital.

Title: State Procurement Preferences - Blind Industries and Services of Maryland - Packaging and Repackaging
Synopsis: Requiring a State or State aided or controlled entity to require a prime contractor to procure certain janitorial products packaged or repackaged by Blind Industries and Services of Maryland.
bill_summary: The bill requires state entities to include in maintenance contracts a requirement that prime contractors procure janitorial products from Blind Industries and Services of Maryland if the products are made, remanufactured, packaged, repackaged, or assembled by them and are available.
responsible_party: State or State aided or controlled entities
stakeholders: Blind Industries and Services of Maryland, state contractors, and the public benefiting from janitorial services
access_to_capital_summary: The bill promotes procurement from Blind Industries and Services of Maryland, potentially increasing their sales and revenue, which could improve their access to capital.

Title: Maryland Inventory of Cemeteries and Burial Sites Workgroup - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Maryland Inventory of Cemeteries and Burial Sites Workgroup for the purpose of studying issues related to the establishment and maintenance of a State cemetery inventory system; and requiring the Workgroup to report its findings and recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly by December 1, 2025.
bill_summary: This bill establishes the Maryland Inventory of Cemeteries and Burial Sites Workgroup to study issues related to creating and maintaining a statewide cemetery inventory system, including definitions, practices, costs, and potential funding.
responsible_party: Maryland Historical Trust and Maryland Office of Cemetery Oversight
stakeholders: Local governments, genealogical and historical organizations, descendant communities, religious and private cemeteries in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's focus is on studying and recommending a cemetery inventory system, not directly providing capital or funding to small businesses.

Title: Frederick County - Barbershop and Beauty Salon Beer and Wine License - Alterations
Synopsis: Increasing from 5 to 6.5 ounces of wine by the glass that a holder of a barbershop or beauty salon beer and wine license in Frederick County may provide to a certain customer for on-premises consumption.
bill_summary: The bill amends the regulations for beer and wine licenses in Frederick County, Maryland, increasing the allowed wine serving size from 5 ounces to 6.5 ounces for barbershop and beauty salon license holders, and clarifies the rules around on-premises consumption and licensing.
responsible_party: Frederick County Department of Permits and Inspections
stakeholders: Barbershop and beauty salon owners, customers in Frederick County, and local regulators
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Crimes Relating to Animals - Restrictions on Keeping Roosters
Synopsis: Prohibiting, beginning January 1, 2027, a certain person from keeping a rooster movement-constrained through use of a certain enclosure or tether, subject to certain exceptions; establishing that a violation of the Act is a civil offense; and providing the Act may be enforced by any State or local law enforcement officers or local animal control authority for the jurisdiction where the violation occurs.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits keeping more than 5 roosters per acre or a total of 25 roosters on a property starting January 1, 2027, unless authorized by the Department of Agriculture. It aims to address issues related to cockfighting and the spread of avian flu.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Agriculture
stakeholders: Rooster owners, animal control agencies, local governments, and the general public concerned with animal welfare and public health
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Health Occupations - State Board of Chiropractic Examiners - Revisions
Synopsis: Altering certain provisions of law governing the State Board of Chiropractic Examiners and the practice of chiropractic in the State related to Board membership, licensure of chiropractors, the discipline of chiropractors, and the denial of licenses to applicants; authorizing the Board to inspect chiropractor offices under certain circumstances; and requiring the Board to require a licensee or applicant to submit to an examination by a health care provider under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: This bill revises laws governing the Maryland State Board of Chiropractic Examiners, including changes to Board membership, licensure, discipline, inspection authority, and examination requirements for chiropractors.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Chiropractic Examiners
stakeholders: Chiropractors and chiropractic students in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact small business owners' access to capital.

Title: Anne Arundel County - Alcoholic Beverages Licenses - Veterans' Organizations
Synopsis: Authorizing a certain holder of a Class C beer, wine, and liquor license in Anne Arundel County to convert the license to a Class C (veterans' organization) license; reducing from $400 to $300 the annual license fee for a Class C (veterans' organization) license; authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Anne Arundel County to provide application and administrative fee discounts to certain licensees and applicants; and authorizing a Class C (veterans' organization) licensee to operate on Sunday without a Sunday license.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes a holder of a Class C beer, wine, and liquor license in Anne Arundel County to convert it to a Class C (veterans' organization) license, adjusts the license fee, allows discounts for certain applicants, and permits operation on Sundays without a separate license for veterans' organizations.
responsible_party: Board of License Commissioners for Anne Arundel County
stakeholders: Veterans' organizations and alcohol license holders in Anne Arundel County
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Motor Vehicles - Automated Enforcement Programs - Privacy Protections
Synopsis: Requiring a custodian of recorded images produced by certain automated enforcement systems to deny inspection of the images, subject to certain exceptions; prohibiting certain State and local agencies from using a recorded image or associated data from an automated enforcement system subject to certain exceptions; and establishing certain requirements and authorizations for the removal and destruction of recorded images and associated data produced by an automated enforcement system.
bill_summary: This bill enhances privacy protections for automated enforcement programs in Maryland by restricting access, use, and sharing of recorded images and data, establishing destruction protocols, and requiring procedural safeguards.
responsible_party: Maryland State and local agencies implementing automated enforcement systems
stakeholders: Motor vehicle operators, law enforcement agencies, and the general public in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill primarily focuses on privacy and procedural protections rather than direct financial support or capital access programs.

Title: Workgroup on the Reorganization of the Maryland Transit Administration
Synopsis: Establishing the Workgroup on the Reorganization of the Maryland Transit Administration to study reorganizing the Maryland Transit Administration; requiring the Workgroup to report its findings and recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly on or before December 1, 2025; and requiring the Department of Transportation, in consultation with the Department of Legislative Services, to submit to the President of the Senate and the Speaker of the House draft legislation to effectuate the recommendations of the Workgroup.
bill_summary: This bill establishes the Maryland Rail Commuter (MARC) Rail Authority, defines its powers and responsibilities, and creates a workgroup to study the reorganization of the Maryland Transit Administration, including the potential transfer of local Baltimore City transit services to the new authority.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation
stakeholders: Maryland residents, transit riders, Baltimore City transit users, local government, and transportation agencies
access_to_capital_summary: The bill has a high potential to impact small business owners' access to capital by improving transit infrastructure and services, which can facilitate economic activity and development.

Title: Maryland Transit Administration - Purple Line - Free Ridership and Promotional Materials and Services
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Transit Administration to develop and implement a program providing for the first month after transit service begins on the Purple Line, free ridership on Purple Line transit vehicles to individuals residing within a one-quarter-mile radius of the Purple Line track; and requiring the Administration to include, beginning on October 1, 2025, for 3 months after service on the Purple Lines begins promotional materials and services at no cost to small businesses located within a one-quarter-mile radius of the Purple Line track.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Transit Administration to offer free ridership on the Purple Line for residents within a quarter-mile of the track for the first three months of service. It also mandates free advertising space on Purple Line vehicles and stations for small businesses within the same radius for three months after service begins.
responsible_party: Maryland Transit Administration
stakeholders: Residents living near the Purple Line and small businesses within a quarter-mile of the Purple Line track
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's focus on free advertising space for small businesses could enhance their visibility and access to customers, indirectly supporting their access to capital.

Title: Baltimore County - Vehicle Laws - Private Roadways in Residential Communities
Synopsis: Prohibiting, from October 1, 2025, to July 1, 2028, a person from driving a motor vehicle in violation of certain provisions of the Maryland Vehicle Law on private roadways in a certain residential community in Baltimore County; authorizing, from October 1, 2025, to July 1, 2028, a police officer to enforce the vehicle law on private roadways in a certain residential community in Baltimore County; and prohibiting a person from driving a motor vehicle in violation of the Act on any roadway located in certain areas of Calvert County.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits driving violations on private roadways within certain residential communities in Baltimore County for a specified period, and authorizes police enforcement during that time. It also requires a report on the program's effectiveness after three years.
responsible_party: Baltimore County Police Department
stakeholders: Residents of the Queen Anne Village community and other residents in Baltimore County and Calvert County using private roadways
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Peace Orders and Protective Orders โ Military Protection Orders
Synopsis: Authorizing a judge to consider whether a military protection order has been issued against a respondent when determining whether to grant a temporary peace order or a temporary protective order; and requiring a law enforcement officer to notify a certain law enforcement agency that an individual may have violated a military protection order under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes judges to consider military protection orders when issuing peace or protective orders, requires law enforcement to notify agencies of potential violations of military protection orders, and updates legal procedures related to these orders.
responsible_party: Maryland courts and law enforcement agencies
stakeholders: Individuals involved in peace or protective orders, military service members, law enforcement agencies, and the judiciary
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Abandoned and Neglected Cemeteries Fund - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Abandoned and Neglected Cemeteries Fund to provide for the care, preservation, maintenance, and restoration of abandoned and neglected cemeteries in the State; authorizing the Governor to include in the annual budget bill an appropriation of $250,000 to the fund; and requiring an annual report by September 30 to the General Assembly on the donations to the Fund and promotional efforts undertaken by money from the Fund.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Abandoned and Neglected Cemeteries Fund to support the care, preservation, and restoration of such cemeteries in Maryland. It creates a voluntary income tax checkoff for contributions to the fund, authorizes appropriations, and sets reporting requirements.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor and State Treasurer
stakeholders: Owners and caretakers of abandoned and neglected cemeteries in Maryland, and the general public interested in cemetery preservation.
access_to_capital_summary: The bill provides a dedicated fund and a voluntary contribution mechanism, which could facilitate financial support for cemetery preservation projects, indirectly impacting access to capital for related initiatives.

Title: Department of Human Services - Federal Commodity Supplemental Food Program - Administration
Synopsis: Requiring the Family Investment Administration in the Department of Human Services to be the central coordinating and directing agency of the federal Commodity Supplemental Food Program using certain funds and resources; and repealing the requirement that the Secretary of Aging administer the Program.
bill_summary: The bill designates the Family Investment Administration in the Maryland Department of Human Services as the central agency for coordinating the federal Commodity Supplemental Food Program, replacing the previous requirement that the Secretary of Aging administer the program.
responsible_party: Family Investment Administration, Department of Human Services
stakeholders: Low-income individuals and families participating in the federal Commodity Supplemental Food Program in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Department of Commerce - Nonprofit Organizations Navigator - Established
Synopsis: Establishing a nonprofit organizations navigator within the Department of Commerce to provide technical assistance and work with nonprofits and units of State government to resolve complexities and delays in State grant-making processes, collect and share certain information, and represent nonprofit organizations' interests and concerns as a member of the Maryland Efficient Grant Application Council; and requiring the Department to report to certain committees of the General Assembly on the implementation of the navigator.
bill_summary: This bill establishes a nonprofit organizations navigator within the Maryland Department of Commerce to assist nonprofits with accessing and applying for state grants, and to represent their interests on the Maryland Efficient Grant Application Council. It also modifies the composition and duties of the Maryland Efficient Grant Application Council and related provisions.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Commerce
stakeholders: Nonprofit organizations in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The program has a high potential to improve access to capital for small nonprofit organizations by providing technical assistance and streamlining grant processes.

Title: Adult Protective Services - Investigations and Disclosure of Information
Synopsis: Authorizing a local department of social services to request assistance from federal law enforcement officers in an investigation relating to an alleged vulnerable adult; and altering certain provisions relating to the disclosure of certain information concerning human services to include adult protective services.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes local departments of social services to request assistance from federal law enforcement in investigations related to alleged vulnerable adults, modifies disclosure rules for adult protective services information, and clarifies investigation procedures for adult abuse and neglect in Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Human Services and local departments of social services
stakeholders: Vulnerable adults and their families, social services agencies, law enforcement agencies, and federal law enforcement involved in investigations
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Digital Advertising Gross Revenues Tax - Assessments - Appeals and Corrections
Synopsis: Establishing a certain appeal process for persons who are subject to the digital advertising gross revenues tax and receive a notice of assessment from the Comptroller; authorizing the Comptroller or the Comptroller's designee to issue an order to correct an erroneous assessment of the digital advertising gross revenues tax, subject to certain conditions; and applying the Act to assessments of the digital advertising gross revenues tax made after December 31, 2025.
bill_summary: The bill establishes an appeal process for persons subject to the digital advertising gross revenues tax in Maryland, allowing them to contest assessments and request corrections or abatements.
responsible_party: Maryland Comptroller's Office
stakeholders: Businesses subject to the digital advertising gross revenues tax in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Maryland Medical Assistance Program - Maternal Health Self-Measured Blood Pressure Monitoring
Synopsis: Requiring, beginning on January 1, 2026, the Maryland Medical Assistance Program to provide coverage for self-measured blood pressure monitoring for certain eligible Program recipients; and requiring reimbursement of health care provider and other staff time used for patient training, transmission of blood pressure data, interpretation of blood pressure readings and reporting, remote patient monitoring, and the delivery of co-interventions, including educational materials or classes.
bill_summary: This bill requires the Maryland Medical Assistance Program to start providing coverage for self-measured blood pressure monitoring for eligible recipients starting January 1, 2026. It also mandates the development of an education campaign about blood pressure monitoring and requires annual reporting on program outcomes and savings.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Medicaid recipients, pregnant women, postpartum women, and individuals with chronic kidney disease, diabetes, heart disease, or cardiometabolic disease in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The program could improve access to blood pressure monitoring devices and related healthcare services for eligible individuals, potentially reducing barriers to managing hypertension.

Title: Food Establishments - Portable Chemical Toilets
Synopsis: Authorizing food establishments that are businesses that conduct agritourism, Class 4 limited wineries, or Class 8 farm breweries to comply with the requirement to provide a convenient lavatory by providing a portable chemical toilet that is supplied with approved hand drying devices, kept in a sanitary condition, is properly ventilated, and is placed at least 25 feet from a well.
bill_summary: The bill allows certain food establishments, specifically those involved in agritourism, limited wineries, and farm breweries, to meet the requirement for a convenient lavatory by providing a portable chemical toilet that meets specific standards and is located at least 25 feet from a well.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Food establishments involved in agritourism, wineries, and farm breweries in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Baltimore County - Political Party Central Committee - Elections
Synopsis: Altering from four to three the number of members elected from each councilmanic district of Baltimore County to the Baltimore County Republican Party Central Committee; and altering the number of members elected from each legislative district of Baltimore County to the Baltimore County Democratic Party Central Committee.
bill_summary: This bill amends the election rules for the Baltimore County Republican and Democratic Party Central Committees, changing the number of members elected from each district.
responsible_party: Baltimore County election authorities or party committees
stakeholders: Members of the Baltimore County Republican and Democratic Party Central Committees, voters in Baltimore County
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Dorchester County - Alcoholic Beverages - Venue Beer, Wine, and Liquor License
Synopsis: Establishing in Dorchester County a venue beer, wine, and liquor license that authorizes the holder to sell or serve beer, wine, and liquor for on-premises consumption during an event where food is served; authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Dorchester County to issue the license to certain nonprofit or for-profit retail businesses that meet certain criteria; and authorizing the issuance of a license to an establishment that is within 300 feet of a place of worship or a school with certain written consent.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a new venue beer, wine, and liquor license in Dorchester County that allows holders to sell or serve alcohol during events where food is served. It sets specific criteria for eligibility, including venue size, capacity, and location restrictions, and allows issuance with the consent of nearby places of worship or schools.
responsible_party: Board of License Commissioners for Dorchester County
stakeholders: Event venues, alcohol consumers, local community, and organizations hosting events in Dorchester County
access_to_capital_summary: The program could facilitate small business events and gatherings by providing a specialized license, potentially improving access to capital for event venues and related businesses.

Title: State Board of Pharmacy - Renewal Notices - Electronic Means
Synopsis: Requiring the State Board of Pharmacy to send renewal notices to licensees, permit holders, and registrants by electronic means, rather than by first-class mail, unless the licensee, permit holder, or registrant requests to receive the renewal notice by first-class mail.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland State Board of Pharmacy to send renewal notices to licensees, permit holders, and registrants via electronic means (email) instead of first-class mail, unless they request to receive notices by mail. It also updates related renewal procedures and deadlines.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Pharmacy
stakeholders: Pharmacy licensees, permit holders, registrants, pharmacy professionals in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Dorchester County - Alcoholic Beverages Licenses - Fees
Synopsis: Altering licensing fees for certain alcoholic beverages licenses in Dorchester County; and authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Dorchester County to charge an application or transfer fee under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill modifies licensing fees for alcoholic beverages licenses in Dorchester County, including increasing some existing fees and adding application and transfer fees.
responsible_party: Dorchester County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Alcohol license applicants and licensees in Dorchester County
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Dorchester County - Alcoholic Beverages - Arts Beer and Wine License
Synopsis: Establishing in Dorchester County an arts beer and wine license that authorizes the holder to sell or serve beer and wine for on-premises consumption; authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Dorchester County to issue the license to a nonprofit or for-profit retail business that engages in the display and sale of original artwork in an arts and entertainment district; authorizing the issuance the license within 300 feet of a place of worship or a school with certain written permission; and providing an annual fee of $250.
bill_summary: The bill establishes an 'Arts Beer and Wine License' in Dorchester County, allowing certain art-related businesses within an arts and entertainment district to sell beer and wine for on-premises consumption, with specific regulations and fees.
responsible_party: Dorchester County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Art businesses, local residents, and visitors in Dorchester County
access_to_capital_summary: The program could potentially support art businesses by allowing them to generate revenue through alcohol sales, but it is primarily a licensing regulation.

Title: Dorchester County - Alcoholic Beverages - Beer, Wine, and Liquor Tasting License
Synopsis: Authorizing certain Class A license holders in Dorchester County to conduct tastings of liquor under certain circumstances, in addition to tastings of beer and wine; and limiting the quantity of liquor allowed per individual for tastings to 0.5 ounces from each offering and 1.5 ounces from all offerings of liquor in 1 day.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes certain Class A license holders in Dorchester County to conduct tastings of liquor, in addition to beer and wine, with specific quantity limits per individual and provisions for licensing and disposal.
responsible_party: Dorchester County Alcoholic Beverages Board
stakeholders: Alcoholic beverage license holders, consumers in Dorchester County, local businesses involved in alcohol sales and tastings
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Anne Arundel County - Alcoholic Beverages - Class C Licenses - Events
