Synopsis: Authorizing a holder of certain Class C licenses in Anne Arundel County to sell beer, wine, and liquor to certain individuals for on-premises consumption during events held at the licensed premises; and requiring an outside group to obtain a per diem license from the Board of License Commissioners for Anne Arundel County if the outside group holds an event hosted by the holder of a certain Class C license.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a new event permit in Anne Arundel County that allows holders of Class C (veterans' organization) licenses to sell alcohol during events, including to non-members, with a permit fee of $100. It also clarifies rules for existing Class C licenses for organizations and fraternal groups.
responsible_party: Anne Arundel County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Veterans' organizations, fraternal organizations, event attendees, local businesses in Anne Arundel County
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's impact on access to capital is indirect, primarily through enabling veterans' organizations to hold events with alcohol sales, which could increase revenue and community engagement.

Title: State Board of Dental Examiners - Expanded Function Dental Assistants - Education and Reinstatement
Synopsis: Authorizing the State Board of Dental Examiners to approve a certain course of study for expanded function dental assistant certification; requiring that a course of study for initial dental assistant certification include at least 35 hours of in-person and online instruction; requiring the Board to reinstate a certain certification only under certain circumstances; requiring the Board to adopt regulations requiring continuing education, including clinical hands-on training, for expanded function dental assistants; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland State Board of Dental Examiners to approve specific courses of study for expanded function dental assistant certification, including online options, and sets regulations for reinstating expired certifications and continuing education requirements.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Dental Examiners
stakeholders: Dental assistants, dental professionals, and patients in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill primarily focuses on education, certification, and regulatory processes, with no direct impact on access to capital for small businesses.

Title: St. Mary's County - Alcoholic Beverages Licenses - Multiple Licensing Plans
Synopsis: Authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for St. Mary's County to issue not more than three Class B beer, wine, and liquor restaurant licenses to a person under certain circumstances; and prohibiting a person from having a direct or indirect interest in more than a certain number of Class B beer, wine, and liquor restaurant licenses.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Board of License Commissioners for St. Mary's County to issue up to three Class B alcohol licenses to an individual or entity, with restrictions on ownership interests to prevent excessive concentration of licenses among a few owners.
responsible_party: Board of License Commissioners for St. Mary's County
stakeholders: Alcohol license applicants and businesses in St. Mary's County
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's restrictions on license ownership could influence the ability of small business owners to acquire multiple licenses, potentially affecting access to capital.

Title: Maryland Protecting Opportunities and Regional Trade (PORT) Act โ Reports of Attorney General โ Frequency
Synopsis: Altering the frequency, from every month to every 6 months, of the reports required to be submitted by the Attorney General to the General Assembly regarding the status of the recovery of economic damages arising from the closure of the Helen Delich Bentley Port of Baltimore and the collapse of the Francis Scott Key Bridge.
bill_summary: This bill changes the reporting frequency for the Attorney General's reports on recovering economic damages from the Port of Baltimore closure and the Francis Scott Key Bridge collapse, increasing the frequency to every 6 months starting July 1, 2024.
responsible_party: Attorney General of Maryland
stakeholders: Maryland residents and businesses affected by the Port closure and bridge collapse
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Business Regulation - Enforcement for Miscellaneous State Business Licenses - Study
Synopsis: Requiring the Comptroller to consult with certain stakeholders to study and make recommendations on the enforcement process for miscellaneous State business licenses; and requiring the Comptroller to report the findings and recommendations of the study to the General Assembly by December 1, 2025.
bill_summary: The bill studies and recommends improvements to the enforcement process for miscellaneous State business licenses, including the use of citations and contact procedures for license enforcement.
responsible_party: Maryland Office of the Comptroller
stakeholders: Business owners, licensees, enforcement agencies, and stakeholders involved in business licensing in Maryland.
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Terminology and Obsolete References โ Maryland State Firefighters Association and Related Terms
Synopsis: Replacing obsolete references to the Maryland State Firemen's Association with references to the Maryland State Firefighters Association; and replacing related terminology.
bill_summary: This bill updates terminology related to the Maryland State Firefighters Association, replacing obsolete references to the Maryland State Firemen's Association, and makes related changes to laws concerning fire service benefits, scholarships, and procedures for contagious disease notification.
responsible_party: Maryland State Firefighters Association
stakeholders: Firefighters, emergency medical technicians, law enforcement officers, correctional officers, and their families in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: State Retirement and Pension System - Transfers Between Systems - Workgroup
Synopsis: Requiring the State Retirement and Pension System to convene a workgroup to study transfers of member service between State and local retirement and pension systems; and requiring the Agency to submit a report of the Workgroup's findings and recommendations, including the need for any legislative initiatives, to the Governor and the General Assembly by December 1, 2025.
bill_summary: This bill requires the Maryland State Retirement Agency to convene a workgroup to study and recommend improvements to the process of transferring member service credits between various State and local retirement systems.
responsible_party: Maryland State Retirement Agency
stakeholders: Members of State and local retirement and pension systems in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Property Tax - Low-Income Housing Tax Credit - Valuation of Property
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of Housing and Community Development to notify the State Department of Assessments and Taxation, within 30 days of closing and the execution and delivery of a certain regulatory agreement, that a commercial property that is developed under a certain provision of federal law has been awarded a low-income tax credit; and applying the Act to all taxable years beginning after June 30, 2025.
bill_summary: The bill modifies how commercial real estate that is developed under federal law and awarded low-income housing tax credits is valued for property tax purposes. It requires the Department of Housing and Community Development to notify the State Department of Assessments and Taxation when such properties are awarded tax credits, and adjusts valuation methods to account for affordability restrictions.
responsible_party: Department of Housing and Community Development and the State Department of Assessments and Taxation
stakeholders: Commercial real estate developers, low-income housing residents, local governments, and property tax authorities
access_to_capital_summary: The bill has a high potential to impact access to capital for small business owners involved in affordable housing development by potentially lowering property taxes and making projects more financially viable.

Title: Election Law - Election Judges - Compensation
Synopsis: Requiring a local board of elections to pay an election judge compensation for completing a certain course of instruction only after the election judge actually serves an election day or early voting day; and authorizing a public school student in the State to earn hours toward the service-learning graduation requirement or receive election judge compensation for service as an election judge.
bill_summary: The bill requires Maryland local election boards to pay election judges only after they serve on election day or early voting day, and allows public school students to earn service-learning hours or receive election judge compensation for service.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Elections and local election boards
stakeholders: Election judges, public school students, Maryland voters
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's impact on access to capital for small business owners is minimal, as it primarily concerns election judge compensation and student service hours.

Title: Public Libraries - Automated External Defibrillator Program (Raymono A. Russell Act)
Synopsis: Requiring certain libraries, beginning January 1, 2026, to place an automated external defibrillator in a prominent area accessible to employees and library users, to provide maintenance for the automated external defibrillator, and to comply with the Public Access Automated External Defibrillator Program; granting certain immunities to libraries and individuals under certain circumstances; requiring by December 1, 2026, a report to certain committees of the General Assembly on the use of defibrillators in libraries; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires certain libraries in Maryland to install and maintain automated external defibrillators (AEDs), ensure trained individuals are present when open, and register the AEDs with the Maryland Institute for Emergency Medical Services Systems. It grants immunities to libraries and individuals acting in good faith during emergencies.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and Maryland Institute for Emergency Medical Services Systems
stakeholders: Library users, library staff, and the general public who use libraries in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The program's impact on access to capital is indirect, primarily through public health improvements and emergency preparedness.

Title: Anne Arundel County - Property Tax Credit - Supermarkets
Synopsis: Authorizing the governing body of Anne Arundel County or of a municipal corporation in Anne Arundel County to grant, by law, a property tax credit against the personal property tax imposed on personal property of a supermarket that completes certain construction and is located in a certain food desert retail incentive area; requiring the governing body to designate what constitutes a food desert retail incentive area for purposes of the tax credit; etc.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes Anne Arundel County to grant property tax credits to supermarkets that complete certain construction in designated food desert areas, encouraging supermarket development in underserved areas.
responsible_party: Anne Arundel County government or municipal corporations within Anne Arundel County
stakeholders: Supermarkets, residents of food desert areas in Anne Arundel County, local government
access_to_capital_summary: The program could significantly improve access to capital for supermarkets investing in underserved areas by providing property tax credits.

Title: State Personnel - BWI Airport Fire and Rescue Department - Collective Bargaining and Arbitration Processes
Synopsis: Altering the collective bargaining process between the State and uniformed fire employees of the BWI Airport Fire and Rescue Department by requiring the parties to reach a collective bargaining agreement on or before September 30 of the year in which the collective bargaining agreement will expire; and establishing a process of binding arbitration in the event of an impasse.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the collective bargaining process for the uniformed fire employees of the BWI Airport Fire and Rescue Department, including establishing a deadline for reaching agreements, and creating a binding arbitration process in case of impasse.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Personnel and Pensions
stakeholders: Uniformed fire employees of the BWI Airport Fire and Rescue Department and the State of Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's impact on small business access to capital is indirect and minimal, mainly related to public sector labor negotiations.

Title: Educational Equality for Service Members Act
Synopsis: Establishing rules of interpretation related to the uniformed services; altering the rule of interpretation for "veteran"; and altering the application of certain provisions of law governing education to apply to all uniformed services, rather than only the armed forces.
bill_summary: The bill establishes rules of interpretation for veterans and uniformed services, expands education-related provisions to include all uniformed services, and creates programs to support military-connected students and personnel, including expedited educator certification, school enrollment, scholarships, and veteran resources.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Veterans and Military Families
stakeholders: Service members, veterans, military families, students, educators, and public schools in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill enhances access to education and support services for military-connected individuals, which could indirectly improve their access to capital through better educational and employment opportunities.

Title: Economic Development - Small Business Guaranty Fund - Alterations
Synopsis: Authorizing the Maryland Small Business Development Financing Authority to authorize the provision of a guaranty under the Small Business Guaranty Fund in an irrevocable letter of credit, an official treasurer's check, funds on deposit in an escrow or other depository account, or any other legal instrument promising a financial institution restitution or reimbursement for its loan losses, within the limits of the guaranty.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland Small Business Development Financing Authority to provide guarantees for up to 80% of certain long-term loans to small businesses, with specific conditions on loan amounts, uses, and terms, supported by the full faith and credit of the State or other legal instruments.
responsible_party: Maryland Small Business Development Financing Authority
stakeholders: Small business owners in Maryland seeking loans
access_to_capital_summary: The program has the potential to significantly improve access to capital for small businesses by providing loan guarantees, reducing lenders' risk.

Title: State Board of Nursing - Advanced Practice Nursing Licensure and Specialty Certification - Reciprocity Discussions (Maryland Border States Advanced Practice Nursing Act)
Synopsis: Requiring the State Board of Nursing to hold discussions with Delaware, Pennsylvania, Virginia, West Virginia, and the District of Columbia to pursue reciprocity agreements for advanced practice nursing licensure and specialty certification; and requiring the Board, by November 1, 2025, and each November 1 for the following 4 years, to submit a report to certain committees of the General Assembly on the status of the discussions, agreements reached, challenges in the negotiations, and any legislative recommendations.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland State Board of Nursing to hold discussions with nursing licensing boards in Delaware, Pennsylvania, Virginia, West Virginia, and the District of Columbia to establish reciprocity agreements for advanced practice nursing licensure and certification, aiming to improve access, portability, and telehealth services.
responsible_party: State Board of Nursing
stakeholders: Advanced practice registered nurses and patients in Maryland and surrounding jurisdictions
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Earned Income Tax Credit - Notice of Eligibility - Alteration
Synopsis: Altering the method by which the Comptroller must provide notice of the maximum income eligibility for the earned income tax credit for the calendar year to all employers in the State to include an electronic means of notification.
bill_summary: The bill alters the method by which the Maryland Comptroller provides notice to employers about the earned income tax credit, and requires employers to notify employees about their potential eligibility for the credit.
responsible_party: Maryland Comptroller's Office
stakeholders: Employers and employees in Maryland who may be eligible for the earned income tax credit
access_to_capital_summary: The bill primarily focuses on information dissemination about tax credits and does not directly impact access to capital for small businesses.

Title: Local Earned Income Tax Credit - Calculation - County Income Tax Rate
Synopsis: Clarifying that a county's applicable income tax rate is the tax rate used to calculate the local earned income tax credit that certain individuals may claim against the county income tax; and applying the Act to all taxable years beginning after December 31, 2024.
bill_summary: This bill clarifies the calculation of the local earned income tax credit in Maryland, specifically how the county income tax rate is used in the calculation, and allows counties to provide a refundable earned income tax credit.
responsible_party: Maryland Office of the Comptroller
stakeholders: Taxpayers in Maryland, especially residents claiming the earned income tax credit
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Criminal Law - Destroying Funerary Objects and Cemetery Elements - Statute of Limitations and Prohibition
Synopsis: Extending from 1 year to 3 years the statute of limitations for prosecutions relating to destroying funerary objects and other elements of a cemetery to begin at the time local authorities knew or reasonably should have known of the violation; and prohibiting a person from willfully destroying, damaging, defacing, or removing any part of the grounds of a cemetery.
bill_summary: The bill increases the statute of limitations for prosecuting crimes related to destroying funerary objects and cemetery elements from 1 year to 3 years after the authorities knew or should have known of the violation. It also prohibits willful destruction or damage to cemetery grounds, including landscaping, and sets penalties for violations.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services or local law enforcement agencies
stakeholders: Cemetery owners, local authorities, and the general public concerned with cemetery preservation and respect for funerary sites
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Comptroller - Recording and Monitoring Telephone Calls - Clarification
Synopsis: Clarifying which telephone calls the Comptroller of the State may record and monitor for training, quality control, and employee safety purposes; and providing that the Comptroller may monitor and record calls to the Comptroller's call centers only.
bill_summary: This bill clarifies the circumstances under which the Maryland Comptroller's office may record and monitor telephone calls, specifically limiting recordings to calls made to the Comptroller's call centers for training, quality control, and safety, and establishing rules for notice, retention, and use of such recordings.
responsible_party: Maryland Comptroller's Office
stakeholders: Maryland taxpayers and state employees
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: State Lottery - Internet Sales of Subscription Plans - Authorization
Synopsis: Authorizing the State Lottery and Gaming Control Agency to allow the establishment of a system or program that allows an individual to purchase a State lottery subscription plan through an electronic device that connects to the Internet, such as a personal computer or mobile device; and requiring the Agency to report by December 1, 2026, to certain committees of the General Assembly on State lottery subscription sales.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland State Lottery and Gaming Control Agency to establish a system allowing individuals to purchase lottery subscription plans online, either directly or through vouchers sold by licensed agents. It also requires the agency to report on subscription sales and renewals by December 2026.
responsible_party: Maryland State Lottery and Gaming Control Agency
stakeholders: Maryland residents interested in purchasing lottery subscriptions, licensed agents, and the Maryland State Lottery
access_to_capital_summary: The program has the potential to improve access to lottery subscriptions via online platforms, which could indirectly support small business vendors involved in voucher sales.

Title: Sales and Use Tax - Sales Between Cannabis Businesses and Cannabis Nurseries - Exemption
Synopsis: Expanding the exemption from the sales and use tax for certain cannabis sales to include sales between certain licensed cannabis businesses and registered cannabis nurseries.
bill_summary: The bill expands the sales and use tax exemption to include sales of cannabis between licensed cannabis businesses and registered cannabis nurseries in Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland Comptroller's Office
stakeholders: Cannabis businesses and registered cannabis nurseries in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's impact on access to capital is indirect, primarily affecting tax exemptions rather than direct financial support or capital access programs.

Title: Highways - Sidewalks and Bicycle Pathways - Construction and Reconstruction
Synopsis: Requiring the State Highway Administration to prioritize funding for the construction and reconstruction of sidewalks and bicycle pathways to sidewalks and bicycle pathways that are, or are adjacent to highways that are, subject to a complete streets policy or another similar Vision Zero program; requiring a local government to request certain funding from the Department of Transportation; and authorizing certain State funding for the construction or reconstruction of sidewalks or bicycle pathways.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland State Highway Administration to prioritize funding for constructing and reconstructing sidewalks and bicycle pathways, especially those adjacent to highways with complete streets policies or Vision Zero programs. It also details funding sharing arrangements between the state and local governments for these projects and mandates guidelines for implementation.
responsible_party: Maryland State Highway Administration
stakeholders: Local governments, pedestrians, cyclists, and residents in urban areas of Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill has a high potential to improve access to capital for sidewalk and bicycle pathway projects, especially in areas with Vision Zero or complete streets policies, by prioritizing funding and providing clear guidelines.

Title: Gaming - Slot Machines - Skills-Based Amusement Devices
Synopsis: Altering the definition of "slot machine" to provide that certain skills-based amusement devices excluded from the definition may award merchandise, tickets, tokens, or other objects that do not exceed a certain minimal value per play and may be accumulated and exchanged for noncash merchandise or prizes of value that is similar to the cumulated value of the objects exchanged, and does not exceed a minimal wholesale value of $599.
bill_summary: The bill amends Maryland law to redefine 'slot machine' to exclude certain skills-based amusement devices that award objects of minimal value, which can be accumulated and exchanged for merchandise or prizes of limited value.
responsible_party: Maryland State Lottery and Gaming Control Commission
stakeholders: Operators of skills-based amusement devices, players, and the general public in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's provisions are unlikely to have a significant direct impact on small business access to capital.

Title: Income Tax - Income Tax Reconciliation Program - Established (Maryland Fair Taxation for Justice-Involved Individuals Act)
Synopsis: Establishing the Income Tax Reconciliation Program in the State to allow certain justice-involved individuals to establish installment payment plans and receive a waiver of any interest and penalties that accrue for unpaid income tax due for a taxable year beginning after December 31, 2024, but before January 1, 2030; requiring the Comptroller to administer the Program; requiring the Comptroller, in collaboration with the Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services, to develop an awareness campaign about the Program; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Income Tax Reconciliation Program in Maryland, allowing justice-involved individuals to set up payment plans and receive waivers of interest and penalties on unpaid income taxes while incarcerated.
responsible_party: Maryland Comptroller's Office in collaboration with the Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services
stakeholders: Justice-involved individuals who are incarcerated or recently released, and the Maryland tax system
access_to_capital_summary: The program has a high potential to improve access to capital for justice-involved individuals by reducing tax-related financial burdens.

Title: Higher Education - Janet L. Hoffman Loan Assistance Repayment Program - Eligibility
Synopsis: Expanding the eligibility for the Janet L. Hoffman Loan Assistance Repayment Program to include individuals who received a certain degree from an accredited veterinary school and provided veterinary services in the State for not less than 5 years or provided volunteer veterinary services at certain animal shelters for 3 years and to include individuals who provided veterinary technician services for not less than 5 years or provided volunteer veterinary technician services at certain animal shelters over a 3-year period.
bill_summary: The bill expands the eligibility criteria for the Janet L. Hoffman Loan Assistance Repayment Program to include veterinary practitioners and veterinary technicians who have provided services for a certain period or volunteered at animal shelters, in addition to existing eligible professions.
responsible_party: Office of Student Financial Assistance
stakeholders: Veterinary practitioners, veterinary technicians, animal shelters, students with student loans in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill could potentially increase access to capital for veterinary professionals by reducing their student debt burden through loan repayment assistance.

Title: Task Force on the Creation of a Division of Returning Citizens and Expanded Reentry Services - Extension of Report Deadline and Task Force
Synopsis: Extending the deadline for the reporting requirement for the Task Force on the Creation of a Division of Returning Citizens and Expanded Reentry Services to be October 31, 2026; and extending the termination date for the Task Force to be June 30, 2027.
bill_summary: The bill extends the deadline for the Task Force on the Creation of a Division of Returning Citizens and Expanded Reentry Services to submit its report to October 31, 2026, and extends the task force's duration until June 30, 2027.
responsible_party: Maryland General Assembly (or the specific task force as designated)
stakeholders: Returning citizens, formerly incarcerated individuals, and the community involved in reentry services
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Wicomico County - Alcoholic Beverages - Temporary To-Go Event Permit and Class C Per Diem Municipal To-Go Beer, Wine, and Liquor License
Synopsis: Establishing a temporary to-go event permit in Wicomico County; authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Wicomico County to issue a temporary to-go event permit to a holder of a Class B beer, wine, and liquor license; establishing a Class C per diem municipal to-go beer, wine, and liquor license in the county; authorizing the Board to issue a Class C per diem municipal to-go beer, wine, and liquor license to a municipality in the county; requiring the Board to adopt certain regulations; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a temporary to-go event permit and a Class C per diem municipal to-go beer, wine, and liquor license in Wicomico County, allowing licensed establishments and municipalities to sell alcohol for carry-out at special events.
responsible_party: Wicomico County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Alcoholic beverage license holders, event organizers, and the public attending special events in Wicomico County
access_to_capital_summary: The program could facilitate alcohol sales at events, potentially increasing revenue for license holders and supporting small businesses involved in event services.

Title: Juvenile Services Education Board - Alterations
Synopsis: Authorizing the Secretary of Higher Education and the State Superintendent of Schools to select a designee to serve on the Juvenile Services Education Board; altering the terms of membership for the Board; and altering certain requirements for meetings of the Board.
bill_summary: This bill makes changes to the composition, meeting requirements, and terms of the Juvenile Services Education Board in Maryland, including allowing the Secretary of Higher Education and the State Superintendent of Schools to select designees and adjusting member terms.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Human Services
stakeholders: Juvenile education and juvenile justice populations in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Health Occupations - Licensed Direct-Entry Midwives - Disciplinary Actions
Synopsis: Clarifying that the State Board of Nursing may deny a license or grant a license, including a license subject to a reprimand, probation, or suspension, if an applicant for a license to practice direct-entry midwifery or a licensed direct-entry midwife violates a ground for discipline.
bill_summary: The bill clarifies the disciplinary actions that the Maryland State Board of Nursing can take against applicants and licensed direct-entry midwives who violate certain rules or laws, including grounds for denial, suspension, or revocation of licenses.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Nursing
stakeholders: Direct-entry midwives and their clients in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Maryland Medical Assistance Program and Health Insurance - Required Coverage for Calcium Score Testing
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Medical Assistance Program and insurers, nonprofit health service plans, health maintenance organizations, and managed care organizations to provide coverage in accordance with the most recent guidelines issued by the American College of Cardiology that expand the scope of preventive care services for the benefit of consumers; and applying the Act to all policies, contracts, and health benefit plans issued, delivered, or renewed in the State on or after January 1, 2026.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Medical Assistance Program and certain health insurance providers to cover calcium score testing for individuals with specific risk factors, starting January 1, 2026.
responsible_party: Maryland Medical Assistance Program and health insurance providers
stakeholders: Individuals with risk factors for heart disease in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: School Health and Wellness Personnel Assessment and Maryland Council on Advancement of School-Based Health Centers
Synopsis: Requiring the State Department of Education and the Maryland Department of Health jointly to conduct an assessment of school health and wellness personnel each year; altering the membership of the Maryland Council on Advancement of School-Based Health Centers; and requiring the Department and the State Department of Education to annually report to the General Assembly on the findings of the assessment beginning December 1, 2027, and publish the report on the website of each agency.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Education and the Maryland Department of Health to conduct an annual assessment of school health and wellness personnel, and it modifies the membership of the Maryland Council on the Advancement of SchoolโBased Health Centers to include a school nurse. It also establishes a new subtitle for the assessment of school health and wellness personnel.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Education and Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: School students, school health personnel, local school systems, local health departments, and stakeholders involved in school-based health services
access_to_capital_summary: The bill primarily focuses on assessment and policy, with no direct program providing capital access, so the impact on access to capital is minimal.

Title: Criminal Law - Dismembering or Burying Human Remains With Intent to Conceal a Crime
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person, with the intent to conceal a crime, from knowingly and willfully dismembering, destroying, removing, burying, disposing of, or obliterating by any means any portion of human remains; prohibiting a person from aiding or abetting another in committing a violation of the Act; and establishing that a violation of the Act is a felony with a penalty of imprisonment not exceeding 5 years.
bill_summary: This bill criminalizes acts committed with the intent to conceal the death of another person, including failing to notify authorities, dismembering, destroying, or disposing of human remains or a dead body, and aiding or abetting such acts. It establishes penalties for violations.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services (implied) or law enforcement agencies
stakeholders: Individuals involved in or affected by crimes related to concealment of death and human remains, including law enforcement and legal system
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Public Safety - Rape Kit Testing - Tracking Program and Grant Fund
Synopsis: Altering from December 31, 2025, to March 31,2026, the date by which a certain report under a certain sexual assault evidence collection kit tracking program is required to be submitted; altering the purpose and use of the Rape Kit Testing Grant Fund; expanding the duties of the Executive Director of the Governor's Office of Crime Prevention and Policy relating to the Fund; and prohibiting the use of the Fund for a certain sexual assault evidence collection kit tracking program.
bill_summary: This bill establishes a Rape Kit Testing Grant Fund to provide funding for testing sexual assault evidence collection kits, especially those collected before October 1, 2020, and to support victim notification and advocacy services. It also updates reporting deadlines for tracking the location and status of sexual assault kits.
responsible_party: Governorโs Office of Crime Prevention and Policy
stakeholders: Victims of sexual assault, law enforcement agencies, forensic laboratories, sexual assault victims' advocacy groups
access_to_capital_summary: The bill creates a dedicated grant fund to finance testing of sexual assault kits, which can significantly improve access to testing resources for law enforcement and forensic labs.

Title: Maryland Deaf Culture Digital Library - Funding and Budget Submission
Synopsis: Requiring the Governor to include in the annual budget bill an appropriation of $450,000 to the Maryland Deaf Culture Digital Library; and requiring the Deaf Culture Digital Library to submit its annual operating budget to the State Library Agency on or before June 1 each year.
bill_summary: The bill establishes funding and organizational requirements for the Maryland Deaf Culture Digital Library, including annual budget allocations, development of resources, partnerships, and advisory boards.
responsible_party: State Library Agency of Maryland
stakeholders: Deaf and hard of hearing individuals, library users, and organizations serving the deaf community in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The program aims to improve access to information and resources for deaf individuals, which could enhance their access to information and services.

Title: Child Support - Driver's License Suspension for Arrearages and Court Orders
Synopsis: Altering the circumstances under which the Child Support Administration may notify the Motor Vehicle Administration of an individual's child support arrearages for the purpose of suspending the individual's driver's license or privilege to drive; and requiring the court, after establishing a child support order, to send a copy of the guideline calculation and the order to the Child Support Administration.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the rules for suspending driver's licenses due to child support arrearages, including reducing the arrearage threshold from 60 to 120 days of nonpayment, requiring court notification of support calculations, and establishing procedures for investigation and reinstatement of licenses.
responsible_party: Child Support Administration of the Department of Human Services and the Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration
stakeholders: Parents with child support obligations, individuals with suspended licenses, and children receiving support
access_to_capital_summary: The bill primarily changes legal procedures and thresholds for license suspension related to child support, with no direct program to improve access to capital for small businesses.

Title: Garrett County Alcoholic Beverages Act of 2025
Synopsis: Establishing certain deluxe complex restaurant and resort complex beer and wine and beer, wine, and liquor licenses in Garrett County; requiring the Board of License Commissioners for Garrett County to hold a hearing for the issuance of certain festival licenses and altering certain notice requirements for the hearing; requiring certain festival license applicants to apply to the Board in a certain manner; clarifying the entities to which the Board may issue certain multiple day and multiple event licenses; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes new licensing options and regulations for alcoholic beverages in Garrett County, including complex resort licenses, festival licenses, and nonprofit organization licenses for events like beer, wine, and liquor festivals.
responsible_party: Maryland Alcoholic Beverages and Cannabis Board
stakeholders: Alcoholic beverage license applicants, festival organizers, nonprofit organizations, and consumers in Garrett County
access_to_capital_summary: The bill creates multiple new licensing categories and opportunities for alcohol-related events, which could facilitate access to capital for businesses and organizations involved in the alcohol and event industries.

Title: Tax Relief and State Personnel Equality for Service Members Act
Synopsis: Establishing rules of interpretation related to the uniformed services; altering the rule of interpretation for "veteran"; and altering the application of certain provisions of law governing personnel and taxation to apply to all uniformed services, rather than only the armed forces.
bill_summary: This bill expands and clarifies benefits, protections, and tax relief for veterans, active service members, and their families across Maryland, including property tax exemptions, reinstatement rights, and other support measures.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Veterans and Military Families
stakeholders: Veterans, active service members, military families, and disabled veterans in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill enhances access to benefits and protections that could indirectly improve small business owners' access to capital, but does not establish a direct program for capital access.

Title: Local Government - Development Impact Fees, Surcharges, and Excise Taxes - Reporting
Synopsis: Requiring county governments to make a certain report by July 1 each year to the Department of Planning on the amount, use, and location of the use of county development impact fees, surcharges, and excise taxes; and requiring county governments to make certain reports to the Department of Planning identifying certain local laws.
bill_summary: This bill requires Maryland county governments to report annually on the collection and use of development impact fees, surcharges, and excise taxes, including details on amounts collected, locations, and legal authorities, starting from October 1, 2025.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Planning
stakeholders: County governments, developers, and residents in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's focus on reporting and transparency does not directly impact small business owners' access to capital.

Title: General Provisions - Veterans Benefits - Honorable Discharge
Synopsis: Defining "honorable discharge" with respect to any State program of benefits, rights, or privileges applicable to a veteran to include certain discharges.
bill_summary: The bill defines 'honorable discharge' for veterans to include discharges that are less than honorable under certain conditions related to sexual orientation, gender identity, PTSD, traumatic brain injury, or sexual trauma, and allows for discharge upgrades based on these criteria.
responsible_party: Department of Veterans and Military Families
stakeholders: Veterans in Maryland who have been discharged under less than honorable conditions due to specific circumstances
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: County Boards of Education - Special Education Service Delivery Models - Publication Requirement
Synopsis: Requiring each county board of education to publish on its website a certain list of special education service delivery models provided for parentally-placed private school students; and defining "parentally-placed private school student" as a child with a disability enrolled by the parent or guardian of the child in a private elementary or secondary school or facility, including a religious school or facility.
bill_summary: This bill requires Maryland county boards of education to publish on their websites a list of all special education service delivery models and services provided to parentally-placed private school students, and to clearly state that placement decisions are made by an individualized education program team in consultation with parents, in accordance with federal law.
responsible_party: Maryland county boards of education
stakeholders: Students with disabilities, parents of students with disabilities, private schools, local education agencies
access_to_capital_summary: The bill primarily focuses on transparency and information dissemination regarding special education services, with no direct impact on access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Higher Education - Maryland Graduate and Professional Scholarship Program - Eligible Institutions
Synopsis: Expanding eligibility under the Maryland Graduate and Professional Scholarship Program to include certain students attending the Meritus School of Osteopathic Medicine.
bill_summary: The bill expands eligibility for the Maryland Graduate and Professional Scholarship Program to include students attending certain institutions in the state, providing financial aid for students in fields like medicine, law, dentistry, pharmacy, nursing, social work, and veterinary medicine.
responsible_party: Maryland Higher Education Commission
stakeholders: Graduate and professional students in Maryland, especially those attending eligible institutions in the state
access_to_capital_summary: The bill potentially increases access to financial aid for graduate and professional students, which can improve their ability to access capital for education-related expenses.

Title: Vehicle Laws - Licenses, Identification Cards, and Moped Operator's Permits - Notation of Nonapparent Disability (Eric's ID Law)
Synopsis: Requiring that an original and renewal application for a license, an identification card, or a moped operator's permit allow an applicant to choose to indicate on the document the applicant's nonapparent disability; requiring the Motor Vehicle Administration to ensure that a certain license, identification card, or moped operator's permit include a notation of a nonapparent disability; requiring the immediate implementation of training for law enforcement concerning interactions with persons with nonapparent disabilities; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration to allow applicants for driver's licenses, ID cards, and moped permits to indicate if they have a nonapparent disability, such as developmental or intellectual disabilities. It mandates that the Administration include a notation of this disability on the document if indicated, and establishes procedures for removal and public outreach.
responsible_party: Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration
stakeholders: Individuals with nonapparent disabilities applying for or holding driver's licenses, ID cards, and moped permits in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Harford County - Alcoholic Beverages - Multiple Licenses - Golf Simulator Facilities
Synopsis: Authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Harford County to issue a Class GSF (golf simulator facility) license to a holder of a Class B license; and clarifying that the Class GSF (golf simulator facility) license counts toward the maximum number of nine Class B alcoholic beverages licenses a holder may be issued.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Harford County to issue a special license for golf simulator facilities, which counts towards the total number of alcohol licenses a holder can have.
responsible_party: Board of License Commissioners for Harford County
stakeholders: Alcohol license holders and golf simulator facility operators in Harford County
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Harford County - Alcoholic Beverages - Performing Arts Nonprofit Organization License - Record-Keeping Requirements
Synopsis: Repealing certain incorrect references to the Comptroller of Maryland in certain provisions of law requiring the holder of a performing arts nonprofit organization license in Harford County to comply with certain record-keeping and reporting requirements; repealing the authority of the Comptroller to suspend the license of a license holder without a hearing under certain circumstances; and authorizing, rather than requiring, the Board to summon a license holder for a hearing and impose a fine under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill amends record-keeping and enforcement procedures for performing arts nonprofit organization alcohol licenses in Harford County, including repealing certain references to the Maryland Comptroller and changing suspension and hearing procedures.
responsible_party: Harford County Board of Alcoholic Beverages
stakeholders: Performing arts nonprofit organizations in Harford County and their patrons
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Harford County - Alcoholic Beverages - Alteration of License Quota
Synopsis: Altering the quota used to determine the maximum number of certain alcoholic beverages licenses that the Board of License Commissioners for Harford County may issue from every 4,000 to every 4,750 individuals in the county.
bill_summary: This bill alters the quota for the maximum number of certain alcoholic beverage licenses that the Harford County Board of License Commissioners can issue, based on the county's population, and specifies the conditions under which new licenses can be issued if the quota is exceeded.
responsible_party: Harford County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Alcoholic beverage license applicants and businesses in Harford County
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Housing and Community Development - Statewide Rental Assistance Voucher Program Eligibility - Alterations
Synopsis: Including the Department of Housing and Community Development in the definition of "public housing agency" for the purposes of the Statewide Rental Assistance Voucher Program; authorizing a public housing agency to administer the Program in accordance with a local administrative plan; authorizing the Department to project-base up to 100% of its authorized voucher units; altering the manner in which the Department and each public housing agency shall prioritize vouchers and housing assistance payments for certain families; etc.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the Maryland Statewide Rental Assistance Voucher Program by including the Department of Housing and Community Development as a public housing agency, allowing it to administer vouchers, project-base vouchers, and prioritize certain families for assistance. It also updates income payment expectations, inspection schedules, and funding allocations for the program.
responsible_party: Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Low-income households, families with children, foster children, military veterans, homeless individuals, disabled individuals, elderly individuals in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's focus on rental assistance vouchers and funding allocations has the potential to improve access to capital for small landlords and property owners by increasing available rental assistance and streamlining program administration.

Title: Natural Resources - Public Lands - Acquisition, Staffing, Operations, and Funding
Synopsis: Altering provisions of law regarding the acquisition of real property by the Department of Natural Resources; establishing a Land and Property Management Program in the Department to process certain  transactions; authorizing the Department and the Natural Resources Police to establish affiliated foundations; authorizing the Governor to transfer certain Program Open Space funds to the Department under certain circumstances; altering and repealing certain provisions of law regarding the use of Program Open Space local funding; etc.
bill_summary: This bill establishes a Land and Property Management Program within the Maryland Department of Natural Resources, creates affiliated foundations to support land management and recreational activities, and makes various changes to laws regarding public lands, real property acquisition, and funding for land preservation and recreation.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Public land users, conservation organizations, local governments, and Maryland residents interested in parks and natural resources
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's creation of affiliated foundations and land management programs has the potential to increase access to capital for land and recreational projects, but the direct impact on small business access to capital is limited.

Title: Maryland Health Insurance Coverage Protection Commission - Established
Synopsis: Establishing the Maryland Health Insurance Coverage Protection Commission to monitor and assess the impact of potential and actual federal changes to specified health care programs and to provide recommendations for State and local action to protect the access of residents of the State to affordable health coverage; and requiring the Commission to submit a report of its findings and recommendations, including any legislative proposals, to the Governor and the General Assembly by December 31 each year.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland Health Insurance Coverage Protection Commission to monitor and assess the impact of federal changes to health care programs like the ACA, Medicaid, and Medicare, and to recommend actions to protect residents' access to affordable health coverage.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health, Maryland Insurance Administration, and Department of Legislative Services
stakeholders: Maryland residents, especially those at risk of losing health coverage due to federal policy changes
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's focus is on monitoring and policy recommendations rather than direct financial programs, so its impact on small business access to capital is minimal.

Title: Natural Resources - State Boat Act - Alterations
Synopsis: Repealing certain advertising and public hearing requirements for proposed regulations implementing the State Boat Act; increasing certain funding thresholds for certain projects financed by the Waterway Improvement Fund; and altering the fees for manufacturer and dealer licenses, certificates of number, Maryland use stickers, and the issuance of certificates of title, transfer of title, or duplicate or corrected certificates of title.
bill_summary: This bill updates Maryland's State Boat Act by redefining 'personal watercraft' and 'personal flotation device', repealing certain vessel classifications and advertising requirements, increasing funding thresholds for waterway projects, adjusting licensing fees, establishing a nonmotorized vessel decal, and modifying safety regulations including child flotation device requirements.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Vessel owners, boaters, waterway users, and the general public in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Natural Resources - Repeal of Somers Cove Marina Commission and Improvement Fund and Alteration of Operations
Synopsis: Repealing provisions of law relating to the Somers Cove Marina Commission, the Somers Cove Marina Improvement Fund, and the operation of Somers Cove Marina; requiring the Secretary to develop a master plan for the operation and improvement of services at Somers Cove Marina by October 1, 2027; requiring all revenue received by the Department from activities associated with Somers Cove Marina be deposited in the Natural Resources Property Maintenance Fund; establishing the Somers Cove Marina Advisory Commission; etc.
bill_summary: The bill repeals the Somers Cove Marina Commission and its Improvement Fund, transfers management responsibilities to the Department of Natural Resources, and establishes new advisory commissions and funds to oversee and operate the marina.
responsible_party: Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Marina users, local government, boating community, fishing industry, tourism industry, and residents of Somerset County and Crisfield
access_to_capital_summary: The bill creates a structured management and funding framework for the marina, which could facilitate access to capital through grants, fees, and revenue from operations.

Title: Maryland Department of Health - Report on Oversight of Substance Use Disorder Treatment Programs and Recovery Residences
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Health to submit reports on or before December 1, 2025, and December 1, 2026, to the Senate Finance Committee, the Senate Budget and Taxation Committee, the House Health and Government Operations Committee, and the House Appropriations Committee on the oversight of substance use disorder treatment programs and recovery residences.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Health to submit reports in 2025 and 2026 on the oversight and regulation of substance use disorder treatment programs and recovery residences, including improvements to oversight procedures and preventing adverse events.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Individuals undergoing substance use disorder treatment and recovery residences in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Health Occupations - Authorization to Practice for Former Federal Employees and Dental Applicants Licensed or Certified in Another State
Synopsis: Requiring the State Board of Dental Examiners to issue a license or certification to certain applicants licensed or certified by another state within 15 business days after receiving the completed application; requiring the Maryland Department of Health to develop a plan for a temporary or permanent authorization to practice a health occupation in the State for certain individuals who left employment with a federal agency after January 20, 2025; requiring the Department to submit the plan by October 1, 2025 to certain committees; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Board of Dental Examiners to issue licenses and certifications to qualified applicants licensed or certified in other states, establishes procedures for licensing dental professionals and dental radiation technologists, and directs the Maryland Department of Health to develop a plan for temporary or permanent practice authorization for individuals who left federal employment after January 20, 2025.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and Maryland Board of Dental Examiners
stakeholders: Dental professionals, dental radiation technologists, and individuals who left federal employment after January 20, 2025
access_to_capital_summary: The bill primarily focuses on licensing and certification procedures, not on direct access to capital for small businesses.

Title: Opioid Restitution Fund - Authorized Uses
Synopsis: Altering the allowable uses of the Opioid Restitution Fund to provide funds for the operating expenses and personnel costs for investigations, enforcement actions, and other activities conducted by the Opioids Enforcement Unit within the Office of the Attorney General that are related to the recovery of funds from opioid-related judgments or settlements; and requiring, beginning October 1, 2025, the Office of the Attorney General to report annually to the General Assembly on the status of activity of the Opioids Enforcement Unit.
bill_summary: The bill alters the uses of the Opioid Restitution Fund to include funding for operating expenses and personnel costs for investigations, enforcement actions, and activities by the Opioids Enforcement Unit within the Office of the Attorney General related to recovering funds from opioid-related judgments and settlements.
responsible_party: Office of the Attorney General
stakeholders: Individuals affected by opioid use disorder, law enforcement, public health agencies, and community organizations involved in opioid recovery and enforcement
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's focus on enforcement and investigation activities may indirectly impact access to capital for small businesses, but it primarily funds enforcement and investigative operations.

Title: Public Health - Use of Opioid Restitution Fund and Training Under the Overdose Response Program
Synopsis: Altering the training that the Maryland Department of Health is authorized to provide under the Overdose Response Program to include emphasis on the restoration of breathing, avoiding withdrawal, and compassionate postoverdose support and care; clarifying that the use of the Opioid Restitution Fund is subject to certain restrictions; and altering the authorized uses of the Opioid Restitution Fund so as to include the addressing of racial disparities in access to prevention, harm reduction, treatment, and recovery support services.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the use of the Opioid Restitution Fund and the training provided under the Overdose Response Program by clarifying restrictions, expanding authorized uses, and supporting various substance use disorder prevention, treatment, and recovery initiatives.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Individuals with substance use disorders, healthcare providers, community organizations, and populations impacted by opioid misuse and overdose
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's focus on funding programs for substance use disorder prevention, treatment, and recovery suggests a high potential for impacting access to capital for small businesses involved in these areas.

Title: Wildlife - Protections and Highway Crossings
Synopsis: Establishing the Maryland Connectivity Coalition to foster collaboration among State and federal agencies, nongovernmental organizations, and other stakeholders for the purpose of protecting endangered wildlife from habitat fragmentation; requiring the State Highway Administration to have final decision-making authority regarding decisions related to placement, funding, or design of wildlife crossings; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland Connectivity Coalition and the Wildlife Connectivity Fund to promote wildlife habitat connectivity and reduce vehicle-wildlife collisions through projects like wildlife crossings. It also requires agencies to consider wildlife movement in planning and provides for public education and donation options.
responsible_party: Department of Natural Resources and Maryland State Highway Administration
stakeholders: Wildlife, motorists, local governments, environmental organizations, and the general public
access_to_capital_summary: The bill creates a dedicated fund and promotes projects that could improve access to wildlife crossing infrastructure, potentially facilitating small business involvement in related construction and engineering services.

Title: Department of Information Technology - Major Information Technology Development Projects - Oversight
Synopsis: Providing that a unit of State government may not purchase, lease, contract for, or rent an information technology service or product unless consistent with the master plan, as determined by the Secretary of Information Technology; providing that the Secretary is responsible for overseeing the implementation of major information technology projects in the State; establishing the Maryland Office of Digital Experience in the Department to provide oversight, leadership, and strategic modernization for major technology projects; etc.
bill_summary: This bill establishes the Maryland Office of Digital Experience to oversee, modernize, and improve major information technology projects within the Maryland state government. It creates new standards, reporting requirements, and oversight mechanisms for IT projects, and sets up a Digital Service Unit to enhance digital services for residents.
responsible_party: Maryland Office of Digital Experience and Department of Information Technology
stakeholders: State government agencies, residents of Maryland, small and minority business vendors involved in state IT projects
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's focus on oversight, standardization, and modernization of IT projects can improve efficiency and reduce costs, potentially increasing access to capital for small businesses involved in state projects.

Title: Motor Vehicles - Reckless, Negligent, and Aggressive Driving (Sergeant Patrick Kepp Act)
Synopsis: Altering the penalties and points assessments related to the offenses of reckless, negligent, and aggressive driving; and adding certain motor vehicle offenses as elements that may contribute to charges for reckless or aggressive driving.
bill_summary: This bill modifies penalties and points assessments for reckless, negligent, and aggressive driving in Maryland. It also adds certain motor vehicle offenses as factors that can contribute to charges of reckless or aggressive driving.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation or relevant Maryland State agency responsible for traffic enforcement and vehicle laws
stakeholders: Motor vehicle drivers and the general public in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: State Board of Professional Counselors and Therapists - Behavior Analysts - Licensure Applications
Synopsis: Requiring the State Board of Professional Counselors and Therapists to issue a license to practice behavior analysis to qualified applicants within 30 days of receiving the completed application; requiring the State Board to issue a license within 50 days to an applicant who submitted an incomplete application but has presented additional information; and requiring the State Board to provide a certain e-mail notification regarding the status of an application for a license to practice behavior analysis.
bill_summary: This bill requires the Maryland State Board of Professional Counselors and Therapists to issue licenses for behavior analysts within specified timeframes, and to notify applicants via email about the status of their applications.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Professional Counselors and Therapists
stakeholders: Applicants for behavior analyst licensure in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Baltimore County - Alcoholic Beverages Licenses - Transfers
Synopsis: Authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Baltimore County to approve the transfer of a Class B or Class D license existing on a certain date that is located in an eligible transferor district to another election district under certain circumstances; and limiting the number of license transfers that the Board may approve from an eligible transferor district.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes the Baltimore County Board of License Commissioners to approve the transfer of certain Class B or D alcohol licenses between election districts under specific conditions, limits the number of such transfers, and establishes rules for assessing the economic impact of transfers.
responsible_party: Baltimore County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Alcohol license holders, local communities, and businesses in Baltimore County
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's focus on license transfers and economic impact assessments may influence the local business environment, but it does not directly create a program to improve access to capital for small businesses.

Title: Washington County - Public Safety - Buildings Used for Agritourism
Synopsis: Adding Washington County to the list of counties that exempt agricultural buildings used for agritourism from certain building performance standards and where an existing agricultural building used for agritourism is not considered a change of occupancy that requires a building permit under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill exempts agricultural buildings used for agritourism in Washington County from certain building standards and simplifies the process for existing agricultural buildings to be used for agritourism without requiring a building permit, under specific conditions.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety or local building authorities
stakeholders: Farmers, agritourism operators, local communities in Washington County
access_to_capital_summary: The bill potentially lowers barriers for farmers and agritourism operators to develop or expand agritourism activities, which could improve their access to capital by reducing compliance costs.

Title: Washington County - Property Tax Credit - Economic Development Projects
Synopsis: Altering eligibility requirements for a certain property tax credit for certain business entities that invest a certain amount in certain real property in Washington County and create a certain number of new and permanent full-time jobs in the county; and altering the amount and duration of the property tax credit.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the property tax credit program in Washington County to incentivize business investments and job creation through increased investment thresholds, expanded eligibility, and extended tax credit durations.
responsible_party: Washington County government
stakeholders: Business entities investing and creating jobs in Washington County
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's focus on property tax credits for business investments and job creation could indirectly influence access to capital, but it does not directly provide capital or financing.

Title: Harford County - Alcoholic Beverages - Hearing Notice
Synopsis: Altering certain notice requirements before the Board of License Commissioners for Harford County may hold public hearings on proposed regulatory changes or license applications; and providing that the Board may publish a decision on certain license applications either in certain newspapers or on its website.
bill_summary: The bill modifies notice and publication requirements for alcohol license applications and regulatory hearings in Harford County, allowing notices to be published either in newspapers or on the county's website, and updates procedures for license application notices and decisions.
responsible_party: Harford County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Alcohol license applicants, license holders, and residents of Harford County
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Common Ownership Communities - Recreational Common Areas - Sensitive Information as Condition for Access
Synopsis: Prohibiting a cooperative housing corporation, condominium association, or homeowners association from requiring certain sensitive information of certain individuals as a condition for access to a recreational common area; and defining "sensitive information" as an individual's Social Security card or Social Security number, Individual Taxpayer Identification Number, birth certificate, racial or ethnic origin, national origin, citizenship or immigration status,  religious or philosophical beliefs, or medical records.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits cooperative housing corporations, condominiums, and homeowners associations from requiring residents or their guests to provide sensitive personal information as a condition for accessing recreational common areas.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development or relevant local housing authorities
stakeholders: Residents of cooperative housing, condominiums, and homeowners associations, including their guests and children
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Professional and Volunteer Firefighter Innovative Cancer Screening Technologies Program - Funding
Synopsis: Altering the amount the Governor is authorized to include in the annual budget for the Program from $500,000 to at least $1,000,000; and authorizing the Secretary to use up to 20% of Program funds to support research centers, including the University of Maryland Institute for Health Computing, in the collection, analysis, and processing of Program outcome data for the purposes of assessing, maximizing, and improving the effectiveness and clinical utility of the cancer screening funded by the Program.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a funding program for innovative cancer screening technologies specifically for professional and volunteer firefighters, funded through a fee on oil transfers in Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Firefighters, cancer screening researchers, academic medical centers in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The program's funding and support for medical research centers could improve access to advanced cancer screening technologies for firefighters, potentially increasing their access to early detection and treatment.

Title: Maryland Uniform Disposition of Abandoned Property Act - Revisions
Synopsis: Making certain virtual currency subject to the abandoned property laws in the State; establishing certain provisions to determine certain information about certain apparent owners of abandoned property; altering and establishing certain provisions pertaining to the presumption of abandonment for certain types of property; establishing certain procedures to establish the death of a certain insured or certain annuitant; altering from $100 to $50 the value at which the Comptroller is required to publish a certain notice; etc.
bill_summary: This bill revises Maryland's laws on unclaimed property, including virtual currency, and updates procedures for handling abandoned property, claims, and the responsibilities of the State Comptroller.
responsible_party: Maryland Office of the Comptroller
stakeholders: Owners of unclaimed property, including virtual currency holders, and financial institutions in Maryland.
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's impact on access to capital is minimal as it mainly updates legal procedures and definitions related to unclaimed property.

Title: Hospitals - Medical Debt Collection - Sale of Patient Debt
Synopsis: Authorizing a hospital, under certain circumstances, to sell the medical debt of patients if the debt is sold to a governmental unit or an entity that is under contract with the unit or a nonprofit organization for the purpose of canceling the debt; requiring that a hospital's financial policy require the hospital to dismiss actions pending against a patient for the collection of debt that was sold and prohibit the hospital from engaging in specified collection activities; etc.
bill_summary: This bill regulates hospital debt collection practices in Maryland, including restrictions on selling patient debt, requirements for hospitals to report on debt collection, and procedures for debt cancellation and patient notification.
responsible_party: Maryland Health โ General (the Maryland Department of Health)
stakeholders: Hospital patients, especially those with medical debt or seeking free or reduced-cost care in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's restrictions on debt selling and collection activities could limit the ability of small business owners (such as debt collectors or financial institutions) to access certain types of medical debt, potentially reducing available capital from this source.

Title: Real Property - Landlord and Tenant - Procedures for Failure to Pay Rent, Breach of Lease, and Tenant Holding Over
Synopsis: Requiring a landlord to provide certain notice to a tenant when a court has issued a warrant of restitution for a failure of a tenant to pay rent, a breach of lease, or a tenant holding over under certain circumstances; establishing certain procedures and requirements for the execution of a warrant for repossession; establishing that the Act does not restrict the authority of the State or a local jurisdiction to enact or enforce certain legislation; applying the Act prospectively; etc.
bill_summary: This bill establishes new procedures and requirements for landlords and courts regarding eviction processes, including notice requirements, execution of warrants for repossession, and handling of tenants' personal property after eviction.
responsible_party: Maryland District Courts and local law enforcement agencies
stakeholders: Tenants and landlords in Maryland, especially those involved in eviction proceedings
access_to_capital_summary: The bill primarily changes eviction procedures and property handling, with no direct impact on small business access to capital.

Title: Higher Education - Hunger-Free Campus Grant Program - Alterations
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Higher Education Commission to designate certain private institutions of higher education as hunger-free campuses; and prohibiting certain private institutions of higher education from being eligible to receive grant funding under the Hunger-Free Campus Grant Program.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the HungerโFree Campus Grant Program to designate certain higher education campuses as hungerโfree, provide funding for initiatives to address student food insecurity, and require reporting on the program's impact.
responsible_party: Maryland Higher Education Commission
stakeholders: Students at higher education institutions facing food insecurity
access_to_capital_summary: The program has a high potential to improve access to capital for initiatives supporting food-insecure students through grants and seed funding.

Title: Correctional Services - Death of Incarcerated Individual - Notification
Synopsis: Requiring the Commissioner of Correction to notify certain elected representatives whenever an incarcerated individual dies in a Division of Correction facility; and requiring the Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services to adopt certain regulations compliant with the federal Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act.
bill_summary: This bill requires the Maryland Department of Correction to notify certain officials and representatives when an incarcerated individual dies in custody, including the cause of death and ensuring compliance with privacy laws.
responsible_party: Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services
stakeholders: Incarcerated individuals, their families, correctional facility staff, and government officials
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Maryland Medical Practice Act and Maryland Physician Assistants Act - Revisions
Synopsis: Repealing obsolete and redundant language in, clarifying language in, and making language consistent across certain provisions of law governing the State Board of Physicians and the regulation of physicians, physician assistants, and allied health professionals; altering certain licensure requirements; altering the grounds for discipline for physicians, physician assistants, and allied health professionals; authorizing the Board to impose a civil penalty for a certain report made in bad faith; etc.
bill_summary: This bill updates and clarifies regulations governing physicians, physician assistants, and allied health professionals in Maryland, including licensure, disciplinary procedures, reporting requirements, and program structures.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Physicians
stakeholders: Physicians, physician assistants, allied health professionals, and the public in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill mainly changes regulatory and disciplinary procedures and does not establish a distinct service or intervention for public access to capital.

Title: Study on Detecting Deadly Weapons in Public Middle and High Schools
