Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Center for School Safety to study how best to detect deadly weapons in public middle and high schools and how best to rapidly report the detection of weapons to a law enforcement agency; requiring the Center to request any available assessment technologies evaluated under the Act; and requiring the Center to issue an interim report by December 1, 2025, and a final report on the findings of the study, in a manner that does not jeopardize school safety, by December 1, 2026, to
bill_summary: This bill requires the Maryland Center for School Safety to study how to detect deadly weapons in public middle and high schools and how to improve reporting of such weapons to law enforcement. It includes evaluating current security measures, exploring new technologies like AI and metal detectors, and assessing the use of security cameras.
responsible_party: Maryland Center for School Safety
stakeholders: Public middle and high school students, school staff, law enforcement agencies, and school administrators
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's focus is on evaluating and improving security measures and technologies, which could impact access to capital for security vendors and technology providers, but it does not directly establish a new program or fund.

Title: Health Occupations - Implicit Bias and Structural Racism Training
Synopsis: Requiring applicants for renewal of certain licenses and certain certificates issued by certain health occupation boards to attest that the applicant completed an implicit bias and structural racism training program, rather than an implicit bias training program, approved by the Cultural and Linguistic Health Care Professional Competency Program; authorizing certain health occupations boards to adopt regulations allowing applicants renewing licenses to receive continuing education credits for completing certain training; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires health care professionals in Maryland to complete implicit bias and structural racism training for license renewal, with the program being approved by the Cultural and Linguistic Health Care Professional Competency Program. It establishes the program, sets the timeline for implementation, and authorizes regulations for continuing education credits.
responsible_party: Cultural and Linguistic Health Care Professional Competency Program and health occupations boards
stakeholders: Health care professionals and patients in Maryland, especially from diverse and marginalized communities
access_to_capital_summary: The bill primarily focuses on training health care professionals and does not directly impact access to capital for small businesses.

Title: Baltimore City - Alcoholic Beverages Licenses - Alterations
Synopsis: Authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Baltimore City to provide a certain waiver from certain requirements for a restaurant within a certain bounded area in the 46th alcoholic beverages district; expanding the class of license to which a certain requirement for a memorandum of understanding applies to include any alcoholic beverages license in Baltimore City; providing an exception to a certain prohibition against the Board allowing a certain license transfer under certain circumstances; etc.
bill_summary: The bill makes various changes to alcohol licensing laws in Baltimore City, including allowing waivers, expanding license types, requiring memoranda of understanding with community associations, extending license expiration dates for transfers, and setting rules for license transfers and conversions.
responsible_party: Baltimore City Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Alcohol licensees, Baltimore City residents, community associations, small business owners in Baltimore City
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's provisions mainly relate to licensing rules and do not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Common Ownership Communities and Zoning Authorities - Operation of Family Child Care Homes - Limitations
Synopsis: Prohibiting a provision in certain documents of certain cooperative housing corporations from prohibiting or restricting the establishment or operation of certain family child care homes; prohibiting a provision in certain documents of certain cooperative housing corporations from limiting the number of children for which certain family child care homes provide family child care below the number authorized by the State Department of Education; etc.
bill_summary: This bill prohibits certain restrictions and limitations on the operation of family child care homes within common ownership communities, condominiums, and local jurisdictions in Maryland. It ensures that such homes cannot be restricted below state-authorized capacity, and it limits the ability of associations and local laws to prohibit or restrict family child care operations.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Education and local government agencies
stakeholders: Family child care providers, families using child care, residents of common ownership communities, local jurisdictions
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's provisions primarily focus on restrictions and legal protections for family child care homes, and do not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Appellate Court of Maryland - Sessions at Educational Institutions
Synopsis: Authorizing the Appellate Court of Maryland, in conjunction with the administrations of secondary and postsecondary educational institutions in the State, to hold sessions at certain secondary and postsecondary educational institutions in the State.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes the Appellate Court of Maryland to hold sessions at secondary and postsecondary educational institutions in the state, in addition to its usual location in Annapolis.
responsible_party: Appellate Court of Maryland
stakeholders: Students, educational institutions, legal community in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Courts - State Reporter - Publication of Cases
Synopsis: Repealing a requirement that the State Reporter secure copyright for the State of published reports of opinions of the Supreme Court of Maryland and the Appellate Court of Maryland.
bill_summary: The bill repeals the requirement that the Maryland State Reporter secure copyright for published reports of opinions of the Supreme Court and Appellate Court of Maryland, and clarifies the responsibilities of the State Reporter in preparing and publishing case reports.
responsible_party: Supreme Court of Maryland
stakeholders: Legal professionals, courts, and the public interested in Maryland case law
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Judiciary Department - Commission on Judicial Disabilities - Temporary Appointment
Synopsis: Allowing the chair of the Commission on Judicial Disabilities to appoint a former member to temporarily fill a certain vacancy on the Commission; allowing the Governor, upon certain request of the chair, to appoint a temporary substitute member or extend the term of an existing member of the Commission; and requiring that any temporary substitute is subject to the same qualifications applicable to the member the substitute is replacing and if the member is a judge or an attorney, must be a member in good standing of the Maryland bar.
bill_summary: This bill proposes a constitutional amendment to allow the chair of the Commission on Judicial Disabilities to appoint a temporary member or extend a memberโs term, particularly in cases of vacancies or recusals, and to permit the Governor to make such appointments upon request.
responsible_party: Maryland General Assembly and the Governor of Maryland
stakeholders: Judges, legal professionals, and the public involved with the judiciary in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Property Tax - Payment Plans - Notice to Taxpayers
Synopsis: Requiring the State Tax Sale Ombudsman to include certain information concerning a certain State installment payment program for property taxes on the Ombudsman's website; requiring the Ombudsman to contract with a vendor to operate an installment payment program for payment of taxes in which any homeowner may enroll; requiring a collector of taxes to include certain information concerning a certain State or local installment payment program for property taxes in a separate insert included with each property tax bill; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department and local tax collectors to provide information about installment payment programs for property taxes to taxpayers through websites, notices, and property tax bills. It establishes a State Tax Sale Ombudsman to assist homeowners and provide resources to help them pay delinquent taxes and avoid tax sales.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation and local tax collectors
stakeholders: Homeowners with delinquent or overdue property taxes in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill has a high potential to improve access to capital for small business owners and homeowners by providing information and assistance on installment payment plans and related programs.

Title: Somerset County - Property Tax - Emergency Services Tax
Synopsis: Authorizing the County Commissioners of Somerset County to impose an emergency services tax on all property subject to the county property tax to pay costs of emergency services; and prohibiting the county commissioners from initially imposing or subsequently increasing an emergency services tax until after a public hearing is held.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Somerset County to impose an emergency services property tax to fund fire, rescue, and emergency medical services, with rules for public hearings and collection procedures.
responsible_party: Somerset County Commissioners
stakeholders: Property owners and residents of Somerset County who benefit from emergency services
access_to_capital_summary: The program could improve funding for emergency services, potentially enhancing their capacity to serve the community, but it does not directly impact small business access to capital.

Title: University System of Maryland - Academic Facilities Bonding Authority
Synopsis: Approving certain projects for the acquisition, development, and improvement of certain academic facilities for the University System of Maryland; authorizing the issuance of bonds by the University System of Maryland in a total principal amount of $25,000,000 for financing the projects; and providing that the bonds issued under the authority of the Act are not a debt or obligation of the State or any of its subdivisions.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the University System of Maryland to issue bonds totaling $30,000,000 to finance projects for academic facilities, including campus-wide improvements at the University of Maryland, College Park, and renewal projects for existing facilities.
responsible_party: University System of Maryland
stakeholders: Students, faculty, and staff of the University System of Maryland, and the broader Maryland community benefiting from improved academic facilities.
access_to_capital_summary: The bill provides a direct financial mechanism (bond issuance) for funding academic facility projects, which can significantly impact the availability of capital for university infrastructure development.

Title: Federal Public Service Loan Forgiveness Program - Employee Certification and Awareness Materials
Synopsis: Establishing requirements related to the certification of employment by public service employers under the federal Public Service Loan Forgiveness Program, including requirements regarding determinations of whether employees are full-time; and requiring the Student Loan Ombudsman in the Office of the Commissioner of Financial Regulation to develop and disseminate information to increase awareness of and participation in the Program.
bill_summary: The bill establishes requirements for public service employers in Maryland to certify employment for employees participating in the federal Public Service Loan Forgiveness Program. It also mandates the development and dissemination of informational materials to increase awareness and participation in the program, and designates the Student Loan Ombudsman to oversee these efforts.
responsible_party: Office of the Commissioner of Financial Regulation and the Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: Public service employees in Maryland, including government and nonprofit workers, and student loan borrowers
access_to_capital_summary: The program has a high potential to improve access to capital for small business owners who are public service employees by facilitating loan forgiveness.

Title: Real Property โ Filing Fee for Residential Mortgage Foreclosure โ Increase
Synopsis: Increasing the filing fee required to accompany an order to docket or a complaint to foreclose a mortgage or deed of trust on residential property from $300 to $450.
bill_summary: This bill increases the filing fee for residential mortgage foreclosure cases from $300 to $450, effective October 1, 2025.
responsible_party: Maryland Judiciary or the Office of Administrative Hearings
stakeholders: Homeowners facing foreclosure, mortgage lenders, mortgage originators, and legal professionals involved in foreclosure proceedings
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's impact on access to capital is minimal as it primarily involves an increase in filing fees for foreclosure cases.

Title: Opioid Restitution Fund - Interactive Dashboard
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Office of Overdose Response, in collaboration with the Maryland Department of Health, to develop and maintain an interactive dashboard on Opioid Restitution Fund spending to share prescription opioid-related settlement information with the public; requiring the dashboard to include links to the State, county, or municipal websites that provide access to additional information on the use of opioid-related settlement funds; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Office of Overdose Response, in collaboration with the Maryland Department of Health, to develop and maintain an interactive dashboard that displays information on the spending of the Opioid Restitution Fund, including settlement payments, past spending, and funded initiatives, with links to additional resources.
responsible_party: Maryland Office of Overdose Response and Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Public, local governments, and organizations involved in opioid settlement funds
access_to_capital_summary: The program primarily provides transparency and information about fund allocation rather than direct financial support or capital access for small businesses.

Title: Economic Development - Maryland Innovation Initiative Institution Partnership Extension Program - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Maryland Innovation Initiative Institution Partnership Extension Program to expand opportunities for technology validation, entrepreneurial development, and industry engagement at eligible institutions; establishing eligibility criteria for project proposals to receive funding under the Program; authorizing the Governor to include an appropriation of $250,000 in the annual budget bill for fiscal years 2027 and 2028 for the Program; and altering the purpose and contents of the Maryland Innovation Initiative Fund.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland Innovation Initiative Partnership Extension Program to support technology validation, entrepreneurial development, and industry engagement at eligible universities and institutions of higher education in Maryland. It provides funding, sets eligibility criteria, and requires contributions from participating institutions.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Economic Development (or equivalent agency responsible for economic development and innovation programs)
stakeholders: Eligible universities, private nonprofit institutions of higher education, industry partners, and the broader Maryland economy.
access_to_capital_summary: The program aims to foster industry partnerships and support commercialization efforts, which could significantly improve small business owners' access to capital through grants and industry collaborations.

Title: Columbia Association - Lease Requirements and Governing Documents Ho. Co. 14-25
Synopsis: Requiring a written lease for certain residential or commercial real property in Howard County to include information on the annual charge assessed by the Columbia Association and a description of certain rights and privileges under certain circumstances; requiring a landlord to provide a tenant with a copy of certain covenants and governing documents under certain circumstances; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires landlords in Howard County to include specific information about the Columbia Association's annual charges and rights in written leases for residential and commercial properties. It also mandates landlords to provide tenants with copies of covenants and governing documents.
responsible_party: Howard County Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Tenants and landlords in Howard County subject to Columbia Association covenants
access_to_capital_summary: The program enhances transparency and access to important property information, which could indirectly support better financial planning for tenants and landlords.

Title: Out-of-Home Placement Providers - Individuals Enrolled in Higher Education and Vocational Training Programs
Synopsis: Authorizing an individual enrolled in an accredited institution of higher education or a residential vocational training program to return to an out-of-home placement provider with whom the individual was previously placed under certain circumstances; requiring an individual to make a request to a local department of social services at least 30 days before the scheduled break; requiring the local department to make a recommendation to the Department of Human Services not later than 21 days before the scheduled break; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes regulations for out-of-home placement providers, including an exemption for individuals enrolled in higher education or vocational training programs, allowing them to return to previous placements under certain conditions.
responsible_party: Department of Human Services
stakeholders: Children in out-of-home placements, individuals enrolled in higher education or vocational training programs, and their families
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's focus is on placement regulations and does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Maryland Insurance Administration and Maryland Department of Health - Workgroup to Study Pharmacy Benefits Managers
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Insurance Administration and the Maryland Department of Health, in consultation with the Prescription Drug Affordability Board, to convene a workgroup to study and review reimbursement for pharmacists; and requiring the workgroup to submit an interim report by December 31, 2025, and a final report on their findings and recommendations to certain committees of the General Assembly by December 31, 2026.
bill_summary: This bill establishes a workgroup to study pharmacy benefits managers, review reimbursement levels, and analyze drug pricing and coverage policies in Maryland, with the goal of improving transparency and affordability.
responsible_party: Maryland Insurance Administration and Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Pharmacies, pharmacy benefits managers, drug manufacturers, health insurers, managed care organizations, and Medicaid recipients in Maryland.
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's focus on reimbursement levels and transparency could influence small pharmacies' access to capital by affecting their revenue and cost structures.

Title: Department of Juvenile Services - Report on Youth Service Bureaus
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of Juvenile Services to submit an annual report to certain committees of the General Assembly by October 1 detailing efforts by the Department to promote predelinquent programs, including youth service bureaus, efforts by the Department to collaborate with and provide technical assistance to local governments regarding the establishment of youth service bureaus, and an assessment of the programs and activities of the bureaus and any other efforts to prevent youth offenses.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Juvenile Services to submit annual reports on youth service bureaus, including their efforts, collaboration, assessment, and youth offense prevention activities.
responsible_party: Department of Juvenile Services
stakeholders: Youth, local governments, juvenile justice system
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly establish a program that impacts access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Procurement - Employee Stock Ownership Plan Preference - Pilot
Synopsis: Authorizing the Maryland Stadium Authority, Morgan State University, St. Mary's College of Maryland, and Baltimore City Community College to establish a certain preference program for certain procurements; authorizing the establishment of a certain evaluation factor for certain proposals by an entity that utilizes certain employee stock ownership plans; requiring contractors to provide certain information to a unit regarding the use of an employee stock ownership plan; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a pilot program in Maryland that provides procurement preferences for entities that utilize employee stock ownership plans (ESOPs). It authorizes certain state agencies and educational institutions to establish evaluation factors favoring ESOP-utilizing bidders and requires contractors to provide verification of their ESOP status.
responsible_party: Maryland State agencies including the Maryland Stadium Authority, University System of Maryland, Morgan State University, St. Maryโs College of Maryland, and Baltimore City Community College.
stakeholders: Small business owners and employees of entities utilizing employee stock ownership plans in Maryland.
access_to_capital_summary: The program has a high potential to impact small business owners' access to capital by incentivizing the use of employee stock ownership plans in procurement processes.

Title: Health Insurance - Utilization Review - Use of Artificial Intelligence
Synopsis: Requiring that certain carriers, pharmacy benefits managers, and private review agents ensure that artificial intelligence, algorithm, or other software tools are used in a certain manner when used for conducting utilization review.
bill_summary: The bill requires health insurance carriers, pharmacy benefits managers, and private review agents in Maryland to ensure that artificial intelligence and other software tools used in utilization review are used appropriately, with specific guidelines on their application and oversight.
responsible_party: Maryland Insurance Commissioner
stakeholders: Health insurance carriers, pharmacy benefits managers, private review agents, and enrollees in Maryland health plans
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's focus is on the regulation and oversight of AI use in utilization review, not on providing capital or financial support to small businesses.

Title: Maryland Small Business Retirement Savings Board - Membership - Alteration
Synopsis: Adding the Comptroller, or the Comptroller's designee, as a member to the Maryland Small Business Retirement Savings Board.
bill_summary: This bill amends the membership of the Maryland Small Business Retirement Savings Board to include the Comptroller or their designee as a member.
responsible_party: Maryland Small Business Retirement Savings Board
stakeholders: Small business owners and employees in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Office of Small, Minority, and Women Business Affairs - Repeal of Interdepartmental Advisory Committee and Establishment of the Governor's Subcabinet on Socioeconomic Procurement Participation
Synopsis: Repealing the Interdepartmental Advisory Committee on Small, Minority, and Women Business Affairs within the Office of Small, Minority, and Women Business Affairs; establishing the Governor's Subcabinet on Socioeconomic Procurement Participation to study and make recommendations on socioeconomic procurement in the State; requiring the Subcabinet to conduct certain meetings and report annually to the Governor on the Subcabinet's activities, progress, and recommendations.
bill_summary: The bill repeals the existing Interdepartmental Advisory Committee on Small, Minority, and Women Business Affairs and establishes the Governorโs Subcabinet on Socioeconomic Procurement Participation to study and improve socioeconomic procurement programs in Maryland.
responsible_party: Governorโs Office of Small, Minority, and Women Business Affairs and the Governorโs Subcabinet on Socioeconomic Procurement Participation
stakeholders: Small businesses, minority and women entrepreneurs, and socioeconomic disadvantaged groups in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill aims to improve socioeconomic procurement programs, which could enhance opportunities for small and disadvantaged businesses to access government contracts and related capital.

Title: Carroll County - Prospective Employees and Volunteers - Criminal History Records Check
Synopsis: Repealing certain limitations on the prospective employees or volunteers of Carroll County for whom the Department of Human Resources of Carroll County may request a criminal history records check.
bill_summary: The bill repeals certain restrictions on Carroll County's ability to request criminal history records checks for prospective employees or volunteers, expanding the types of positions for which checks can be requested.
responsible_party: Carroll County Department of Human Resources
stakeholders: Prospective employees and volunteers of Carroll County
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Carroll County - Public Facilities Bond
Synopsis: Authorizing and empowering the County Commissioners of Carroll County to borrow not more than $36,900,000 in order to finance the construction, improvement, or development of certain public facilities in Carroll County and to effect such borrowing by the issuance and sale at public or private sale of its general obligation bonds; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Carroll County to issue up to $36,900,000 in bonds to finance public facilities, water and sewer projects, and volunteer fire department facilities, including the ability to issue refunding bonds and installment purchase obligations for land easements.
responsible_party: Carroll County Commissioners
stakeholders: Residents of Carroll County, volunteer fire departments, public facility users, landowners with easements
access_to_capital_summary: The program has a high potential to improve access to capital for small businesses and fire departments through bonds and loans.

Title: Charles County - Alcoholic Beverages - Baseball Stadium License - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the areas in which beer, wine, and liquor may be sold and consumed under a Class B-Stadium (baseball stadium) beer, wine, and liquor license in Charles County to exclude any parking areas; and altering the types of containers in which beer, wine, and liquor may be served.
bill_summary: The bill amends the regulations for the Class BโStadium (baseball stadium) alcohol license in Charles County, including where alcohol can be sold and consumed, the types of containers used, and the hours of sale.
responsible_party: Charles County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Baseball stadium patrons, local residents, and businesses in Charles County
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's impact on access to capital is minimal as it mainly changes licensing rules and container regulations.

Title: Health Occupations - Licensed Direct-Entry Midwives - Revisions
Synopsis: Altering the scope of practice of licensed direct-entry midwives; providing that the practice of direct-entry midwifery is independent and not does not require oversight by another health care practitioner; repealing the requirement that licensed direct-entry midwives report certain information to the Direct-Entry Midwifery Advisory Committee; altering the disciplinary actions that may be taken against a licensed direct-entry midwife or an applicant for a license; etc.
bill_summary: This bill revises the scope of practice for licensed direct-entry midwives in Maryland, making their practice independent without needing oversight from other healthcare practitioners, and updates reporting and disciplinary procedures.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Nursing
stakeholders: Licensed direct-entry midwives, pregnant individuals, newborns, and families in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill primarily changes practice regulations and reporting requirements for midwives, with no direct funding or financial program established.

Title: Election Law - Provisional Ballots - Nonpartisan Board of Education Contests
Synopsis: Providing that a voter is qualified to vote a provisional ballot if the provisional ballot was cast because the voter claimed a different political party affiliation from the political party affiliation on record for the voter and the voter made a selection in a nonpartisan board of education contest; and requiring a local board of canvassers to count only the votes cast in a nonpartisan board of education contest for those provisional ballots.
bill_summary: This bill modifies Maryland election law to specify that a provisional ballot cast by a voter who claims a different political party affiliation than the one on record, and who makes a selection in a nonpartisan board of education contest, should only have the votes from that nonpartisan contest counted. It also clarifies the conditions under which provisional ballots are accepted and counted.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Elections
stakeholders: Voters participating in elections, especially those involved in nonpartisan board of education contests and voters claiming different political party affiliations
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Public Senior Higher Education Institutions - Pregnant and Parenting Students - Plan Requirements (Pregnant and Parenting Student Support Act)
Synopsis: Requiring certain public senior higher education institutions to adopt a plan regarding pregnant and parenting students to include referral to on-campus or off-campus services to assist regarding the availability of or eligibility for certain government assistance programs and any other programs, scholarships, or subsidies that may be available for pregnant and parenting students; and requiring each public senior higher education institution to post the plan on the institution's website on or before August 1, 2026.
bill_summary: The bill requires public senior higher education institutions in Maryland to adopt and post a plan to support pregnant and parenting students, including providing information on government assistance programs, resources for adoption, accommodations, and healthcare referrals.
responsible_party: Public senior higher education institutions in Maryland
stakeholders: Pregnant and parenting students at public senior higher education institutions in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill primarily focuses on support services and accommodations for students, not on access to capital for small businesses.

Title: Gaming - Charles County Gaming Permit Review Board - Repeal
Synopsis: Repealing the Charles County Gaming Permit Review Board; and transferring certain powers and duties concerning gaming activities in Charles County from the board to the County Attorney for Charles County.
bill_summary: The bill repeals the Charles County Gaming Permit Review Board and transfers its powers and duties to the County Attorney for Charles County, including reviewing gaming permit applications and regulating gaming activities.
responsible_party: Charles County Attorney's Office
stakeholders: Fundraising organizations, gaming permit applicants, residents of Charles County
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Somerset County - Salaries of Local Officials - Increase
Synopsis: Increasing the salaries of the Sheriff of Somerset County, the County Commissioners of Somerset County, the President of the County Commissioners of Somerset County, a member of the County Roads Board of Somerset County, and the President of the County Roads Board of Somerset County.
bill_summary: This bill increases the salaries of certain public officials in Somerset County, including the Sheriff, County Commissioners, and members of the County Roads Board.
responsible_party: Somerset County government
stakeholders: Public officials and residents of Somerset County
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Health Insurance - Adverse Decisions - Notices, Reporting, and Examinations
Synopsis: Requiring that certain adverse decision and grievance decision notices include certain information in a certain manner; requiring that the information regarding criteria and standards for utilization review that a private review agent is required to post on its website or the carrier's website be posted on the member's and provider's pages of the websites; requiring that certain information submitted to the Maryland Insurance Commissioner be aggregated by zip code; etc.
bill_summary: This bill enhances transparency and accountability in health insurance adverse decision processes by requiring detailed notices, posting of criteria on websites, aggregation of decision data by zip code, and improved communication channels for members and providers.
responsible_party: Maryland Insurance Commissioner
stakeholders: Health insurance members, healthcare providers, insurance carriers in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill primarily focuses on decision transparency and process improvements rather than direct financial support or capital access programs.

Title: Workgroup on the Creation of a Data Dashboard for Public Work Contracts and Apprentices - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Workgroup on the Creation of a Data Dashboard for Public Work Contracts and Apprentices to study the most efficient and cost-effective method to create a publicly available data dashboard that disaggregates information regarding public work contracts with the State and apprentices working under the public work contracts; and requiring the Workgroup to report its findings and recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly by January 7, 2027.
bill_summary: This bill establishes a workgroup to study and recommend the creation of a publicly accessible data dashboard that disaggregates information about public work contracts, including contractor details, wages, apprenticeships, and demographic data, with the goal of increasing transparency.
responsible_party: Commissioner of Labor and Industry, Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: Public work contractors, subcontractors, employees, apprentices, and the general public interested in transparency of public contracts
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's focus on transparency and data sharing could indirectly improve access to capital for small businesses by providing clearer information about wages, benefits, and apprenticeship opportunities, but it does not directly establish a financial program.

Title: Postconviction Review - Procedure to Reduce Duration of Sentence (Maryland Second Look Act)
Synopsis: Authorizing a certain individual to file a motion to reduce the duration of a certain sentence if the individual was convicted between the ages of at least 18 and under 25, was not sentenced to life, is not a sex offender, has served at least 20 years of the term of confinement, and was not convicted of murder involving a victim who was a first responder who was killed in the line of duty; applying procedures for a proceeding under the Act; etc.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes individuals serving long-term sentences in Maryland to petition for a reduction of their sentences after serving at least 20 years, with specific procedures and considerations for hearings and factors influencing the decision. It also establishes a process for certain individuals convicted as minors or young adults to seek sentence reductions after 20 years.
responsible_party: Maryland courts and criminal justice system
stakeholders: Long-term incarcerated individuals, victims, and the Maryland criminal justice system
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's focus on sentence reduction processes may indirectly impact the reintegration and economic stability of formerly incarcerated individuals, but it does not directly establish a program to improve access to capital.

Title: Workgroup on Establishing a Science and Technology Best Practices and Innovation Network - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the membership of the Workgroup on Establishing a Science and Technology Best Practices and Innovation Network; and extending the workgroup to June 30, 2027.
bill_summary: This bill establishes a Workgroup on Establishing a Science and Technology Best Practices and Innovation Network, extends its duration, and specifies its membership, responsibilities, and reporting requirements.
responsible_party: University of Maryland, Baltimore County (providing staff)
stakeholders: Scientists, technology experts, citizen scientists, industry representatives, academic institutions, and the general public interested in science and technology innovation in Maryland.
access_to_capital_summary: The bill aims to facilitate collaboration and information exchange among science and technology experts, which could indirectly improve access to capital for small businesses and innovators by fostering a more connected and innovative ecosystem.

Title: Natural Resources - Pursuing Wounded Deer After Legal Hunting Hours and Using a Light - Authorization
Synopsis: Authorizing a person who is authorized by the Department of Natural Resources to hunt deer and who wounds a deer during legal hunting hours to pursue and kill the deer after legal hunting hours using the means authorized for the applicable hunting season or permit which may include use of a light or throw or cast the rays of a spotlight, a headlight, an artificial light, a battery, or any other device while pursuing the wounded deer.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes individuals who are permitted to hunt deer and who wound a deer during legal hunting hours to pursue and kill the deer after legal hours, using a light or other device, with certain restrictions.
responsible_party: Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Deer hunters and wildlife management authorities in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Access to Health Insurance for Child Care Professionals - Outreach
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Health Benefit Exchange to promote access to health insurance for child care professionals; and requiring the Exchange to conduct a survey, in consultation with the State Department of Education and relevant nonprofit organizations, to assess current levels of health care access across the child care community.
bill_summary: The bill promotes access to health insurance for child care professionals by encouraging collaboration between the Maryland Department of Education, the Maryland Health Benefit Exchange, and nonprofit organizations. It includes outreach, assistance with obtaining insurance, and conducting a survey on healthcare access within the child care community.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Education in collaboration with the Maryland Health Benefit Exchange
stakeholders: Child care professionals and child care providers in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The program aims to improve health insurance access for child care professionals, which could indirectly impact their financial stability and ability to access capital, but it is primarily focused on health coverage.

Title: Public Nuisance - Common Carriers - Damage to Public Infrastructure
Synopsis: Prohibiting certain common carriers from damaging certain public infrastructure necessitating the closure of the infrastructure; establishing that a violation of the Act is a public nuisance; authorizing the State or a local government to bring a civil action against a common carrier for a violation under the Act; and providing that a common carrier that commits a violation may be liable to the State or local government for civil penalties of $1,000 per day for each day the public nuisance continues.
bill_summary: This bill prohibits certain common carriers from damaging public infrastructure such as bridges and highways, and establishes legal actions and penalties for violations.
responsible_party: State or local government
stakeholders: Public infrastructure and government agencies responsible for infrastructure maintenance
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact small business owners' access to capital.

Title: Transportation Network Companies - Weekly Fare and Earnings Summary and Operator Data Reporting
Synopsis: Requiring a transportation network company to provide each operator with a weekly fare and earnings summary; requiring a transportation network company to report, on or before February 1 each year, certain information to the Public Service Commission; and providing that the report submitted to the Commission may be made available to the General Assembly on request, provided that the report remain confidential and exempt from public disclosure.
bill_summary: The bill requires transportation network companies to provide weekly fare and earnings summaries to their operators, offer digital receipts after each ride, and report annual aggregated data to the Maryland Public Service Commission, including information on fares, operator earnings, and demographics.
responsible_party: Maryland Public Service Commission
stakeholders: Transportation network operators, drivers, passengers, and transportation network companies in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's provisions mainly focus on reporting and transparency requirements, with no direct intervention or service creation that would impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Catastrophic Event Account - Transfer of Funds - State Disaster Recovery Fund
Synopsis: Authorizing the transfer of funds from the Catastrophic Event Account to the State Disaster Recovery Fund if the balance of the Fund has been depleted due to use or transfer or the estimated costs for providing adequate disaster relief for a natural disaster or catastrophic situation are in excess of the Fund's balance; and providing the Legislative Policy Committee has 10 days to review and make comments before the Governor may transfer certain funds from the Account through budget amendment.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the transfer of funds from the Catastrophic Event Account to the State Disaster Recovery Fund under certain circumstances, and modifies the review period for such transfers.
responsible_party: Maryland State government, specifically the Public Safety and State Finance and Procurement departments
stakeholders: State and local government agencies involved in disaster response and recovery
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly establish or fund a program aimed at increasing access to capital for small businesses.

Title: Frederick County - Alcoholic Beverages - Class C (Theater) Beer, Wine, and Liquor License
Synopsis: Establishing a Class C (theater) beer, wine, and liquor license in Frederick County; authorizing the manager of the theater or any other official designated by the theater to sign the application for the license; authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Frederick County to issue the license for use by certain theaters; authorizing the license holder to sell beer, wine, and liquor for on-premises consumption, subject to certain limitations; establishing an annual license fee of $150; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a new Class C (theater) beer, wine, and liquor license in Frederick County, allowing theaters to sell alcohol for on-premises consumption during certain events.
responsible_party: Board of License Commissioners for Frederick County
stakeholders: Theaters and event organizers in Frederick County
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Preserve Telehealth Access Act of 2025
Synopsis: Repealing the limitation on the period during which the Maryland Medical Assistance Program and certain insurers, nonprofit health service plans, and health maintenance organizations are required to provide reimbursement for certain health care services provided through telehealth on a certain basis and at a certain rate; altering the circumstances under which health care practitioners are authorized to prescribe certain controlled dangerous substances for the treatment of pain through telehealth; etc.
bill_summary: The bill expands telehealth access in Maryland by removing restrictions on the duration and scope of audio-only telephone consultations, requiring reimbursement for telehealth services at the same rate as in-person services, and establishing reporting requirements for telehealth developments. It also clarifies standards for healthcare practitioners prescribing controlled substances via telehealth and mandates coverage for telehealth services by insurers and health plans.
responsible_party: Maryland Health Care Commission and relevant health insurance entities
stakeholders: Patients, healthcare providers, insurers, and health plans in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's focus on expanding telehealth services and reimbursement could improve access to healthcare, but it does not directly impact small business access to capital.

Title: Health Services Cost Review Commission - Community Benefits - Community Health Worker Workforce Program
Synopsis: Altering the definition of "community benefit" to include a community health worker workforce program which is intended to provide services to patients of a nonprofit hospital and to improve health outcomes; authorizing a nonprofit hospital and a community-based organization to establish a community health worker workforce program; providing that a partnership that establishes a community health worker workforce program may be executed through a memorandum of understanding; establishing requirements for the memorandum of understanding; etc.
bill_summary: The bill allows nonprofit hospitals and community organizations to establish community health worker workforce programs as part of community benefits, including providing health insurance to workers and improving health outcomes.
responsible_party: Health Services Cost Review Commission and participating nonprofit hospitals and community organizations
stakeholders: Community health workers, nonprofit hospitals, community-based organizations, and the communities they serve
access_to_capital_summary: The program has the potential to improve access to health insurance and support for community health workers, thereby enhancing small business owners' access to capital through workforce development and health outcomes.

Title: Residential Real Property - Tenants' Right of First Refusal
Synopsis: Clarifying the circumstances under which liability for the failure to comply with certain requirements relating to a tenant's right of first refusal to purchase residential property is restricted to the owner of the property and does not attach to the property.
bill_summary: The bill clarifies that liability for failing to comply with tenants' right of first refusal to purchase residential property is limited to the owner and does not attach to the property itself.
responsible_party: Office of Tenant and Landlord Affairs
stakeholders: Tenants and property owners of residential rental properties in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners, as it primarily clarifies legal liabilities related to property transactions.

Title: Prison Education Delivery Reform Commission - Reporting and Sunset Extension
Synopsis: Extending the time for submission of the interim report and final report of the Prison Education Delivery Reform Commission by 3 years; and extending the termination date for the Commission by 3 years.
bill_summary: The bill extends the reporting deadlines and the termination date for the Prison Education Delivery Reform Commission, delaying its final reports from 2025 and 2026 to 2028 and 2029, and extends the commission's effective period.
responsible_party: Prison Education Delivery Reform Commission
stakeholders: Prison education programs, incarcerated individuals, and the Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Task Force to Improve Attendance and Reduce Chronic Absenteeism in Schools
Synopsis: Establishing the Task Force to Improve Attendance and Reduce Chronic Absenteeism in Schools for the purpose of studying and making recommendations on practices to identify, prevent, and eliminate chronic absenteeism by students from schools in the State; and requiring the Task Force to report its findings and recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly by December 31, 2025.
bill_summary: This bill establishes a Task Force to Study and Make Recommendations on Improving Attendance and Reducing Chronic Absenteeism in Maryland Schools. It outlines the composition, responsibilities, and reporting requirements for the task force, and mandates updates to regulations and distribution of guidance and toolkits to address chronic absenteeism.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: Students, parents, teachers, school administrators, and local school systems in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Family Investment Program - Child Support
Synopsis: Phasing in a requirement that all child support received in a month pass through to a family seeking assistance under the Family Investment Program and prohibiting the consideration of child support in computing the amount of assistance received.
bill_summary: The bill phases in a requirement that all child support received in a month pass through to families receiving assistance under the Family Investment Program and prohibits considering child support when calculating benefits for the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Human Services
stakeholders: Families receiving assistance under the Family Investment Program and Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program, and children in those families.
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's impact on access to capital is indirect, primarily affecting family income and benefits rather than small business capital access.

Title: State Retirement and Pension System โ Deferred Vested Former Members โ Return to Service
Synopsis: Establishing that an individual who, after earning service credit sufficient for a vested allowance in the State Police Retirement System, the Correctional Officers' Retirement System, or the Law Enforcement Officers' Pension System, separates from service, and subsequently returns to service in a position in the same system under certain circumstances, is subject to the same requirements to which certain members of the same system are subject.
bill_summary: This bill clarifies that individuals who, after earning service credit in certain Maryland retirement systems and then leaving employment, return to a position in the same system under specific conditions, are subject to the same rules as current members. It applies to the Employees' Pension System, State Police Retirement System, Correctional Officersโ Retirement System, and Law Enforcement Officersโ Pension System.
responsible_party: Maryland State Retirement Agency or relevant Maryland State department overseeing retirement systems
stakeholders: Members of the Maryland State Retirement and Pension Systems who leave and then return to service in the same system
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's impact on access to capital for small business owners is indirect and minimal, as it mainly addresses retirement system rules.

Title: Accountants - Licensed Out-of-State Practice Privileges - Qualifications
Synopsis: Altering the qualifications for an individual licensed as a certified public accountant in another state to practice certified public accountancy in the State by requiring that the individual must have passed the Uniform CPA Examination when qualifying for the license in the other state.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the qualifications for out-of-state licensed certified public accountants (CPAs) to practice in Maryland, allowing those with licenses from other states where they passed the Uniform CPA Exam to practice in Maryland without additional licensing, under certain conditions.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Public Accountancy
stakeholders: Certified Public Accountants licensed in other states and seeking to practice in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Education - Initial Teacher Certification - Qualifications
Synopsis: Altering the qualifications for an initial teacher certificate to include passing a portfolio-based assessment of a nationally accredited teacher preparation program.
bill_summary: The bill amends the qualifications for initial teacher certification in Maryland to include passing a portfolio-based assessment of a nationally accredited teacher preparation program, starting July 1, 2025.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: Prospective teachers and students in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Tidal Fish Licenses - Oyster Authorizations - Administrative Penalties
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of Natural Resources to suspend for up to 5 years for a first violation, rather than revoke, a person's oyster authorization for knowingly committing certain violations; providing for the reinstatement for certain persons of an oyster authorization and an entitlement to engage or work in the oyster fishery; altering a certain offense related to the use of prohibited gear; and repealing the 90-day time period within which a certain administrative hearing must be held.
bill_summary: This bill modifies the penalties and procedures related to oyster fishing violations in Maryland. It changes the consequences from revocation to suspension for first offenses, sets specific suspension durations, and provides a process for reinstating oyster authorizations after certain periods, including for those revoked before July 1, 2025.
responsible_party: Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Oyster fishers and related industry stakeholders in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's focus on penalties and reinstatement procedures does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Endangered and Threatened Species - Incidental Taking - Bats
Synopsis: Authorizing the Secretary of Natural Resources to issue an incidental taking permit for the Indiana bat, the northern long-eared bat, the tricolor bat, or the eastern small-footed bat if an applicant submits a certain conservation plan and the Secretary makes certain findings.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland Department of Natural Resources to issue incidental taking permits for certain bat species, including the Indiana bat, Northern long-eared bat, Tricolored bat, and Eastern small-footed bat, if applicants submit conservation plans and meet specific findings to ensure the protection and recovery of these species.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Bat species in Maryland, conservation organizations, land developers, and the general public concerned with wildlife protection
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's impact on small business access to capital is indirect, primarily through conservation planning and potential mitigation costs.

Title: Employment and Insurance Equality for Service Members Act
Synopsis: Establishing rules of interpretation related to the uniformed services; altering the rule of interpretation for "veteran"; and altering the application of certain provisions of law governing the regulation of business, economic development, insurance, and labor and employment to apply to all uniformed services, rather than only the armed forces.
bill_summary: The bill establishes rules for interpreting the roles of service members, veterans, and uniformed services in Maryland law, and creates programs to support military personnel, veterans, and their families, including licensing, employment, and small business support initiatives.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Veterans and Military Families
stakeholders: Service members, veterans, military families, small business owners, and consumers in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill creates a no-interest loan program for veteran-owned small businesses and reserve component members, which could significantly improve access to capital for these groups.

Title: Property Tax - Exemption for Blind Individuals - Alteration
Synopsis: Increasing the amount of a certain property tax exemption for dwelling houses owned by blind individuals or their surviving spouses from $15,000 to $40,000.
bill_summary: This bill increases the property tax exemption amount for dwelling houses owned by blind individuals or their surviving spouses from $15,000 to $40,000, and makes related adjustments to the exemption rules.
responsible_party: Maryland local governments (counties and municipal corporations) and the Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation
stakeholders: Blind individuals and their surviving spouses who own and reside in qualifying dwelling houses in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners; it pertains to property tax exemptions for homeowners.

Title: Baltimore City - Speed Monitoring Systems - Interstate 83
Synopsis: Increasing from two to four the number of speed monitoring systems that may be placed on Interstate 83 in Baltimore City; limiting to not more than one speed monitoring system in each direction that may be in operation at the same time on Interstate 83 in Baltimore City; and making permanent the authorization to place speed monitoring systems on Interstate 83 in Baltimore City.
bill_summary: The bill increases the number of speed monitoring systems that can be placed on Interstate 83 in Baltimore City from two to four, limits the number of systems in operation at the same time to one per direction, and makes the authorization to place these systems permanent.
responsible_party: Baltimore City Government or Maryland Department of Transportation (implied)
stakeholders: Drivers and residents in Baltimore City, especially those on Interstate 83
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Family Law - Permanent Protective Orders - Consent
Synopsis: Specifying that an individual may consent to the issuance of a permanent protective order against the individual.
bill_summary: The bill allows individuals to consent to the issuance of a permanent protective order against themselves in cases of abuse, provided certain conditions are met, including prior protective orders, convictions, and sentences.
responsible_party: Maryland Judiciary
stakeholders: Individuals seeking protection orders and victims of abuse in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Public Health Abortion Grant Program - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Public Health Abortion Grant Program to provide grants to improve access to abortion care clinical services for individuals in the State; establishing the Public Health Abortion Grant Program Fund as a special, nonlapsing fund to provide grants under the Program; and requiring that certain premium funds collected by health insurance carriers be used to provide certain coverage and to support improving access to abortion care clinical services under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Public Health Abortion Grant Program and Fund to provide grants to organizations that improve access to abortion care services for individuals in Maryland, especially those with limited resources. It also mandates that certain health insurance premium funds be used to support abortion care services and creates rules for fund management and oversight.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and the Maryland Insurance Administration
stakeholders: Individuals in Maryland seeking abortion care, especially those uninsured or underinsured, and organizations providing abortion services.
access_to_capital_summary: The program has a high potential to directly impact access to capital for organizations providing abortion services by providing grants and funding support.

Title: Public Ethics - Conflicts of Interest and Blind Trust - Governor
Synopsis: Requiring the Governor to place certain interests into a certain certified blind trust or divest of certain interests within 6 months after taking the oath of office; requiring the Governor to enter into a nonparticipation agreement with the State Ethics Commission for any interests not included in a blind trust; authorizing the Ethics Commission to impose a fine of up to $5,000 for each violation of the Act; requiring the Commission to adopt regulations to carry out the Act including standards for types of interests that be exempted; etc.
bill_summary: This bill establishes new rules for the Governor of Maryland regarding conflicts of interest, including the requirement to place certain interests into a blind trust or divest within a specified period, and mandates reporting and transparency measures related to interests in business entities seeking state contracts.
responsible_party: Maryland State Ethics Commission
stakeholders: Governor, restricted individuals, Maryland state government, businesses seeking state contracts, and the public interested in government transparency.
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's focus on conflicts of interest and transparency could indirectly impact small business owners by promoting fair competition and reducing undue influence, but it does not directly create a program to improve access to capital.

Title: Nursing Homes - Cost Reports
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Health to review the cost reports and other data submitted by each nursing home that participates in the Maryland Medical Assistance Program; and requiring the Department to report the findings resulting from the review conducted under the Act to the Governor and certain committees of the General Assembly by October 1, 2025, and each October 1 thereafter through 2029.
bill_summary: The bill requires nursing homes in Maryland to spend at least 75% of their total revenue from nursing and residential care on direct care wages and benefits. It also mandates annual submission of cost reports by nursing homes to the Maryland Department of Health, which will review the data related to revenues and wages, and report findings to the governor and legislative committees.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Nursing homes, nursing home residents, direct care staff, policymakers
access_to_capital_summary: The program aims to improve transparency and potentially increase wages for direct care staff, which could impact access to capital for nursing homes through better wage management and compliance.

Title: Health Insurance - Cancellation and Nonrenewal of Coverage - Required Notice
Synopsis: Requiring that a carrier provide notice by certain electronic means, in addition to written notice, of cancellation or nonrenewal of a small group market health benefit plan and include information regarding additional health benefit coverage options in the notice; and applying the Act to all policies, contracts, and health benefit plans issued, delivered, or renewed in the State on or after January 1, 2026.
bill_summary: This bill requires health insurance carriers in Maryland to provide electronic notice, in addition to written notice, to small employers and employees about cancellations or nonrenewals of health plans. It also mandates that notices include information about additional coverage options, such as COBRA and plans through the Maryland Health Benefit Exchange.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Insurance
stakeholders: Small business owners, employees, and health insurance carriers in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill primarily focuses on notification procedures and does not directly impact access to capital for small businesses.

Title: Continuing Care Providers - Governing Bodies - Membership
Synopsis: Requiring the appointment of an alternate subscriber member to the governing body of a continuing care provider; and authorizing the alternate subscriber member to attend all meetings of the governing body and vote only if the regular subscriber is unable to fulfill the subscriber's duties as a regular member of the governing body.
bill_summary: The bill requires the appointment of an alternate subscriber member to the governing body of a continuing care provider, specifies their duties, and outlines the composition and appointment process for governing bodies of such providers.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Human Services
stakeholders: Residents and subscribers of continuing care providers in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners; it focuses on governance and representation.

Title: Maryland Commission for Women - Maryland Collaborative to Advance Implementation of Coverage of Over-the-Counter Birth Control
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Commission for Women to establish the Maryland Collaborative to Advance Implementation of Coverage of Over-the-Counter Birth Control to study access to over-the-counter birth control; and requiring the Collaborative to submit an interim report by January 1, 2026, and a final report of its findings and recommendations to the Governor and General Assembly by December 1, 2027.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland Collaborative to Advance Implementation of Coverage of Over-the-Counter Birth Control, which will study and make recommendations to improve access to over-the-counter birth control in Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland Commission for Women in the Department of Human Services
stakeholders: Individuals seeking access to over-the-counter birth control, healthcare providers, pharmacies, and public health organizations in Maryland.
access_to_capital_summary: The program aims to improve access to over-the-counter birth control, which could reduce costs and barriers for consumers, potentially increasing access to contraception.

Title: Criminal Law - Crimes of Malicious or Fraudulent Burning - Prohibitions and Penalties
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person from committing a certain crime of malicious or fraudulent burning that causes the death of or serious physical injury to a firefighter; and establishing that a person who violates the Act is guilty of a felony and on conviction is subject to imprisonment not to exceed 10 years.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits individuals from committing malicious or fraudulent burning crimes that result in the death or serious injury of a firefighter, establishing it as a felony with penalties up to 10 years in prison.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services (implied)
stakeholders: Firefighters, criminal justice system, residents of Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Election Law - Gubernatorial Primary Election - Date
Synopsis: Altering, from the last Tuesday in June to the fourth Tuesday in June, the date for the primary election in the year of the gubernatorial election.
bill_summary: This bill changes the date of the statewide primary election in Maryland to the fourth Tuesday in June in the year of the gubernatorial election, and clarifies the date for presidential election years.
responsible_party: Maryland State Election Board or relevant election authorities
stakeholders: Voters and candidates participating in Maryland elections
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Tax Sales - Homeowner Protection Program - Funding and Alterations
Synopsis: Requiring each collector of taxes that maintains a website to include on the collector's website certain information and a certain link relating to the Homeowner Protection Program; altering the information the State Department of Assessments and Taxation is required to obtain and include in a certain annual report regarding tax sales; requiring the State Tax Sale Ombudsman to take certain actions to maximize enrollment in the Homeowner Protection Program; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Homeowner Protection Program in Maryland, which aims to help vulnerable homeowners avoid tax sales and remain in their homes. It includes funding provisions, program administration, and requirements for local governments and the Department of Assessments and Taxation.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation
stakeholders: Homeowners at risk of tax sale, local governments, and the Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation
access_to_capital_summary: The program has a high potential to impact small business owners' access to capital by providing assistance to homeowners, preventing foreclosures, and maintaining community stability.

Title: Consumer Protection - Workgroup on Artificial Intelligence Implementation
Synopsis: Establishing the Workgroup on Artificial Intelligence Implementation; requiring the Workgroup to monitor and make recommendations related to the regulation of artificial intelligence, consumer protection, current private sector use of artificial intelligence, enforcement authority for the Office of the Attorney General's Office of Consumer Protection, and impact in the determination of government benefits; and requiring the Workgroup to make its recommendations to certain committees of the General Assembly by July 1, 2026.
bill_summary: This bill establishes a Workgroup on Artificial Intelligence Implementation in Maryland to monitor and make recommendations on issues related to AI and consumer protection, including regulation, privacy, and impact on government benefits.
responsible_party: Department of the University of Maryland Center for Health and Homeland Security
stakeholders: Consumers, AI developers, government agencies, and various industry sectors impacted by AI in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly address access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Public Health - Pediatric Hospital Overstay Patients and Workgroup on Children in Unlicensed Settings and Pediatric Overstays
Synopsis: Specifying that the scope of the Maryland Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Registry and Referral System includes private and State inpatient and outpatient mental health and substance use services; requiring the Maryland Department of Health and the Department of Human Services, under certain circumstances, to ensure pediatric hospital overstay patients are placed in the least restrictive setting when clinically indicated and when possible; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes programs and workgroups to improve the placement and treatment of pediatric hospital overstay patients and children in unlicensed settings, including creating coordinators, data collection, and assessment of needs and resources.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and Department of Human Services
stakeholders: Children in hospitals, children in unlicensed settings, healthcare providers, state agencies
access_to_capital_summary: The bill aims to improve placement options and services for children, which could facilitate access to appropriate care and resources.

Title: Montgomery County - Task Force on the Displacement of Residents of Emory Grove MC 5-25
Synopsis: Establishing the Task Force on the Displacement of Residents of Emory Grove to study how urban renewal caused the displacement of residents from the Emory Grove community and make recommendations on potential remedies to those who were displaced by urban renewal; requiring the Task Force to submit an interim report by December 15, 2025, and a final report of its findings and recommendations to the Montgomery County Council, the Montgomery County Executive, the Montgomery County Delegation, and the General Assembly by December 15, 2026.
bill_summary: This bill establishes a Task Force on the Displacement of Residents of Emory Grove to study how urban renewal from 1960 to 1985 caused displacement and to recommend remedies for those displaced.
responsible_party: Montgomery County Office of Human Rights
stakeholders: Residents displaced from Emory Grove due to urban renewal between 1960 and 1985
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's focus is on studying historical displacement and recommending remedies; it does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Somerset County Code of Public Local Laws - 2025 Edition - Legalization
Synopsis: Legalizing the 2025 Edition of the Somerset County Code of Public Local Laws and any supplement to the extent to which that code or supplement contains laws enacted by the General Assembly.
bill_summary: This bill legalizes the 2025 Edition of the Somerset County Code of Public Local Laws and any supplements, making them valid legal references and evidence of law within Maryland.
responsible_party: Somerset County Government
stakeholders: Residents and officials of Somerset County, Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not establish or impact programs related to access to capital for small businesses.

Title: Business Regulation โ Licensing โ Definition of Storage Warehouse
Synopsis: Altering, with respect to business licensing requirements in the State, the definition of "storage warehouse" to exclude a self-service storage facility.
bill_summary: The bill amends Maryland's business licensing laws to clarify that self-service storage facilities are not considered storage warehouses requiring a license, and establishes licensing requirements for storage warehouses.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor or relevant licensing authority
stakeholders: Storage warehouse operators and businesses that use storage services in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's impact on access to capital is indirect, primarily affecting licensing requirements rather than providing direct financial support or capital access programs.

Title: Property Tax - Payment in Lieu of Taxes Agreements - Broadband Service Providers
Synopsis: Authorizing the governing body of a county to enter into a payment in lieu of taxes agreement with a provider of broadband service located in the county for property located in the county and owned by the provider; and applying the Act to all taxable years beginning after June 30, 2025.
bill_summary: The bill allows Maryland counties to enter into agreements with broadband service providers for payment in lieu of property taxes, and sets rules for valuing the property of broadband providers and utilities for tax purposes.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation
stakeholders: Broadband service providers, county governments, and residents in rural areas of Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's impact on access to capital is indirect, primarily through potential tax incentives and valuation rules affecting broadband providers.

Title: Health Insurance - Insulin - Prohibition on Step Therapy or Fail-First Protocols
Synopsis: Prohibiting certain insurers, nonprofit health service plans, and health maintenance organizations from imposing a step therapy or fail-first protocol for insulin or an insulin analog used to treat an insured's or enrollee's Type 1, Type 2, or gestational diabetes; and applying the Act to all policies, contracts, and health benefit plans issued, delivered, or renewed in the State on or after January 1, 2026.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits certain health insurers and plans from imposing step therapy or fail-first protocols on insulin or insulin analogs used to treat diabetes, starting January 1, 2026.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health or Insurance Department (not explicitly specified)
stakeholders: Individuals with diabetes who use insulin or insulin analogs
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Anne Arundel County Crownsville Hospital Memorial Park Advisory Committee
Synopsis: Establishing the Anne Arundel County Crownsville Hospital Memorial Park Advisory Committee to provide advice on the planning of the Park; requiring the Advisory Committee to make recommendations to ensure that the Park focuses on mental and physical health and well-being, is equitable in providing access to the property, is truthful about the history of Crownsville Hospital, and preserves the natural beauty of the site; and requiring the Committee to report its achievements and recommendations to certain entities by February 1 each year.
bill_summary: This bill establishes the Anne Arundel County Crownsville Hospital Memorial Park Advisory Committee to advise on planning and development of the memorial park.
responsible_party: Anne Arundel County government
stakeholders: Residents of Anne Arundel County, local community, cultural and historical organizations, and park visitors
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly create a program that impacts access to capital for small businesses.

Title: Real Estate Commission - Continuing Education Requirements - Alterations
