Synopsis: Altering certain requirements for continuing education required for the renewal of a license for real estate brokers, associate real estate brokers, and real estate salespersons, including the number of clock hours, course topics, course instructors, and course application fees.
bill_summary: This bill amends the continuing education requirements for real estate licensees in Maryland, including the number of hours, course topics, and instructor qualifications, effective October 1, 2025.
responsible_party: Maryland Real Estate Commission
stakeholders: Real estate licensees, prospective and current real estate professionals in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill primarily updates education requirements and does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Health Insurance - Preventive Services - High Deductible Health Plans and Enforcement Authority
Synopsis: Clarifying the application of certain health insurance preventive services coverage requirements to certain high deductible health plans; and requiring the Insurance Commissioner to enforce certain provisions of law related to preventive services consistent with the recommendations and guidelines set by certain federal agencies in effect on December 31, 2024.
bill_summary: The bill clarifies the application of health insurance preventive services coverage requirements to high deductible health plans in Maryland. It requires the Maryland Insurance Commissioner to enforce these provisions in accordance with federal guidelines and recommendations, and allows the adoption of regulations to expand preventive coverage.
responsible_party: Maryland Insurance Commissioner
stakeholders: Health insurance providers and consumers in Maryland, especially those with high deductible health plans
access_to_capital_summary: The bill primarily focuses on insurance coverage rules and enforcement, with no direct impact on small business access to capital.

Title: Maryland Self-Service Storage Act - Sale of Personal Property in Satisfaction of Lien - Notice Requirements
Synopsis: Requiring a certain operator of a certain self-service storage facility to notify at least 10 days prior to conducting a sale of an occupant's personal property stored in certain leased space at the self-service storage facility of the time, place, and terms of the sale by hand delivery, verified mail, or electronic mail at the occupant's last known address.
bill_summary: This bill updates Maryland law regarding the sale of personal property stored in self-service storage facilities, including new notice requirements before conducting a sale of the stored property.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Commerce or relevant self-storage regulatory authority
stakeholders: Self-storage facility operators and tenants in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill primarily changes legal procedures and does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Election Law - Local Boards of Elections - Language Assistance Program
Synopsis: Establishing the Language Assistance Program; requiring a local board of elections to participate in the Program if the State Board determines that there is a significant need for language assistance to voters in the county in a language other than English; requiring the State Board to designate, not later than February 1 of the year of the election, certain languages other than English in which a local board that is required to participate in the Program must provide assistance to voters; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Language Assistance Program for voters in Maryland, requiring local election boards to provide language support and materials in designated languages based on community needs, and setting criteria for determining those languages.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Elections
stakeholders: Voters with limited English proficiency in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The program primarily focuses on election assistance and language support, not on access to capital for small businesses.

Title: Public Utilities - Electric Cooperatives - Rate Proceedings
Synopsis: Applying to electric cooperatives certain provisions of law related to rate proceedings held by the Public Service Commission to determine whether additional revenues are required to allow certain public service companies to earn the existing fair rate of return authorized in a previous base rate proceeding; and requiring the Commission to order an electric cooperative to conduct a certain public hearing.
bill_summary: This bill applies certain rate proceeding rules to electric cooperatives in Maryland, requiring the Public Service Commission to hold public hearings and determine if additional revenues are needed for these cooperatives to earn their authorized rates, with specific procedures for final orders and potential further proceedings.
responsible_party: Public Service Commission of Maryland
stakeholders: Electric cooperatives and their ratepayers in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's provisions could influence the financial stability and rate-setting processes of electric cooperatives, potentially impacting their access to capital.

Title: Baltimore County - Alcoholic Beverages - Class B-OB-CRD (Office Building - Commercial Revitalization District) Beer, Wine, and Liquor License
Synopsis: Establishing a Class B-OB-CRD (office building - commercial revitalization district) beer, wine, and liquor license in Baltimore County; authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Baltimore County to issue the license to an establishment that previously had or has a certain zoning classification and is at least a certain distance from a place of worship under certain circumstances and subject to certain limitations; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a new Class BโOBโCRD (office building โ commercial revitalization district) beer, wine, and liquor license in Baltimore County, allowing certain restaurants in specific districts to sell alcohol under particular conditions, including proximity exceptions near places of worship.
responsible_party: Baltimore County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Restaurants and establishments in Baltimore County, particularly in office buildings and commercial revitalization districts
access_to_capital_summary: The bill could facilitate alcohol sales for eligible restaurants, potentially increasing revenue and access to capital for these businesses.

Title: Montgomery County - Speed Monitoring Systems - Maryland Route 200 (Intercounty Connector) MC 10-25
Synopsis: Authorizing the placement and use by the Maryland Transportation Authority of speed monitoring systems on Maryland Route 200 (Intercounty Connector) in Montgomery County; requiring the District Court to remit to the Authority any civil penalties collected by the District Court resulting from a citation issued using a speed monitoring system operated by the Authority; and requiring the State Highway Administration to provide the Authority with access to certain systems and contacts.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland Transportation Authority to place and use speed monitoring systems on Maryland Route 200 (Intercounty Connector) in Montgomery County, and establishes procedures for collecting civil penalties from citations issued using these systems. It also details the roles of courts, local agencies, and the Maryland Highway Administration in managing and overseeing these systems and penalties.
responsible_party: Maryland Transportation Authority
stakeholders: Motor vehicle drivers in Montgomery County, Maryland, and local government agencies involved in traffic enforcement
access_to_capital_summary: The program has a high potential to impact small business owners' access to capital by streamlining citation processing and revenue collection related to speed monitoring systems.

Title: State Procurement - Minority Business Enterprise Program - Extension and Reports
Synopsis: Altering the termination date for certain provisions of law governing the Minority Business Enterprise Program and its application to public-private partnerships, offshore wind projects, video lottery terminals, and sports wagering licenses; and altering the date by which certain reports, studies, and guidelines must be submitted.
bill_summary: The bill extends the termination dates of various minority business enterprise programs and related regulations, shifting enforcement from 2025 to 2026, and requires reports and analyses on program compliance, subgoals, and race-neutral approaches.
responsible_party: Maryland Office of Small, Minority, and Women Business Affairs and the Board of Public Works
stakeholders: Minority-owned businesses, state agencies, and public-private partnership entities in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's focus on minority business enterprise programs and subgoals suggests a potential impact on access to capital for minority-owned businesses, but it mainly involves regulatory extensions and analyses.

Title: Workgroup to Study the Rise in Adverse Decisions in the State Health Care System - Establishment
Synopsis: ยงEstablishing the Workgroup to Study the Rise in Adverse Decisions in the State Health Care System to make recommendations to improve State reporting on adverse decisions, reduce the number of adverse decisions, and develop recommendations for legislation to address the rise in adverse decisions; and requiring the Workgroup to report its findings and recommendations to certain committees of the General Assembly by December 1, 2025.
bill_summary: This bill establishes a Workgroup to Study the Rise in Adverse Decisions in the Maryland health care system, with the goal of analyzing current reporting requirements, making recommendations to improve reporting and reduce adverse decisions, and proposing legislation.
responsible_party: Health Services Cost Review Commission and Maryland Insurance Administration
stakeholders: Health payers, healthcare providers, patients, and policymakers in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill aims to improve transparency and reduce adverse decisions, which could indirectly facilitate better access to health services and financial stability for providers and patients.

Title: Public Health - Phenibut Consumer Protection Act (JT Alvey Phenibut Consumer Protection Act)
Synopsis: Requiring a retailer that prepares, distributes, sells, or exposes for sale a phenibut product to disclose the factual basis on which any representations regarding the phenibut product are made; establishing prohibitions related to the preparation, distribution, and sale of phenibut products, including prohibitions related to the sale of phenibut to individuals under the age of 21 years and the marketing of phenibut to minors; establishing certain penalties for violations of the Act; etc.
bill_summary: This bill establishes regulations for the sale and marketing of phenibut products in Maryland, including disclosure requirements, restrictions on sale to minors, and advertising limitations, and mandates a report on adverse health events related to phenibut.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Consumers, retailers, and manufacturers of phenibut products in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Public Health - Alzheimer's Disease and Related Dementias - Information on Prevalence and Treatment
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Health, in partnership with certain entities, to incorporate information regarding treatments approved by the Food and Drug Administration for Alzheimer's disease and related dementias and to increase understanding and awareness of treatment of Alzheimer's disease and related dementias into relevant public health outreach programs; requiring the Department to establish and maintain a website with information on the prevalence and hospitalization rate for Alzheimer's and related dementias;  etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Health to incorporate information about FDA-approved treatments for Alzheimer's disease and related dementias into public health outreach programs. It also mandates the creation of a website that provides data on the prevalence and hospitalization rates of these conditions, disaggregated by various demographics.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Individuals affected by Alzheimer's disease and related dementias, healthcare providers, public health officials, and at-risk communities such as Black and Latino populations.
access_to_capital_summary: The bill primarily focuses on public health information and data dissemination, with no direct programs or interventions related to access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Disability and Life Insurance - Medical Information (Genetic Testing Protection Act)
Synopsis: Prohibiting insurance carriers that offer life insurance or disability insurance policies or contracts from unfairly discriminating against an individual by taking certain actions relating to coverage based on medical information; prohibiting certain carriers from accessing sensitive medical information without first obtaining written consent or mandating certain genetic testing or full genome sequencing as a prerequisite for life insurance or disability insurance eligibility or coverage;  etc.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits insurance companies offering life, long-term care, or disability insurance in Maryland from discriminating against individuals based on genetic testing results, including restrictions on accessing genetic information without consent and mandating genetic testing. It aims to protect individuals from genetic discrimination in insurance coverage.
responsible_party: Maryland Insurance Commissioner
stakeholders: Individuals seeking life, long-term care, or disability insurance in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The program has a high potential to impact access to capital for small business owners and individuals by preventing genetic discrimination in insurance, which can influence their ability to obtain coverage and financial security.

Title: African American Heritage Preservation Program and Grant Fund - Noncapital Grants and Donations
Synopsis: Altering the purpose of the African American Heritage Preservation Program and Grant Fund to provide funding for African American Heritage Preservation Noncapital Grants for the purpose of preserving or sharing African American history or culture in the State; requiring certain noncapital grants to be made using certain money received by the African American Heritage Preservation (AAHP) Grant Fund; and authorizing the AAHP Grant Fund to receive grants and donations.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the African American Heritage Preservation Program and Grant Fund to include funding for noncapital grants aimed at preserving or sharing African American history and culture in Maryland. It establishes a dedicated grant fund with an annual appropriation of $5 million, and sets procedures for applying, awarding, and reporting on grants.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Planning and the Trust on African American History and Culture
stakeholders: African American communities, historical preservation organizations, local governments, and cultural institutions in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill creates a significant dedicated fund and a structured grant process, which could substantially improve access to capital for projects preserving African American history and culture.

Title: Baltimore Convention and Tourism Redevelopment and Operating Authority Task Force - Revisions
Synopsis: Requiring the Baltimore Convention and Tourism Redevelopment and Operating Authority Task Force to identify certain funding sources and mechanisms, and to submit a report to the Governor, the Mayor of Baltimore City, and the General Assembly on its findings and recommendations by December 1, 2025; and extending the termination date for the Task Force from June 30, 2025, to June 30, 2026.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Baltimore Convention and Tourism Redevelopment and Operating Authority to oversee the renovation, revitalization, and operation of the Baltimore Convention site and promote Baltimore as a tourist destination. It also extends the term of the related Task Force and details its responsibilities and reporting requirements.
responsible_party: Baltimore Convention and Tourism Redevelopment and Operating Authority
stakeholders: Tourists, Baltimore City residents, local businesses, and the tourism industry in Baltimore
access_to_capital_summary: The bill creates a new authority with powers to issue bonds, enter into contracts, and manage property, which could significantly impact small business access to capital through these mechanisms.

Title: Financial Institutions - Conventional Home Mortgage Loans - Assumption and Required Disclosures
Synopsis: Requiring banking institutions, credit unions, mortgage lenders, mortgage lending businesses, and mortgage loan originators to include a certain provision in certain conventional home mortgage loans authorizing a certain borrower to purchase the property interest of a certain borrower in connection with a decree of absolute divorce if the lending entity determines that the assuming borrower qualifies for the loan; applying certain provisions of the Act retroactively; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires certain entities to include provisions in conventional home mortgage loans that allow borrowers to assume the mortgage in connection with a divorce decree, and mandates disclosure of this provision to loan applicants. It also clarifies definitions related to mortgage loans and lenders.
responsible_party: Maryland financial institutions regulatory agencies, including the Maryland Department of Financial Institutions
stakeholders: Homeowners, mortgage lenders, and borrowers involved in divorce proceedings in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill potentially facilitates smoother mortgage assumptions during divorces, which could impact access to homeownership and refinancing options for affected borrowers.

Title: Consumer Protection - Credit Reporting - Medical Debt (Fair Medical Debt Reporting Act)
Synopsis: Prohibiting a consumer reporting agency from furnishing any consumer report containing certain adverse information relating to a consumer's medical debt, or any collection action against a consumer for medical debt, or maintain a file on a consumer related to medical debt or collections; prohibiting a person from using medical debt information from a consumer report for certain purposes; prohibiting a health care facility, a health care practitioner, or an ambulance service from disclosing medical debt to a consumer reporting agency; etc.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits the inclusion of medical debt information in consumer reports, restricts the use of medical debt in creditworthiness decisions, and sets rules for hospitals regarding debt collection, reporting, and patient protections.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and the Maryland Consumer Protection Agency
stakeholders: Consumers with medical debt, hospitals, healthcare providers, debt collectors, and credit reporting agencies in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill has a high potential to impact small business owners, especially healthcare providers and debt collectors, by restricting medical debt reporting and collection practices.

Title: Real Estate Appraisers - Licensure and Certification - Qualifications
Synopsis: Prohibiting the State Commission of Real Estate Appraisers, Appraisal Management Companies, and Home Inspectors from requiring an applicant to hold a bachelor's degree or higher to qualify for a certain certification or licensure as a real estate appraiser.
bill_summary: The bill amends Maryland law to remove the requirement that real estate appraiser licensure and certification applicants hold a bachelor's degree or higher, focusing instead on experience and federal qualifications.
responsible_party: Maryland State Commission of Real Estate Appraisers, Appraisal Management Companies, and Home Inspectors
stakeholders: Real estate appraisers and individuals seeking licensure or certification in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners or real estate professionals.

Title: Frederick County - Alcoholic Beverages - Tasting Permits
Synopsis: Altering in Frederick County the beer and wine consumption permit to be the beer and wine tasting permit and the beer, wine, and liquor consumption permit to be the beer, wine, and liquor tasting permit; and requiring the Board to regulate the quantity of beer and wine served to an individual and the number of bottles or other containers from which the quantity is served.
bill_summary: The bill modifies alcohol tasting permits in Frederick County, changing permit names, adjusting the quantities of alcohol that can be tasted, and updating related regulations and fees.
responsible_party: Frederick County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Alcohol license holders, consumers, and businesses in Frederick County
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Workgroup to Study Implementation of an Expanded 3-1-1 Nonemergency System
Synopsis: Establishing the Workgroup to Study Implementation of an Expanded 3-1-1 Nonemergency System; requiring the Workgroup to review a certain study completed by the Department of Information Technology in order to establish a plan to implement the recommendations of the study; and requiring the Workgroup to report its findings and recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly by November 1, 2025.
bill_summary: This bill establishes a workgroup to study the implementation of an expanded 3-1-1 nonemergency telephone system in Maryland, including reviewing current services, best practices, and developing a plan for expansion.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Information Technology
stakeholders: Maryland residents, public safety agencies, telecommunications industry, local governments
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly address access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Board of Trustees for the State Retirement and Pension System - Investment Division - Compensation and Staffing
Synopsis: Clarifying that the Board of Trustees for the State Retirement and Pension System shall pay certain incentive compensation to the Chief Investment Officer for the State Retirement and Pension System if the Chief Investment Officer retires from the Investment Division of the State Retirement Agency in a certain manner; clarifying that the Board of Trustees shall pay certain incentive compensation to certain employees of the Investment Division if the employees retire from the Investment Division in a certain manner; etc.
bill_summary: The bill clarifies the compensation, incentives, and staffing procedures for the Board of Trustees of the Maryland State Retirement and Pension System, including establishing a Compensation and Staffing Committee and setting rules for incentive payments to the Chief Investment Officer and Investment Division staff.
responsible_party: Maryland State Retirement and Pension System Board of Trustees
stakeholders: Employees of the Investment Division of the Maryland State Retirement and Pension System, Chief Investment Officer, and related staff
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's focus on incentive compensation and staffing criteria could influence the ability of investment staff to perform effectively, potentially impacting access to capital indirectly.

Title: Correctional Officers' Retirement System - Membership - Clarifications
Synopsis: Clarifying the membership in the Correctional Officers' Retirement System for certain employees of certain Maryland Department of Health facilities; and clarifying that certain participating employees who are appointed, promoted, or transferred are members of the Correctional Officers' Retirement System as a condition of employment.
bill_summary: This bill clarifies and updates the membership rules for the Correctional Officers' Retirement System in Maryland, including provisions for transferring service credits and unused sick leave for certain employees, and specifies the start and end dates for these provisions.
responsible_party: Maryland State Retirement and Pension System
stakeholders: Correctional officers and employees of Maryland Department of Health facilities affected by the retirement system rules
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact small business owners' access to capital.

Title: State Retirement and Pension System - Reemployment Earnings Limitations - Maximum Average Final Compensation
Synopsis: Clarifying that the maximum average final compensation that certain retirees of the State Retirement and Pension System is to be based on the minimum annual salary on the standard State pay scale as of January 1 of the preceding calendar year in order to be exempt from a certain reemployment earnings limitation; and adding an average final compensation reemployment exemption for the temporary suspension of a retirement allowance for disability retirees.
bill_summary: The bill clarifies the maximum average final compensation for certain retirees of the Maryland State Retirement and Pension System, specifically setting it based on the minimum annual salary on the standard state pay scale as of January 1 of the previous year. It also provides an exemption for reemployment earnings limitations for disability retirees during a temporary suspension of their retirement allowance.
responsible_party: Maryland State Retirement and Pension System
stakeholders: Retirees of the Maryland State Retirement and Pension System, especially those who are reemployed or receiving disability retirement benefits
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's provisions are unlikely to have a direct impact on small business owners' access to capital.

Title: State Retirement and Pension System โ Alterations and Clarifications
Synopsis: Altering certain due dates of certain reports from the State Retirement and Pension System; and clarifying the eligibility requirements of State Police Retirement System members to participate in the Deferred Retirement Option Program.
bill_summary: The bill makes changes to the Maryland State Retirement and Pension System, including updating report due dates, clarifying eligibility for the Deferred Retirement Option Program (DROP) for State Police Retirement System members, and establishing rules for participation in DROP.
responsible_party: Maryland State Retirement Agency
stakeholders: Members of the Maryland State Police Retirement System and the State Retirement and Pension System
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's impact on access to capital for small business owners is indirect and minimal, mainly related to pension and retirement system administration.

Title: Electricity and Gas - Emissions Reductions, Rate Regulation, Cost Recovery, Infrastructure, Planning, Renewable Energy Portfolio Standard, and Energy Assistance Programs (Next Generation Energy Act)
Synopsis: Authorizing the Department of Housing and Community Development to issue loans, in addition to grants, for certain purposes relating to reducing direct greenhouse gas emissions from certain multifamily residential buildings; requiring the Maryland Energy Administration, in coordination with the Public Service Commission and the Department of Natural Resources, to pursue certain agreements with neighboring states and federal agencies related to the development of new nuclear energy generation stations; etc.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes Maryland to issue loans and grants for reducing greenhouse gas emissions from multifamily buildings, pursue agreements for nuclear energy development, expand energy infrastructure planning, and establish procurement processes for dispatchable energy, nuclear projects, and energy storage. It also updates regulations for utilities, promotes clean energy, and sets standards for energy projects and community benefits.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development, Maryland Energy Administration, Public Service Commission, Department of Natural Resources, Maryland Department of Labor, and other state agencies involved in energy and utility regulation.
stakeholders: Low- to moderate-income households, small and minority-owned businesses, utility customers, energy developers, and residents of Maryland.
access_to_capital_summary: The bill creates new programs and mechanisms for financing energy projects, including loans, grants, and procurement processes, which could significantly improve access to capital for clean energy and infrastructure projects.

Title: Public Utilities - Generating Stations - Generation and Siting (Renewable Energy Certainty Act)
Synopsis: Altering the factors the Public Service Commission must consider before taking final action on a certificate of public convenience and necessity; establishing a distributed generation certificate of public convenience and necessity to authorize the construction and operation of a certain distributed solar energy generating system; requiring the Power Plant Research Program, by July 1, 2026, to develop and submit to the Commission proposed siting and design requirements and licensing conditions; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland's regulations on the siting, construction, and operation of renewable energy generating stations, including solar energy systems, and establishes new programs for community solar and energy storage, along with licensing, permitting, and environmental considerations.
responsible_party: Maryland Public Service Commission and Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Residents, local governments, solar energy developers, environmental groups, and low- to moderate-income communities
access_to_capital_summary: The bill creates new pathways and programs for community solar and energy storage, which could facilitate access to capital for small and local solar projects, especially in underserved communities.

Title: Energy Resource Adequacy and Planning Act
Synopsis: Establishing the Strategic Energy Planning Office; requiring the Office to develop a Comprehensive Wholesale Energy Markets and Bulk Power System Risk Report and examine certain scenarios to support the development of the Risk Report; requiring the Risk Report to assess wholesale energy market financial resource adequacy and reliability risks and to identify any necessary cost-effective solutions that ensure electric system reliability while meeting the State's energy policy goals; etc.
bill_summary: This bill establishes the Strategic Energy Planning Office within the Maryland Public Service Commission to develop comprehensive energy forecasts, conduct risk assessments of wholesale energy markets, and examine scenarios to support energy resource planning and policy development in Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland Public Service Commission and Maryland Energy Administration
stakeholders: Electricity consumers, energy producers, and Maryland residents impacted by energy policy and planning
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's programs aim to improve energy market stability and planning, which could facilitate better access to capital for energy projects, but it primarily focuses on planning and analysis rather than direct capital access.

Title: Health Insurance, Family Planning Services, and Confidentiality of Medical Records - Consumer Protections - Updates
Synopsis: Updating references to federal law related to family planning services, grandfathered plans, explanation of benefits, summaries of benefits and coverage, medical loss ratios, catastrophic plans, annual limits for cost sharing, prescription drugs, and rescissions; altering the definitions of "legally protected health care" and "sensitive health services" to include gender-affirming care for purposes of law governing the disclosure of information regarding sensitive health services; etc.
bill_summary: This bill updates Maryland laws related to health insurance, family planning services, and medical records confidentiality. It clarifies definitions, aligns state law with recent federal regulations, and establishes a state-funded family planning program to support providers affected by federal funding changes.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Individuals seeking family planning and reproductive health services, health care providers, and insurance companies in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill has a high potential to improve access to capital for family planning providers affected by federal funding changes, supporting their continued operation and service provision.

Title: Mechanical Repair Contracts - Technical Service Bulletins
Synopsis: Prohibiting a mechanical repair contract from containing a provision precluding coverage for service to a motor vehicle solely for issues identified in a technical services bulletin and prohibiting the denial of a service claim solely for such an issue by a guarantor or provider.
bill_summary: This bill establishes rules for mechanical repair contracts for motor vehicles, including prohibiting deceptive statements, ensuring truthful testimonials, and preventing denial of coverage for issues identified in technical service bulletins.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation and Maryland Insurance Administration
stakeholders: Motor vehicle owners, vehicle dealers, and service providers in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's provisions mainly regulate repair contracts and do not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Judicial and Public Safety for Service Members Act
Synopsis: Establishing rules of interpretation related to the uniformed services; altering the rule of interpretation for "veteran"; and altering the application of certain provisions of judicial proceedings, corrections, criminal, family, public safety, and real property laws to apply to all uniformed services, rather than only the armed forces.
bill_summary: The bill establishes rules of interpretation related to the uniformed services, broadens the application of laws concerning veterans and service members, and makes various legal and procedural updates to support military personnel, veterans, and their families in Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Veterans and Military Families
stakeholders: Service members, veterans, military families, and related organizations in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill includes provisions that could facilitate access to benefits and legal protections for service members and veterans, potentially improving their access to capital indirectly.

Title: Montgomery County Planning Board and Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission - Open Meetings - Live Streaming Requirement MC/PG 101-25
Synopsis: Establishing that certain project site visits and educational field tours do not constitute open meetings subject to the requirement that the Montgomery County Planning Board and the Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission, respectively, stream live video or audio of their open meetings.
bill_summary: This bill establishes requirements for live streaming and recording of open meetings for the Montgomery County Planning Board and the Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission, including provisions for technical failures and exceptions for site visits and educational tours.
responsible_party: Montgomery County Planning Board and Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission
stakeholders: Public, local government agencies, and interested stakeholders in open meetings and transparency
access_to_capital_summary: The bill primarily focuses on transparency and open meetings, with no direct impact on access to capital for small businesses.

Title: Prince George's County - Board of Appeals - Membership MC/PG 106-25
Synopsis: Altering the membership of the board of appeals in Prince George's County to be at least three members; and altering the number of members of the board required to concur in any resolution to a simple majority.
bill_summary: This bill alters the membership and voting requirements of the Board of Appeals in Prince George's County, including the number of members and the majority needed to pass resolutions.
responsible_party: Prince George's County Council
stakeholders: Residents and property owners in Prince George's County
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Commission on Behavioral Health Care Treatment and Access - Workgroups
Synopsis: Requiring the Commission on Behavioral Health Care Treatment and Access to establish a workgroup on the improvement of health, social, and economic outcomes related to substance use; requiring the workgroup to make recommendations on changes to State laws, policies and practices needed to mitigate the harm related to criminalization of substance use and related to the discharge of patients from substance use treatment programs; and requiring the workgroup to submit a certain report annually.
bill_summary: This bill establishes a workgroup within the Maryland Commission on Behavioral Health Care Treatment and Access to improve health, social, and economic outcomes related to substance use, and outlines its responsibilities and composition.
responsible_party: Maryland Commission on Behavioral Health Care Treatment and Access
stakeholders: Individuals with substance use disorders, criminal justice-involved individuals, healthcare providers, and community organizations involved in behavioral health and substance use treatment.
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's focus on improving treatment access and outcomes for substance use disorders may indirectly influence access to capital for related services, but it does not directly establish a financial program.

Title: Life and Health Insurance Policies and Annuity and Health Maintenance Organization Contracts - Discretionary Clauses - Prohibition
Synopsis: Prohibiting the use of discretionary clauses in life insurance policies, health insurance policies, annuity contracts, and health maintenance organization contracts.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits the use of discretionary clauses in health insurance policies, life insurance policies, annuity contracts, and health maintenance organization contracts in Maryland, effective from January 1, 2026.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and Maryland Insurance Administration
stakeholders: Consumers purchasing health, life, and annuity insurance policies in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners, as it mainly changes legal rules for insurance policies.

Title: State Retirement and Pension System - Administrative Fees - Repeal
Synopsis: Requiring the Board of Trustees for the State Retirement and Pension System to certify certain employer contribution rates each fiscal year; requiring the employer contribution rates to include recognition of certain administrative and operational expenses; repealing a requirement that certain administrative and operational expenses of the State Retirement and Pension System and the State Retirement Agency be funded by charging each participating employer an administrative fee for each system participant; etc.
bill_summary: The bill repeals the requirement that administrative and operational expenses of the Maryland State Retirement and Pension System be funded through employer administrative fees, and instead funds these expenses through the system's accumulation fund, with costs included in employer contribution rates starting in fiscal year 2027.
responsible_party: Board of Trustees for the State Retirement and Pension System
stakeholders: Participants and employers in the Maryland State Retirement and Pension System
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's changes to funding mechanisms are unlikely to have a direct impact on small business owners' access to capital.

Title: Residential Real Property - Landlord and Tenant - Notice of Landlord Entry
Synopsis: Requiring a landlord to provide a tenant with certain written notice in a certain manner at least 24 hours in advance of when the landlord intends to enter a leased premises, except in the event of a certain emergency; and authorizing the court to issue a certain injunction or assess certain damages under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: This bill requires landlords of residential properties to give tenants written notice before entering the leased premises, except in emergencies, and specifies the notice procedures and allowable times for entry.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Residential tenants and landlords in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill primarily changes notice requirements for landlord entry and does not directly impact access to capital for small businesses.

Title: Prince George's County - Federal Bureau of Investigation Headquarters - Mandated Appropriation
Synopsis: Requiring the Governor to include $200,000,000 in the annual operating or capital budget bill for site redevelopment and transportation infrastructure improvements if the U.S. General Services Administration applies to Prince George's County or the State for a permit associated with the relocation of the Federal Bureau of Investigation Headquarters to Prince George's County.
bill_summary: The bill mandates that the Maryland Governor include at least $200 million in the annual budget for site redevelopment and transportation infrastructure improvements if the U.S. General Services Administration relocates the FBI headquarters to Prince George's County.
responsible_party: Maryland Governor's Office and State Budget Office
stakeholders: Residents and businesses in Prince George's County, Maryland, and federal agencies involved in the FBI headquarters relocation
access_to_capital_summary: The bill allocates a significant amount of funding specifically for infrastructure related to the FBI headquarters relocation, which could facilitate broader economic development and improve access to capital for local businesses.

Title: Local Government - Local Personnel - Leave With Pay
Synopsis: Establishing that governmental units may provide disaster service leave with pay to certain employees; establishing that an employee of a governmental unit of a county or a municipality in the State may be entitled to disaster service leave with pay under certain circumstances; authorizing certain governmental units to waive certain requirements for disaster service leave; and authorizing a governmental unit of a county or a municipality to provide leave with pay under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill allows Maryland counties and municipalities to provide paid disaster service leave to employees who volunteer during disasters, and also to provide paid leave for jury service, union activities, military service, court appearances, and other necessary leave.
responsible_party: Maryland local government agencies (counties and municipalities)
stakeholders: Employees of counties and municipalities, disaster volunteers, emergency responders, and the general public during disasters
access_to_capital_summary: The bill primarily provides leave benefits and does not directly impact access to capital for small businesses.

Title: Health Insurance - Individual Market Stabilization - Establishment of the State-Based Health Insurance Subsidies Program
Synopsis: Establishing the State-Based Health Insurance Subsidies Program to provide subsidies to individuals in the State to mitigate the impact of a reduction in certain federal advance premium tax credits for calendar years 2026 through 2028; and requiring the Maryland Health Benefit Exchange to implement the Program under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the StateโBased Health Insurance Subsidies Program to provide subsidies to individuals in Maryland to offset the impact of reductions in federal premium tax credits, and creates a dedicated fund to support various health insurance initiatives including market stability and subsidies.
responsible_party: Maryland Health Benefit Exchange
stakeholders: Individuals purchasing health insurance in Maryland, especially those affected by federal premium tax credit reductions
access_to_capital_summary: The program has a high potential to impact small business owners' access to capital by stabilizing health insurance costs and providing subsidies.

Title: Behavioral Health Advisory Council and the Commission on Behavioral Health Care Treatment and Access - Plan to Implement Early and Periodic Screening, Diagnostic, and Treatment Requirements
Synopsis: Requiring the Behavioral Health Advisory Council and the Commission on Behavioral Health Care Treatment and Access, through its workgroup, to implement Early and Periodic Screening, Diagnostic, and Treatment requirements; requiring the workgroup to provide recommendations to implement recommendations in a certain Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services State Health Official letter; and requiring the Maryland Department of Health to report its findings and recommendations to the General Assembly by January 1, 2026.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Health to convene a workgroup to develop a plan for implementing Early and Periodic Screening, Diagnostic, and Treatment (EPSDT) requirements for children's behavioral health. It involves creating recommendations for screening, assessment, community-based services, and addressing urgent needs, with a report due by January 1, 2026.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Children with behavioral health issues, their families, healthcare providers, and behavioral health advocates in Maryland.
access_to_capital_summary: The bill primarily focuses on behavioral health screening and services for children, not directly on access to capital for small businesses.

Title: Housing Authorities - Tax-Exempt Status - Modifications
Synopsis: Exempting certain real property owned by certain nonprofit entities created by public housing authorities from State and local property taxation; directing certain nonprofit entities created by public housing authorities to make payment in lieu of taxes that may be set by mutual agreement with a political subdivision; and applying the Act to all taxable years beginning after June 30, 2025.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the tax-exempt status of certain property owned by public housing authorities and related nonprofit entities, allowing them to be exempt from state and local taxes and to make payments in lieu of taxes based on mutual agreements.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Public housing authorities, nonprofit housing entities, and residents of affordable housing in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's focus on tax exemptions and payments in lieu of taxes does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Maryland Medical Assistance Program and Health Insurance - Coverage for Anesthesia - Prohibiting Time Limitations
Synopsis: Requiring, beginning January 1, 2026, the Maryland Medical Assistance Program, managed care organizations, and certain insurers, nonprofit health service plans, and health maintenance organizations, if providing coverage for the delivery of anesthesia for a procedure for which a licensed medical professional issues an order, to provide the coverage for the duration of the procedure; prohibiting the establishment, implementation, or enforcement of policies or practices  that place time limitations on the delivery of anesthesia; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Medical Assistance Program and certain health insurance providers to cover the full duration of anesthesia for procedures, including related medical care immediately before and after, without imposing time limits. It also extends these requirements to managed care organizations starting January 1, 2026.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and Maryland Insurance Administration
stakeholders: Patients receiving anesthesia during medical procedures in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill primarily focuses on insurance coverage and does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Health Insurance - Step Therapy or Fail-First Protocols - Drugs to Treat Associated Conditions of Advanced Metastatic Cancer
Synopsis: Prohibiting certain insurers, nonprofit health service plans, and health maintenance organizations from imposing a step therapy or fail-first protocol for certain prescription drugs prescribed by a treating physician to treat a symptom of or side effect from the treatment of stage four metastatic cancer and use of the prescription drug is consistent with best practices for treatment of the condition.
bill_summary: This bill prohibits certain health insurers and plans from imposing step therapy or fail-first protocols on prescription drugs used to treat symptoms or side effects of advanced metastatic cancer under specific circumstances, especially when prescribed by a treating physician.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health or relevant health insurance regulatory agency
stakeholders: Patients with advanced metastatic cancer, healthcare providers, insurers, and health plans in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill primarily affects insurance protocols and does not directly impact access to capital for small businesses.

Title: Montgomery County - Alcoholic Beverages - Beauty Salon and Barbershop License MC 3-25
Synopsis: Expanding eligibility for a certain beauty salon license in Montgomery County to include a holder of a certain barbershop permit; authorizing a holder of the license to provide up to 1.7 ounces of liquor for on-premises consumption in addition to beer and wine; and authorizing the holder to provide not more than 12 ounces of beer, 5 ounces of wine, or 1.7 ounces of liquor for on-premises consumption by a beauty salon or barbershop customer; and requiring an annual license fee of $100.
bill_summary: The bill expands the eligibility for a specific alcohol license in Montgomery County to include holders of barbershop permits, allowing them to provide liquor for on-premises consumption, and modifies the amount of beer that can be served.
responsible_party: Montgomery County Department of Permitting Services
stakeholders: Beauty salons and barbershops in Montgomery County, their customers, and local alcohol license holders
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Insurance - Automobile Insurance - Maryland Automobile Insurance Fund and Affordability Study
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Automobile Insurance Fund to calculate and report its risk based capital level in accordance with certain provisions of insurance law and maintain total adjusted capital in a certain amount; establishing that certain provisions of insurance law regarding prior approval rate making apply to the Fund during a certain time period and under certain circumstances; requiring the Maryland Insurance Administration to establish a workgroup to study automobile insurance affordability; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Automobile Insurance Fund to maintain certain capital levels, report on its risk-based capital, and study automobile insurance affordability. It also establishes a workgroup to analyze factors affecting insurance rates and affordability, and authorizes the Fund to certify a financial amount up to $20 million for 2025 operating results.
responsible_party: Maryland Insurance Administration and Maryland Automobile Insurance Fund
stakeholders: Automobile insurance consumers, private passenger automobile insurers, and related stakeholders in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill has a high potential to impact small business owners and consumers by addressing insurance affordability and financial stability of the insurance fund.

Title: Public Health - Health Equity Dashboard
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Health, in collaboration with the Commission on Health Equity, to develop a clear and easy-to-understand graphic data dashboard that includes age-adjusted health disparity data disaggregated by race, ethnicity, and gender; and requiring the Department to update the data dashboard on a quarterly basis, as determined by data availability.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Health, in collaboration with the Commission on Health Equity, to develop and regularly update a health equity data dashboard that displays disaggregated health disparity data by race, ethnicity, and gender, covering various health indicators.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health in collaboration with the Commission on Health Equity
stakeholders: Public health officials, policymakers, and communities affected by health disparities in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Maryland Department of Health - AHEAD Model Implementation - Electronic Health Care Transactions and Population Health Improvement Fund
Synopsis: Clarifying that electronic health care transactions information may be used to support the participation of the State in the States Advancing All-Payer Health Equity Approaches and Development (AHEAD) Model and any successor models; establishing the Population Health Improvement Fund to support the statewide population health targets under the AHEAD Model and any successor models; authorizing the Health Services Cost Review Commission to assess a uniform, broad-based, and reasonable amount in hospital rates to be credited to the Fund; etc.
bill_summary: The bill clarifies the use of electronic health care transaction data to support Maryland's participation in the AHEAD Model, establishes the Population Health Improvement Fund to invest in population health initiatives, and authorizes assessments on hospital rates to fund these efforts. It also sets reporting and oversight requirements.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and the Health Services Cost Review Commission
stakeholders: Public health populations, healthcare providers, hospitals, and policymakers in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's focus on population health initiatives and funding mechanisms suggests a high potential to impact access to capital for small health-related projects.

Title: Allegany County - Alcoholic Beverages - Minimum Age for Employment of Underage Individuals
Synopsis: Altering the minimum age for employment in Allegany County for alcoholic beverages license holders that do not derive more than half of their revenues from the sale of food from 16 years of age to 18 years of age.
bill_summary: The bill amends the minimum age for employment in Allegany County for alcoholic beverage license holders, allowing individuals aged 18 to 21 to be employed, with certain conditions based on revenue sources.
responsible_party: Allegany County government or local licensing authority
stakeholders: Underage individuals seeking employment, alcoholic beverage license holders, local businesses in Allegany County
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Public Utilities - Solar Energy Generating Systems - Systems Located on or Over Water Retention Ponds, Quarries, or Brownfields
Synopsis: Providing that solar energy generating systems located on or over certain water retention ponds or quarries are eligible for the Small Solar Energy Generating System Incentive Program; and authorizing the Mayor and City Council of Baltimore City or the governing body of a county or municipal corporation to grant by law, a certain property tax credit against the county or municipal corporation property tax imposed on certain nonresidential solar energy generating systems.
bill_summary: The bill expands the eligibility for the Small Solar Energy Generating System Incentive Program to include floating solar systems on water retention ponds, quarries, or brownfields, and authorizes local governments to grant property tax credits for such systems. It also clarifies that certain nonresidential solar systems on brownfields, water retention ponds, or quarries are exempt from property tax.
responsible_party: Maryland Public Utilities Commission and local governments (Baltimore City and counties)
stakeholders: Nonresidential solar energy system owners, local governments, and communities near brownfields, water retention ponds, or quarries
access_to_capital_summary: The bill potentially increases access to capital for solar projects on brownfields and water retention ponds by providing tax incentives and expanding program eligibility.

Title: Public Safety - State Clearinghouse for Missing Persons
Synopsis: Renaming and transferring the State Clearinghouse for Missing Children to be the State Clearinghouse for Missing Persons; requiring the Department of State Police to study the Department's capacity to report about persons who have disappeared from, or thought to be located in Maryland, to the National Missing and Unidentified Persons System; and requiring the Department to submit its findings to the Governor and the General Assembly by December 1, 2025.
bill_summary: The bill renames the State Clearinghouse for Missing Children to the State Clearinghouse for Missing Persons, transfers its responsibilities to the Department of State Police, and requires the department to report on its capacity to share information with the National Missing and Unidentified Persons System by December 1, 2025.
responsible_party: Department of State Police
stakeholders: Missing persons and law enforcement agencies in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Child Care Scholarship Program - Youth Transitioning From Foster Placement to Successful Adulthood Program - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Youth Transitioning From Foster Placement to Successful Adulthood Program in the Child Care Scholarship Program to remove certain application barriers for parenting foster youth and increase eligibility access to the Child Care Scholarship Program;
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Youth Transitioning From Foster Placement to Successful Adulthood pilot program within the Child Care Scholarship Program to help foster youth access child care subsidies and remove application barriers.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Education
stakeholders: Foster youth aged 16 to 21 and their children in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The program aims to improve access to child care subsidies for foster youth, which can directly impact their ability to access capital for employment or education.

Title: Office of Child Care Advisory Council - Membership - Alterations
Synopsis: Increasing the maximum number of members of the Office of Child Care Advisory Council from 30 to 31; and adding a representative of the Maryland Association of Public Library Administrators to the membership of the Council.
bill_summary: This bill increases the maximum number of members on the Maryland Office of Child Care Advisory Council from 30 to 31, adds a representative from the Maryland Association of Public Library Administrators to the Council, and makes related adjustments to the Council's membership composition.
responsible_party: Maryland Office of Child Care
stakeholders: Child care providers, public library administrators, and children in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Correctional Services - Geriatric and Medical Parole
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Parole Commission to consider the age of an incarcerated individual when determining whether to grant parole; altering how the Commission evaluates a request for medical parole; requiring the Commission to develop procedures for assessing parole requests by certain incarcerated individuals; repealing the authorization for the Governor to disapprove of a decision by the Commission to grant medical parole; requiring the Commission to conduct a certain risk assessment at a certain time; etc.
bill_summary: This bill reforms Maryland's medical and geriatric parole laws, including criteria for eligibility, procedures for requests, and the role of the Maryland Parole Commission. It emphasizes considering the age and health of incarcerated individuals and establishes new processes for assessing and granting parole for elderly and seriously ill inmates.
responsible_party: Maryland Parole Commission and Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services
stakeholders: Elderly and seriously ill incarcerated individuals, victims, and the Maryland criminal justice system
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's focus on parole assessments and the potential for savings to be used for reinvestment indicates a moderate potential to impact access to capital for small businesses, primarily through reinvestment of savings.

Title: Dorchester County - Well and On-Site Sewage Disposal Activities - Privatization Program
Synopsis: Authorizing the Department of the Environment, at the request of the Dorchester County government and the local health department or county agency in Dorchester County that has received a well or on-site sewage disposal system delegation of authority by the Department, to establish a privatization program for the performance of activities associated with the well or on-site sewage disposal system delegation of authority in Dorchester County.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland Department of the Environment to establish a privatization program in Dorchester County for activities related to well and on-site sewage disposal systems, at the request of the county government and a delegated approval authority.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Residents and businesses in Dorchester County requiring well and sewage disposal services
access_to_capital_summary: The program could potentially improve access to capital for small service providers by allowing privatization of certain activities.

Title: Workgroup on Home Detention Monitoring - Report Alterations and Data Collection
Synopsis: Requiring the Workgroup on Home Detention Monitoring to study and make recommendations to the General Assembly regarding certain policies, practices, and responses when a person violates a condition of home detention monitoring; and requiring the Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services to collect and report to the Workgroup certain data on or before September 1 each year.
bill_summary: This bill establishes a Workgroup on Home Detention Monitoring to study policies, practices, and responses related to violations of home detention conditions, and requires the collection and reporting of relevant data by the Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services.
responsible_party: Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services
stakeholders: Individuals on home detention, law enforcement, judicial system, detention agencies, and policymakers
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Unemployment Insurance - Child Support Arrearage to Work Pilot Program - Established
Synopsis: Establishing a Child Support Arrearage to Work Pilot Program within the Department of Labor to connect individuals who are unemployed and in arrears under a child support order with employment opportunities in the State; and requiring the Department to report on or before July 1, 2026, on the Department's findings and any recommendations related to the continuation of the Program.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Child Support Arrearage to Work Pilot Program within the Maryland Department of Labor to connect unemployed individuals with child support arrears to employment opportunities in the state, including government jobs.
responsible_party: Department of Labor, in consultation with the Department of Human Services and the Department of Budget and Management
stakeholders: Unemployed individuals with child support arrears in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The program aims to connect individuals with employment opportunities, which could improve their financial stability and ability to access capital.

Title: Public Health - Buprenorphine - Training Grant Program and Workgroup
Synopsis: Establishing the Buprenorphine Training Grant Program to assist counties with offsetting the cost of training paramedics to administer buprenorphine; including the Program as an authorized use of funding from the Opioid Restitution Fund; requiring the Governor to include in the annual budget bill an appropriation of at least $50,000 from the Opioid Restitution Fund for the Program; and requiring the Maryland Office of Overdose Response to convene a workgroup to study access to buprenorphine in the State.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Buprenorphine Training Grant Program to help counties fund training paramedics to administer buprenorphine, and creates a workgroup to study access to buprenorphine in Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland Office of Overdose Response
stakeholders: Paramedics, counties, individuals with opioid use disorder, healthcare providers, and the general public in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The program aims to improve access to buprenorphine services, which can facilitate treatment for opioid use disorder, potentially increasing access to necessary medications.

Title: Baltimore County - Alcoholic Beverages - Change of Location
Synopsis: Establishing an additional circumstance under which the Board of License Commissioners for Baltimore County may approve a change of location for a certain alcoholic beverages license; and providing that the Board may approve a certain change if the license was originally issued within the same election district and has been at the same location for a least 10 years.
bill_summary: This bill allows the Baltimore County Board of License Commissioners to approve additional circumstances under which a license for alcoholic beverages can be transferred to a new location, including a new provision that permits a license to be moved if it has been at the same location for at least 10 years.
responsible_party: Baltimore County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Alcoholic beverage license holders and businesses in Baltimore County
access_to_capital_summary: The bill potentially facilitates the transfer of licenses, which could impact small business owners' ability to access capital by enabling more flexible location changes.

Title: Public Health - Maryland Interested Parties Advisory Group - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Maryland Interested Parties Advisory Group to ensure adequate access to applicable home- and community-based services in the State; requiring the Maryland Department of Health to provide certain support to the Advisory Group; and requiring by September 1 each year beginning in 2026, the Advisory Group to report its activities and recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland Interested Parties Advisory Group to ensure adequate access to home- and community-based services and a qualified direct care workforce for Medicaid recipients. It sets up the group's structure, responsibilities, and reporting requirements.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Medicaid home- and community-based service consumers, direct care workers, provider organizations, and the general public in Maryland.
access_to_capital_summary: The program aims to improve the workforce and service access, which could indirectly impact small business access to capital through workforce stability and funding transparency.

Title: Maryland Collaborative to Improve Children's Oral Health Through School-Based Programs - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Maryland Collaborative to Improve Children's Oral Health Through School-Based Programs to study and make recommendations on ways to improve school-based dental programs; and requiring the Collaborative to submit an interim report by December 1, 2025, and a final report on its findings and recommendations by October 1, 2026.
bill_summary: This bill establishes a program to improve children's oral health in Maryland through school-based dental services, including the study and expansion of dental hygienist practices and school-based dental programs.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Children in Maryland, especially those in underserved communities, school health programs, dental providers, and families
access_to_capital_summary: The bill aims to improve access to dental services for children, which could indirectly impact small business owners providing dental services or supplies, but does not directly establish a financial program for capital access.

Title: State Public Transit Service and Stations - Exclusion for Assault and Bodily Injury
Synopsis: Providing that a person alleged by a public transit operator to have committed an assault or other intentional act causing bodily injury may be prohibited from using a State public transit service or entering a State public transit service station; requiring the Maryland Transit Administration to create a rider code of conduct and implement a comprehensive internal safety program to strengthen protection for operators and passengers; etc.
bill_summary: The bill allows individuals accused of assault or causing bodily injury on public transit or stations to continue using transit services and stations, with certain restrictions and an appeals process. It also requires the Maryland Transit Administration to create a rider code of conduct and implement a safety program to protect operators and passengers.
responsible_party: Maryland Transit Administration
stakeholders: Public transit riders, operators, and passengers in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's focus is on safety and conduct policies rather than direct financial support or capital access programs.

Title: Baltimore County - Alcoholic Beverages - Waiting Period After License Denial
Synopsis: Establishing in Baltimore County certain waiting periods for the application for or issuance of an alcoholic beverages license at a specific location if an application for a license at that location has been previously denied.
bill_summary: This bill establishes waiting periods in Baltimore County for applying for or receiving an alcoholic beverages license if a previous application at that location was denied. Specifically, it prohibits new applications for 1 year after a first denial and for 2 years after a second denial at the same location.
responsible_party: Baltimore County Alcoholic Beverages Licensing Board
stakeholders: Alcoholic beverage license applicants and businesses in Baltimore County
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's impact on access to capital is indirect, mainly affecting licensing timelines rather than financial access.

Title: Maryland Behavioral Health Crisis Response System โ Integration of 9โ8โ8 Suicide and Crisis Lifeline Network and Outcome Evaluations
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Behavioral Health Crisis Response System to have a State 9-8-8 Suicide and Crisis Lifeline, rather than a crisis communication center, in each jurisdiction; requiring each State 9-8-8 Suicide and Crisis Lifeline in the System to coordinate with the national 9-8-8 Suicide and Crisis Lifeline Network to provide supportive counseling, suicide prevention, crisis intervention, referrals to additional resources, and direct dispatch to other services as needed; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Maryland Behavioral Health Crisis Response System that includes a statewide 9-8-8 Suicide and Crisis Lifeline, coordinating with the national 9-8-8 network, and sets up evaluation and data collection processes to improve crisis services.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Individuals experiencing mental health crises and their families in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's focus is on crisis response services and data evaluation, not on providing direct access to capital for small businesses.

Title: Residential Condominium Unit Insurance - Lapses in Coverage - Prohibition on Denial
Synopsis: Prohibiting an insurer, with respect to residential condominium unit insurance, from refusing to issue a policy based solely on a prior lapse in coverage of the applicant if the lapse was due to an insurer's withdrawal from the market, the lapse in coverage was for no longer than 90 days, the applicant provides an affidavit that the applicant has not incurred any losses during the lapse in coverage, and the applicant provides any other documentation required by the insurer.
bill_summary: This bill prohibits property and casualty insurers from denying coverage for homeowner's or renter's residential condominium unit insurance solely due to a prior lapse in coverage, under certain conditions. It also allows insurers to require an affidavit from applicants regarding their loss history.
responsible_party: Maryland Insurance Administration
stakeholders: Homeowners, renters, and condominium unit owners in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill reduces barriers to obtaining insurance coverage after lapses, potentially improving access to necessary coverage for affected individuals.

Title: Real Property - Residential Rental Property - Pet Policy Disclosure (Pet Policy Transparency Act)
Synopsis: Requiring the landlord of a residential rental property to provide the property's pet policy on the property's website and as part of an application form for a rental unit on the property.
bill_summary: The bill requires landlords of residential rental properties in Maryland to disclose their pet policies on their website, in digital advertisements, and in rental applications. It also mandates landlords to provide specific pet policy details to prospective tenants before lease signing.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development or relevant local housing authorities
stakeholders: Residential tenants and landlords in Maryland, especially those with pets
access_to_capital_summary: The bill primarily focuses on disclosure of pet policies and does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Department of the Environment - Definition of Ecological Restoration
Synopsis: Defining the term "ecological restoration" as an activity undertaken with the goal of recovering, re-establishing, or enhancing a degraded, damaged, or destroyed ecosystem through improvements to physical, chemical, or biological characteristics or processes, returning natural or historical functions or services, or protecting or improving resiliency.
bill_summary: The bill defines 'ecological restoration' as activities aimed at recovering, re-establishing, or enhancing ecosystems that are degraded, damaged, or destroyed, and requires the Department of the Environment to update regulations to incorporate this definition.
responsible_party: Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Ecosystems, environmental agencies, conservation groups, and the general public interested in ecological health
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly establish a program or intervention that impacts access to capital for small businesses.

Title: Heating, Ventilation, Air-Conditioning, or Refrigeration Contractors - Equipment Sales
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person from knowingly offering to sell or selling heating, ventilation, air-conditioning, or refrigeration equipment to an individual that does not hold a certain license issued by the Board of Heating, Ventilation, Air-Conditioning, or Refrigeration Contractors except under certain circumstances; requiring certain persons to provide a certain notice to purchasers of heating, ventilation, air-conditioning, or refrigeration equipment at the time of sale; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes regulations for the sale of heating, ventilation, air-conditioning, and refrigeration equipment, including licensing requirements for sellers and reporting obligations, and prohibits unlicensed sales.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Heating, Ventilation, AirโConditioning, and Refrigeration Contractors
stakeholders: Heating, ventilation, air-conditioning, and refrigeration equipment sellers and consumers in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's focus on licensing and reporting requirements for equipment sellers may influence access to capital indirectly, but it does not directly create a program to improve capital access.

Title: Montgomery County - Municipal Authority to Regulate Structures - Alterations MC/PG 116-25
Synopsis: Altering the authority of a municipal corporation or governed special taxing district in Montgomery County to adopt an additional or stricter building requirement than is required by a State, regional, or county unit to regulate the construction, repair, or remodeling of certain structures on land zoned for single-family residential use to apply to buildings with four or fewer dwelling units and their accessory structures without regard to the zoning for the land where the building is located.
bill_summary: The bill alters the authority of municipal corporations or special taxing districts in Montgomery County to regulate the construction, repair, or remodeling of certain residential structures, specifically buildings with four or fewer units, regardless of zoning.
responsible_party: Montgomery County municipal government or special taxing districts
stakeholders: Residents and property owners of Montgomery County, especially those involved with small residential buildings and structures
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's impact on access to capital is indirect, primarily through regulatory changes that could influence construction and remodeling costs and processes.

Title: Corporations and Associations โ Revisions
Synopsis: Establishing a process for and certain exceptions to the transfer of assets that are collateral for securing a mortgage, pledge, or security interest without the approval of the stockholders; and repealing provisions of law specifying what shall be included in the articles of merger if a limited partnership or limited liability company is a party to the articles.
bill_summary: The bill revises laws related to corporations and associations in Maryland, including establishing a process for transferring assets that are collateral for securing a mortgage or security interest without requiring stockholder approval, and making amendments to rules about mergers and asset transfers.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Commerce or relevant state agency responsible for corporate regulation
