stakeholders: Mary Maryland corporations, associations, and their stakeholders, including investors and creditors
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's provisions could facilitate more flexible asset transfers and mergers, potentially impacting access to capital for businesses by streamlining processes.

Title: Baltimore City โ Alcoholic Beverages โ Authorizations and Revisions
Synopsis: Requiring the Board of License Commissioners for Baltimore City to impose a fee of not more than $250 for expedited processing of certain Class C per diem licenses; requiring the Board to adopt regulations related to the application process for Class C per diem licenses, including for the denial or revocation of the licenses, and limiting the number of licenses that may be issued to a person for the same location within a certain period of time; etc.
bill_summary: The bill makes various revisions to alcohol licensing rules in Baltimore City, including establishing fees for expedited license processing, setting regulations for certain license types, and authorizing new licenses in specific districts with conditions.
responsible_party: Board of License Commissioners for Baltimore City
stakeholders: Alcohol license applicants, Baltimore City residents, local businesses, and community organizations in Baltimore City
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly create a program that impacts access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Montgomery County - Speed Monitoring Systems - High-Risk Highways MC 17-25
Synopsis: Authorizing the placement and use of speed monitoring systems on highways in Montgomery County that are at high risk for certain motor vehicle crashes; prohibiting the placement and use of speed monitoring systems on certain highways in Montgomery County; requiring the fines collected by Montgomery County or by a municipal government in Montgomery County as a result of violations enforced by a speed monitoring system to be used to fund the study, design, and construction of certain safety-related projects; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the use of speed monitoring systems on high-risk highways in Montgomery County, Maryland, and specifies how fines collected from violations are to be used for safety projects. It also sets rules for the placement, use, and evaluation of these systems.
responsible_party: Montgomery County Department of Transportation or relevant local government agency
stakeholders: Motor vehicle drivers, residents, and local government in Montgomery County, Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill primarily focuses on traffic safety and the use of fines for safety projects, not on access to capital for small businesses.

Title: Montgomery County - Alcoholic Beverages - Class BD-BWL Licenses - Multiple Licenses MC 18-25
Synopsis: Increasing to two the number of Class BD-BWL alcoholic beverages licenses in Montgomery County that the same person may hold; and specifying that the establishment for which a second class BD-BWL license is issued shall have average daily receipts from the sale of food that exceed the average daily receipts from the sale of alcoholic beverages.
bill_summary: The bill increases the number of Class BDโBWL alcoholic beverage licenses that a single person can hold in Montgomery County, provided the establishment with the second license has higher food sales than alcohol sales, and clarifies the types of beverages that can be sold under the second license.
responsible_party: Montgomery County Alcoholic Beverages Board
stakeholders: Alcoholic beverage license holders and establishments in Montgomery County
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Family Law - Child Custody - Determinations
Synopsis: Authorizing the court, in determining legal and physical custody in certain child custody proceedings, to consider certain factors; and authorizing the court to modify a child custody or visitation order if the court determines that there has been a material change in circumstances since the issuance of the order that related to the needs of the child or the ability of the parents to meet those needs and that modifying the order is in the best interests of the child.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland laws regarding child custody and visitation, allowing courts to consider specific factors when determining custody arrangements, and clarifies circumstances under which custody or visitation orders can be modified, especially in cases involving abuse or significant changes in circumstances.
responsible_party: Maryland Judiciary or Family Court system
stakeholders: Children and their parents involved in custody and visitation disputes in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Housing Development Permits - Local Reporting Requirements (Maryland Housing Data Transparency Act)
Synopsis: Requiring certain counties to report information quarterly about certain housing development permits to the Department of Planning beginning January 1, 2027; authorizing municipalities to make certain quarterly reports to the Department regarding housing development permits issued by the municipality, beginning January 1, 2027; and requiring the Department of Planning to make certain permit information available on a public, interactive, and searchable website; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires Maryland counties with at least 150,000 residents to report quarterly on housing development permits, including detailed data on residential projects, to the Department of Planning. It also authorizes municipalities to do the same starting in 2027, and mandates the Department to publish this data publicly.
responsible_party: Department of Planning
stakeholders: Local jurisdictions, residents, housing developers, and policymakers interested in housing development data
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's focus on reporting and transparency could indirectly improve access to capital by providing better data for decision-making, but it does not directly establish a program to increase capital access.

Title: Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission - Membership, Reporting, Billing, and Planning (WSSC Planning and Reporting Act of 2025) MC/PG 105-25
Synopsis: Requiring one of the three commissioners from Montgomery County on the Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission to be the Director of the Montgomery County Department of Environmental Protection or a designee; requiring the Commission to submit a long range comprehensive financial plan in a certain manner; requiring the budget authorization for the Office of the Inspector General of the Commission to be approved independently and without involvement of Commission staff; etc.
bill_summary: This bill makes various reforms and reporting requirements for the Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission (WSSC), including changes to its membership, financial planning, transparency, customer engagement, and oversight processes. It also establishes new reporting, evaluation, and transparency measures for the agency.
responsible_party: Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission (WSSC) and related Maryland state agencies
stakeholders: Residents and customers of Montgomery County and Prince Georgeโs County, Maryland, and stakeholders involved in water utility management and oversight
access_to_capital_summary: The bill includes provisions for financial planning, stress testing, and independent evaluations that could impact the agency's financial stability and access to capital, but does not directly establish a new program for capital access.

Title: Property Tax - Credit for Law Enforcement Officer or Rescue Worker - Expansion to Judicial Officer
Synopsis: Authorizing the governing body of a county or municipal corporation or the Mayor and City Council of Baltimore City to provide a certain property tax credit to certain judicial officers, surviving spouses, or cohabitants; requiring the county or municipal corporation to define, by law, who is a correctional officer and judicial officer; and applying the Act retroactively to all taxable years beginning after June 30, 2022.
bill_summary: The bill expands property tax credits to include judicial officers, surviving spouses, and cohabitants of fallen or disabled public safety officers and judicial officers, allowing local governments to provide these credits retroactively.
responsible_party: Local governments (county or municipal corporations) in Maryland
stakeholders: Judicial officers, public safety officers, their spouses, cohabitants, and property owners in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The program could potentially reduce property tax burdens for eligible individuals, indirectly supporting their financial stability, but it does not directly impact access to capital for small businesses.

Title: Public and Nonpublic Schools - Student Elopement - Notice and Reporting Requirements (Ace's Law)
Synopsis: Requiring certain public and nonpublic schools to notify a parent or guardian if a student attempts or accomplishes an elopement, the act of leaving the school campus without permission; requiring certain schools and individualized education program teams to review and address with relevant stakeholders certain behavior in updating a student's individualized education program or behavior intervention plan; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires public and nonpublic schools in Maryland to notify parents or guardians if a student attempts or successfully elopes from the school campus. It establishes reporting requirements, review processes for students with behavioral plans, and creates an accountability system for schools to track and reduce elopement incidents.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Education
stakeholders: Students, parents, schools, and school districts in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill primarily focuses on safety and reporting procedures rather than direct access to capital for small businesses.

Title: Montgomery County - Board of Education - Student Member Compensation MC 7-25
Synopsis: Altering the compensation of the student member of the Montgomery County Board of Education.
bill_summary: This bill increases the compensation for the student member of the Montgomery County Board of Education, with specific salary amounts set for different years, and establishes a scholarship and stipend program for student members based on the current highest undergraduate tuition and fees.
responsible_party: Montgomery County Board of Education
stakeholders: Student members of the Montgomery County Board of Education and their higher education costs
access_to_capital_summary: The bill provides a scholarship and stipend program for student members, which could impact their access to funds for higher education.

Title: Child Abuse and Neglect - Reports and Records - Disclosure
Synopsis: Requiring a local director of a local department of social services or the Secretary of Human Services to disclose certain reports and records of child abuse and neglect within 30 days after receiving a request if certain conditions are met; requiring the Secretary to notify the State's Attorney's office of a request to disclose certain reports and records of child abuse and neglect; requiring the State's Attorney's office to be given 30 days during which the office is authorized to redact certain portions of the reports and records; etc.
bill_summary: This bill modifies the rules for disclosing reports and records of child abuse and neglect in Maryland, including timelines, conditions, and the scope of information that can be disclosed, especially in cases involving fatalities or near fatalities.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Human Services
stakeholders: Children and families involved in child abuse and neglect cases, child protective services, law enforcement, and legal entities
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Public Safety - Immigration Enforcement (Maryland Values Act)
Synopsis: Requiring federal law enforcement officers to notify certain individuals of federal immigration action at certain sensitive locations; prohibiting certain schools, libraries, and units of State or local government that operate at certain sensitive locations from allowing certain federal personnel access to areas not accessible to the general public, subject to certain exceptions; requiring the Attorney General to develop and publish certain guidance regarding immigration enforcement actions at certain sensitive locations; etc.
bill_summary: This bill enhances immigration enforcement restrictions and protections in Maryland. It prohibits entering into new immigration enforcement agreements, limits cooperation with federal immigration authorities, and requires the development of policies to protect sensitive locations from immigration enforcement activities. It also mandates the development of privacy procedures for personal records and geolocation data.
responsible_party: Maryland Attorney General and relevant state and local agencies
stakeholders: Immigrants, public service providers, schools, libraries, and government agencies in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill primarily focuses on immigration enforcement and privacy protections, with no direct programs aimed at increasing access to capital for small businesses.

Title: State Board of Cosmetologists - Licensing - Eyelash Extensions
Synopsis: Authorizing the State Board of Cosmetology to issue a limited license to provide eyelash extension services; altering the definition of "provide esthetic services" to include providing eyelash extension services; and requiring an applicant for a limited license to provide eyelash extension services to be at least 17 years old, have successfully completed a 9th grade education or equivalent, received certain training, and passed a practical and written examination.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland State Board of Cosmetologists to issue a limited license for providing eyelash extension services, expands the definition of esthetic services to include eyelash extensions, and establishes licensing, training, and operational rules for eyelash extension technicians and salons.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Cosmetologists
stakeholders: Cosmetologists, eyelash extension technicians, salons, and consumers receiving eyelash extension services
access_to_capital_summary: The bill could improve access to capital for small businesses and practitioners by formalizing licensing and training, potentially increasing legitimacy and customer trust.

Title: Montgomery County - School Bus Stops on Highways - Alterations MC 8-25
Synopsis: Applying certain provisions of law regarding school bus stops located on certain highways in Montgomery County to a school bus stop at a location for which at least 400 citations were issued in the preceding fiscal year to drivers traveling in the opposite direction of the bus stop; and prohibiting, beginning on December 31, 2028, locating a school bus stop on any highway with five or more undivided traffic lanes, except under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill modifies how traffic fines collected in Montgomery County are paid and used, directs that fines from certain traffic violations be paid directly to Montgomery County or the District Court, and allocates the funds for specific purposes such as constructing median dividers on highways. It also establishes new rules for school bus stops on highways in Montgomery County, including requirements for posting school crossing guards or traffic control devices at bus stops with high citation volumes.
responsible_party: Montgomery County Department of Transportation and Maryland State Highway Administration
stakeholders: Drivers, school children, Montgomery County residents, and local government agencies
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's impact on access to capital for small business owners is indirect, primarily through the allocation of traffic fine revenues for infrastructure projects.

Title: Department of Commerce - Montgomery County Agricultural Reserve Study MC 15-25
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of Commerce, in coordination with certain county agencies and organizations, to study economic development in and the tourist and visitor economy of the Montgomery County Agricultural Reserve and, on or before June 30, 2026, report its findings to the members of the Montgomery County Delegation to the General Assembly; and requiring the Department to make recommendations regarding policies and programs that can help promote and preserve the Montgomery County Agricultural Reserve.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Commerce to study the economic development and tourism impact of the Montgomery County Agricultural Reserve, and to report findings and recommendations to support the reserve and local small businesses that depend on tourism.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Commerce in coordination with Montgomery County agencies and organizations
stakeholders: Small businesses, recreation sites, historic sites, and residents in Montgomery County Agricultural Reserve and visitors/tourists
access_to_capital_summary: The program aims to understand and enhance the visitor economy, which could indirectly support small business access to capital, but does not directly provide capital or financial services.

Title: Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission - System Development Charge - Exemptions MC/PG 107-25
Synopsis: Requiring, rather than authorizing, the Montgomery County Council and the Prince George's County Council to grant exemptions from the system development charge imposed by the Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission for certain properties and projects located in Montgomery County; limiting the exemption to $80,000; altering the method by which the county councils establish eligibility for the exemptions; prohibiting the county councils from requiring that an applicant for an exemption own the property for which the exemption is sought; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Montgomery County and Prince George's County Councils to grant exemptions from the system development charge imposed by the Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission for certain properties and projects, with specific eligibility criteria and a first-come, first-served application process until a maximum annual limit is reached.
responsible_party: Montgomery County Council and Prince George's County Council
stakeholders: Property owners and developers in Montgomery County and Prince George's County, especially those involved in revitalization, affordable housing, community organizations, child care, and programs for disabled individuals.
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's provisions for exemptions could reduce costs for certain property owners, potentially improving access to capital for projects that qualify.

Title: Queen Anne's County - Municipalities - Speed Limits
Synopsis: Authorizing municipalities in Queen Anne's County to decrease the maximum speed limit to not less than 15 miles per hour on highways without performing an engineering and traffic investigation.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes municipalities in Queen Anne's County to reduce the maximum speed limit on highways to not less than 15 miles per hour without conducting an engineering and traffic investigation.
responsible_party: Municipalities in Queen Anne's County
stakeholders: Residents and motorists in Queen Anne's County and its municipalities
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Somerset County - Alcoholic Beverages - Liquor Tasting License
Synopsis: Establishing a liquor tasting license in Somerset County; authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Somerset County to issue the license to the holder of a Class A beer, wine, and liquor license; and establishing liquor tasting license fees.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a liquor tasting license in Somerset County, allowing holders of Class A beer, wine, and liquor licenses to permit consumers to taste liquor without charge, under specified conditions and quantities.
responsible_party: Board of License Commissioners for Somerset County
stakeholders: Liquor license holders and consumers in Somerset County
access_to_capital_summary: The program could facilitate small business growth by allowing license holders to promote their products through tastings, potentially increasing sales and customer engagement.

Title: Health Insurance - Coverage for Specialty Drugs
Synopsis: Prohibiting certain insurers, nonprofit health service plans, and health maintenance organizations from excluding coverage for certain specialty drugs that are administered or dispensed by a provider that is an in-network provider of covered medical oncology services and complies with State regulations for the administering and dispensing of specialty drugs, if the specialty drugs meet certain qualifications; and requiring the reimbursement rate for certain specialty drugs to meet certain criteria.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits certain health insurers and plans from excluding coverage for specific specialty drugs that are administered or dispensed by qualified providers, sets reimbursement standards for these drugs, and regulates pharmacy benefits managers' practices related to specialty drugs and pharmacy networks.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and Insurance Commission
stakeholders: Patients requiring specialty drugs, healthcare providers, insurers, pharmacy benefits managers, and small business owners in the pharmacy sector
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's impact on access to capital is indirect, primarily through regulation of reimbursement rates and pharmacy network practices, which could influence the financial stability of providers and pharmacy benefits managers.

Title: Maryland Developmental Disabilities Administration Waiver Advisory Council - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Maryland Developmental Disabilities Administration Waiver Advisory Council to advise and provide recommendations to the Developmental Disabilities Administration on system design, service delivery, and quality enhancement strategies for the Medicaid waiver programs operated by the Administration.
bill_summary: This bill establishes the Maryland Developmental Disabilities Administration Waiver Advisory Council to advise on system design, service delivery, and quality strategies for Medicaid waiver programs for individuals with developmental disabilities.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Individuals with developmental disabilities, their families, service providers, advocacy groups, and related state agencies
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly address access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Hospitals and Medical Professional Liability Insurers - Obstetric Services Policies (Doula and Birth Policy Transparency Act)
Synopsis: Requiring certain hospitals to adopt certain policies relating to obstetric services and to provide evidence to the Maryland Department of Health that the hospital has the policies; requiring the Maryland Department of Health to provide certain policies to the public on request; and requiring insurers that issue or deliver medical professional liability insurance policies in the State to provide the Maryland Department of Health, on request, with information regarding the insurer's policy regarding coverage of obstetric services.
bill_summary: The bill requires hospitals to adopt policies supporting doulas, informed consent for significant medical interventions, and transfer procedures for obstetric care. It also mandates insurers to provide information on obstetric coverage to the Maryland Department of Health.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Pregnant individuals, hospitals, doulas, and insurers in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill primarily focuses on policies and transparency related to obstetric services, with no direct funding or financial programs for small business capital access.

Title: Department of Social and Economic Mobility - Established
Synopsis: Establishing the Department of Social and Economic Mobility; providing for the Secretary of Social and Economic Mobility; providing the purpose of the Department is to provide support for units of State government, individuals, and businesses for the maintenance of social equity policies in the State; establishing the Department of Social and Economic Mobility Special Fund; requiring the Governor to include in the annual budget bill a certain appropriation from the Transportation Trust Fund to the Fund; etc.
bill_summary: This bill establishes the Maryland Department of Social Equity and Economic Mobility, consolidates various social equity programs and offices, and creates a special fund to support social equity initiatives, including those related to small, minority, and women-owned businesses and cannabis industry participation.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Social Equity and Economic Mobility
stakeholders: Individuals, small businesses, minority and women-owned businesses, and communities disproportionately impacted by the war on drugs in Maryland.
access_to_capital_summary: The bill creates programs and funds aimed at supporting social equity and minority business enterprises, which could significantly impact access to capital for these groups.

Title: Anne Arundel County - Alcoholic Beverages - License and Permit Distance Requirements
Synopsis: Authorizing the Board of Liquor Commissioners for Anne Arundel County to issue a certain dancing permit to the holder of a Class H beer and wine or beer, wine, and liquor license for a licensed premises located within 1,000 feet of a school located at the Annapolis Mall, rather than prohibiting the Board from doing so; and authorizing the Board to issue a new Class B beer and wine or beer, wine, and liquor license to an establishment located within 1,000 feet of a school located at the Annapolis Mall.
bill_summary: The bill relaxes restrictions on issuing certain alcohol licenses and permits within 1,000 feet of schools and places of worship in Anne Arundel County, allowing more flexibility for license issuance and permits near schools.
responsible_party: Anne Arundel County Board of Liquor Commissioners
stakeholders: Alcohol license holders, businesses near schools and places of worship, residents of Anne Arundel County
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Anne Arundel County - Alcoholic Beverages - Limited Special Event Permit
Synopsis: Authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Anne Arundel County to issue a limited special event permit to holders of certain alcoholic beverages licenses; and authorizing a permit holder to provide music, dancing, and other legal forms of entertainment.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the issuance of a limited cultural special event permit in Anne Arundel County, allowing license holders to provide cultural music, dancing, and entertainment on specific dates, with certain restrictions and fees.
responsible_party: Board of License Commissioners for Anne Arundel County
stakeholders: Alcoholic beverage license holders, cultural event organizers, residents of Anne Arundel County
access_to_capital_summary: The program could facilitate cultural events that may boost local businesses, but it does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Charles County - Off-Highway Recreational Vehicles - Regulation and Enforcement
Synopsis: Authorizing Charles County to regulate the operation of off-highway recreational vehicles in the county and to impound an off-highway recreational vehicle that is the subject of certain alleged motor vehicle violations.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Charles County to regulate the operation of off-highway recreational vehicles, including registration, age restrictions, and enforcement measures such as impoundment of vehicles involved in violations.
responsible_party: Charles County government
stakeholders: Off-highway recreational vehicle users in Charles County, local residents, law enforcement agencies
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Health Insurance - Provider Directory - Required Updates
Synopsis: Renaming "network directory" to be "provider directory" to conform to a certain federal law; altering the time period from 15 to 2 working days within which certain carriers are required to update the information that must be made available in the carrier's provider directory on the Internet; altering the information required to be included in a provider directory; requiring that a provider directory in printed form include a statement regarding the accuracy of the provider information; etc.
bill_summary: This bill updates regulations concerning health insurance provider directories, including renaming 'network directory' to 'provider directory', setting update frequency requirements, and establishing standards for accuracy and notification procedures.
responsible_party: Maryland Insurance Commissioner
stakeholders: Health insurance enrollees, health care providers, health care facilities, and health insurance carriers in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill primarily focuses on provider directory accuracy and transparency, with no direct impact on small business access to capital.

Title: Baltimore City - Office of the Sheriff - Neighborhood Services Unit
Synopsis: Establishing the Neighborhood Services Unit within the Office of the Sheriff of Baltimore City; requiring the Neighborhood Services Unit and the Board of License Commissioners of Baltimore City to work in partnership to enforce the alcoholic beverages laws of Baltimore City and to enter into a memorandum of understanding that specifies the respective roles and responsibilities of the parties and funding in connection with the partnership; expanding the authorized uses of certain revenue to include the Neighborhood Services Unit; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Neighborhood Services Unit within the Baltimore City Sheriff's Office, which will work in partnership with the Board of License Commissioners to enforce alcohol laws and perform other duties. It also details funding mechanisms, including revenue from certain surcharges.
responsible_party: Baltimore City Sheriff's Office and the Board of License Commissioners of Baltimore City
stakeholders: Residents of Baltimore City, small business owners involved in alcohol licensing, and community members impacted by law enforcement and licensing enforcement activities.
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's focus is on law enforcement and licensing enforcement, with no direct programs aimed at increasing access to capital for small businesses.

Title: Commercial Law - Credit Regulation - Earned Wage Access and Credit Modernization
Synopsis: Subjecting certain earned wage access products to the Maryland Consumer Loan Law and other provisions that regulate entities that provide consumer credit; restricting the acceptance of tips by certain lenders under certain circumstances; providing for the licensing or registration of certain entities offering earned wage access products with certain exemptions; regulating earned wage access service agreements; limiting the costs and fees associated with obtaining an earned wage access product; etc.
bill_summary: This bill regulates earned wage access products by subjecting them to consumer credit laws, establishing licensing requirements for providers, and setting rules for disclosures, fees, and consumer protections.
responsible_party: Maryland Office of Financial Regulation
stakeholders: Consumers seeking earned wage access and providers of earned wage access services in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's provisions primarily focus on consumer protections and licensing, with limited direct impact on small business access to capital.

Title: Environment - Managed Aquifer Recharge Pilot Program - Establishment
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person from performing groundwater augmentation except under certain circumstances; establishing the Managed Aquifer Recharge Pilot Program to regulate and evaluate the use of treated reclaimed water as a source for groundwater augmentation through managed aquifer recharge permits; requiring the demonstration facility to address a groundwater supply or quality problem that is anticipated to occur in the next 25 years; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Managed Aquifer Recharge Pilot Program in Maryland to test the use of treated reclaimed water for groundwater augmentation, including permitting, regulation, and monitoring of the process.
responsible_party: Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Groundwater users, environmental agencies, industrial water users, and communities affected by groundwater quality and supply issues
access_to_capital_summary: The program could improve access to capital for small businesses involved in water treatment and infrastructure development by providing a regulated testing environment and potential future expansion.

Title: Maryland Medical Assistance Program, Maryland Childrenโs Health Program, and Health Insurance โ Transfers to Special Pediatric Hospitals โ Prior Authorizations
Synopsis: Prohibiting the Maryland Medical Assistance Program, the Maryland Children's Health Program, managed care organizations, and certain health insurers, nonprofit health service plans, and health maintenance organizations from requiring prior authorization for a transfer to a special pediatric hospital.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits the Maryland Medical Assistance Program, Maryland Childrenโs Health Program, managed care organizations, and certain health insurers from requiring prior authorization for transfers to special pediatric hospitals, starting January 1, 2026.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Children under 22 years old and individuals with co-occurring physical and behavioral health conditions who need transfers to special pediatric hospitals
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's impact on access to capital is indirect, focusing on healthcare access rather than financial capital for small businesses.

Title: Prescription Drug Repository Program - Revisions
Synopsis: Altering the Prescription Drug Repository Program, including by allowing certain entities located in another state to participate in the Program as drop-off sites and repositories, including over-the-counter drugs under the Program, and altering the individuals who are eligible to receive drugs or medical supplies under the Program; and altering the persons for whom and the activities with respect to which certain immunity is provided under the Program.
bill_summary: This bill revises the Maryland Prescription Drug Repository Program to include participation by out-of-state entities as drop-off sites and repositories, allowing donation, dispensing, and disposal of prescription drugs, over-the-counter drugs, and medical supplies, with updated regulations and standards.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Pharmacy
stakeholders: Eligible patients, pharmacies, drop-off sites, medical supply donors, and out-of-state entities participating in the program
access_to_capital_summary: The program primarily facilitates donation and redistribution of drugs, not direct access to capital for small businesses.

Title: Vaccinations by Pharmacists and Health Insurance Coverage for Immunizations
Synopsis: Altering the vaccinations that a pharmacist may administer, subject to certain requirements, to an individual of at least a certain age; altering the vaccinations included in the minimum package of child wellness services for which certain health insurers and nonprofit health service plans are required to provide coverage to include those recommended by the Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention as of December 31, 2024.
bill_summary: The bill expands the vaccinations pharmacists can administer to include individuals aged 3 and above, and updates the list of vaccines. It also requires certain health insurance plans to cover a minimum package of child wellness services, including immunizations and developmental screenings.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and the Maryland Insurance Administration
stakeholders: Children, parents, healthcare providers, and health insurance policyholders in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill primarily focuses on healthcare services and insurance coverage, with no direct programs aimed at increasing access to capital for small businesses.

Title: Primary and Secondary Education - Youth-Centric Technology and Social Media Resource Guide
Synopsis: Requiring the National Center for School Mental Health at the University of Maryland School of Medicine, in consultation with the State Department of Education, to develop and publish a youth-centric technology and social media resource guide by the 2027-2028 school year; requiring the guide to be distributed, beginning with the 2027-2028 school year, to each public school and the parent teacher organization for each public school and posted on the websites of the Department and each county board; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the University of Maryland's National Center for School Mental Health, in consultation with the Maryland Department of Education, to develop and publish a youth-centric technology and social media resource guide for public school students, starting with the 2027-2028 school year. The guide aims to provide age-appropriate information and best practices for safe and informed use of technology and social media, and will be updated annually.
responsible_party: National Center for School Mental Health at the University of Maryland School of Medicine in consultation with the Maryland Department of Education
stakeholders: Public school students, parents, guardians, and educators in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The program is focused on providing information and guidance on technology use and safety, not on financial services or access to capital.

Title: Natural Resources - Vessels - Carbon Monoxide Warning Labels (Matthew's Law)
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person from operating a gasoline-powered vessel manufactured after July 31, 2007, that has accommodation spaces, swim platforms, or aft lounging areas on the waters of the State unless the vessel has carbon monoxide warning labels affixed in conspicuous locations in the vicinity of both the transom and the helm of the vessel; and prohibiting the Department of Natural Resources from imposing a penalty on a person that violates the Act.
bill_summary: This bill prohibits the operation of certain gasoline-powered vessels with specific features unless they have carbon monoxide warning labels affixed in designated locations. It also states that the Department of Natural Resources cannot impose penalties for violations.
responsible_party: Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Operators of gasoline-powered vessels with accommodation spaces, swim platforms, or aft lounging areas in Maryland waters
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Garrett County - Bids and Contracts - Advertisement Exceptions
Synopsis: Providing that, in Garrett County, a certain requirement to advertise for bids does not apply to a certain contract for goods or services procured on an as-needed basis over time or for certain vehicles.
bill_summary: This bill exempts Garrett County from the requirement to advertise for bids for certain contracts, specifically for goods or services procured on an as-needed basis over time or for certain vehicles, allowing for more flexible procurement processes.
responsible_party: Garrett County Government
stakeholders: Garrett County government, vendors, and residents of Garrett County
access_to_capital_summary: The bill potentially simplifies procurement processes for Garrett County, which could indirectly impact small business access to capital by reducing administrative barriers.

Title: Caroline County - Alcoholic Beverages - Special Event Venue License and Multiple Event Licenses
Synopsis: Establishing the special event venue beer, wine, and liquor license in Caroline County; authorizing the Board of License Commissioners of Caroline County to issue the license to the owner of a venue with a certain zoning classification; authorizing holders of certain multiple event licenses in Caroline County to store alcoholic beverages on the licensed premises between individual events in a certain manner; requiring the license holder to keep complete records of all alcoholic beverages purchased and sold on the premises; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a new special event venue license for alcohol sales in Caroline County, allowing venues with certain zoning to sell beer, wine, and liquor during specified events. It also authorizes the issuance of multiple event licenses for up to 40 days per year, with provisions for storing alcohol between events and record-keeping requirements.
responsible_party: Caroline County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Venue owners, event organizers, and attendees in Caroline County
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's impact on access to capital is indirect, primarily affecting venue owners and event organizers by enabling them to hold multiple events and sell alcohol, which could increase revenue and financial opportunities.

Title: Anne Arundel County - Property Tax - Day Care Centers and Child Care Centers
Synopsis: Exempting personal property used in connection with certain large family child care homes from valuation and taxation in Anne Arundel County; authorizing the governing body of Anne Arundel County or the governing body of a municipal corporation in Anne Arundel County to grant, by law, a property tax credit against the real property tax owed on the portion of real property used for certain child care centers and day care centers; etc.
bill_summary: The bill provides property tax exemptions and credits for personal property and real estate used in connection with large family child care homes, child care centers, and day care centers in Anne Arundel County.
responsible_party: Anne Arundel County government or municipal corporations within Anne Arundel County
stakeholders: Child care providers, families using child care services, and the local government of Anne Arundel County
access_to_capital_summary: The bill mainly offers tax relief and does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Department of General Services - Assessment of State-Owned Facilities - Child Care Centers
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of General Services to conduct an assessment of facilities owned by the State and operated by the 16 State agencies the Department supports to evaluate whether the facility or a portion of the facility would be suitable to lease to a child care center;  requiring the Department to report to the General Assembly the results of the assessment and a description of whether each facility is suitable to lease to a child care center by December 1, 2026; and requiring the report to be published on the Department's website.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of General Services to assess all state-owned facilities operated by 16 state agencies to determine if they are suitable for leasing to child care centers. The department must report the findings to the General Assembly and publish the report online by December 1, 2026.
responsible_party: Department of General Services
stakeholders: Child care providers, families seeking child care, state agencies, and children in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The program has the potential to increase access to suitable facilities for child care providers, thereby improving their ability to access capital for expansion or operation.

Title: Security Guards and Security Guard Employers - Registration, Certification, and Regulation
Synopsis: Providing that a cannabis agent who is employed to provide security services for a cannabis licensee or cannabis registrant as a security guard or by a security guard agency is not required to obtain a State or national criminal history records check if the cannabis agent is authorized to provide security guard services; altering the definition of "security guard employer" for purposes of certain provisions of law to exclude video lottery facilities, sports wagering facility licensees, and health care facilities; etc.
bill_summary: The bill modifies regulations concerning cannabis agents and security guards, including exemptions from criminal background checks for certain cannabis agents providing security services, and updates definitions and regulations for security guard employers and agencies. It also sets the effective date for these changes as October 1, 2025.
responsible_party: Maryland State Government, specifically the Maryland Medical Cannabis Commission and the Maryland Department of Labor, Licensing and Regulation
stakeholders: Cannabis licensees, security guard agencies, security guards, and cannabis agents in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Health Insurance - Provider Panels - Credentialing for Behavioral Health Care Professionals
Synopsis: Altering the providers of certain community-based health services that a carrier is prohibited from rejecting for participation on the carrier's provider panel; altering the period of time in which certain carriers are required to accept or deny certain social workers, counselors, and psychology associates for participation on the carrier's provider panel to within 60 days after the date a carrier receives a completed application.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the credentialing process for behavioral health care professionals seeking to participate in health insurance provider panels in Maryland. It prohibits rejection of certain community-based providers based on scope of practice and sets specific timelines for acceptance or rejection of applications.
responsible_party: Maryland Insurance Administration
stakeholders: Behavioral health care professionals and health insurance providers in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's focus is on credentialing procedures and does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Health Insurance - Required Coverage - Hearing Aids
Synopsis: Altering the circumstances under which certain insurers, nonprofit health service plans, and health maintenance organizations are required to provide coverage for medically appropriate and necessary hearing aids for adults to require coverage if the hearing aid is ordered, fitted, and dispensed by a licensed hearing aid dispenser.
bill_summary: The bill requires certain health insurance providers in Maryland to cover medically necessary hearing aids for adults, with specific conditions on dispensing and cost limits, starting January 1, 2026.
responsible_party: Health insurance providers in Maryland
stakeholders: Adults with hearing impairments in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill primarily focuses on insurance coverage for hearing aids and does not directly impact access to capital for small businesses.

Title: Lead Testing and Inspections - Falsifying Information - Penalty
Synopsis: Establishing a civil penalty not exceeding $50,000 for a person who falsifies information that is submitted in a report of the results of lead-contaminated dust testing or visual inspection of an affected property.
bill_summary: This bill establishes penalties for falsifying information in lead testing and inspection reports, including civil penalties up to $50,000 and other enforcement measures.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Property owners, tenants, and lead testing/inspection professionals in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Vehicle Laws - Driver's Licenses - Electronic Credentials (Maryland Mobile ID Enhancement Act)
Synopsis: Authorizing the Motor Vehicle Administration to enter into an agreement to facilitate the issuance, use, and verification of electronic credentials through a national association of motor vehicle agencies; and authorizing an individual who will operate a rented vehicle to use a certain electronic credential showing a representation of a valid driver's license, instead of a driver's license, to rent the vehicle.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration to issue and verify electronic driver credentials, which can be used in place of physical driver's licenses, especially for renting vehicles. It also establishes agreements for the use of these electronic credentials across states and federal agencies.
responsible_party: Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration
stakeholders: Drivers, vehicle rental companies, and state agencies
access_to_capital_summary: The bill primarily focuses on electronic credentials for driver verification and does not directly impact access to capital for small businesses.

Title: Vehicle Equipment - Portable Variable Messaging Signs - Authorization
Synopsis: Authorizing a tow truck to display a portable variable messaging sign mounted on the tow truck while at the scene of a crash or a disabled vehicle; and requiring the portable variable messaging sign to conform to the standards established in the manual on uniform traffic control devices adopted by the State Highway Administration and display only messages approved by the Administration.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes tow trucks to display portable variable messaging signs at the scene of crashes or disabled vehicles, provided the signs meet certain standards and are approved by the Maryland State Highway Administration.
responsible_party: Maryland State Highway Administration
stakeholders: Tow truck operators, emergency responders, drivers involved in crashes or disabled vehicles, and the general public
access_to_capital_summary: The program could improve safety and communication at crash scenes, potentially aiding small business owners who operate tow trucks or related services.

Title: Civil Actions - Child Sexual Abuse
Synopsis: Altering certain provisions relating to the award of noneconomic damages to a claimant in an action for child sexual abuse; altering certain provisions relating to the liability of the State under the Maryland Tort Claims Act and of a local government under the Local Government Tort Claims Act for certain claims of child sexual abuse; and requiring the Maryland Judiciary to report to the General Assembly by January 31, 2027, and each year thereafter, on the amount of each award and a summary of the sexual abuse claims related to the award.
bill_summary: This bill extends the statute of limitations for filing civil claims of child sexual abuse, sets limits on damages, and adjusts liability and immunity rules for the state, local governments, and school boards related to child sexual abuse claims, especially those involving minors.
responsible_party: Maryland Judiciary and State Insurance Commissioner
stakeholders: Victims of child sexual abuse, state and local government entities, school boards, and insurance providers
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's focus on damages limits and liability does not directly impact small business access to capital.

Title: Health Care Facilities - Hospitals and Freestanding Birthing Centers - Perinatal Care Standards
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Health, in coordination with the Maryland Institute for Emergency Medical Services Systems, to adopt regulations establishing minimum perinatal care standards for hospitals that meet or exceed the Maryland Perinatal System Standards for each hospital that provides obstetrical services; and requiring each hospital that provides obstetrical services and freestanding birthing centers, as a condition of licensure, to comply with certain minimum perinatal care standards.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Health, in coordination with the Maryland Institute for Emergency Medical Services Systems, to adopt regulations establishing minimum perinatal care standards for hospitals providing obstetrical services and for freestanding birthing centers. These standards must meet or exceed the Maryland Perinatal System Standards and are a condition for licensure.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Hospitals, freestanding birthing centers, pregnant women, and newborns in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's focus on establishing care standards is likely to improve quality and safety, but it does not directly create a program that impacts access to capital for small businesses.

Title: Howard County - Alcoholic Beverages - Class D Licenses - Delivery
Synopsis: Applying certain provisions of law relating to the delivery of alcoholic beverages in Howard County to a holder or an employee of a holder of a Class D license.
bill_summary: The bill allows holders or employees of Class D alcohol licenses in Howard County to deliver alcoholic beverages within the county, with specific requirements for age verification and documentation.
responsible_party: Howard County Alcoholic Beverages Board
stakeholders: Alcohol license holders, employees, and consumers in Howard County
access_to_capital_summary: The bill facilitates alcohol sales and delivery, potentially increasing revenue for license holders, but does not directly impact access to capital for small businesses.

Title: Support and Protections for Individuals Affected by Federal Actions (Protect Our Federal Workers Act)
Synopsis: Renaming the Federal Government Shutdown Employee Assistance Loan Fund to be the Federal Government Employee Assistance Loan Fund; authorizing funds appropriated to the Catastrophic Event Account to be expended to assist in funding costs connected to a relocation, closure, or mass layoff of a unit of the federal government; establishing the Expedited Hiring Program in the Department of Budget and Management; authorizing an appointing authority to recruit for certain vacant positions in State government; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Federal Government Employee Assistance Loan Fund to provide loans to Maryland residents who are federal employees affected by government shutdowns or layoffs, and expands the powers of the Attorney General to address federal actions impacting residents. It also creates an Expedited Hiring Program for state jobs, modifies the Catastrophic Event Account to include federal shutdowns and layoffs, and authorizes transfers of funds to support these initiatives.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor and the Office of the Attorney General
stakeholders: Federal government employees in Maryland, federal contractors, Maryland residents affected by federal shutdowns or layoffs
access_to_capital_summary: The bill has a high potential to directly impact small business owners and federal employees' access to capital through the loan fund and related programs.

Title: Courts - Parental Accommodations
Synopsis: Requiring circuit courthouses in the State, constructed or renovated on or after October 1, 2025, to maintain on its premises a private lactation room to be used by certain individuals; providing that breast-feeding mothers and certain individuals caring for children under 3 years old may be excused from jury service; and requiring the Maryland Judiciary to collect certain information on jury service excusals and report annually to the Maryland General Assembly beginning by December 31, 2025.
bill_summary: The bill requires certain Maryland circuit courthouses to have lactation rooms for nursing mothers and individuals caring for young children, and allows breastfeeding mothers and caregivers of children under 4 to be excused from jury service. It also mandates the Maryland Judiciary to collect and report data on jury service excusals.
responsible_party: Maryland Judiciary
stakeholders: Breastfeeding mothers, caregivers of young children, jurors, and the general public using courthouses
access_to_capital_summary: The bill primarily focuses on accommodations and legal procedures, with no direct impact on access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Juveniles - Truancy Reduction Pilot Programs - Report
Synopsis: Requiring the Chief Justice of the Supreme Court of Maryland to report annually by November 1 to the General Assembly on the Truancy Reduction Pilot Program; and requiring the report to include the number of Truancy Reduction Pilot Programs established in State, the number of participants in each pilot program; information on the outcomes of the participants in each program, and recommendations to improve the function of the current program.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Judiciary to report on the impact and effectiveness of Truancy Reduction Pilot Programs, including data on student GPA, graduation rate, and truancy rate, and to make recommendations on their effectiveness in Baltimore City. The report is due by December 1, 2026.
responsible_party: Maryland Judiciary
stakeholders: Students involved in truancy reduction programs, schools, and families in Maryland, especially in Baltimore City.
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Local Government - Hiring and Promotion Preferences for Veterans and Spouses of Service Members and Veterans (Families Serve Act)
Synopsis: Authorizing counties and municipalities to grant a preference in hiring and promotion to eligible veterans, spouses of an eligible service member, spouses of certain eligible veterans and eligible service members, and surviving spouses of deceased eligible veterans; and authorizing counties and municipalities to adopt a local law that allows for the application of a certain credit on a selection test for eligible spouses, eligible veterans, and certain spouses and surviving spouses.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Maryland counties and municipalities to adopt laws that give hiring and promotion preferences to veterans, their spouses, and surviving spouses, including applying test score credits for these groups.
responsible_party: Counties and municipalities in Maryland
stakeholders: Veterans, spouses of veterans, surviving spouses of deceased veterans, and local government employment agencies
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's focus is on employment preferences and test score credits, which may indirectly impact access to employment opportunities but does not directly address access to capital.

Title: Maryland Small Business Innovation Research and Technology Transfer Incentive Program - Alterations
Synopsis: Repealing certain provisions of law specifying certain limitations on awards or investments provided to certain small businesses under the Maryland Small Business Innovation Research and Technology Transfer Incentive Program.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the Maryland Small Business Innovation Research and Technology Transfer Incentive Program by repealing certain limitations on awards or investments to small businesses, allowing for increased support, especially for those engaged in research related to public health crises.
responsible_party: The Maryland Department of Commerce (The Corporation)
stakeholders: Small businesses engaged in research and development, especially those involved in public health crisis response
access_to_capital_summary: The bill increases the potential for small businesses to receive larger awards and investments, thereby improving their access to capital.

Title: Economic Development - Western Maryland Economic Future Investment Board and Senator George C. Edwards Fund - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the composition of the Western Maryland Economic Future Investment Board; providing that the Executive Director serves as a nonvoting member of the Board, but may vote to break a tie; providing criteria for the awarding of grant and loan funding to include the creation or retention of at least 25 jobs, creation or retention of at least 10 jobs each with wages that exceed 120% of the State minimum wage, or creates significant population growth in the area in which the project is located; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Western Maryland Economic Future Investment Board and the Senator George C. Edwards Fund to promote economic development and create jobs in Western Maryland through grants and loans for infrastructure and business projects.
responsible_party: The Council (likely the Maryland Department of Commerce or a designated economic development agency)
stakeholders: Businesses, local governments, and residents in Western Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The program has a high potential to directly impact small business owners' access to capital by providing targeted grants and loans for economic development projects.

Title: Motor Vehicles โ Rental Fleet Vehicles โ Registration
Synopsis: Establishing an alternative registration process for rental fleet vehicles; requiring the Motor Vehicle Administration to issue distinctive registration plates for rental vehicles registered under the alternative process; and requiring, in addition to an annual registration fee, the owner of a registered rental vehicle to pay a one-time initial registration fee not to exceed $8.50 when the new registration plates are issued.
bill_summary: The bill establishes an alternative registration process for rental fleet vehicles in Maryland, including the issuance of distinctive registration plates and a one-time initial registration fee.
responsible_party: Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration
stakeholders: Rental fleet vehicle owners and rental car companies in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Transportation-Related Tolls - Installment Payment Plans
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Transportation Authority to establish programs to offer installment payment plans for the payment of certain tolls, in excess of $300.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Transportation Authority and the Department of Transportation to establish income-based installment payment plans for paying tolls, civil penalties, and fines related to transportation violations.
responsible_party: Maryland Transportation Authority and Department of Transportation
stakeholders: Individuals with unpaid tolls, civil penalties, and fines in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The program has a high potential to improve access to capital for individuals struggling to pay transportation-related fines and tolls.

Title: Land Use and Real Property - Accessory Dwelling Units - Requirements and Prohibitions
Synopsis: Establishing the policy of the State to promote and encourage the creation of accessory dwelling units on land with a single-family detached dwelling unit as the primary dwelling unit in order to meet the housing needs of the citizens of the State; requiring, on or before October 1, 2026, the legislative body of certain counties or municipal corporations to adopt a local law authorizing the development of accessory dwelling units on land with certain single-family detached dwelling units subject to certain requirements; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires Maryland counties and municipal corporations to adopt laws allowing the development of accessory dwelling units (ADUs) on land zoned for single-family detached homes, with specific requirements and restrictions. It also establishes policies for ADU approval, impact fees, utility connections, and treatment of ADUs as separate lots for voting and assessments.
responsible_party: Local legislative bodies of Maryland counties and municipal corporations
stakeholders: Homeowners, potential ADU developers, residents in single-family zones, homeowners associations
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's provisions could facilitate the development of ADUs, potentially increasing access to capital for small property owners and developers by reducing barriers and costs.

Title: Local Finance - Special Taxing Districts - Anne Arundel County Erosion Prevention Projects and Erosion Control Projects
Synopsis: Requiring interest earnings on money deposited for a certain taxing and assessment district to be credited to that district; specifying that a certain provision of law governing the petition process for the construction of an erosion prevention project or erosion control project in a certain district in Anne Arundel County does not apply to certain planning, permitting, or cost estimate activities; authorizing certain entities to use tax funds for upkeep or reconstruction of an existing shore erosion control project; etc.
bill_summary: The bill modifies laws related to erosion prevention and control projects in Maryland, particularly in Anne Arundel County. It clarifies how interest earnings on funds are credited, allows the use of tax funds for maintenance of existing erosion control projects, and adjusts procedures for project planning and approval.
responsible_party: Local government, specifically county district councils and the entity administering shore erosion control districts
stakeholders: Property owners and residents in districts affected by shoreline erosion in Maryland, especially in Anne Arundel County
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's provisions could facilitate access to funds for erosion control projects, potentially easing financial barriers for property owners and districts.

Title: Prince George's County - Chesapeake and Atlantic Coastal Bays Critical Area Protection Program - Cutting or Clearing Trees MC/PG 113-25
Synopsis: Providing that, in Prince George's County, to enforce a certain violation involving the clearing or cutting of trees in the Chesapeake and Atlantic Coastal Bays Critical Area, the Prince George's County Department of Permitting, Inspections, and Enforcement must record a lien on property that is the subject of the violation in a certain manner; establishing certain limits, prohibitions, requirements, and authorizations on actions certain local jurisdictions may take if a lien is not recorded as required by the Act; etc.
bill_summary: The bill provides legal protections for property owners in Prince George's County regarding the cutting or clearing of trees in the Chesapeake and Atlantic Coastal Bays Critical Area, including procedures for enforcement, liens, and reimbursement for costs related to violations, with certain retroactive applications and temporary effects.
responsible_party: Prince George's County government and the MarylandโNational Capital Park and Planning Commission
stakeholders: Property owners and local government in Prince George's County
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: State Government - Equal Access to Public Services for Individuals With Limited English Proficiency and Individuals With Disabilities
Synopsis: Requiring the Governor's Office of Immigrant Affairs and the Department of Disabilities to convene the Maryland Language Advisory Group, by January 1, 2026, to make findings and recommendations on oversight, monitoring, investigation, and enforcement of certain provisions of law relating to equal access to public services for certain individuals; altering provisions of law relating to equal access to public services for individuals with limited English proficiency to include individuals with disabilities; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires Maryland state agencies to develop and implement language access plans to ensure individuals with limited English proficiency and disabilities have equal access to public services. It establishes oversight, monitoring, and enforcement mechanisms, including the creation of an advisory group, and allocates funding starting in fiscal year 2027.
responsible_party: Governorโs Office of Immigrant Affairs and the Department of Disabilities
stakeholders: Individuals with limited English proficiency and disabilities in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's focus is on access to public services and language assistance, not on access to capital for small businesses.

Title: State Board of Professional Counselors and Therapists - Temporary Telehealth Licenses - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing a temporary telehealth license to be issued by the State Board of Professional Counselors and Therapists authorizing the holder to provide clinical professional counseling services only to a student attending an institution of higher education in the State if the student and out-of-state licensed professional counselor have a previously established relationship that has existed for at least 6 months; limiting the term of the temporary license to 6 months; and prohibiting the renewal of a temporary licensed issued under the Act.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland State Board of Professional Counselors and Therapists to issue temporary telehealth licenses to out-of-state licensed professional counselors, allowing them to provide counseling services via telehealth to students enrolled in Maryland's institutions of higher education under specific conditions.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Professional Counselors and Therapists
stakeholders: Students enrolled in Maryland institutions of higher education and out-of-state licensed professional counselors
access_to_capital_summary: The bill primarily focuses on licensing and telehealth practice regulations, with no direct impact on access to capital for small businesses.

Title: Maryland State Department of Education - Publicly Funded Prekindergarten - Analysis and Report (Mixed Delivery Model Viability Act)
Synopsis: Requiring the State Department of Education to convene a workgroup to conduct an analysis of the mixed delivery, publicly funded prekindergarten system established under the Blueprint for Maryland's Future; and requiring the workgroup to submit a final report, by December 31, 2027, to the Accountability and Implementation Board and the General Assembly on any changes made by the Department in response to the recommendations in its interim report, and any additional recommendations for changes to the prekindergarten system; etc.
bill_summary: This bill requires the Maryland State Department of Education to form a workgroup to analyze the mixed delivery, publicly funded prekindergarten system, including private and public providers, to improve efficiency, equity, and quality.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: Prekindergarten children, parents, private and public prekindergarten providers, child care providers, and policymakers in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's focus is on analyzing and improving the prekindergarten system, not directly providing capital or funding, so the impact on access to capital is limited.

Title: Public Health - Report on Establishing a Directory of Home Health Care Providers
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Health, in consultation with certain stakeholders, to submit a report on the feasibility of establishing and maintaining an online directory of home health care providers to certain committees of the General Assembly by December 31, 2025.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Health to report on the feasibility of creating an online directory of home health care providers in the state, including details on what information should be included and how it could support consumers and workforce development.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Individuals seeking home health care services, home health care providers, and related agencies in Maryland.
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's focus is on establishing a directory and improving information access, with some support for workforce development, but it does not directly create a program that impacts access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Disability Services - Adapted Vehicle Access Pilot Program - Established
Synopsis: Establishing the Adapted Vehicle Access Pilot Program to provide adapted vehicles to individuals who require a mobility aid; and requiring the Department of Disabilities to implement and administer the Program, request, apply for, and facilitate certain donations to the Program, study the impacts of the Program, and report to the Governor and the General Assembly on the Program on or before December 1, 2028.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Adapted Vehicle Access Pilot Program to provide adapted vehicles to individuals who require a wheelchair or mobility aid, managed by the Department of Disabilities. It includes provisions for requesting donations, studying the program's impacts, and reporting on its outcomes.
responsible_party: Department of Disabilities
stakeholders: Individuals who require adapted vehicles for mobility, especially those in areas with limited public transportation access
access_to_capital_summary: The program has the potential to significantly improve access to adapted vehicles for individuals with mobility needs, thereby enhancing their independence and employment opportunities.

Title: Howard County - Alcoholic Beverages - Class MT (Movie Theater) License
Synopsis: Establishing a Class MT (movie theater) beer, wine, and liquor license in Howard County; authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Howard County to issue the license to the owner of a movie theater who holds a crowd control training certification; authorizing a license holder to sell beer, wine, and liquor to certain patrons at retail for on-premises consumption; and authorizing the Board to set certain limitations on and requirements for the license.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a new Class MT (movie theater) license in Howard County that allows movie theaters to sell beer, wine, and liquor for on-premises consumption to patrons who have purchased tickets to movies.
responsible_party: Howard County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Movie theater owners and patrons in Howard County
access_to_capital_summary: The program could potentially increase revenue for movie theaters, but does not directly impact access to capital for small businesses.

Title: Baltimore City - AIDS Prevention Sterile Needle and Syringe Exchange Pilot Program - Revisions
Synopsis: Renaming the AIDS Prevention Sterile Needle and Syringe Exchange Pilot Program to be the HIV Prevention Syringe Services Program; altering the duties of the Program to provide for the safe distribution of syringes and  hypodermic needles and account for the number of hypodermic needles and syringes exchanged and distributed by the Baltimore City Health Department; altering the membership and duties of the Program's oversight committee; altering the immunity provided to Program staff and participants; etc.
bill_summary: The bill renames the existing AIDS Prevention Sterile Needle and Syringe Exchange Pilot Program to the HIV Prevention Syringe Services Program in Baltimore City, and makes various changes to its structure, oversight, and procedures, including expanding its scope to include education, referrals, and data collection related to HIV and drug use.
responsible_party: Baltimore City Health Department
stakeholders: Injecting drug users, public health officials, community organizations in Baltimore City
access_to_capital_summary: The program primarily focuses on health services and harm reduction rather than direct financial support or capital access for small businesses.

Title: State Personnel - Paid Family and Medical Leave
Synopsis: Requiring the Secretary of Budget and Management and the governing body of a public institution of higher education adopt regulations governing paid family and medical leave benefits for Executive Branch employees; establishing certain parameters for the paid family and medical leave; authorizing, beginning July 1, 2026, Executive Branch employees to submit a request for paid family and medical leave in accordance with established procedures; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes paid family and medical leave benefits for employees in the Maryland State Executive Branch, including regulations, eligibility, and procedures for requesting leave, starting July 1, 2026.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Budget and Management
stakeholders: Employees in the Maryland State Executive Branch
access_to_capital_summary: The program could improve access to capital for small business owners by providing paid leave, reducing financial strain during leave periods.

Title: Medical Records - Notice of Destruction - Method
Synopsis: Requiring that notice of the destruction of medical records be provided by first-class mail or by e-mail, rather than by both methods; and providing that if notice is provided by e-mail and no response or delivery receipt is obtained from the e-mail address to which notice was provided, the health care provider shall provide notice via first-class mail at least 10 days before the date on which the record is to be destroyed.
bill_summary: The bill updates the process for notifying patients about the destruction of their medical records, changing the notification method to either first-class mail or email, but not both, unless certain circumstances apply.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health or healthcare providers responsible for record management
stakeholders: Patients and healthcare providers in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Financial Institutions - Consumer Credit - Application of Licensing Requirements (Maryland Secondary Market Stability Act of 2025)
Synopsis: Providing that certain provisions of law governing the licensing of providers of certain financial services in the State do not apply to a certain trust that acquires or is assigned a certain mortgage loan under certain circumstances; establishing the Maryland Licensing Workgroup to study and make recommendations on licensing requirements for persons that provide financial services in the State; and requiring the Workgroup to report to the Governor and the General Assembly by December 31, 2025.
bill_summary: The bill clarifies licensing exemptions for certain mortgage and installment loan providers, establishes a Maryland Licensing Workgroup to study and recommend licensing requirements for financial service providers, and makes related legal and procedural changes.
responsible_party: Maryland Office of Financial Regulation
stakeholders: Mortgage lenders, installment loan providers, consumers, financial service providers in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's impact on access to capital is indirect, mainly through regulatory clarifications and recommendations, with no direct program providing capital.
