Title: Prior Authorizations of State Debt - Alterations
Synopsis: Amending certain prior authorizations of State Debt to change the names of certain grantees, alter the authorized uses of certain grants, and extend the termination date of certain grants.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes numerous grants and funding for various public projects, including infrastructure, community centers, health facilities, arts centers, and revitalization efforts across Maryland, with most grants set to terminate or be eligible for review after June 1, 2032.
responsible_party: Various Maryland state agencies, including the Department of Housing and Community Development, University System of Maryland, and local government agencies.
stakeholders: Communities, health care providers, educational institutions, cultural organizations, and local governments across Maryland.
access_to_capital_summary: The bill primarily allocates grants for public projects and does not directly establish a program to improve access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Wicomico County Board of Education - Election of Members, Student Member, and Compensation
Synopsis: Altering, beginning with the general election in 2026, the districts from which certain members of the Wicomico County Board of Education are elected; adding at least one student member from the 11th or 12th grade in good standing and regularly enrolled in the public school system to the county board for purposes of advising the county board on the thoughts and feelings of students in the County public schools; and providing that the members of the county board are entitled to certain compensation and reimbursement.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the composition and election process of the Wicomico County Board of Education, adds a student member to the board, and sets compensation and reimbursement rules for members.
responsible_party: Wicomico County Board of Education
stakeholders: Students, residents of Wicomico County, and local educational community
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Gaming - Sports Wagering Facilities - Request for Relocation
Synopsis: Authorizing certain sports wagering facility licensees to submit a written request to the State Lottery and Gaming Control Commission to relocate the sports wagering facility if the facility was originally issued a Class B sports wagering facility license on or before September 30, 2023, and the new location is in the same county, complies with certain location requirements, and is approved by the Sports Wagering Application Review Commission.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes certain sports wagering facility licensees in Maryland to submit requests to relocate their facilities within the same county, subject to specific conditions and approvals.
responsible_party: Maryland State Lottery and Gaming Control Commission
stakeholders: Sports wagering facility licensees and the sports betting industry in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners, as it mainly changes relocation rules for existing sports wagering facilities.

Title: Barbers and Cosmetologists - License Qualifications - Domestic Violence Awareness Training
Synopsis: Requiring the State Board of Barbers and the State Board of Cosmetologists, beginning October 1, 2025, to require as a condition for licensure and initial renewal of a license an applicant or a licensee to complete certain training in domestic violence awareness; requiring the Maryland Department of Labor to approve certain domestic violence awareness training that is offered in person and virtually, includes guidance on certain topics, and has a duration of at least 1 hour; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland State Board of Barbers and the State Board of Cosmetologists to include a one-hour domestic violence awareness training as a qualification for licensing and license renewal for barbers and cosmetologists.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor, State Board of Barbers, State Board of Cosmetologists
stakeholders: Barbers, cosmetologists, and their clients in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The program is focused on licensing requirements and does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Maryland Higher Education Commission - Academic Program Approval - Revisions
Synopsis: Requiring certain nonpublic institutions of higher education to submit a certain letter of intent regarding intended new graduate level programs to the Maryland Higher Education Commission in a certain manner and every 6 months; repealing a provision of law that required the Commission to circulate certain letters of intent; repealing a certain provision of law that limited which institutions of higher education could propose or implement certain academic programs for certain graduate level programs under certain circumstances; etc.
bill_summary: The bill revises the process for approving new graduate programs at higher education institutions in Maryland, including requiring institutions to submit letters of intent every six months for proposed programs, and updates the criteria and procedures for program approval, especially for emerging workforce needs.
responsible_party: Maryland Higher Education Commission
stakeholders: Higher education institutions, students, workforce development agencies, and regional industries in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's focus on emerging workforce programs and collaboration may facilitate the development of specialized programs, potentially improving access to targeted educational funding and resources for institutions.

Title: Real Property - Holding Over - Expedited Hearing and Service of Summons for Active Duty Service Members
Synopsis: Requiring the District Court to hold a hearing on a tenant holding over within 45 days after a landlord makes a complaint if the landlord or the landlord's spouse is on active duty with the United States military; and authorizing a private process server to serve a certain summons if the constable or sheriff of the county fails to serve the summons within 10 days after the summons is issued by the court.
bill_summary: This bill requires the District Court to hold a hearing within a specified number of days for tenants holding over when the landlord or their spouse is on active military duty, and allows private process servers to serve summons under certain circumstances. It also updates procedures for eviction and possession cases, especially for military personnel.
responsible_party: District Court of Maryland
stakeholders: Tenants, landlords, active duty military service members
access_to_capital_summary: The bill primarily changes legal procedures related to eviction and does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Real Property - Wrongful Detainer - Time of Hearing and Service of Process
Synopsis: Altering provisions relating to wrongful detainer actions, including requirements for summonses, hearing, and judgments.
bill_summary: This bill criminalizes fraudulent possession or claiming of residential real property, establishes procedures for owners to remove such persons through affidavits and sheriff actions, and modifies the process for wrongful detainer actions including hearings, service, and appeals.
responsible_party: Maryland courts and law enforcement agencies
stakeholders: Residential property owners and lawful possessors in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill primarily addresses legal procedures and criminal penalties related to property possession, with no direct impact on access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Department of General Services - Identification Cards - Veteran Status Notation
Synopsis: Authorizing the Department of General Services to include a notation on a certain identification card indicating that the holder is a veteran under certain circumstances; requiring the Department to obtain the consent of a certain holder of an identification card before transmitting certain information to a certain executive agency; and prohibiting the Department from transmitting certain information obtained on an application for an identification card except under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland Department of General Services to include a veteran status notation on identification cards issued to certain individuals and establishes procedures for obtaining and transmitting veteran status information with consent.
responsible_party: Department of General Services
stakeholders: Veterans and state employees or individuals issued identification cards by the Department of General Services
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Funeral Establishments, Crematories, and Reduction Facilities - Disposition of Unclaimed Remains - Veterans
Synopsis: Requiring a licensed funeral establishment, crematory operator, or reduction facility to take certain actions if a certain veterans service organization does not take possession of certain unclaimed cremains, hydrolyzed remains, or soil remains that qualify for a plot in a veterans cemetery within a certain period of time.
bill_summary: The bill requires funeral establishments, crematories, and reduction facilities to notify veterans service organizations about unclaimed remains of veterans or their dependents after 90 days, and to transfer such remains to these organizations if they are identified as veterans' remains. If the veterans' service organization does not take possession within 10 days, the remains are to be transferred to the Department of Veterans and Military Families for proper disposition.
responsible_party: Department of Veterans and Military Families
stakeholders: Veterans and their families, funeral establishments, crematories, reduction facilities, veterans service organizations
access_to_capital_summary: The bill primarily focuses on the disposition process of unclaimed veteran remains and does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Health Occupations Boards - Notation of Veteran Status and Eligibility for Benefits
Synopsis: Authorizing health occupations boards to include a notation indicating veteran status on a license, certificate, registration, or public profile.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes health occupations boards in Maryland to establish a process for including a notation of veteran status on licenses, certificates, or registrations, and to assist in determining eligibility for veterans benefits.
responsible_party: Health Occupations Boards in Maryland
stakeholders: Veterans seeking health-related licenses or certifications in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill primarily focuses on veteran status notation and benefits eligibility, not on access to capital for small businesses.

Title: Chesapeake Conservation Corps Program - Renaming
Synopsis: Renaming the Chesapeake Conservation Corps Program to be the Thomas V. Mike Miller, Jr. Chesapeake Conservation and Climate Corps Program.
bill_summary: The bill renames the Chesapeake Conservation Corps Program to the Thomas V. Mike Miller, Jr., Chesapeake Conservation and Climate Corps Program, in honor of the long-serving Maryland Senate President, and continues its funding and activities related to environmental and energy conservation projects.
responsible_party: Chesapeake Bay Trust
stakeholders: Environmental conservation organizations, program participants, and the general public interested in Chesapeake Bay and climate initiatives
access_to_capital_summary: The program is focused on environmental and energy conservation projects, which may indirectly support small businesses involved in these sectors, but it is primarily a service and conservation initiative.

Title: Criminal Law - Animal Abuse or Neglect - Penalties
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person from committing a violation of the prohibition against abusing or neglecting an animal that results in the death of a domestic animal or livestock or the need to euthanize the domestic animal or livestock; providing that a person who violates the Act is guilty of a misdemeanor and on conviction is subject to imprisonment for up to 1 year or a fine of up to $5,000 or both; and authorizing a court to impost certain conditions of sentencing and probation.
bill_summary: This bill enhances penalties for animal abuse or neglect that results in the death or euthanasia of an animal, and authorizes courts to prohibit offenders from owning or residing with animals for a period of time.
responsible_party: Maryland judicial system (courts)
stakeholders: Individuals convicted of animal abuse or neglect, animals, and the general public
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Department of the Environment - Notation of Veteran Status
Synopsis: Authorizing the Department of the Environment to establish a certain process in collaboration with one or more boards under the Department's direction and control that requires a board to include a notation indicating veteran status on a professional license or certificate.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland Department of the Environment to establish a process that allows professional licensing boards to include a notation of veteran status on licenses or certificates and to assist in determining eligibility for veterans benefits.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Veterans applying for professional licenses and certificates in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The program could improve access to benefits for veterans, potentially easing their transition into professional fields, but it does not directly impact access to capital for small businesses.

Title: Election Law - Absentee Ballots - Notice to Request Application
Synopsis: Requiring the local board of elections to send a written notice regarding a request for a State-approved absentee ballot application with a specimen ballot and any other mailings to voters and eligible voters to further awareness of the option of mail-in voting, except under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill requires Maryland local election boards to include a written notice on how to request an absentee ballot with certain mailings to voters at least 60 days before each statewide primary election, unless the voter has permanent absentee ballot status or other exceptions apply.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Elections
stakeholders: Voters in Maryland, especially those interested in absentee voting
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Boating Accidents - Reporting Requirement - Property Damage
Synopsis: Specifying that property damage that results from an accident that involves any vessel subject to the State Boat Act while on the waters of the State includes damage to navigational aid markers, lights, or identifiers for purposes of a certain reporting requirement.
bill_summary: This bill amends Maryland law to specify that property damage resulting from certain boating accidents includes damage to navigational aid markers, lights, or identifiers, and updates reporting requirements for such accidents.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Boaters, navigational aid providers, and the general public using waterways in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Maryland Public Ethics Law - School Boards - Compliance Certification
Synopsis: Requiring each school board to certify to the State Ethics Commission, on or before October 1 each year, that the school board is in compliance with certain requirements of the Maryland Public Ethics Law.
bill_summary: The bill requires each school board in Maryland to annually certify to the State Ethics Commission that it is in compliance with the Maryland Public Ethics Law, starting from October 1, 2025.
responsible_party: Maryland State Ethics Commission
stakeholders: School boards, school officials, and employees in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Maryland Department of Labor - Licenses - Notation of Veteran Status and Eligibility for Benefits
Synopsis: Authorizing units in the Maryland Department of Labor to establish a certain process to include a notation of veteran status on an occupational license.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes units in the Maryland Department of Labor to establish a process for including a notation of veteran status on occupational licenses and to assist in determining eligibility for veterans' benefits.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: Veterans applying for occupational licenses in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The program could improve access to benefits for veterans, but does not directly impact access to capital for small businesses.

Title: Boating Accidents - Duty to Stop at the Scene, Render Assistance, and Provide Information - Penalties
Synopsis: Requiring the operator of a vessel involved in a collision, accident, or other casualty stop the vessel as close as possible to the scene of the collision, accident, or casualty until the operator has rendered certain assistance and provided certain information; establishing certain criminal penalties for the operator of a vessel involved in a collision, accident, or other casualty who does not take certain actions in violation of the Act of imprisonment of up to 2 months or a fine not to exceed $500 or both; etc.
bill_summary: This bill updates Maryland law to require vessel operators involved in collisions, accidents, or casualties to stop near the scene, render assistance, and provide information, with increased penalties for violations, and mandates reporting of accidents.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Vessel operators, boaters, and individuals involved in boating accidents in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: State Board of Stationary Engineers - Member Appointments - Advice and Consent of the Senate
Synopsis: Providing that the Governor appoint members of the State Board of Stationary Engineers with the advice and consent of the Senate.
bill_summary: This bill changes the appointment process for members of the State Board of Stationary Engineers, requiring the Governor to appoint members with the advice and consent of the Senate.
responsible_party: State of Maryland, Department of Business Occupations and Professions
stakeholders: Members of the State Board of Stationary Engineers and related industry professionals
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Access to Counsel in Evictions - Task Force and Special Fund
Synopsis: Extending through fiscal year 2028 distributions by the Comptroller from funds gained from abandoned property in the State to the Access to Counsel in Evictions Special Fund; altering the staff and duties of the Access to Counsel in Evictions Task Force; and extending through fiscal year 2028 an annual $14,000,000 appropriation by the Governor from the Access to Counsel in Evictions Special Fund to the Maryland Legal Services Corporation.
bill_summary: The bill extends and establishes funding for the Access to Counsel in Evictions program, including creating a special fund, allocating funds from abandoned property proceeds, and setting up a task force to evaluate and improve legal access for tenants facing eviction.
responsible_party: Maryland Legal Services Corporation (MLSC)
stakeholders: Tenants facing eviction, legal service providers, community organizations, landlords, and the general public in Maryland.
access_to_capital_summary: The program has a high potential to impact small business owners and tenants by providing legal representation and support in eviction proceedings, which can influence access to housing and stability.

Title: Agriculture - Departmental Authority Over Identification, Inspection, and Sale of Cantaloupes - Repeal
Synopsis: Repealing the Department of Agriculture's authority over the identification, inspection, and sale of cantaloupes.
bill_summary: This bill repeals the Maryland Department of Agriculture's authority over the identification, inspection, and sale of cantaloupes, effectively removing existing regulations and oversight related to cantaloupe sales.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Agriculture
stakeholders: Cantaloupe growers, sellers, and consumers in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Health โ General Article โ References to Mental Health
Synopsis: Replacing references to mental hygiene with references to mental health in certain provisions of law governing public health; establishing that, by July 1, 2027, the Department of Health shall conduct a thorough review of Department regulations and adopt regulations to ensure consistency with the Act; and requiring the Department to update all public-facing electronic materials to be consistent with the Act as soon as practicable.
bill_summary: The bill updates legal references from 'mental hygiene' to 'mental health' in Maryland law, establishes a Mental Health CommunityโBased Services Fund to support community services and housing for individuals with mental illness, and requires a review of regulations to ensure consistency with these changes.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Individuals with mental health needs, mental health service providers, community organizations, and the general public
access_to_capital_summary: The bill creates dedicated funding and programs aimed at increasing community-based mental health services and housing, which can improve access to capital for providers and related initiatives.

Title: Confined Aquatic Disposal Cells - Construction - Moratorium
Synopsis: Prohibiting the Department of the Environment from processing or making any recommendation on a certain application submitted for the purpose of constructing a confined aquatic disposal cell from June 1, 2025, through May 31, 2029; and prohibiting the Board of Public Works from approving a certain application submitted for the purpose of constructing a confined aquatic disposal cell from June 1, 2025, through May 31, 2029.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a temporary moratorium from June 1, 2025, to May 31, 2029, on processing or approving applications for constructing confined aquatic disposal cells within 5 miles of residential overburdened communities in Maryland.
responsible_party: Department of the Environment and the Board of Public Works
stakeholders: Residents of residential overburdened communities, environmental agencies, and entities involved in dredging and disposal activities
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact small business access to capital.

Title: Maryland Veterans Trust - Board of Trustees - Membership
Synopsis: Altering the membership of the Board of Trustees of the Maryland Veterans Trust to include the Secretary of Disabilities or the Secretary's designee.
bill_summary: This bill amends the membership of the Maryland Veterans Trust Board of Trustees to include the Secretary of Disabilities as a member.
responsible_party: Maryland Veterans Trust Board of Trustees
stakeholders: Veterans and organizations serving veterans in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Correctional Services - Geriatric and Medical Parole
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Parole Commission to consider the age of  incarcerated individuals when determining whether to grant parole; altering how the Commission evaluates a request for medical parole, including providing for a meeting between the incarcerated individual and the Commission; requiring the Commission to develop procedures for assessing parole requests by older incarcerated individuals; requiring the Commission to report yearly to the Justice Reinvestment Oversight Board on the outcomes of certain parole considerations; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Parole Commission to consider the age of incarcerated individuals when determining parole eligibility, especially for geriatric and medically incapacitated prisoners. It establishes procedures for medical parole requests, including meetings and risk assessments, and expands eligibility criteria for geriatric parole. The bill also authorizes the use of savings from prison population reductions to support parole and reentry programs.
responsible_party: Maryland Parole Commission and Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services
stakeholders: Geriatric and medically incapacitated incarcerated individuals, parolees, and the criminal justice system in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's focus on parole for older and medically incapacitated individuals may indirectly impact access to capital by potentially reducing incarceration costs and supporting reinvestment in community programs.

Title: Maryland Veterans Service Animal Program - Eligibility - Family Members of Veterans
Synopsis: Expanding eligibility for the Maryland Veterans Service Animal Program to include a spouse or dependent of an eligible veteran.
bill_summary: The bill expands the eligibility for the Maryland Veterans Service Animal Program to include spouses and dependents of eligible veterans, and establishes a fund to support training and therapy services involving service dogs, support dogs, and therapy horses for veterans and their families.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Veterans Affairs
stakeholders: Veterans and their families in Maryland, nonprofit training entities, and the general public benefiting from veteran support services.
access_to_capital_summary: The program has the potential to significantly improve access to capital for small organizations involved in veteran support services through funding and grants.

Title: Board of Trustees of the Maryland Teachers and State Employees Supplemental Retirement Plans - Renaming
Synopsis: Renaming the Board of Trustees of the Maryland Teachers and State Employees Supplemental Retirement Plans to be the Board of Trustees of the Maryland State Employees Supplemental Retirement Plans; and providing that the Board of Trustees of the Maryland State Employees Supplemental Retirement Plans is the successor of the Board of Trustees of the Maryland Teachers and State Employees Supplemental Retirement Plans.
bill_summary: This bill renames the Board of Trustees of the Maryland Teachers and State Employees Supplemental Retirement Plans to the Board of Trustees of the Maryland State Employees Supplemental Retirement Plans, and clarifies that the successor board assumes all related powers and obligations.
responsible_party: Department of Legislative Services and the Board of Trustees of the Maryland State Employees Supplemental Retirement Plans
stakeholders: State employees and retirees involved in the Maryland State Employees Supplemental Retirement Plans
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Property Tax - Deadline to Set County and Municipal Corporation Tax Rates - Alteration
Synopsis: Altering, from July 1 to June 20, the deadline by which the governing body of a county or municipal corporation is required to set its property tax rate for the next taxable year.
bill_summary: The bill changes the deadline by which counties and municipal corporations in Maryland must set their property tax rates for the upcoming year, moving the deadline to June 1.
responsible_party: County and municipal governments in Maryland
stakeholders: County and municipal residents and property owners in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Drunk and Drug-Impaired Driving and Failure to Remain at the Scene - Revocation of Driver's License
Synopsis: Requiring the Motor Vehicle Administration to revoke the driver's license of a person who has been convicted of impaired driving that contributes to an accident, or fails to remain at the scene of an accident, that results in the death or life-threatening injury to another person; and authorizing a person whose driver's license is revoked under the Act or for homicide by motor vehicle while impaired to apply for license reinstatement after a certain period of time.
bill_summary: The bill mandates the revocation of a driver's license for individuals convicted of or granted probation for impaired driving that causes death or serious injury, or for failing to remain at the scene of an accident resulting in death or injury. It also establishes procedures for license reinstatement after revocation and links license revocation to participation in the Ignition Interlock System Program.
responsible_party: Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration
stakeholders: Drivers convicted of impaired driving or involved in fatal or injury-causing accidents in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill primarily focuses on license revocation and reinstatement procedures related to impaired driving and does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Cannabis Reform - Revisions
Synopsis: Extending the time period from July 1, 2025, to July 1, 2026, during which a holder of a certain cannabis dispensary license may continue to deliver medical cannabis; limiting application submissions for on-site consumption licenses to social equity applicants under certain circumstances; authorizing a political subdivision to establish hours of operation for on-site consumption establishments; providing that a certain food sales exemption from the sales and use tax does not apply to the sale of certain cannabinoid beverages; etc.
bill_summary: This bill reforms Maryland's cannabis laws by extending medical cannabis delivery, establishing rules for on-site consumption licenses, regulating cannabis events, and setting licensing and zoning requirements for dispensaries and cultivators.
responsible_party: Maryland Cannabis Administration
stakeholders: Cannabis consumers, medical patients, cannabis businesses, local governments, and the general public
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's provisions for licensing, events, and social equity programs could improve access to capital for small cannabis businesses, especially social equity applicants.

Title: Workers' Compensation - Payment From Uninsured Employers' Fund - Revisions
Synopsis: Authorizing the Worker's Compensation Commission to offset or credit against an award certain benefits paid by the Uninsured Employer's Fund; requiring the Workers' Compensation Commission to make the Fund a party to a claim filed against an uninsured employer; authorizing a covered employee or the dependents of a covered employee to apply to the Director of the Fund for payment from the Fund;  requiring the Fund to pay certain additional awards under certain circumstances; etc.
bill_summary: The bill revises the procedures and rules for the Maryland Uninsured Employers' Fund related to workers' compensation claims, including how benefits are paid, how the Fund is involved in claims against uninsured employers, and reimbursement processes.
responsible_party: Maryland Workersโ Compensation Commission
stakeholders: Employees, dependents, uninsured employers, and the Maryland Workersโ Compensation Commission
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's impact on access to capital for small business owners is indirect, mainly through changes in claims and reimbursement processes.

Title: Limited Line Credit Insurance - Qualification of Applicants
Synopsis: Altering certain requirements relating to programs of instruction for applicants for certain limited lines credit insurance licenses; and requiring the insurer that provides the program of instruction to retain records relating to the program of instruction while in use and for a period of at least 5 years after its last use.
bill_summary: The bill amends Maryland insurance law to modify requirements for applicants seeking limited lines credit insurance licenses, including the program of instruction they must complete.
responsible_party: Maryland Insurance Administration
stakeholders: Applicants for limited lines credit insurance licenses in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: State Government - Public Employee Relations Act - Alterations
Synopsis: Repealing the condition that must be met for a certain exclusive representative to meet with a new employee by video or similar technology; altering certain requirements for the deputy directors appointed by the Public Employee Relations Board; and altering certain procedures regarding the timing of exclusive representation elections.
bill_summary: The bill makes changes to Maryland's Public Employee Relations Act, including allowing exclusive representatives to meet with new employees via video technology, clarifying the conditions for membership dues deductions, and altering procedures for labor relations and elections.
responsible_party: Public Employee Relations Board of Maryland
stakeholders: Public employees, employee organizations, and public employers in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's provisions are administrative and procedural, with no direct impact on small business access to capital.

Title: Department of the Environment - Fees, Penalties, Funding, and Regulation
Synopsis: Altering the authorized uses of the Maryland Clean Air Fund to include certain activities relating to mitigating and reducing air pollution in the State; authorizing the Department of the Environment to charge a fee for processing and issuing on-site sewage disposal permits and individual well construction permits under certain circumstances; requiring a holder of a license to transfer oil into the State to pay a certain fee when oil owned by the licensee is first transferred into the State; establishing the Private Dam Repair Fund; etc.
bill_summary: The bill makes various changes to environmental funding, fees, and regulations in Maryland, including altering the uses of the Maryland Clean Air Fund, establishing a Private Dam Repair Fund, and updating permit and registration fees for environmental activities and infrastructure.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Environmental agencies, private dam owners, permit applicants, local governments, and residents impacted by environmental regulations
access_to_capital_summary: The bill establishes a dedicated fund and loan programs for private dam repairs, which could improve safety and reduce costs for dam owners, potentially facilitating access to capital for dam repair and safety upgrades.

Title: Controlled Hazardous Substance Facility Permit - Research Facilities - Chemical Warfare Material Requirements
Synopsis: Providing that certain provisions of law regarding chemical warfare material requirements under a controlled hazardous substance facility permit do not apply to the incineration of chemical warfare materials at a certain research facility if the incineration is done for research, development, or demonstration purposes; and establishing additional requirements applicable to research, development, and demonstration permits issued for the incineration of chemical warfare materials at a research facility.
bill_summary: This bill regulates the incineration of chemical warfare materials at research facilities in Maryland, establishing safety, monitoring, and emergency preparedness requirements, and authorizing permits for research, development, and demonstration purposes.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Research facilities handling chemical warfare materials, local communities near such facilities, environmental and public health agencies
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's focus on safety, monitoring, and permit requirements for research facilities may influence the development and deployment of incineration technology, but it does not directly provide capital access for small businesses.

Title: Election Law - Local Boards of Elections - Election Plan Requirements
Synopsis: Requiring a local board of elections to submit an election plan to the State Board of Elections for approval at least 7 months before each statewide primary election; establishing requirements related to an election plan; and altering the requirements related to polling place plans, ballot drop box plans, and early voting center plans.
bill_summary: This bill updates and enhances the election planning and voting procedures in Maryland, including requirements for local boards of elections to submit detailed election plans, including polling place, ballot drop box, and early voting center plans, for approval by the State Board of Elections. It also establishes procedures for public notice, community engagement, and the placement of voting facilities.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Elections
stakeholders: Voters in Maryland, including historically disenfranchised communities and election officials
access_to_capital_summary: The bill primarily focuses on election planning and voting procedures, with no direct impact on small business access to capital.

Title: Maryland Tort Claims Act - Employees of an Office of a Sheriff
Synopsis: Providing that an employee of the office of a sheriff of a county or Baltimore City is immune from liability under the Maryland Tort Claims Act in the same manner as a sheriff or deputy sheriff.
bill_summary: The bill extends immunity from certain liability to employees of the office of a sheriff of a county or Baltimore City, similar to the immunity already granted to sheriffs and deputy sheriffs, under the Maryland Tort Claims Act.
responsible_party: Maryland State Government
stakeholders: Employees of sheriff's offices, sheriffs, deputy sheriffs, and the public served by sheriff's offices
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Baltimore City - Alcoholic Beverages - Hours of Operation Violations - Civil Penalties
Synopsis: Establishing for a first offense by a holder of an alcoholic beverages license in Baltimore City of operating the licensed premises outside specified hours of operation without obtaining a certain exemption a fine of not less than $1,000 or suspension of the license or both, and for a second or subsequent offense a fine of not less than $2,000 and not more than $20,000 or suspension of the license or both.
bill_summary: The bill establishes civil penalties for alcohol license holders in Baltimore City who operate outside the permitted hours without an exemption, including fines and license suspensions for violations.
responsible_party: Baltimore City Alcoholic Beverages Board
stakeholders: Alcohol license holders, Baltimore City businesses, residents
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact small business access to capital.

Title: Maryland Protecting Opportunities and Regional Trade (PORT) Act - Reports of Attorney General - Frequency
Synopsis: Altering from each month to every 6 months the frequency with which the Attorney General is required to report to the General Assembly regarding the status of the recovery of economic damages arising from the closure of the Helen Delich Bentley Port of Baltimore and the collapse of the Francis Scott Key Bridge; and requiring the Attorney General to pursue all available options, including filing actions against the applicable parties, to recover all possible economic damages arising from the Port closure and the Bridge collapse.
bill_summary: The bill amends the Maryland Protecting Opportunities and Regional Trade (PORT) Act to change the reporting frequency of the Attorney General's reports on recovering economic damages from the collapse of the Francis Scott Key Bridge and the closure of the Port of Baltimore, requiring reports every 6 months starting July 1, 2024.
responsible_party: Attorney General of Maryland
stakeholders: Maryland residents and businesses affected by the Port closure and bridge collapse
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly establish or modify programs related to access to capital for small businesses.

Title: Financial Institutions and Activities - Virtual Currency Kiosks - Registration and Regulation
Synopsis: Establishing registration and operating requirements for a virtual currency kiosk operator to operate a virtual currency kiosk in the State; authorizing the Commissioner of Financial Regulation to investigate and enforce the Act in a certain manner; and authorizing the Commissioner to assess against a virtual currency kiosk operator a civil penalty not to exceed $1,000 for each knowing and willful violation  of the Act.
bill_summary: This bill establishes registration, operational, and regulatory requirements for virtual currency kiosks and their operators in Maryland, including registration procedures, transaction limits, disclosure requirements, and enforcement powers.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor, Commissioner of Financial Regulation
stakeholders: Virtual currency kiosk operators and users in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's provisions on transaction limits and disclosures could influence small business access to capital, but primarily focus on regulation and consumer protection.

Title: Election Law โ Chief Election Judges โ Party Affiliation
Synopsis: Requiring the election director of a local board of elections to designate chief election judges from certain political parties to each polling place except under certain circumstances; and requiring an election director who is unable to designate chief judges for a polling place at least 45 days before the start of early voting to make a certain designation in a certain manner.
bill_summary: The bill requires local election boards to designate chief election judges from specific political parties at each polling place, with certain exceptions, to promote party representation and fairness in elections.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Elections
stakeholders: Voters, political parties, election officials
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Department of Veterans and Military Families - Communications, Outreach, and Advocacy Program - Alterations
Synopsis: Requiring the Communications, Outreach, and Advocacy Program in the Department of Veterans and Military Families to expand certain services to include service members and their families; and requiring the Secretary of Veterans and Military Families to submit an annual report by December 1 each year to the Governor and the General Assembly that includes a general assessment of communication methods utilized in support of the Communications, Outreach, and Advocacy Program.
bill_summary: This bill requires the Maryland Department of Veterans and Military Families to establish and maintain an online registry for veterans, service members, and interested individuals to access information about available services, benefits, and news. It also expands the department's outreach and communication efforts to better inform and assist veterans and military families.
responsible_party: Department of Veterans and Military Families
stakeholders: Veterans, service members, military families, and interested individuals in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill primarily focuses on information dissemination and outreach, with no direct intervention or service that would significantly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Education - Youth Suicide Prevention School Program - Revisions
Synopsis: Altering the requirements of the Youth Suicide Prevention School Program to increase pupil awareness of the relationship between gambling and youth suicide.
bill_summary: The bill revises the Maryland Youth Suicide Prevention School Program to include increased awareness of the relationship between gambling and youth suicide, and emphasizes recognizing behavioral health issues, trauma, and violence among students.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Education
stakeholders: Students, school personnel, community mental health agencies, and youth at risk of suicide and gambling addiction
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly address access to capital for small businesses.

Title: Natural Resources - Canada Geese - Bag Limits
Synopsis: Requiring, during the migratory Canada goose (Atlantic population) hunting season, the bag limit for all Canada geese in certain areas of  the State, including geese found in the Atlantic Flyway Resident Population Hunt Zone and the Atlantic Population Hunt Zone, to conform to the bag limit for Atlantic population Canada geese adopted annually by the Department of the Interior's U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service.
bill_summary: This bill requires that during the migratory Canada goose hunting season, the bag limit for all Canada geese in certain areas of Maryland conform to the annual limits set by the U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service, and it specifies the duration and geographic scope of this regulation.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Hunters and wildlife management authorities in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Baltimore County - Speed Monitoring Systems - Interstate 695 and Interstate 83
Synopsis: Authorizing the State Highway Administration to place and use not more than four speed monitoring systems on Interstate 695 and Interstate 83 in Baltimore County subject to notice requirements; requiring that fines collected in Baltimore County as a result of violations enforced by speed monitoring systems on Interstate 695 and Interstate 83 be used to recover costs and assist in covering the cost of roadway and safety improvements on Interstate 695 and Interstate 83 in Baltimore County; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland State Highway Administration to place and operate speed monitoring systems on Interstate 695 and Interstate 83 in Baltimore County, Maryland. It establishes that fines collected from violations recorded by these systems will be used to recover costs and fund roadway and safety improvements. The bill also sets procedures for issuing citations, handling violations, and reporting on the program's effectiveness.
responsible_party: Maryland State Highway Administration
stakeholders: Motorists and residents in Baltimore County, Maryland, especially those near Interstate 695 and Interstate 83
access_to_capital_summary: The program has a high potential to impact small business owners' access to capital by generating revenue that can be used for roadway improvements, which may improve local economic conditions.

Title: Baltimore City - Raffles - Organizations Affiliated With a Professional Major League Baseball Team
Synopsis: Authorizing certain organizations that are affiliated with a professional major league baseball team that plays its home games in Baltimore City to conduct certain raffles; requiring the organization to obtain a permit to conduct raffles from an agency designated by the Baltimore City government; providing that a permit to hold certain raffles expires at the end of the calendar year in which the permit was issued; requiring that raffle tickets are sold using age-verification measures to ensure the buyer is at least 18; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes organizations affiliated with professional Major League Baseball teams in Baltimore City to conduct raffles at games, with specific rules on permits, ticket sales, and geographic boundaries, and limits on the number of raffles per year.
responsible_party: Baltimore City government (Designated City Agency)
stakeholders: Organizations affiliated with professional Major League Baseball teams in Baltimore City and their supporters
access_to_capital_summary: The program has a moderate potential to impact access to capital for small businesses, mainly through permitted raffles and prize awards.

Title: Revenge Porn - Definition of Visual Representation and Civil Action
Synopsis: Authorizing a person to bring and maintain a civil action for defamation against another who distributes a computer-generated visual representation that is indistinguishable from an actual visual representation of the person and is of a sexual or intimate nature; and prohibiting a person from knowingly distributing a certain computer-generated visual representation of another under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill defines and criminalizes the distribution of computer-generated visual representations of individuals that depict them with exposed intimate parts or engaged in sexual activity without consent, and provides civil remedies for victims. It also establishes procedures for handling such visual representations in court records.
responsible_party: Maryland courts and law enforcement agencies
stakeholders: Individuals depicted in visual representations, victims of revenge porn, law enforcement, and the judiciary
access_to_capital_summary: The bill primarily addresses legal definitions and civil and criminal procedures, with no direct program for small business capital access.

Title: Maryland Department of Health and Office of Health Care Quality - Nursing Home Inspections - Reporting
Synopsis: Requiring the Secretary of Health, on request of a county, to delegate to the county the authority to conduct surveys and complaint investigations of nursing homes; requiring the Maryland Department of Health to execute a certain memorandum of understanding with a requesting county within 90 days; and requiring that the Maryland Department of Health and counties equally share the costs of conducting surveys delegated by the Secretary of Health.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Health to delegate authority to counties for conducting nursing home site visits, surveys, and complaint investigations upon request, and establishes reporting requirements for these activities. It also sets procedures for investigations and surveys, including when ownership transfers occur.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and Office of Health Care Quality
stakeholders: Nursing homes, residents, families, and local health agencies in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's focus is on inspection and reporting procedures, not on providing direct access to capital for small businesses.

Title: Maryland Police Training and Standards Commission - Review of Report and Recommendations
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Police Training and Standards Commission to annually review a certain report published by the Independent Investigations Division of the Office of the Attorney General; and requiring the Commission to make any recommendations that the Commission determines are appropriate based on its review of the report.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Police Training and Standards Commission to annually review a report published by the Independent Investigations Division of the Office of the Attorney General and make recommendations based on that review.
responsible_party: Maryland Police Training and Standards Commission
stakeholders: Law enforcement agencies, the Independent Investigations Division, and the public interested in police oversight and accountability
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Public Safety Officer - Performance of Duties - Death Benefits
Synopsis: Altering circumstances under which certain individuals are presumed to have died as a direct and proximate result of an injury sustained in the performance of duties for purposes of eligibility for death benefits.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the circumstances under which public safety officers are presumed to have died due to injuries sustained in the performance of their duties, expands death benefits to include 9-1-1 specialists, adjusts benefit amounts based on inflation, and establishes procedures for participation in pension systems for law enforcement, firefighters, emergency medical technicians, and 9-1-1 specialists.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services
stakeholders: Public safety officers, their families, and related emergency response personnel in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill primarily changes legal presumptions and benefit procedures, with no direct program to impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Natural Resources - Wildland Areas - Overhead Transmission Lines
Synopsis: Exempting certain areas in the Big Savage Mountain Wildland, Bear Pen Wildland, and Dan's Mountain Wildland from being designated as a wildland area, subject to a certificate of public convenience and necessity being obtained for a certain transmission line; and requiring the Public Service Commission to require an applicant for a certificate of public convenience and necessity for the construction of a certain overhead transmission line to provide wildland impact mitigation guarantees.
bill_summary: This bill exempts certain wildland areas in Maryland from being designated as wildlands if a certificate of public convenience and necessity is obtained for specific transmission lines, and requires mitigation guarantees and land management plans for such projects.
responsible_party: Maryland Public Service Commission and Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Wildland areas, local communities, environmental groups, and utility companies involved in transmission line projects
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's impact on access to capital is indirect, focusing on environmental mitigation and land management requirements for transmission projects.

Title: Environment - Coal Combustion By-Products - Fees, Coordinating Committee, and Regulations
Synopsis: Altering the factors that the Department of the Environment is required to consider in establishing a certain fee; requiring the Department to use certain excess fees collected from certain generators of coal combustion by-products for certain purposes; establishing the Statewide Coal Combustion By-Products Coordinating Committee to share information, monitoring results, and certain remedial actions with respect to certain coal combustion by-product sites; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a fee on coal combustion by-products, creates a statewide coordinating committee to monitor and share information on coal by-product sites, and mandates the Department of the Environment to adopt regulations for managing these by-products, including federal guidelines.
responsible_party: Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Generators of coal combustion by-products, environmental agencies, public health organizations, communities near coal by-product sites
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's focus on regulation and monitoring may indirectly influence the financial aspects of coal by-product management, but it does not directly create financial programs or capital access initiatives.

Title: Registered Apprenticeship Investments for a Stronger Economy (RAISE) Act
Synopsis: Altering the duties of the Maryland Apprenticeship and Training Council; repealing the Youth Apprenticeship Advisory Committee; establishing the Maryland Office of Registered Apprenticeship Development to scale registered apprenticeships across industries and occupations to meet the needs of the State's economy; establishing the Maryland Pay Per Apprentice Program within the Maryland Department of Labor; establishing the Maryland Pay Per Apprentice Program Fund as a special, nonlapsing fund; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes new programs and initiatives to promote registered apprenticeships in Maryland, including the creation of the Maryland Office of Registered Apprenticeship Development, the Registered Apprenticeship Qualified Intermediary Program, and the Maryland Apprenticeship Incentive Pay Per Apprentice Program, along with related advisory boards and funding mechanisms.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor and the Division of Workforce Development and Adult Learning
stakeholders: Employers, apprentices, workforce development organizations, and industries in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill provides financial incentives and funding to support apprenticeship programs, which can significantly improve small business access to capital for training new apprentices.

Title: Criminal Records โ Expungement and Maryland Judiciary Case Search (Expungement Reform Act of 2025)
Synopsis: Altering certain provisions of law relating to waiting periods for the filing of certain petitions for expungement to authorize the filing of a petition a certain amount of time after the completion of the sentence; adding to the list of misdemeanor convictions that a person may expunge under certain circumstances; prohibiting the Maryland Judiciary Case Search from in any way referring to the existence of a charge of possession of cannabis if the conviction was later pardoned by the Governor; etc.
bill_summary: The Expungement Reform Act of 2025 modifies Maryland laws regarding the timing and eligibility for expunging criminal records, expands the list of misdemeanor convictions eligible for expungement, and restricts the Maryland Judiciary Case Search from referencing certain records, including those that resulted in acquittal or dismissal.
responsible_party: Maryland Judiciary or Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services
stakeholders: Individuals with criminal records seeking expungement, legal professionals, and the general public
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's provisions on expungement and record restrictions could significantly improve access to capital for individuals with criminal records by removing barriers to employment and financial opportunities.

Title: Trafficking Regulated Firearms - Felony Classification
Synopsis: Requiring that the prosecution for an offense of trafficking a regulated firearm be instituted within 3 years after the offense was committed; reclassifying the prohibition against transporting a regulated firearm into the State for the purpose of unlawfully selling or trafficking the firearm to be a felony; and establishing a penalty on conviction of imprisonment of up to 10 years or a fine of up to $25,000 or both.
bill_summary: The bill increases the felony classification for unlawfully transporting regulated firearms into Maryland for the purpose of selling or trafficking, and extends the statute of limitations for prosecuting certain firearm trafficking offenses to three years.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety or judicial agencies responsible for enforcement and prosecution
stakeholders: Law enforcement agencies, prosecutors, and individuals involved in firearm trafficking or affected by firearm laws in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Security Guard Agencies - Special Police Officers - Application for Appointment
Synopsis: Authorizing a certain security guard agency to apply for the appointment of special police officers in order to protect property owned or leased by the security guard agency's clients.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes security guard agencies in Maryland to apply for the appointment of special police officers to protect property owned or leased by their clients, expanding the entities eligible to appoint such officers.
responsible_party: Maryland Police Training and Standards Commission
stakeholders: Security guard agencies, property owners, and clients in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The program could improve security and reduce losses for small businesses, potentially increasing their access to capital by reducing risks.

Title: Real Property - Unlawfully Restrictive Covenant Modifications - County or Municipality Notice Requirements
Synopsis: Altering notice requirements relating to the recordation of a restrictive covenant modification to an unlawfully restrictive covenant by authorizing a county or municipality to provide notice by publication in one or more newspapers of general circulation in the county or municipality where the property is located once per week for 4 successive weeks and on the official website of a county or municipality where the property is located.
bill_summary: This bill modifies notice requirements for counties and municipalities in Maryland when they record modifications to unlawfully restrictive covenants on properties, allowing for more transparent notification to property owners.
responsible_party: Maryland counties and municipalities
stakeholders: Property owners in Maryland, especially those affected by restrictive covenants
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Home Builders - New Home Sales - Notice of Appliance Warranty Registration
Synopsis: Requiring a person registered to build a new home to provide at the time of closing for the initial sale of a new home information about the warranties for appliances registered by the person, including the date of the warranty registration and the time remaining under the warranty.
bill_summary: The bill requires home builders registered to build new homes in Maryland to provide specific warranty information about appliances, including HVAC systems, at the time of closing for the initial sale of a new home.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor, Licensing, and Regulation or relevant home building regulatory agency
stakeholders: Home buyers of new homes in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill primarily focuses on warranty disclosures and does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Prince George's County - Illegal Dumping and Litter Control Law - Video Evidence and Reward Programs
Synopsis: Authorizing Prince George's County to establish a pilot program allowing a member of the public to submit video evidence of an alleged violation of the Illegal Dumping and Litter Control Law to a certain enforcement unit; requiring the program to allow a member of the public to receive a portion of fines collected in relation to the violation; and authorizing the governing body of Prince George's County to refer unpaid fines to the Central Collection Unit of the Department of Budget and Management for collection.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Prince George's County to establish a pilot program allowing the public to submit video evidence of illegal dumping and litter violations, with rewards for evidence leading to convictions. It also details how fines collected from violations are to be used, including funding the pilot program and public rewards.
responsible_party: Prince George's County government
stakeholders: Residents and visitors of Prince George's County, environmental enforcement agencies, and small business owners involved in litter control
access_to_capital_summary: The program has the potential to incentivize public participation in enforcement, which could indirectly support small businesses involved in waste management and litter control.

Title: Business Occupations and Professions - Professional Engineers - Examination
Synopsis: Requiring an applicant for a license to practice engineering to pass an examination in the fundamentals of engineering given by the State Board for Professional Engineers before passing the required examination in the principles and practice of engineering.
bill_summary: The bill requires applicants for a professional engineering license in Maryland to pass the Fundamentals of Engineering examination before taking the Principles and Practice of Engineering exam, and clarifies the experience and educational requirements for licensure.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board for Professional Engineers
stakeholders: Aspiring and current professional engineers in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Public Safety - Police Accountability - Time Limit for Filing Administrative Charges
Synopsis: Altering the deadline for the completion of the process of review by a certain investigating unit through disposition by an administrative charging committee under certain circumstances; requiring a law enforcement agency to file any administrative charges arising out of an investigation of alleged police officer misconduct that is not required to be reviewed by an administrative charging committee within 1 year and 1 day after the date that the appropriate official employed by the law enforcement agency became aware of the incident; etc.
bill_summary: This bill amends the procedures and deadlines for law enforcement agencies and administrative charging committees to review and file charges related to police misconduct, including provisions for cases involving criminal investigations.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services
stakeholders: Police officers, law enforcement agencies, and the public involved in police misconduct investigations
access_to_capital_summary: The bill primarily changes review and filing deadlines for misconduct cases and does not directly impact access to capital for small businesses.

Title: Commission to Study Health Insurance Pooling - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Commission to Study Health Insurance Pooling to study the pooling of public employee health insurance purchasing between the State, counties, municipal corporations, and county boards of education in the State to maximize value and efficiency while maintaining a broad package of benefits and reasonable premiums for public employees; and requiring the Commission to report its findings and recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly by December 1, 2026.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Commission to Study Health Insurance Pooling to analyze the potential benefits of pooling public employee health insurance purchasing across the State, counties, and educational entities, with the goal of increasing efficiency and reducing costs.
responsible_party: Department of Budget and Management
stakeholders: Public employees, State and local government entities, health insurance providers
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's focus on pooling health insurance purchasing could lead to cost savings and more affordable coverage options for public employees, potentially improving access to health-related benefits.

Title: Baltimore City - Property Tax - Authority to Impose on Vacant and Abandoned Property Owned by Nonprofit Organizations
Synopsis: Authorizing the Mayor and City Council of Baltimore City to establish, by law, a subclass of real property consisting of certain property that is owned by a nonprofit organization that has been vacant and has not been significantly improved for at least 5 consecutive years and to set a special property tax rate for that property.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Baltimore City to establish a special property tax rate for vacant and abandoned properties owned by nonprofit organizations that have not been used or significantly improved for 3 to 5 years, and to impose a higher tax rate on such properties.
responsible_party: Baltimore City Government
stakeholders: Nonprofit organizations, property owners, and residents of Baltimore City
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's focus on property taxation for vacant properties owned by nonprofits may indirectly influence the financial stability of nonprofits, but it does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: State Government - Maryland Reparations Commission
Synopsis: Establishing the Maryland Reparations Commission to study and make recommendations relating to appropriate benefits to be made to individuals whose ancestors were enslaved in the State or were impacted by certain inequitable government policies; and requiring the Commission to submit a preliminary report by January 1, 2027, and a final report of its findings and recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly by November 1, 2027.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland Reparations Commission to study and recommend benefits for individuals impacted by slavery and historical inequitable government policies in Maryland, including potential reparations such as monetary compensation and other benefits.
responsible_party: Maryland Reparations Commission and State agencies providing staff support
stakeholders: Individuals whose ancestors were enslaved in Maryland or impacted by inequitable government policies, and the broader Maryland community
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's focus on reparations and benefits could potentially impact access to capital for affected individuals, especially if monetary reparations or financial incentives are implemented.

Title: Behavioral Health Crisis Response Grant Program - Funding
Synopsis: Requiring the Governor to include in the annual budget bill for each of fiscal years 2027 through 2029 an appropriation of $5,000,000 to the Behavioral Health Crisis Response Grant Program.
bill_summary: The bill allocates funding for the Behavioral Health Crisis Response Grant Program in Maryland, increasing annual appropriations and specifying that a portion be used for mobile crisis teams starting in fiscal year 2023.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Individuals experiencing behavioral health crises and local jurisdictions implementing crisis response systems
access_to_capital_summary: The program has a high potential to improve access to behavioral health crisis response services, including mobile crisis teams, which can enhance access to immediate care.

Title: Baltimore City and Takoma Park - Stop Sign Monitoring Systems - Authorization of Pilot Program
Synopsis: Authorizing the use of stop sign monitoring systems in school zones in Baltimore City, if authorized by local law; providing that the owner or driver of a motor vehicle recorded failing to obey a stop sign is subject to a citation and a certain civil penalty under certain circumstances; establishing certain defenses to a charge of an alleged violation recorded by a stop sign monitoring system; requiring that 50% of the fines collected under the Act be distributed to the local management board and be used only for certain youth programming; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the use of stop sign monitoring systems in certain school zones in Baltimore City and Takoma Park, establishes procedures for citations and penalties, allocates a portion of the fines to youth programs, and sets reporting requirements for the cities involved.
responsible_party: Baltimore City Department of Transportation and the City of Takoma Park
stakeholders: Residents, drivers, and youth in Baltimore City and Takoma Park, especially in school zones
access_to_capital_summary: The program's impact on small business access to capital is indirect and limited, primarily through potential revenue from fines used for youth programs.

Title: Criminal Procedure - U Nonimmigrant Status Petitions
Synopsis: Altering the requirements for certification of a U Nonimmigrant Status Petition; altering the individuals eligible to request a certain official to certify victim helpfulness relating to certification of a U Nonimmigrant Status Petition; altering the time periods within which a certain certifying entity shall certify or decline a certain form under certain circumstances; requiring a certifying entity to develop protocols to assist certain petitioners to take certain actions.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the certification process for U Nonimmigrant Status petitions in Maryland, including who can request certification, the timelines for certifying entities, and the circumstances under which information can be disclosed.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor and certifying entities such as law enforcement agencies and attorneys
stakeholders: Victims of qualifying crimes seeking U Nonimmigrant Status in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's focus is on legal certification procedures and does not directly impact access to capital for small business owners.

Title: Courtroom Security - Minimum Adequate Security
Synopsis: Requiring each law enforcement agency, department, or entity providing security at a courthouse facility to submit a report by September 30, 2025, to the Chief Justice of the Supreme Court of Maryland; requiring the report include the current number of court security officers available, the minimum number needed to meet adequate security standards, the current number of vacancies and a viable plan to meet minimum adequate security standards as identified in the Act; etc.
bill_summary: This bill establishes minimum security staffing standards for courtrooms in Maryland, requiring the presence of a specified number of security officers during proceedings, and mandates reporting from law enforcement agencies on their current staffing and plans to meet these standards.
responsible_party: Maryland Judiciary and law enforcement agencies providing courthouse security
stakeholders: Courthouse staff, security officers, defendants, plaintiffs, and the general public using Maryland courthouses
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's focus on staffing standards and reporting does not directly impact access to capital for small businesses.

Title: St. Mary's County - Public Facilities Bond
Synopsis: Authorizing and empowering the County Commissioners of St. Mary's County to borrow not more than $71,000,000 in order to finance the construction, improvement, or development of certain public facilities in St. Mary's County, and to effect such borrowing by the issuance and sale at public or private sale of its general obligation bonds; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes St. Mary's County to issue up to $71 million in bonds to finance the construction, improvement, and development of various public facilities in the county, including schools, roads, parks, and public safety buildings.
responsible_party: St. Mary's County Commissioners
stakeholders: Residents and users of public facilities in St. Mary's County
access_to_capital_summary: The program has a high potential to impact small business owners' access to capital by providing funding for public projects that may involve local contractors and suppliers.

Title: Campaign Finance - Political Organizations - Disclosures on Solicitations (Stop Scam PACs Act)
Synopsis: Requiring certain political organizations to include certain disclaimers and disclosures on certain solicitations; authorizing the State Administrator of Elections to investigate a potential violation of the Act; and authorizing the State Board after the issuance of a public report of its finding to prohibit a person who violated the Act from making further solicitations for a certain period or impose a civil penalty not to exceed $10,000.
bill_summary: The bill requires certain political organizations to include disclaimers and disclosures on solicitations, especially when using candidate names or for political purposes, and establishes investigation and enforcement procedures.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Elections
stakeholders: Political organizations, candidates, political parties, and voters in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's focus on disclosures and investigations may indirectly influence the transparency of political fundraising, but it does not directly impact access to capital for small businesses.

Title: Courts - Artificial Intelligence Evidence Clinic Pilot Program - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing an Artificial Intelligence Evidence Clinic Pilot Program within the Administrative Office of the Courts to provide expertise in artificial intelligence to the circuit courts and the District Court in the form of expert testimony on the authenticity of electronic evidence the court determines may have been created or altered using artificial intelligence; authorizing the Governor for fiscal years 2027 and 2028 to include an appropriation of $250,000 in the annual budget bill for the Program; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes an Artificial Intelligence Evidence Clinic Pilot Program within the Maryland courts to develop expert testimony resources on AI for use in court cases, especially civil cases without legal representation.
responsible_party: Administrative Office of the Courts
stakeholders: Court systems, college and university students, recent graduates, faculty, technology professionals, civil litigants
access_to_capital_summary: The program aims to develop AI expertise resources for courts, which could indirectly support small businesses by improving legal processes involving electronic evidence, but it does not directly provide capital access.

Title: Maryland Community Action Agencies - Funding
Synopsis: Requiring the Governor to include an appropriation of $250,000 in the annual budget bill to the Department of Housing and Community Development in fiscal years 2027 through 2030 as a grant to community action agencies statewide for measures to combat poverty.
bill_summary: The bill mandates that the Maryland Governor include specific annual appropriations in the state budget from 2027 to 2032 to fund community action agencies with grants starting at $500,000 and increasing to $7,000,000 by 2032, to support efforts to combat poverty.
responsible_party: Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Community action agencies and low-income populations in Maryland
access_to_capital_summary: The program provides direct grants to community action agencies, which can significantly improve their capacity to support low-income individuals, thereby potentially increasing access to capital for small businesses and community projects.

Title: Labor and Employment - Uninsured Employers' Fund Board - Membership and Reserves
Synopsis: Altering the membership of the Uninsured Employers' Fund Board; and requiring, rather than authorizing, the Board to establish reserves to meet potential losses of the Uninsured Employers' Fund.
bill_summary: The bill alters the membership structure of the Uninsured Employers' Fund Board, requiring the Board to establish reserves to cover potential losses of the fund, and specifies the composition and appointment process for the Board members.
responsible_party: Uninsured Employers' Fund Board
stakeholders: Employers, employees, and policyholders in Maryland's workers' compensation system
access_to_capital_summary: The bill's focus on establishing reserves for the fund may indirectly impact the stability of the fund, but it does not directly create a program to improve access to capital for small businesses.
